gence of the knowledge worker will bring about fundamental changes in

the very structure and nature of the economic system.

ACTION POINT:

What percentage of your workforce consists of people

whose work requires advanced schooling? Tell these people you value

their contributions and ask them to participate in decisions where their

expertise is important. Make them feel like owners.

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

少林是谁的少林？

少林是谁的少林呢？这个问题是个好问题。

少林方丈肯定觉得，这只我们少林的少林呀，有什么疑问么？我们方丈室，达摩院，罗汉堂，戒律院

的高管层主导着整个少林，当然是我们的少林了。

我们说不和张三丰交换武功就不交换；说不交出谢逊就不交出；我们可以随意把《易筋经》交给外

人，就是说他有缘；我们也可以命令打死偷学武功的小P孩；同时对外宣布：我们藏书阁的书，向来不

禁弟子翻阅。

因为，这是我们的少林。

少林不只是属于我们这些高管，还属于每一个普通的弟子，普通的弟子出去后，也会自豪地说自己是

少林弟子，旁人也会高看一些。而那些好学的弟子，会在寺庙里努力学习自己喜欢的武功，或者文

学，少林是他们的，给他们提供了安全的环境。

少林还属于那些俗家弟子，有一个叫做都大锦的，他是少林俗家弟子，武功普通，当他有了问题，也

会第一时间来少林求助，因为他知道，少林也是他的。少林也会帮他，这不，去了四个圆字辈兄弟去

救助他，虽然也没帮上啥。

所以，少林是所有少林人的少林，少林会为所有少林人提供安全，保障，以及名气。

那么少林只是少林人的少林么？

当然不止，少林还是整个江湖的少林。当你被欺负时，如果没人帮你，你可以去少林看看，他们大概

会“主持正义”；当林平之被灭门，如果他跑到少林，少林大概也会想办法给他个公道。毕竟，少林明

面上还是“正派的老大”。

当少林听说有契丹人要来内地抢武林秘籍时，当即组织人去雁门关阻拦；当意识到左冷禅的阴谋后，

随即选择支持令狐冲在泰山上捣乱。

因为，少林还是江湖的少林。作为在江湖上存在了千年的门派，少林一直把维护江湖的稳定当成自己

的职责，毕竟，一个稳定的江湖才是符合少林利益的。

不管少林愿意不愿意，他都必须维护江湖的安稳，参与江湖的大大小小事物。

那么除了属于少林人，属于江湖外，少林还属于谁呢？

其实，它还属于自己。作为千年的”老妖精“， 少林的方丈换了很多，少林的戒律院、达摩院、罗汉堂

人来人往，少林的大门口，郭襄来过，丁春秋来过，萧峰来过，张三丰来过，韦小宝也来过。江湖也

在变化，逍遥派出现了，又消失了；东海有个桃花岛，后来也消失了；有个侠客岛，也消失了；有明

教，有日月神教，后来也消失了。而少林还在。

似乎，少林会永久存在下去，那么少林靠什么要生存呢？大家去打家劫舍么？毕竟，那么多人，人吃

马嚼，也要花钱呀。

所以，少林还是会做生意的。常见的有香油钱，也就是信徒捐赠，还有就是庙产，周围的土地，都是

少林的，是皇帝御赐的，少林可以自己种，也可以租给农户种；少林还有很多俗家弟子做生意，比如

哪个都大锦，做那么大生意，肯定要给少林捐赠一些呀。

后来我想，如果林震南把林平之送到少林学上几年，不管武功如何，至少混一个少林俗家弟子的身

份，余沧海也不敢那么明目张胆的的灭门吧。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

26 FEBRUARY

Balancing Three Corporate Dimensions

Shareholder sovereignty is bound to flounder.

sovereignty：

主权；最高统治权；最高权威

flounder：

（在水、泥等中）挣扎

bound to： 一定会；束缚于

(over sth) complete power to govern a country

[ V , usually + adv./prep. ] to struggle to move or get somewhere in water, mud, etc.

be tied to, be certain to

It is a fair-weather model.

fair-weather：

[ only before noun ] ( disapproving ) ( of people

when it is pleasant for them

同甘不共苦的；只在顺境中的

人 ) behaving in a particular way or doing a particular activity only

An important task for top management in the next society’s corporation will be to balance the three

dimensions of the corporation: as an economic organization, as a human organization, and as

an increasingly important social organization.

Each of the three models of the corporation developed in the past half-century stressed one of

these dimensions and subordinated the other two.

The German model of the “social market economy” put the emphasis on the social dimension;

the Japanese one, on the human dimension;

and the American one, on the economic dimension.

None of the three is adequate on its own.

adequate ：

的；合乎需要的

(for sth) | ~ (to do sth) enough in quantity, or good enough in quality, for a particular purpose or need

足够的；合格

The German model achieved both economic success and social stability, but at the price of high

unemployment and dangerous labor-market rigidity.

rigidity： 物 硬度， 力 刚性；严格，刻板；僵化；坚硬

  1. [ ]

[ ]

The Japanese model was strikingly successful for many years, but faltered at the first serious

challenge; indeed, it was a major obstacle to recovery from Japan’s recession of the 1990s.

strikingly： 显著地；突出地，引人注目地

faltered：

衰退

obstacle：

障碍；阻碍；绊脚石

recession：

remarkably, notably, dramatically, prominently, markedly

V-I If something falters, it loses power or strength in an uneven way, or no longer makes much progress.

(to sth/to doing sth) a situation, an event, etc. that makes it difficult for you to do or achieve sth

[ C U ] a difficult time for the economy of a country, when there is less trade and industrial activity than usual and more

people are unemployed

经济衰退；经济萎缩

Shareholder sovereignty is also bound to flounder.

sovereignty：

主权；最高统治权；最高权威

flounder：

（在水、泥等中）挣扎

bound to： 一定会；束缚于

(over sth) complete power to govern a country

[ V , usually + adv./prep. ] to struggle to move or get somewhere in water, mud, etc.

be tied to, be certain to

It is a fair-weather model that works well only in times of prosperity.

prosperity：

兴旺；繁荣；成功；昌盛

[ U ] the state of being successful, especially in making money

Obviously the enterprise can fulfill its human and social functions only if it prospers as a business.

prospers：

兴隆 成功

V-I If people or businesses prosper, they are successful and do well.

;

But now that knowledge workers are becoming the key employees, a company also needs to be a

desirable employer to be successful.

desirable：

想望的；可取的；值

(that)… | ~ (for sb) (to do sth) ( formal ) that you would like to have or do; worth having or doing

得拥有的；值得做的

ACTION POINT:

Audit your organization’s performance as an economic, human, and social entity.

List five areas where it comes up short. Prepare a plan to correct these.

come up

走近；发生；开始；上升；发芽；被提出

Managing in the Next Society

26 FEBRUARY

Balancing Three Corporate Dimensions

Shareholder sovereignty is bound to flounder. It is a fair-weather model.

An important task for top management in the next society’s corporation

will be to balance the three dimensions of the corporation: as an eco-nomic

organization, as a human organization, and as an increasingly im-portant

social organization. Each of the three models of the corporation developed in

the past half-century stressed one of these dimensions and subordinated the

other two. The German model of the “social market economy” put the

emphasis on the social dimension; the Japanese one, on the human

dimension; and the American one, on the economic dimen-

sion.

None of the three is adequate on its own. The German model achieved

both economic success and social stability, but at the price of high unem-

ployment and dangerous labor-market rigidity. The Japanese model was

strikingly successful for many years, but faltered at the first serious chal-

lenge; indeed, it was a major obstacle to recovery from Japan’s recession of

the 1990s. Shareholder sovereignty is also bound to flounder. It is a fair-

weather model that works well only in times of prosperity. Obviously the

enterprise can fulfill its human and social functions only if it prospers as

Abusiness. But now that knowledge workers are becoming the key employ-ees,

a company also needs to be a desirable employer to be successful.

ACTION POINT:

Audit your organization’s performance as an economic,

human, and social entity. List five areas where it comes up short. Prepare

a plan to correct these.

Managing in the Next Society

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

客户想要什么？

有个朋友想卖课，也就是做知识付费，他是金融领域的，所以开课讲金融报名的，有保险，有信托，

有基金，有养老，也有宏观经济。

我问他，你为啥要讲这么多呀。他说，金融人士对这些刚兴趣呀。

我又问他，你一个人讲的了这么多么？他说，我可以请人呀。

说的好像很有道理。

过了几天，我去问他，课卖的怎么样？他说一般，几十个吧。他也做了免费的直播课，免费课也就300

多人听，大家好像兴趣不是特别大。

然后我又问题，你觉得你的客户是谁？

他很兴奋地说：“800万保险从业者，他们是最爱学习的”。

我就很好奇了，既然有800万个目标客户，为什么才来300多人呢？

他说：“我也不知道”。

我又问他：”你觉得你的客户要想要什么呢？“

他说：”获客吧“。

然后我又问他：”你的课，能帮助业务员获客么？还有，这是你的想法？还是他们的想法？“

他说：”不知道“。

现在讲课的人很多，都快比上课的人呢多了，为什么有的课能卖上千万，有的课就算9.9，甚至免费，

也没几个人听呢？

”我的客户群体是800万保险业务员，他们需要金融知识“。

这是他们的想法么？

“你有客户么？”

“你了解你的客户么？”

“你的客户需要什么？以什么形式需要？”

“他们为什么要找你来学？”

不要自己回答这些问题了，找到你的“客户”，问他们吧。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

27 FEBRUARY

Defining Business Purpose and Mission

What is our business?

Nothing may seem simpler or more obvious than to know what a company’s business is.

A steel mill makes steel; a railroad runs trains to carry freight and passengers; an insurance

company underwrites fire risks; a bank lends money.

steel：

钢

mill ：

常构成复合词

工厂；制造厂

underwrites：

a strong hard metal that is made of a mixture of iron and

( often in compounds

) a factory that produces a particular type of material

V-T If an institution or company underwrites an activity or underwrites the cost of it, they agree to provide any

money that is needed to cover losses or buy special equipment, often for an agreed-upon fee.

为…提供经济担保; 同意资助

Actually, “What is our business?” is almost always a difficult question and the right answer is

usually anything but obvious.

obvious：

明显的；显然的；易理解的

(to sb) (that…) easy to see or understand

A business is not defined by the company’s name, statutes, or articles of incorporation.

It is defined by the want the customer satisfies when she buys a product or a service.

To satisfy the customer is the mission and purpose of every business.

The question “What is our business?” can, therefore, be answered only by looking at the business

from the outside, from the point of view of the customer and the market.

What the customer sees, thinks, believes, and wants, at any given time, must be accepted by

management as an objective fact and must be taken as seriously as the reports of the salesperson,

the tests of the engineer, or the figures of the accountant.

accountant：

会计；会计师

a person whose job is to keep or check financial accounts

And management must make a conscious effort to get answers from the customer herself rather

than attempt to read her mind.

conscious ：

意识到；注意到

[ not before noun ] ~ of (doing) sth | ~ that aware of sth; noticing sth

ACTION POINT:

Talk to one customer every day this week.

Ask them how they see your company, what they think of it, what kind of company they believe it is

and what they want from it.

Use this feedback to better define your company’s mission.

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

27 FEBRUARY

Defining Business Purpose and Mission

What is our business?

Nothing may seem simpler or more obvious than to know what

Acompany’s business is. A steel mill makes steel; a railroad runs trains to carry

freight and passengers; an insurance company underwrites fire

risks; a bank lends money. Actually, “What is our business?” is almost

always a difficult question and the right answer is usually anything but

obvious.

A business is not defined by the company’s name, statutes, or articles of

incorporation. It is defined by the want the customer satisfies when she buys

a product or a service. To satisfy the customer is the mission and pur-pose of

every business. The question “What is our business?” can, there-fore, be

answered only by looking at the business from the outside, from the point of

view of the customer and the market. What the customer sees, thinks,

believes, and wants, at any given time, must be accepted by man-agement as

an objective fact and must be taken as seriously as the reports of the

salesperson, the tests of the engineer, or the figures of the accountant. And

management must make a conscious effort to get answers from the customer

herself rather than attempt to read her mind.

ACTION POINT:

Talk to one customer every day this week. Ask them how

they see your company, what they think of it, what kind of company they

believe it is and what they want from it. Use this feedback to better define

your company’s mission.

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

教主是谁的教主？

张无忌是明教教主，武功天下第一。明教的军队打下天下后，却是朱元璋做了皇帝，张无忌据说找了

个地方绣花去了。为什么作为教主，最后却靠边站了？

史火龙是丐帮帮主，陈友谅找了一个人假冒他，龙头，掌钵长老居然都没有看出来，还被他耍的团团

转，史火龙死了大家都不知道，丐帮究竟姓陈？还是姓史？

这些看起来很奇怪的事情，其实都是自然的一个结果，都是因为这些位高权重的人的一个错误判断。

张无忌知道自己是明教的教主，却不知道明教不但有左右使，有四法王，有五散人，还有五行旗的几

十万人；张无忌虽然做了教主，其实只是做了光明顶的教主，而没有作到明教真正的教主。明教的几

十万教众，他们对张无忌就不大感冒，他们认的是哪些一直带着他们打仗的朱元璋、常遇春、甚至陈

友谅。

张无忌凭借武功和人脉成为了明教教主，却把注意力过多集中到了高层，也就是光明顶上闹来闹去的

那些人，什么青翼蝠王，什么光明左使，甚至放下激战中的明教，带着庞大的管理层去满满大海去迎

接金毛狮王。

愣是把一个大教的教主当成了光明顶的办公室主任。

史火龙更过分，明明是几十万丐帮的帮主，硬是做成了2-3个丐帮高层的经理人。而且，这些高层还都

不大认识他。

这是一个很奇怪的事情，当张无忌做教主时，当史火龙做帮主时，他们如何看自己的教和帮呢？

光明左右使，四法王等，当然是自己的教众，是自己需要考虑的，几十万教众也是自己要考虑的；四

大长老当然是自己要考虑的，几十万丐帮的乞丐也是自己的属下。

再说说萧峰，需要和高层商量时，绝对不含糊，没事时，就会去和低袋的弟子一起喝酒，因为他知

道，自己的帮众，不止有哪些八袋九袋长老，还有那些一袋二袋弟子。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

28 FEBRUARY

Defining Business Purpose and Mission:

The Customer

Who is the customer?

“Who is the customer?” is the first and the crucial question in defining business purpose and

business mission.

crucial：

至关重要的；关键性的

(to/for sth) | ~ (that…) extremely important, because it will affect other things

It is not an easy, let alone an obvious question.

let alone：更不必说；听任；不打扰

How it is being answered determines, in large measure, how the business defines itself.

The consumer—that is, the ultimate user of a product or a service—is always a customer.

ultimate：

最后的；最终的；终极的

happening at the end of a long process

Most businesses have at least two customers.

Both have to buy if there is to be a sale.

The manufacturers of branded consumer goods always have two customers at the very least: the

housewife and the grocer.

It does not do much good to have the housewife eager to buy if the grocer does not stock the

brand.

Conversely, it does not do much good to have the grocer display merchandise advantageously

and give it shelf space if the housewife does not buy.

merchandise：

商品；货品

( formal ) goods that are bought or sold; goods that are for sale in a shop/store

To satisfy only one of these customers without satisfying the other means that there is no

performance.

ACTION POINT:

Take one product or service that you are responsible for and determine how many kinds of

customers you have for it.

Then figure out if you are satisfying all of your different kinds of customers, or if you are ignoring

some category(ies) of customers.

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

28 FEBRUARY

Defining Business Purpose and Mission:

The Customer

Who is the customer?

“Who is the customer?” is the first and the crucial question in defining

business purpose and business mission. It is not an easy, let alone an obvious

question. How it is being answered determines, in large measure, how the

business defines itself. The consumer—that is, the ultimate user of

a product or a service—is always a customer.

Most businesses have at least two customers. Both have to buy if there

is to be a sale. The manufacturers of branded consumer goods always

have two customers at the very least: the housewife and the grocer. It

does not do much good to have the housewife eager to buy if the grocer

does not stock the brand. Conversely, it does not do much good to have

the grocer display merchandise advantageously and give it shelf space if

the housewife does not buy. To satisfy only one of these customers

without satisfying the other means that there is no performance.

ACTION POINT:

Take one product or service that you are responsible for

and determine how many kinds of customers you have for it. Then figure

out if you are satisfying all of your different kinds of customers, or if you

are ignoring some category(ies) of customers.

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

刘正风之死

刘正风死了。

不但自己死了，自己的大儿子也死了，自己的女儿也死了，自己的弟子们也都死了。刘正风被灭门

了。

而且是被嵩山派灭门的，或者说，是被五岳派剑派灭门的。

左冷禅以五岳剑派盟主的身份派出4名武功高强的师弟以及几十位第二代弟子围攻了刘正风的洗手大

礼，在众目睽睽之下，当着泰山掌门天门道长，华山掌门岳不群，恒山派定逸师太以及上千位高手的

面杀死了刘正风一家。

定逸试图动手保护，受伤后愤然而退，岳不群和天门道长也悄然而退。众英雄也哑然而退。

然后，刘正风就这样被灭门了，灭门的理由是“为了武林中千百万同道的身家性命”。

衡山派历代高手都喜好音乐，刘正风是这样，莫大掌门也是这样。因着音乐，刘正风认识了魔教的曲

洋，两个人琴箫相合，互相引为知己。

两人商量后，考虑各自的身份，两人决定共同退出江湖，不再参与江湖中的恩怨。他们本来以为魔教

不好退，没成想首先被灭门的反而是号称正派的五岳剑派。

刘正风是衡山派弟子。在当时，魔教势力大五岳剑派各自岌岌可危，为了应对魔教的威胁，五岳剑派

选择结盟，形成互相呼应的机制来对抗魔教庞大的势力。这就是五岳剑派的来历。

可以看出，五岳剑派加入联盟的主要职责是互相照应，对抗魔教的威胁。不过，五岳剑派还是五个单

独的门派，门派内的事情，肯定还是各自的掌门说了算。除非是影响到整体的危险，盟主对五岳剑派

里各个人是没有什么权限的。

这是刘正风对五岳剑派的理解。所以，刘正风把自己退出衡山派的事情告诉了师兄莫大，也告诉了盟

主左冷禅。他倒没有什么可担心的。毕竟，这只是衡山派的事情。师兄是什么样的人自己很清楚，反

正也不理自己。

可是，左冷禅不这么想。

左冷禅要和魔教对抗，需要更强大的实力。五岳剑派联合起来能不能打败魔教呢？左冷禅并不知道，

不过，他还是要试试。

所以，虽然大家认为五岳剑派是联盟，各个派内的事情还是各个掌门自己的事情，左冷禅却认为都是

自己的事情：如果刘正风离开了，哪天王正风再离开怎么办？岳不群离开怎么办？仪琳小姑娘也离开

怎么办？

所以，左冷禅必须不能让刘正风离开，并不是“为了武林中千百万同道的身家性命”，而是为了自己好

容易建立起来的联盟，绝不容许任何人破坏。

这也就意味着，为了“对抗魔教”，必须消灭五岳剑派自由进出的规则，所有人必须为我所用。这就是

左冷禅的想法。

但这并不是岳不群的想法，也不少天门的想法，也不是定逸的想法，更不是莫大的想法。

定逸师太外刚内和，脾气虽然暴躁，心地却极慈祥，首先道：“如此什好，也免得伤了大家的和气。丁

师兄、陆师兄，咱们答应了刘贤弟罢。他既不再跟魔教中人结交，又远离中原，等如世上没了这人，

又何必定要多造杀业？”天门道人点头道：“这样也好，岳贤弟，你以为如何？”岳不群道：“刘贤弟言出

如山，他既这般说，大家都信得过的。来来来，咱们化干戈为玉帛，刘贤弟，你放了费贤弟，大夥儿

喝一杯解和酒，明儿一早，你带了家人弟子，便离开衡山城罢！”

所以，这些人还是想让刘正风离开，但左冷禅不同意。左冷禅给了刘正风两个选择：

  1. 一个月内杀死曲洋。

  2. 灭你全家。

这时，岳不群、天门、定逸、包括刘正风都很清楚知道。大家本来期望结成联盟来对抗魔教的五岳剑

派，也成了一个新的魔教。

（定逸）心知受伤已然不轻，眼前无法与抗，一挥手，怒道：“咱们走！”大踏步向门外走去，门下群

尼都跟了出去。

然后，刘正风就死了。同时死去的还有五岳剑派。因为，这时的五岳剑派，已经不再是成立之初的那

个五岳剑派了。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

29 FEBRUARY

Understanding What the Customer Buys

What does the customer consider value?

The final question needed in order to come to grips with business purpose and business mission is:

“What is value to the customer?”

It may be the most important question.

Yet it is the one least often asked.

least：

( usually the least ) smallest in size, amount, degree, etc.

最小的；最少的；程度最轻的

One reason is that managers are quite sure that they know the answer.

Value is what they, in their business, define as quality.

But this is almost always the wrong definition.

The customer never buys a product.

By definition the customer buys the satisfaction of a want.

He buys value.

For the teenage girl, for instance, value in a shoe is high fashion.

It has to be “in.”

Price is a secondary consideration and durability is not value at all.

durability： 耐久性；坚固；耐用年限

For the same girl as a young mother, a few years later, high fashion becomes a restraint.

restraint：

约束力；管制措施；制

约因素

[ C usually pl. ] ~ (on sb/sth) a rule, a fact, an idea, etc. that limits or controls what people can do

She will not buy something that is quite unfashionable.

But what she looks for is durability, price, comfort and fit, and so on.

The same shoe that represents the best buy for the teenager is a very poor value for her slightly

older sister.

What a company’s different customers consider value is so complicated that it can be answered

only by the customers themselves.

Management should not even try to guess at the answers—it should always go to the customers in

a systematic quest for them.

ACTION POINT:

What do your customers consider most valuable about the product or service you provide?

If you don’t know, find out. If you do know, ask your customers if you are delivering.

delivering：

履行

V-T/V-I If you deliver something that you have promised to do, make, or produce, you do, make, or produce it.

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

实现;

29 FEBRUARY

Understanding What the Customer Buys

What does the customer consider value?

The final question needed in order to come to grips with business pur-pose

and business mission is: “What is value to the customer?” It may be the most

important question. Yet it is the one least often asked. One rea-

son is that managers are quite sure that they know the answer. Value is

what they, in their business, define as quality. But this is almost always

the wrong definition. The customer never buys a product. By definition

the customer buys the satisfaction of a want. He buys value.

For the teenage girl, for instance, value in a shoe is high fashion. It has to

be “in.” Price is a secondary consideration and durability is not value at all.

For the same girl as a young mother, a few years later, high fashion be-comes

a restraint. She will not buy something that is quite unfashionable. But what

she looks for is durability, price, comfort and fit, and so on. The same shoe

that represents the best buy for the teenager is a very poor value for her

slightly older sister. What a company’s different customers consider value is

so complicated that it can be answered only by the customers themselves.

Management should not even try to guess at the answers—it should always

go to the customers in a systematic quest for them.

ACTION POINT:

What do your customers consider most valuable about the

product or service you provide? If you don’t know, find out. If you do

know, ask your customers if you are delivering.

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

何去何从的岳不群

我正在读《笑傲江湖》，从头读，逐字读。我发现，岳不群还是很奇怪的。

当岳不群发现青城派在练习”辟邪剑法“后，判断出了青城派要对福威镖局动手。青城派是江湖上的大

派，福威镖局是大江以南最大的镖局，而且岳不群在小时候见过青城派的长青子，知道青城派和福威

镖局的那段公案。

作为华山掌门的岳不群当然要派人去看一下这件事的进展，并且做出相应的应对。

岳不群派了二弟子劳德诺和女儿岳林姗去了。果然，青城派灭门了福威镖局，林震南夫妻被抓，林平

之逃亡。

后来，岳不群遇到了林平之，林平之家财万贯，身负血海深仇，而且有侠义精神，先后救过岳林姗和

令狐冲，充满侠义之器。“武功是可以练的，侠义之气却是与生俱来，人品高下，由此而分。”所以，

当林平之像岳不群拜师时，岳不群当然选择了说”yes“。

后来岳不群来到刘正风的洗手大会上，看到左冷禅对刘正风的咄咄逼人，岳不群知道，五岳剑派已经

不是之前的五岳剑派了。正常蜕变成左冷禅的私人武装。

作为华山派的掌门人，岳不群能如何做？如何在应对魔教的同时，应对左冷禅的崛起？

左冷禅不但武功高强，还占据了”正派联盟“盟主的身份，反对左冷禅，就是反对正派。这样的人是没

法在江湖上生存的，不管是刘正风还是他岳不群。

为了对抗魔教，对抗左冷禅，保住华山，岳不群需要武功，需要势力。

因为气宗剑宗的斗争，华山派高手和武功损失殆尽。岳不群自己也没学全华山派的武功，唯一有点信

心的就是《紫霞神功》了，还只是普普通通。这一点个岳不群心里多少有点数。

知道青城派公道福威镖局，本来也想看看辟邪剑法有什么厉害处，发现不过如此。

后来，发现令狐冲居然会用剑宗前辈的武功，岳不群大惊之下又大怒。

岳不群和这个大弟子的关系一直非常不错。令狐冲有什么事情，都会和自己说的，这么大的事却没和

自己说！

是被剑宗收买了么？

岳不群急需强大的武力。

这时，华山派众弟子来到了福州，发现了《辟邪剑谱》。这时岳不群第一次看到这个剑谱，拿到剑谱

后，岳不群看到第一行的“欲练神功挥刀自宫”，马上决定杀死在场的所有人，包括林平之。

可惜，没有杀死。

拿到《辟邪剑谱》后，岳不群面临着巨大的压力。

一方面是魔教的再次活跃，任我行重出江湖，华山面临危机。一方面是左冷禅的步步紧逼；一方面是

令狐冲的态度不明。一方面是门下没有什么得力的弟子。

而手头唯一可以抗衡，有点力量的就这个“割鸡鸡”了。割了不一定成，不割一定不成。割？还是不

割？

这是个问题。

在之后的一天里，岳不群想到了很多事，想到了大家对林远图的评价，想到了自己这么多年被左冷禅

等的欺负，想想夫人差点被嵩山派欺负，想到了刘正风被灭门却无可奈何。

一天后，岳不群大刀一挥，割了。

幸运的时，《辟邪剑谱》确实有效。岳不群武功大进。

坏消息时，学习了辟邪剑谱的岳不群突然发现，所谓的华山并没有什么重要，夫人、女儿，也没那么

重要了。反而是哪些虚幻的“人生妙悟”有点意思。

不管如何，现在岳不群已经有信心，也有能力去面对左冷禅，甚至东方不败了。

只是这个世界好像变了，那些也不重要了。

是呀，我费劲心机贮备好硬应对这些变化了。却发现自己变了。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

1 MARCH The C… .m4a

3.14MB

一小时运动

英文原文

1 MARCH

The Change Leader

The most effective way to manage change successfully is to create it.

One cannot manage change. One can only be ahead of it.

In a period of upheavals, such as the one we are living in, change is the norm.

upheavals：

动乱

N-COUNT An upheaval is a big change which causes a lot of trouble, confusion, and worry.

To be sure, it is painful and risky, and above all it requires a great deal of very hard work.

risky：

有危险（或风险）的

involving the possibility of sth bad happening

But unless it is seen as the task of the organization to lead change, the organization will not

survive.

In a period of rapid structural change, the only ones who survive are the change leaders.

A change leader sees change as an opportunity.

A change leader looks for change, knows how to find the right changes, and knows how to make

them effective both outside the organization and inside it.

To make the future is highly risky.

It is less risky, however, than not to try to make it.

A goodly proportion of those attempting to will surely not succeed.

proportion：

部分；份额

goodly：

相当大的；相当多的

[ C+sing./pl.v. ] a part or share of a whole

( old-fashioned , formal ) quite large in size or amount

But predictably, no one else will.

predictably：adv. 可预言地

ACTION POINT:

Anticipate the future and be a change leader.

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

Managing in the Next Society

1 MARCH

The Change Leader

The most effective way to manage change successfully is to create it.

One cannot manage change. One can only be ahead of it. In a period of

upheavals, such as the one we are living in, change is the norm. To be sure, it

is painful and risky, and above all it requires a great deal of very hard work.

But unless it is seen as the task of the organization to lead change, the

organization will not survive. In a period of rapid structural change, the only

ones who survive are the change leaders. A change leader sees change as an

opportunity. A change leader looks for change, knows how to find the right

changes, and knows how to make them effective both outside the or-

ganization and inside it. To make the future is highly risky. It is less risky,

however, than not to try to make it. A goodly proportion of those attempting

to will surely not succeed. But predictably, no one else will.

ACTION POINT:

Anticipate the future and be a change leader.

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

Managing in the Next Society

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

微信群原来可以这样用

有个朋友想写书。他是某个领域的专业人士，想写专业方面的说，说自己缺少案例。

我说，你建一个微信群，然后找各个和你工作相光的人，每天和大家聊，同时鼓励大家互相聊，同时

你有意地引导话题，很快就可以得到很多素材了。

身边有很多朋友做知识付费，就是录一个课，然后卖给想学习、听课的同学。这些同学经常发愁说课

程买的人太少。找不到客户。

我说，很容易呀，你建一个群，找到你认为可能感兴趣的人，然后和他们聊，看他们想要什么愿意为

什么样的内容付费，希望是什么形式，沟通上一段时间，你就清楚了。

有一个朋友做场地运营，他经验丰富，每个场地都被他安排的很舒服，很惬意。不过，这两年他也有

点纠结，好像大家多少有一些不满意。

我说，你的感觉可能是对的，你可以建一个微信群，把你的租户，以及有意向的人拉在一起，一方面

你可以和他们聊，一方面也可以引导他们互相聊天，在这些聊天过程中，你就会发现这些人的真正需

求了。

微信有一个SLOGON是“连接一切”，虽然还没有做到，也已经连接了几乎所有的人，不论你是做什么

的，你的朋友圈都会有你的客户的，这些人一方面可能会买单你的产品，一方面也可能指着你的鼻子

给你提意见。

有时，你和某个人私聊， 活着打电话问意见，你不一定能得到准确的信息，当你把很多人拉到一起，

拉到一个群，这些人的交流就会给你很多触动。前提是你做好引导。

当你客户混到一起后，就会触发无规则的交流，因着你的产品，因着你的服务，因着他们的需求。

然后，你就可以跟着这些人的建议，结合自己的想法，做出符合需求的产品，或者服务。

微信群其实是一个很好的获取客户信息的方法。因为感兴趣的才会进来，不感兴趣的就会推出，留在

群里还愿意聊天的，一定是对产品有许多话说的人，而这些话，是私聊和问卷都拿不到了。

所以，如果你不了解你的客户，那么，建个微信群吧。让他们进来随意聊天，让他们告诉你，什么才

是他们想要的。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

2 MARCH Test o….m4a

4.51MB

一小时运动

英文原文

2 MARCH

Test of Innovation

Measure innovations by what they contribute to market and customer.

The test of an innovation is whether it creates value.

Innovation means the creation of new value and new satisfaction for the customer.

A novelty only creates amusement.

novelty：

amusement：

[ U ] the quality of being new, different and interesting

新奇；新颖；新鲜

[ U ] the feeling that you have when sth is funny or amusing, or it entertains you

可笑；愉悦；娱乐

Yet, again and again, managements decide to innovate for no other reason than that they are bored

with doing the same thing or making the same product day in and day out.

The test of an innovation, as well as the test of “quality,” is not “Do we like it?”

It is “Do customers want it and will they pay for it?”

Organizations measure innovations not by their scientific or technological importance but by what

they contribute to market and customer.

They consider social innovation to be as important as technological innovation.

Installment selling may have had a greater impact on economics and markets than most of the

great scientific advances in this century.

Installment：

分期付款方式；分期付款购物法

impact

巨大影响；强大作用

installment plan n.

:~ (of sth) (on sb/sth) the powerful effect that sth has on sb/sth

ACTION POINT:

Identify innovations in your organization that are novelties versus those that are creating value.

Did you launch the novelties because you were bored with doing the same thing?

novelties:

廉价小饰物；小玩意儿

[ C ] a small cheap object sold as a toy or a decorative object

If so, make sure your next new product or service meets your customers’ needs.

The Frontiers of Management

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

2 MARCH

Test of Innovation

Measure innovations by what they contribute to market and customer.

The test of an innovation is whether it creates value. Innovation means the

creation of new value and new satisfaction for the customer. A nov-elty only

creates amusement. Yet, again and again, managements decide to innovate for

no other reason than that they are bored with doing the same thing or making

the same product day in and day out. The test of an inno-vation, as well as the

test of “quality,” is not “Do we like it?” It is “Do cus-

tomers want it and will they pay for it?”

Organizations measure innovations not by their scientific or technolog-

ical importance but by what they contribute to market and customer. They

consider social innovation to be as important as technological innovation.

Installment selling may have had a greater impact on economics and mar-

kets than most of the great scientific advances in this century.

ACTION POINT:

Identify innovations in your organization that are novel-

ties versus those that are creating value. Did you launch the novelties be-

cause you were bored with doing the same thing? If so, make sure your

next new product or service meets your customers’ needs.

The Frontiers of Management

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

谁是你的敌人

教育部门一直在想方设法收拾那些资质不全的培训机构，没想到一场瘟疫彻底解决了这个问题。

吴晓波老师一直说银行在期待信息化，只是各种步奏一直很慢，新冠病来了，好像也就没人再去银行

了：本来就是线上能做的事呀。所以，吴老师说：加油！银行人。

消灭小偷的不是警察，而是支付宝；消灭随身听的居然是手机。

子弹短信出来时，信誓旦旦地要干掉微信；其实，在子弹微信之前，飞信、来往就试过。基本上没

戏，因为，干掉微信的，大概率不是另一个微信。

让柯达破产的，不是其他相机公司，而是手机公司；每一个做儿童教育的，你会发现，你的竞争对手

不是其他老师，而是王者荣耀：你必须比游戏更有吸引力。

疫情过后，很多人会觉得饭店会报复性反弹。其实，压垮很多饭店的，可能是那些已经学会各种菜肴

的家庭主妇（主夫）。

左冷禅认为，阻拦他成就霸业的是五岳派的那些掌门人，比如天门道人、莫大、岳不群、定闲。没想

到反而是令狐冲。

其实，我们整天盯着我们认定的那些竞争者，其实，真正的竞争者根本就在我们视线之外。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

一小时运动

英文原文

3 MARCH

Knowledge External to the Enterprise

The technologies that are likely to have the greatest impact on a company and an industry are

technologies outside its own field.

impact

巨大影响；强大作用

:~ (of sth) (on sb/sth) the powerful effect that sth has on sb/sth

Many changes that have transformed enterprises have originated outside the specific industry of

that enterprise.

Here are three notable examples.

The zipper was originally invented to close bales of heavy goods, such as grain, particularly in

seaports.

bales:

大包，大捆（轻物品）

grain

谷物；谷粒

seaport

海港城市

zipper n. 拉链

a large amount of a light material pressed tightly together and tied up

:[ U C ] the small hard seeds of food plants such as wheat , rice, etc.; a single seed of such a plant

:a town with a harbour used by large ships

:

Nobody thought of using it for clothing. The clothing industry did not think it could replace buttons.

And the inventor never dreamed it would be successful in the clothing industry.

Commercial paper (that is, short-term notes originated by nonbank financial institutions) did not

originate with banks, but had a tremendous negative impact on them.

Commercial paper : 会计 商业票据， 金融 流通票据

originated

始创 起源

tremendous:

巨大的；极大的

negative

消极的；负面的；缺乏热情的

  1. [

]

[

]

commercial bill, mercantile paper

:V-T/V-I When something originates or when someone originates it, it begins to happen or exist.

;

very great

considering only the bad side of sth/sb; lacking enthusiasm or hope

Under U.S. law, commercial paper is considered a security, which means that commercial banks

cannot deal in it.

deal in：v. 经营

Because financial services companies, such as Goldman Sachs, Merrill Lynch, GE Capital, and so

on, discovered this, they have largely replaced commercial banks as the world’s most important

and leading financial institutions.

Fiberglass cable, the invention that has revolutionized the telephone industry, did not come out of

the great telephone research labs in the U.S., Japan, or Germany. It came, rather, from a glass

company, Corning.

Fiberglass：n. 玻璃纤维；玻璃丝

Corning：康宁公司是特殊玻璃和陶瓷材料的全球领导厂商。基于 多年在材料科学和制程工艺领域的知识， 康宁创造并生产出了

160

众多被用于高科技消费电子、移动排放控制、电信和生命科学领域产品的关键组成部分。

康宁公司（简称康宁）世界500强企业，1851年于美国纽约州的康宁市成立。

ACTION POINT:

Identify at least one change that has originated outside your industry that either has transformed or

has the potential to transform your enterprise.

Look for ideas in other industries that can be used profitably in your industry.

profitably： 有利地；有益地

advantageously, favourably

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

From Data to Information Literacy (Corpedia Online Program)

3 MARCH

Knowledge External to the Enterprise

The technologies that are likely to have the greatest impact on a company

and an industry are technologies outside its own field.

Many changes that have transformed enterprises have originated out-

side the specific industry of that enterprise. Here are three notable examples.

The zipper was originally invented to close bales of heavy goods, such as

grain, particularly in seaports. Nobody thought of using it for cloth-ing. The

clothing industry did not think it could replace buttons. And the

inventor never dreamed it would be successful in the clothing industry.

Commercial paper (that is, short-term notes originated by nonbank fi-

nancial institutions) did not originate with banks, but had a tremendous

negative impact on them. Under U.S. law, commercial paper is considered

Asecurity, which means that commercial banks cannot deal in it. Because

financial services companies, such as Goldman Sachs, Merrill Lynch, GE

Capital, and so on, discovered this, they have largely replaced commercial

banks as the world’s most important and leading financial institutions.

Fiberglass cable, the invention that has revolutionized the telephone in-dustry,

did not come out of the great telephone research labs in the U.S., Japan, or

Germany. It came, rather, from a glass company, Corning.

ACTION POINT:

Identify at least one change that has originated outside

your industry that either has transformed or has the potential to transform

your enterprise. Look for ideas in other industries that can be used prof-

itably in your industry.

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

From Data to Information Literacy (Corpedia Online Program)

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

从射手座到处女座

我不懂星座。

年轻时经常听到朋友们聊星座，我也就凑热闹了解一下，听的多了，也就多少了解一些。

我是射手座，射手座的人乐观、诚实、热情、喜欢挑战，不过很容易浮躁不安，鲁莽行事，喜欢冒险

家，热爱旅行、喜欢赌博性的活动，为人变化多端，有双重性格的特质。

其中，我理解最深的就是”变化多端“，或者说点子非常多。

作为射手座的我，是不缺点子的，看到任何事情，我在了解这件事的进行中，就会冒出很多点子，注意，是

冒出，不是由我来控制的。

所以，大家对射手座的感觉即使”一会一个想法“，根本就固定不下来。因为点子多，也就不在意电子，自己

偶尔出一个”完美的“点子，还没等别人理解，自己就忘记了。

这个就是典型的我。只是随着年龄增加，我的”毛病“好像少了一些。

有一次，我和一个星座高手（其实我不懂什么样的人可以被称为高手，不过，她自己称自己为高手）聊天，

她说，30岁以后的人，不能只看自己的星座了，还要看”上升星座“。

当然，我不懂什么是上升星座，就问她：”我的上升星座是什么呢？“

这个姑娘拿了我的生辰八字，还有出生地后，经过复杂运算，然后告诉我，我的上升星座是处女座。

那么，处女座的性格特征是什么呢？

处女座的人追求完美，挑剔和神经紧张，吹毛求疵正，唠叨又婆婆妈妈，和人相处很不愉怏。我也认识几个

处女座，他们确实追求完美。我觉得已经可以的事情，他们觉得还没开始。

而我现在也变成了处女座。然后，我开始想我的性格，发现，我好像也开始挑剔了。我开始追求排版的精美

（当然，和真正的处女座还是差的很远），我开始追去颜色的搭配，我开始追去画面的布局，而不是草草地

完成一个点子，然后思绪又到了下一个。

而现在的我，就是射手座+处女座的结合体。

一方面，我还是不缺点子，但凡某个事我想做，总是有足够多（不一定好）的点子。同时，对于那些我自己

觉得比较好的点子，我也会话更多的精力让它完成，甚至”完美“。

是呀，”完美“第一次出现在我的生命中。比如，今天早上我随时写了对一首诗的感悟，写完后，我发现，简

单地放在哪里有点不好。然后我就找了个公号发出来。发送的时候，我第一次觉得，应该排的好看一些，然

后我就刻意地花了2分钟排了一下版。

所以，在我目前还不长的这个生命里，我简单地经历了从射手座到处女座的。然后发现，这个成长挺有趣：

开始我们总是有很作主意，很多想法，随着时间的推移，我们总是要找到其中一些”最好“的，这时，我发现

我的时间不多了，没法任性地去想那么多电子了，只要关注其中的几个，甚至是一个。

然后在这几个甚至一个中，找到自己的rightone。

这或许就是我的人生吧。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

4 MARCH

In Innovation, Emphasize the Big Idea

Emphasize：

强调；重视；着重

to give special importance to sth

Innovative ideas are like frogs’ eggs: of a thousand hatched, only one or two survive to maturity.

hatched：

V-T/V-I When a baby bird, insect, or other animal hatches, or when it is hatched, it comes out of its egg by breaking the

使孵出; 孵出

maturity：the quality of thinking and behaving in a sensible, adult manner （思想行为、作品等）成熟

shell.

The innovative organization understands that innovation starts with an idea.

Ideas are somewhat like babies—they are born small, immature, and shapeless.

immature：

（行为）不成熟的，不够老练

的，幼稚的

behaving in a way that is not sensible and is typical of people who are much younger

They are promise rather than fulfillment.

fulfillment：n. 履行；实行；满足（感）

In the innovative organization executives do not say, “This is a damn-fool idea.”

Instead they ask, “What would be needed to make this embryonic, half-baked, foolish idea into

something that makes sense, that is feasible, that is an opportunity for us?”

embryonic：

胚胎期的；萌芽期的；未成熟的

half-baked：

计划不完善的；考虑不周的

feasible：

可行的；行得通的

( formal ) in an early stage of development

[ usually before noun ] ( informal ) not well planned or considered

that is possible and likely to be achieved

But an innovative organization also knows that the great majority of ideas will turn out not to make

sense.

Executives in innovative organizations therefore demand that people with ideas think through the

work needed to turn an idea into a product, a process, a business, or a technology.

They ask, “What work should we have to do and what would we have to find out and learn before

we can commit the company to this idea of yours?”

These executives know that it is as difficult and risky to convert a small idea into successful reality

as it is to make a major innovation.

major：

主要的；重要的；大的

[ usually before noun ] very large or important

They do not aim at “improvements” or “modifications” in products or technology.

They aim at innovating a new business.

ACTION POINT:

Make a list of your three best ideas.

Then make a list of the key pieces of information you need to know and the major work that needs

to be done before these ideas can blossom into a new business.

blossom：

（尤指果树或灌木的）花朵，花簇

[ C U ] a flower or a mass of flowers, especially on a fruit tree or bush

Now pursue the best idea, or if none is practical, start again.

pursue：

追求；致力于；执行；贯彻

[ VN ] to do sth or try to achieve sth over a period of time

The Frontiers of Management

4 MARCH

In Innovation, Emphasize the Big Ide

AInnovative ideas are like frogs’ eggs: of a thousand hatched,

only one or two survive to maturity.

The innovative organization understands that innovation starts with an

idea. Ideas are somewhat like babies—they are born small, immature, and

shapeless. They are promise rather than fulfillment. In the innovative

organization executives do not say, “This is a damn-fool idea.” Instead they

ask, “What would be needed to make this embryonic, half-baked, foolish ide

Ainto something that makes sense, that is feasible, that is an opportunity

for us?”

But an innovative organization also knows that the great majority of

ideas will turn out not to make sense. Executives in innovative organiza-

tions therefore demand that people with ideas think through the work

needed to turn an idea into a product, a process, a business, or a technol-

ogy. They ask, “What work should we have to do and what would we

have to find out and learn before we can commit the company to this ide

Aof yours?” These executives know that it is as difficult and risky to

convert a small idea into successful reality as it is to make a major

innovation. They do not aim at “improvements” or “modifications” in

products or technol-ogy. They aim at innovating a new business.

ACTION POINT:

Make a list of your three best ideas. Then make a list of the

key pieces of information you need to know and the major work that

needs to be done before these ideas can blossom into a new business.

Now pursue the best idea, or if none is practical, start again.

The Frontiers of Management

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

如何预见未来？说说必然和巧合

如何预见未来呢？有很多方法。

比如，你要预测世界杯的冠军，你只需要选择足够多的人群，然后把人群一分为二。

把每场比赛的两种输赢可能性分别发给其中的一半人。然后继续在下一场继续。

在下一场继续两种输赢的可能性发给上次发对的那一半人。然后继续到下一场。

直到决赛 ，仍然是把两种输赢的可能性分别发给上一次发对的那些人。

最后那些受到正确“预测”的人一定认为你是神，居然预测中了所有的淘汰赛。

其实，你只是说了一种必然。

因为在淘汰制里，每一场比赛都会有一个输赢。所以，你”预见“了未来。

还有一种是巧合，比如，在一些论坛，每天都有人说某个地方会地震。当然，大多时候并不好发生。

而一旦发生后，我们在回过头来找那个预测某个特定地方有地震的信息，然后，我们有发现了神。

马云在1999年成立了阿里巴巴，投身到了电子商务，成就了现在的阿里帝国。很多人肯定觉得马云是

神一样的人物，居然在那种纷繁复杂的市场中敏锐地看清楚了未来的发展规划，从而做出了这么大的

成就。

其实，当时做电子商务的公司很多，做的比阿里早的也有，做的比阿里好的也有，实力比阿里强的也

有，只是阿里成功了。现在回过头来看阿里，除了发现马云的睿智外，我们并不能看到太多：时代选

择了马云而已。

如果我们回想我们的祖先，会发现我们的某个祖先在战争的刀枪中艰难地爬行，我们非常为他担心，

因为他一旦死了，就没有我们什么事了。

其实，不用担心，现在活得的某一个，他的祖先一定会历经各种磨难也会活下来的。你想想是不是这

个道理？

从我们祖先的角度来看我们，我们就是一个巧合：那么巧，我的后人居然可以延续到几百年，几千年

后！而换个视角，我会发现，我们必然能在历史中找到我们的祖先：你看，他正在要饭，今天要不到

就会饿死，不过，他一定会要到的，因为他是我们的祖先。

春节前爆发的新冠疫情，它会带来什么样的改变？市场的改变，经济的改变，社会的改变，政府的改

变？我们应该如何应对这种改变？

2年后，甚至10年后，当时的人会非常清晰，而且非常自然地说：因为疫情，所以人们之间的情感变得

淡了，因为疫情，所以人们不再上街吃饭了。

而处在这个时代的我们，并不知道，我们对每一个明天都惴惴不安，我们对哪怕一秒后都没有十足的

把握。

不过，我们能做的是，我们充分了解我们所能了解的事情。然后按照我们的理解，选择出我们认为最

大的可能性，选择出我们推断出的必然。然后用这个推断来规划我们的生活。如果我们要规划的话。

当我们爬到山顶时，我们非常明确的是，我们会下山，这是必然，至于从哪里下去，在路上会遇到什

么人，那就是偶然了。

或许，我会恰好遇到”她“，也或许，我只是会遇到一只狼。这些都是巧合。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

5 MARCH

Managing for the Future

Prediction of future events is futile.

futile：

having no purpose because there is no chance of success

徒然的；徒劳的；无效的

The starting point to know the future is the realization that there are two different, though

complementary, approaches:

realization:

认识；领会；领悟

complementary：

[ U sing. ] ~ (that…) | ~ (of sth) the process of becoming aware of sth

(to sth) two people or things that are complementary are different but together form a useful or attractive

combination of skills, qualities or physical features

互补的；补充的；相互补足的

Finding and exploiting the time lag between the appearance of a discontinuity in the economy and

society and its full impact—one might call this anticipation of a future that has already happened.

lag:

缓慢移动；发展

[ V ] ~ (behind sb/sth) | ~ (behind) to move or develop slowly or more slowly than other people, organizations, etc.

缓慢；滞后；落后于

discontinuity

:[ U ] the state of not being continuous

不连贯；不连续

Imposing on the yet unborn future a new idea that tries to give direction and shape to what is to

come.

Imposing:

[ V ] ~ (on/upon sb/sth) to expect sb to do sth for you or to spend time with you, when it may not be convenient for them

勉强（某人做某事）；硬要…和…在一起

This one might call making the future happen.

The future that has already happened is not within the present business; it is outside: a change in

society, knowledge, culture, industry, or economic structure.

It is, moreover, a major trend, a break in the pattern rather than a variation within it.

trend:

variation

趋势；趋向；倾向；动态；动向

:[ C U ] ~ (in/of sth) a change, especially in the amount or level of sth （数量、水平等的）变化，变更，变异

(towards/in sth) a general direction in which a situation is changing or developing

Looking for the future that has already happened and anticipating its impacts introduces new

perception in the beholder.

perception ：

术语

知觉；感知

[ U ] ( technical

) ( formal ) the way you notice things, especially with the senses

The need is to make oneself see it.

What then could or should be done is usually not too difficult to discover.

The opportunities are neither remote nor obscure.

obscure：

费解的；难以理解的

difficult to understand

The pattern has to be recognized first.

Predicting the future can only get you in trouble.

Predicting：

预言；预告；预报

to say that sth will happen in the future

The task is to manage what is there and to work to create what could and should be.

ACTION POINT:

Spot a discontinuity in the economy or society that has appeared and presents an opportunity for

your enterprise.

Spot：

不用于进行时

( not used in the progressive tenses

easy to do so

看见；看出；注意到；发现

) to see or notice a person or thing, especially suddenly or when it is not

Determine how long it will take for this change to impact the business.

Develop a business plan to cash in on this insight.

Managing for Results

5 MARCH

Managing for the Future

Prediction of future events is futile.

The starting point to know the future is the realization that there are two

different, though complementary, approaches:

•Finding and exploiting the time lag between the appearance of

Adiscontinuity in the economy and society and its full impact—one

might call this anticipation of a future that has already happened.

•Imposing on the yet unborn future a new idea that tries to give

direction and shape to what is to come. This one might call making

the future happen.

The future that has already happened is not within the present

business; it is outside: a change in society, knowledge, culture, industry,

or economic structure. It is, moreover, a major trend, a break in the

pattern rather than a variation within it. Looking for the future that has

already happened and anticipating its impacts introduces new perception

in the beholder. The need is to make oneself see it. What then could or

should be done is usually not too difficult to discover. The opportunities

are neither remote nor ob-scure. The pattern has to be recognized first.

Predicting the future can only get you in trouble. The task is to manage

what is there and to work to create what could and should be.

ACTION POINT:

Spot a discontinuity in the economy or society that has

appeared and presents an opportunity for your enterprise. Determine how

long it will take for this change to impact the business. Develop

Abusiness plan to cash in on this insight.

Managing for Results

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

什么样的人是英雄？

小时候，喜欢看武打电影，看到那些武林高手在各种悬崖边上打斗，感觉那些人居然不怕，很是英

雄。就很佩服那样的人。

后来，长大了一些，发现自己是个懦夫，而且恐高，站到10层楼以上就不敢往下看了，更别提站在悬

崖边了。

再后来，我长大了，发现自己还是胆小，什么都怕，不敢大声说话，不敢公开演讲，被人欺负也不敢

反抗，也不敢去和领导谈涨工资。

所以，我这样的人，肯定不适合创业， 因为他们说创业都要胆大，要有”把脑袋别在腰带上“的气魄。

而我没有。

偶尔，我会和一些股民聊天，他们与很多很有趣的理论，他们说，炒股就是”撑死胆大的，饿死胆小的

“，所以，要敢于逆行。”赢了豪华游艇，属于下地干活“。

有个股民说：”其实，我们股民玩的是‘火中取栗’”，我们不怕风险，只要有利润。事实上，我们的利润

都来自风险，而且是巨大的风险。

然后，又有人和我说：“人生哪里没有风险呢？喝凉水还能噎死呢，做啥没有风险呢？” 所以我们要拥

抱风险。

而我，则是个风险厌恶型的， 我几乎厌恶所有的风险，甚至是没面子的风险。所以，我总是不做什么

事情。让自己风险降到最低。

然后我想，企业家，是不是就是那些特别爱冒险的人呢？

那云、马化腾、任正非，那些人是不是都是爱冒险的人呢？

马云是不是冒险去创业了？任正非是不是40多岁，才冒着巨大的风险去开公司？

或者说，古代那些将军，军事家，是不是都是嗜血好杀，经常置之死地而后生呢？

好像是，好像又不是。

其实，对于那些人来说创业才是最低风险的事情，当马云实在找不到工作时，他选择了创业，当马化

腾的公司实在卖不出去的时候，他选择了坚持，当任正非在40多岁，已经无可失去时，他选择了创办

华为。

所以，所谓的创业者，他们只是选择了风险最小的事情，而不是相反。

或许，某天，当我不得不创业时，当我不得不抛下脸面去公开演讲时，当我敲开老板的门去和他谈工

资时，我只是选择了我当时风险最小的选择。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

6 MARCH

Innovation and Risk Taking

Successful innovators are conservative.

conservative：

opposed to great or sudden social change; showing that you prefer traditional styles and values

I once attended a university symposium on entrepreneurship at which a number of

psychologists spoke.

symposium：

保守的；守旧的

(on sth) a meeting at which experts have discussions about a particular subject; a small conference

研讨会；小型讨论会

专题讨论会；

entrepreneurship：

N-UNCOUNT Entrepreneurship is the state of being an entrepreneur, or the activities associated with being

企业家(身份、行为); 企业家精神

psychologists：N-COUNT A psychologist is a person who studies the human mind and tries to explain why people behave in the

way that they do. 心理学家

an entrepreneur.

Although their papers disagreed on everything else, they all talked about an “entrepreneurial

personality,” which was characterized by a “propensity for risk taking.”

entrepreneurial ：

具有创业素

ADJ Entrepreneurial means having the qualities that are needed to succeed as an entrepreneur.

质的

personality：

性；人格

[ C U ] the various aspects of a person’s character that combine to make them different from other people

propensity：

向；习性

(for sth) | ~ (for doing sth) | ~ (to do sth) ( formal ) a tendency to a particular kind of behaviour

性格；个

（行为方面的）倾

A well-known and successful innovator and entrepreneur who had built a process-based innovation

into a substantial worldwide business in the space of twenty-five years was then asked to

comment.

substantial ：

大量的；价值巨大的；重大的

comment：

表达意见

large in amount, value or importance

(on/upon sth) to express an opinion about sth

He said: “I find myself baffled by your papers. I think I know as many successful innovators and

entrepreneurs as anyone, beginning with myself.

baffled：

使困惑

V-T If something baffles you, you cannot understand it or explain it.

I have never come across an ‘entrepreneurial personality.’

The successful ones I know all have, however, one thing—and only one thing—in common: they are

not ‘risk takers.’ They try to define the risks they have to take and to minimize them as much as

possible.

Otherwise none of us could have succeeded.”

This jibes with my own experience.

jibes：

N-COUNT A jibe is a rude or insulting remark about someone that is intended to make them look foolish.

嘲讽

I, too, know a good many successful entrepreneurs.

Not one of them has a “propensity for risk taking.”

Most successful innovators in real life are colorless figures, and much more likely to spend hours

on cash-flow projections than to dash off looking for “risks.”

They are not “risk-focused”; they are “opportunity-focused.”

ACTION POINT:

Determine which of your ideas presents the least risk and the most opportunity and focus on them.

Innovation and Entrepreneurship

6 MARCH

Innovation and Risk Taking

Successful innovators are conservative.

Ionce attended a university symposium on entrepreneurship at which

Anumber of psychologists spoke. Although their papers disagreed on

everything else, they all talked about an “entrepreneurial personality,” which

was characterized by a “propensity for risk taking.” A well-known and

successful innovator and entrepreneur who had built a process-based

innovation into a substantial worldwide business in the space of twenty-five

years was then asked to comment. He said: “I find myself baffled by your

papers. I think I know as many successful innovators and entrepreneurs as

anyone, beginning with myself. I have never come across an ’entrepre-neurial

personality.’ The successful ones I know all have, however, one thing—and

only one thing—in common: they are not ‘risk takers.’ They try to define the

risks they have to take and to minimize them as much as pos-

sible. Otherwise none of us could have succeeded.”

This jibes with my own experience. I, too, know a good many successful

entrepreneurs. Not one of them has a “propensity for risk taking.” Most suc-

cessful innovators in real life are colorless figures, and much more likely to

spend hours on cash-flow projections than to dash off looking for “risks.”

They are not “risk-focused”; they are “opportunity-focused.”

ACTION POINT:

Determine which of your ideas presents the least risk and

the most opportunity and focus on them.

Innovation and Entrepreneurship

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

岳不群和左冷禅，如果创业，谁更容易成功？

岳不群和左冷禅是《笑傲江湖》里两个反派，而且都是身在正派里的反派人物。这两个人也是被大家

讨论最多的人物，一个被称为伪君子，一个呗称为野心家。 那么，这两个人有什么本质的区别呢？谁

更“厉害”一些呢？谁是更好的“领导人”呢？

如果创业，谁更容易成功呢？

这是一个很有趣的话题，这就要看一下两个人更深层次的区别了。

左冷禅是嵩山派掌门人，岳不群是华山派掌门人，在这个层面，两个人都是承袭了先辈的“遗泽”，比

不出高低的。

嵩山派高手多。左冷禅有不少师弟，武功很高；华山派高手少，除了岳不群和宁中则外，基本上没什

么高手。不过，嵩山派的高手大多数师弟，而华山派却因为内斗，师弟大多死了，或者离开了，这个

也不能赖岳不群。所以，虽然实力上嵩山派比华山派高，这和两个人的能力关系也不大。

左冷禅是五岳派的盟主，而岳不群只是五岳派掌门。左冷禅这个盟主，我感觉更像是“轮值主席”，只

是恰好轮到了左冷禅。而且盟主只是对五岳派共同事物的处理。有点像“联合国秘书长”的意思。不

过，这个位置肯定会有视角的不同，算是左冷禅的一个优势。

当然，左冷禅的武功比岳不群要高，而且要高不少。左冷禅可以和任我行一对一单挑，岳不群估计不

行。这个也是左冷禅的优势。

左冷禅意识到了一个问题，就是，分散的五岳剑派，是对付不了魔教的，而且，也是不能展示自己势

力的，所以，左冷禅要把五岳剑派合并成五岳派，所有的人成为自己的门人弟子，从而实质性扩大自

己的势力，近一点和魔教对抗，远一点甚至可以武林称霸。

为了做到这一点，左冷禅针对性地对五派进行策反、处置、谋划。

对于泰山派，左冷禅收买了玉玑子等天门道长的师叔们，以便在必要时刻完成对泰山派的吞并；

对于恒山派，左冷禅刚开始认为那些尼姑会非常柔弱，就在压力下威逼他们接受并派，没想到三个老

尼姑宁死不屈，在临死前还把掌门之位传给了“骡”令狐冲；不过，三定还是死了。定静死于左冷禅之

手，定闲、定逸死于岳不群之手；

对于华山派，基于岳不群的名望，左冷禅派了弟子劳德诺卧底华山派，窃取华山派的机密，见机行

事。而且左冷禅清楚岳不群的武功不行，所以，也不算太忌惮；

对于衡山派，左冷禅派人杀死了刘正风，而且，左冷禅知道衡山派掌门人莫大胆小怕事，而且武功一

般，大概率不会公开反对自己。

做好了这些筹划，左冷禅就开始了并派的投票和掌门人的选举。左冷禅认为，并派的通过是没什么意

外的，而自己当选掌门人也是没什么意外的。当上掌门人后，就可以正式挑战魔教了。

这就是左冷禅的筹划。

可惜，左冷禅百密一疏。劳德诺早就被岳不群识破了，岳不群玩了一个“群英会蒋干中计”的戏码，左

冷禅得到了两个假信息：1. 岳不群武功一般；2. 拿到了假的辟邪剑谱。

在最后牌桌上一反两瞪眼时，岳不群先是借着左冷禅的局，完成了并派的投票，然后又用真的辟邪剑

法刺瞎了左冷禅的双眼，从而爆出了冷门，成为了嵩山之巅的一匹黑马。成为了五岳派的第一任掌门

人，当然，也是最后一任。

从结果来看，左冷禅“为谁辛苦为谁忙”， “为他人做嫁衣裳”，而岳不群“以静待动”，“以逸待劳“，最后

收了果子。

看起来还是岳不群高人一等。

那么，真实情况呢？咱们看看两个人筹划和处理的分别是什么问题。

左冷禅筹划的是一个”未知的问题“，在左冷禅筹划前，江湖上是没有人这么做的。而岳不群做的是左

冷禅出给他的题：

我派了个人去你那里，你怎么做？我要并派，你怎么办？我要投票，你怎么办？我要选掌门，你怎么

办？

所以，左冷禅是自己谱曲，自己演奏，而岳不群只是在左冷禅的曲谱里做一个优秀的表演而已。

在一个公司，作为一个企业家，一方面固然需要每天面对市场上各种风云变幻，答出很多确定题目的

答案，更多的是要在贫瘠的市场中，找到相对平缓的一块市场，自己开始谱曲，开始演奏，最后还要

躬身入局，自弹自唱。

从这个视角来看，反而左冷禅是更适合这个市场的，因为他自己谱了曲，自己唱了，只是没唱好而

已。

至于岳不群，只是一个回答题的好学生而已。“三长一短选最短,三短一长选最长 两长两短就选B,同长

同短就选A 长短不一选择D,参差不齐C无敌 ”

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

7 MARCH

Creating a True Whole

Create a true whole greater than the sum of its parts.

A manager has the task of creating a true whole that is larger than the sum of its parts.

One analogy is the task of the conductor of a symphony orchestra, through whose effort, vision,

and leadership individual instrumental parts become the living whole of a musical performance.

analogy：

[ C ] ~ (between A and B) | ~ (with sth) a comparison of one thing with another thing that has similar features; a feature

类比；比拟；比喻

conductor：a person who stands in front of an orchestra , a group of singers etc., and directs their performance, especially sb

who does this as a profession （管弦乐队、合唱队等的）指挥；职业指挥

symphony：a long complicated piece of music for a large orchestra , in three or four main parts (called movements ) 交响乐；交响

曲

orchestra：[ C+sing./pl.v. ] a large group of people who play various musical instruments together, led by a conductor 管弦乐队

that is similar

But the conductor has the composer’s score; he is only interpreter.

interpreter：

口译工作者；口译译员

a person whose job is to translate what sb is saying into another language

The manager is both composer and conductor.

The task of creating a genuine whole also requires that the manager, in every one of her acts,

consider simultaneously the performance and results of the enterprise as a whole and the diverse

activities needed to achieve synchronized performance.

It is here, perhaps, that the comparison with the orchestra conductor fits best.

A conductor must always hear both the whole orchestra and, say, the second oboe.

Similarly, a manager must always consider both the overall performance of the enterprise and, say,

the market-research activity needed.

By raising the performance of the whole, she creates scope and challenge for market research.

By improving the perfor-mance of market research, she makes possible better overall business results.

The manager must simultaneously ask two double-barreled questions: “What better business

performance is needed and what does this require of what activities?”

And “What better performances are the activi-ties capable of and what improvement in business

results will they make possible?”

ACTION POINT:

Have you composed your symphony? Has your boss com-posed his or hers?

Have you begun rehearsals with your players yet?

Can you hear the second oboe? Are you ready for Carnegie Hall?

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

7 MARCH

Creating a True Whole

Create a true whole greater than the sum of its parts.

Amanager has the task of creating a true whole that is larger than the

sum of its parts. One analogy is the task of the conductor of a sym-phony

orchestra, through whose effort, vision, and leadership individual

instrumental parts become the living whole of a musical performance. But

the conductor has the composer’s score; he is only interpreter. The man-

ager is both composer and conductor.

The task of creating a genuine whole also requires that the manager, in

every one of her acts, consider simultaneously the performance and

results of the enterprise as a whole and the diverse activities needed to

achieve syn-chronized performance. It is here, perhaps, that the

comparison with the orchestra conductor fits best. A conductor must

always hear both the whole orchestra and, say, the second oboe. Similarly,

a manager must always con-sider both the overall performance of the

enterprise and, say, the market-research activity needed. By raising the

performance of the whole, she creates scope and challenge for market

research. By improving the perfor-mance of market research, she makes

possible better overall business re-sults. The manager must

simultaneously ask two double-barreled questions: “What better business

performance is needed and what does this require of what activities?”

And “What better performances are the activi-ties capable of and what

improvement in business results will they make possible?”

ACTION POINT:

Have you composed your symphony? Has your boss com-

posed his or hers? Have you begun rehearsals with your players yet? Can

you hear the second oboe? Are you ready for Carnegie Hall?

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

疫情期间，你做了些什么呢？

这个春节挺有趣的，我本来定了初二去上海，因为疫情的原因也取消了。这个春节基本上没花什么

钱，算省下了，花的多的也就是儿子们吃了几千块钱的牛羊肉。

然后我就在家宅着，庆幸自己在节前买了一个书桌，并且在书桌前贴了一块软性磁力白板，可以按着

自己心情随意写点什么。

由于在家的时间长，每天吃的都是那些，所以，我也就学着去和面，我现在和面可快了，而且会活各

种面。

在疫情期间，我还做了几个方案，并且把方案设计的资料做了一个整体的梳理。把几千个文件重新做

了阅读、合并、删除。算是对工作做了一个整理吧。

然后我还读了几百页的英文原版书。逐字读的，读的很慢。现在阅读英文的速度要快多了。我还读了

十几本书，有病毒的，有蝙蝠的，有心理学的，有管理学的，有体育的，有诗词的，我发现，通过这

个阅读，这个世界在我面前呈现除了完全不同的形态，我以为的坚固，其实只是一系列的偶尔。

最后，我还立了不少flag，比如，让自己开始平和，提升自己的钝感力等等。

然后，我去看朋友圈，看看大家都在做什么。

我一个喜欢的作家在疫情期间完成了60万字的新书修订稿；另一个作家也完成了初稿，并且开始着手

写小说。疫情的自我隔离对于写作人士来说是影响最小的，因为他们本来就随时做着自我隔离，所

以，他们的收获都是很直接的。

有一个朋友开始筹划线上授课的体系，在这之前，他是坚定地在做线下培训机构。这个对他来说是个

挑战，不过，他说，既然遇到了，那就闯过去。

好几个自媒体写手在”上蹿下跳“，嗅探着各种机会，因为对于媒体人来说，一生能遇到几次这样的机

会呢？每天都是意外，每天都是爆点，每天都是新闻。

这是，很多人都意识到，这是一个可以让大家实现“跳跃”的一个机会，如果在这之前，你的业务是连

续的话，现在这个疫情就为你的业务提供了“跳跃”的机会。

在这个疫情期间，甚至之后，你会发现，房子不再值钱，因为没人；关系不再值钱，因为太多；技术

不再稀缺，因为信息的发达，在这个时代，唯一值钱的就是你自己，所以，在这个疫情期间，很多人

都在思考如何用好“自己”，以及身边的那些“他们”。也就是人力。

在这些天，如果你用心做了某个事，而且是心无旁骛（你还能旁到哪里去呀）地做。那么，你会发现

你有非常快的进步。

我现在每天会关机两个小时，我发现这两个小时基本上可以完成之前一天的工作。这对我来说就是非

常棒的成长了。

疫情总归要结束，疫情结束后，你的这些想法，或许着手的，或者落地的，或者只是想想的，会如何

改变你呢？你会做出什么样的变化呢？

不管你变不变，这个世界肯定变了。

而你，能做的只有“应对”。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

8 MARCH

Turbulence: Threat or Opportunity?

Turbulence：

a situation in which there is a lot of sudden change, confusion, disagreement and sometimes violence

骚乱；动乱；

动荡；混乱

Threat：[ C U ] ~ (to do sth) a statement in which you tell sb that you will punish or harm them, especially if they do not do what you

want 威胁；恐吓

When it rains manna from heaven, some people put up an umbrella.

manna：

《圣经》

[ U ] ( in the Bible

) the food that God provided for the people of Israel during their 40 years in the desert

玛纳（以色列人在荒野40年中神赐的食粮）

吗哪，

Others reach for a big spoon.

The manager will have to look at her task and ask, “What must I do to be prepared for danger, for

opportunities, and above all for change?”

First, this is a time to make sure that your organization is lean and can move fast.

lean：

前俯（或后仰）；倾斜

[ V , usually + adv./prep. ] to bend or move from a vertical position

So this is a time when one systematically abandons and sloughs off unjustifiable products and

activities—and sees to it that the really important tasks are adequately supported.

sloughs：

自然脱落

V-T When a plant sloughs its leaves, or an animal such as a snake sloughs its skin, the leaves or skin come off naturally.

unjustifiable：

( of an action

行动 ) impossible to excuse or accept because there is no good reason for it 不可原谅的；无法接受

的；无正当理由的

adequately：adv. 充分地；足够地；适当地

Second, she will have to work on the most expensive of resources—time—particularly in areas

where it is people’s only resource, as it is for highly paid, important groups such as research

workers, technical service staffs, and all managers.

And one must set goals for productivity improvement.

Third, managers must learn to manage growth and to distinguish among kinds of growth.

distinguish：

区分；辨别；分清

(between) A and B | ~ A from B to recognize the difference between two people or things

If productivity of your combined resources goes up with growth, it is healthy growth.

Fourth, the development of people will be far more crucial in the years ahead.

crucial：

至关重要的；关键性的

(to/for sth) | ~ (that…) extremely important, because it will affect other things

ACTION POINT:

Get rid of unjustifiable products and activities, set goals to improve productivity, manage growth,

and develop your people.

The “How to” Drucker

Managing in Turbulent Times

8 MARCH

Turbulence: Threat or Opportunity?

When it rains manna from heaven, some people put up an umbrella.

Others reach for a big spoon.

The manager will have to look at her task and ask, “What must I do to be

prepared for danger, for opportunities, and above all for change?” First, this is

a time to make sure that your organization is lean and can move fast. So this

is a time when one systematically abandons and sloughs off un-justifiable

products and activities—and sees to it that the really important tasks are

adequately supported. Second, she will have to work on the most expensive

of resources—time—particularly in areas where it is people’s only resource,

as it is for highly paid, important groups such as research workers, technical

service staffs, and all managers. And one must set goals for productivity

improvement. Third, managers must learn to manage growth and to

distinguish among kinds of growth. If productivity of your combined

resources goes up with growth, it is healthy growth. Fourth, the

development of people will be far more crucial in the years ahead.

ACTION POINT:

Get rid of unjustifiable products and activities, set goals to

improve productivity, manage growth, and develop your people.

The “How to” Drucker

Managing in Turbulent Times

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

东西方文化的一个区别

我发现了东西方文化的一个区别。今天就说说这个发现。

东方文化总是在“法祖”，而西方文化总是在“期来”。

也就是说，我们中华的文化总是认为古代是最好的，而西方人总是认为“希望在未来”。

在我们的文化里，过去总是比现在好，现在的一切努力，只是为了达到我们古人的那个高度。几千年

来，我们反复注解《论语》，然后大家争论，“你的解读不是圣人之意，而我的更接近”。也就是说，

大家的努力只是为了更加接近祖先。

一部《黄帝内经》几千年来，中医的还是在那个框框下解读，唯恐出框。同样的还有《易经》，

在我们的文化中，我们的文明出生是最完美的，之后就“漏”了，我们要做的就是不停修复，让自己更

像古人。

而西方人，他们每天都在发现未来，他们觉得过去是确定的，他们要做的是成就未来。所以，他们每

天都在创造和发明。对于不能理解，不能解释的，他们就做假设，然后空着，留给未来的人去处理。

而我们东方人，遇到不能理解的，不能解释的，则会去翻故纸堆，找找《易经》《论语》《黄帝内

经》《道德经》等等等等。

对于西方人来说，今天，以及未来的每一天，都是全新的未知的，每天都在变化，所以，他们每天要

做的就是迎接各种新的事情，然后把新的事情柔和到自己的生活里。

而对于我们东方人来说，今天至少昨天的延续，我们昨天已经做的足够好的，今天要做的是小心翼翼

地像昨天学习就好了。

其实，我们也有一些祖先意识到这个问题了，他们也会发出一些振聋发聩的声音：上胡不法先王之

法？！而《易经》里也说了“不可为典要，唯变所适”。

可是，没用，几千年后，我们还是在法先王之法，还是逐字逐句地理解圣贤的经典。在我们内心，我

们还是觉得，我们是没法超越先人的，所以，我们害怕哪怕一点点的变化。

而这个时代，一切都在变化，唯一不变的就是变化。

你在留恋昨天么？还是在期待自然而来的明天？

听说人的全身细胞，每7年就会换一次，七年后你和七年前完全不是一个人了。

民国是好于现在的，大清是好于民国的，明朝是好于大清的，唐宋是优于大明的，而最优的则是三皇

五帝的时候。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

9 MARCH

Organize for Constant Change

Constant：

[ usually before noun ] happening all the time or repeatedly

连续发生的；不断的；重复的

Today’s certainties always become tomorrow’s absurdities.

certainties：

absurdities：n. 荒谬；谬论；荒谬的言行

N-UNCOUNT Certainty is the state of being definite or of having no doubts at all about something.

确定

One thing is certain for developed countries—and probably for the entire world—we face long years

of profound changes.

profound ：

巨大的；深切的；深远的

very great; felt or experienced very strongly

An organization must be organized for constant change.

It will no longer be possible to consider entrepreneurial innovation as lying outside of management

or even as peripheral to management.

peripheral：

次要的；附带的

(to sth) ( formal ) not as important as the main aim, part, etc. of sth

Entrepreneurial innovation will have to become the very heart and core of management.

The organization’s function is entrepreneurial, to put knowledge to work—on tools, products, and

processes; on the design of work; on knowledge itself.

entrepreneurial：

具有创业素

质的

ADJ Entrepreneurial means having the qualities that are needed to succeed as an entrepreneur.

Deliberate emphasis on innovation may be needed most where technological changes are least

spectacular.

Deliberate：

动作或行为

不慌不忙的；小心翼翼的；从容不迫的

emphasis：

强调；重视；重要性

spectacular：

壮观的；壮丽的；令人惊叹的

( of a movement or an action

) done slowly and carefully

(on/upon sth) special importance that is given to sth

very impressive

Everyone in a pharmaceutical company knows that the company’s survival depends on its ability

to replace three quarters of its products by entirely new ones every ten years.

pharmaceutical：

制药的；配药的；卖药的

adj.[ only before noun ] connected with making and selling drugs and medicines

But how many people in an insurance company realize that the company’s growth—perhaps even

its survival—depends on the development of new forms of insurance?

The less spectacular or prominent technological change is in a business, the greater the danger

that the whole organization will ossify, and the more important, therefore, is the emphasis on

innovation.

spectacular： 壮观的，惊人的；公开展示的

prominent：

重要的；著名的；杰出的

ossify：

僵化；使固定不变

adj.

important or well known

to become or make sth fixed and unable to change

ACTION POINT:

Are you and your organization in danger of ossification?

ossification：n. 骨化；成骨；（思想的）僵化

Decide how you and your organization can systematically innovate, and build this into your

management process.

Managing in a Time of Great Change

The Practice of Management

The Ecological Vision

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

9 MARCH

Organize for Constant Change

Today’s certainties always become tomorrow’s absurdities.

One thing is certain for developed countries—and probably for the en-

tire world—we face long years of profound changes. An organization must be

organized for constant change. It will no longer be possible to con-sider

entrepreneurial innovation as lying outside of management or even as

peripheral to management. Entrepreneurial innovation will have to be-come

the very heart and core of management. The organization’s function is

entrepreneurial, to put knowledge to work—on tools, products, and

processes; on the design of work; on knowledge itself.

Deliberate emphasis on innovation may be needed most where techno-

logical changes are least spectacular. Everyone in a pharmaceutical com-

pany knows that the company’s survival depends on its ability to replace

three quarters of its products by entirely new ones every ten years. But

how many people in an insurance company realize that the company’s

growth—perhaps even its survival—depends on the development of new

forms of insurance? The less spectacular or prominent technological

change is in a business, the greater the danger that the whole organization

will ossify, and the more important, therefore, is the emphasis on innova-

tion.

ACTION POINT:

Are you and your organization in danger of ossification?

Decide how you and your organization can systematically innovate, and

build this into your management process.

Managing in a Time of Great Change

The Practice of Management

The Ecological Vision

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

胸有成竹和以终为始

胸有成竹这个成语说的是北宋时一个叫做文同的人，画竹子很厉害，而且他非常喜欢竹子。为了画好

竹子，他经常在竹林中散步，仔细观察竹子生长的情况、枝叶伸展的姿态、竹笋成长的细节以及在四

季中的变化。他对竹子非常熟悉，闭上眼都能想出竹子的样子，一有时间就在家里画竹。他画的竹子

栩栩如生，远近闻名，许多人千里迢迢地赶来请他画竹。

他有一个朋友叫做晁补之，晁补之经常找文同喝酒赏竹，最爱看他画竹。有一位年轻人想向文同学习

画竹，先向晁补之请教文同画竹的秘诀，晁补之说：当他画竹时，已经心里面有竹的影子了，这就是

他独到的地方。而文同说“我只是把心中琢磨成熟的竹子画下来罢了。”

西方有一本书叫做《高效能人士的七个习惯》，这本书一共讲了七个好习惯，其中第二个叫做”以终为

始“，英文是”think the end in mind”，也就是“在脑中想一下这件事的结果（过程）”。

仔细琢磨一下，这确实是提高效率的一个好的方法，如果你在做每一件事前，都可以构思一下这件事

的大概经历，你在真正做这件事时，就会心里有底，对事情的反馈也有点数，就不会“临时抱佛脚”

了。这样，你的效率就提高了很多。

这两个成语特别有意思，胸有成竹，我在画竹子前，竹子已经在我心里了，我只是用笔把它画出来；

我在做事前，已经吧这件事想好了，我只是按心里的节奏把这件事完成而已。

这样做事，永远不急不慌：把胸中的竹子画出来而已，把脑里的事情做出来而已。

那么如果画错了呢？

我胸中有个竹子，然后我要用手把它画出来，手要是一抖呢？或者纸偏一下呢？或者墨的颜色发生变

化呢？我要废弃这幅画么？

我在大脑里已经构划了这件事，如果这件事出现意外呢？我应该如何做？恼羞成怒？还是沉着应对？

其实，不管文同画多少次竹子，不管他胸中有多少竹子，每次落笔，他画出来的和胸中那个大概总是

不一样的，不过，每幅竹子都很迷人。

至于做事，不管你在大脑中如何筹划思考过程和结果，总是会有不同。当你遇到不同时，没必要去羞

怒，及时修正就好了。因为，变化总是永恒的。而胸中的那个竹子，那种的那个计划，只是参考而

已，我们应该期待每一次落笔带来的期待，每一次做事面对的变化。

因为，这个期待和变化，会带来新的不同，新的机会，而成长，也就是在这个时候。

我胸有成竹，但不故步自封。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

10 MARCH

Searching for Change

A change is something people do; a fad is something people talk about.

fad：

一时的风尚；短暂的狂热

something that people are interested in for only a short period of time

Entrepreneurs see change as the norm and as healthy.

Usually they do not bring about the change themselves.

But—and this defines the entrepreneur and entrepreneurship—the entrepreneur always searches

for change, responds to it, and exploits it as an opportunity.

responds：

回

应

V-T/V-I When you respond to something that is done or said, you react to it by doing or saying something yourself.

exploits：

V-T If you say that someone is exploiting you, you think that they are treating you unfairly by using your work or ideas

and giving you very little in return.

利用; 剥削

Look at every change, look out every window.

And ask: “Could this be an opportunity?”

“Is this new thing a genuine change or simply a fad?”

genuine：

真的；名副其实的

real; exactly what it appears to be; not artificial

The difference is very simple: A change is something people do, and a fad is something people talk

about.

An enormous amount of talk is a fad.

You must also ask yourself if these transitions, these changes, are an opportunity or a threat.

transitions：

转型

N-VAR Transition is the process in which something changes from one state to another.

If you start out by looking at change as threat, you will never innovate.

Don’t dismiss something because this is not what you had planned.

dismiss：

一提

sb/sth (as sth) to decide that sb/sth is not important and not worth thinking or talking about

The unexpected is often the best source of innovation.

不予考虑；摒弃；对…不屑

ACTION POINT:

Take a half an hour to discuss with a colleague the changes sweeping your industry and identify

the biggest genuine changes.

sweeping：

影响广泛的；大范围的；根本性的

[ usually before noun ] having an important effect on a large part of sth

Ignore the fads; figure out how to capitalize on the genuine changes.

capitalize：

商

（或资金）

[ usually passive ] ( business

Managing in the Next Society

) to provide a company etc. with the money it needs to function

为…提供运营资本

10 MARCH

Searching for Change

A change is something people do; a fad is something people talk about.

Entrepreneurs see change as the norm and as healthy. Usually they do not

bring about the change themselves. But—and this defines the en-trepreneur

and entrepreneurship—the entrepreneur always searches for

change, responds to it, and exploits it as an opportunity.

Look at every change, look out every window. And ask: “Could this be

an opportunity?” “Is this new thing a genuine change or simply a fad?”

The difference is very simple: A change is something people do, and a fad

is something people talk about. An enormous amount of talk is a fad. You

must also ask yourself if these transitions, these changes, are an

opportunity or a threat. If you start out by looking at change as threat, you

will never in-novate. Don’t dismiss something because this is not what

you had planned. The unexpected is often the best source of innovation.

ACTION POINT:

Take a half an hour to discuss with a colleague the changes

sweeping your industry and identify the biggest genuine changes. Ignore

the fads; figure out how to capitalize on the genuine changes.

Managing in the Next Society

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

王语嫣会是武功高手么？

王语嫣是很多人喜欢的一个女生，是一个可以竞争金庸第一美女的人物。而且是一个超级计算机+超级

搜索引擎的人物。

王语嫣读过很多武功，在记录里，除了北冥神功、六脉神剑、等极少数武功外，王语嫣“阅读”过所有

的武功，包括很多很小的门派的武功。并且记住了。

记住武功虽然很厉害，王语嫣却更厉害，她不但记住了每一个武功的每个招式，还把所有的武功都融

会贯通，看到任何行为，都可以在自己的武功库里找到最适当的组合。

注意，是最适当的组合。更难得的是，她甚至可以根据某一个初次见面的人的实际情况来筛选出最佳

的武功组合。

这就太强大了。这需要怎么打的云计算能力以及模式识别能力呀。

然而，王语嫣做到了，不但做到了，还做的很完美。

那么，一个问题来了，如果王语嫣学武，她会是一个武功高手么？

在连载版里，王语嫣本来叫做王玉燕，武功相当不错，到了三联版后就一点武功都不会了，我还挺喜

欢这个设定的。在我心里，王语嫣本身就是一个学霸。而且，即使她学武功，也不会高，还不如干脆

不学，保留学霸的人设。

阅读武功、记忆武功，熟悉武功之间的关联，这个是用脑的，而且，很多高阶的武功，都有“道理”相

配合，理解了底层逻辑，就可以推到出各种可能性。所以，只要拥有超强大脑，加上兴趣（显然，王

姑娘是为了表格学的），就可以获得这个能力。

那么，学习武功呢？那就要一招一式去练习，不但要懂，还要亲手去练习。更主要的是，随着时间的

推移，你一天就可以记忆、学会、贯通很多武功，而练习，最终还是要一招一式。也就是说，你练习

成的，永远是你学习的一个子集。

更主要的是，你一旦着手去练习了，就会得到身体、对手，甚至空气的真实反馈，这时，你对各个武

功不再保持完美的状态了，这个也会影响你学习武功。那样的王语嫣，大概也不能记住、贯通那么多

武功了。

所以，有的人去学记忆武功，像王语嫣那样，她从来不学武功，也不需要考虑武功的缺陷，也不需要

考虑内功的差异，也不需要考虑身体的微恙。就那么去学、去计算就好了。

而真正学武功的那些人，当他们用腿、胳膊、头、手指等来学习武功时，他们会更接近武功，而不是

武学。

至于王语嫣这样的女孩子，为什么要学武功呢？你舍得么？

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

11 MARCH

Piloting Change

Piloting：

N the navigational handling of a ship near land using buoys, soundings, landmarks, etc, or the finding of a ship’s position

by such means

引航

Neither studies nor market research nor computer modeling is a substitute for the test of reality.

（警句）

substitute：

代替者；代替物；代

用品

(for sb/sth) a person or thing that you use or have instead of the one you normally use or have

Everything improved or new needs first to be tested on a small scale; that is, it needs to be piloted.

piloted：

驾驶 飞机 为 船只 领航

V-T If someone pilots an aircraft or ship, they act as its pilot.

(

);

(

)

The way to do this is to find somebody within the enterprise who really wants the new.

Everything new gets into trouble.

And then it needs a champion.

champion：

a person, team, etc. that has won a competition, especially in a sport

冠军；第一名；优胜者

It needs somebody who says, “I am going to make this succeed,” and who then goes to work on it.

And this person needs to be somebody whom the organization respects.

This need not even be somebody within the organization.

Often a good way to pilot a new product or new service is to find a customer who really wants the

new, and who is willing to work with the producer on making truly successful the new product or

the new service.

If the pilot test is successful—it finds the problems nobody anticipated but also finds the

opportunities that nobody anticipated, whether in terms of design, of market, of service—the risk

of change is usually quite small.

ACTION POINT:

Make sure the best ideas in your organization have fierce advocates to see them through a test in

the marketplace.

fierce：

尤指人或动物

凶猛的；凶狠的；凶残的

advocates：

倡导者

( especially of people or animals

) angry and aggressive in a way that is frightening

N-COUNT An advocate of a particular action or plan is someone who recommends it publicly.

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

11 MARCH

Piloting Change

Neither studies nor market research nor computer modeling

is a substitute for the test of reality.

Everything improved or new needs first to be tested on a small scale; that

is, it needs to be piloted. The way to do this is to find somebody within the

enterprise who really wants the new. Everything new gets into trouble.

And then it needs a champion. It needs somebody who says, “I am going

to make this succeed,” and who then goes to work on it. And this person

needs to be somebody whom the organization respects. This need not

even be somebody within the organization.

Often a good way to pilot a new product or new service is to find a cus-

tomer who really wants the new, and who is willing to work with the pro-

ducer on making truly successful the new product or the new service. If the

pilot test is successful—it finds the problems nobody anticipated but also

finds the opportunities that nobody anticipated, whether in terms of de-sign,

of market, of service—the risk of change is usually quite small.

ACTION POINT:

Make sure the best ideas in your organization have fierce

advocates to see them through a test in the marketplace.

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

你为什么学武功？

在金庸的江湖中，有很多武术高手，那么，这些高手都是为什么而学武功呢？

少林的方丈大多是少林同一代中的第一高手，如方证，玄慈等。这说明要做少林方丈，一个基本的要

求就是成为同辈人中的第一高手。

这个规则也对其他门派适合，如泰山派的天门，衡山派的莫大，昆仑派的铁琴先生等。这些为了获得

权力，成为一帮一派的老大，必须苦练武功，让自己的拳头有足够的说服力。

其次，就是各个主角了。金庸的主角有个特点，就是大多不愿意学武功。可是，机缘巧合，武功硬塞

进了了。咱们看看这些主角们吧。

首先是令狐冲，令狐冲本来是华山派大弟子，学习本门武功还算刻苦，算是本门第一。他的理想是接

任师父成为华山派掌门，进而迎娶小师妹岳灵珊。所以，他虽然聪明，对武功也没有多少苛求。

所以，他学习独孤九剑，是风清扬“求”他学的。而且是在田伯光作为外部压力下学的。如果没有这个

压力，学不学就不好说了。

后来方证想收他为弟子，传授他“易经筋”，哪怕面临死亡威胁，他也拒绝了。再后来，学习“吸星大

法”，本意是为了偏偏黑白子的。不小心就学了。再后来，一个一个吸别人内力，好像都是迫不得已，

让人看着就来气。

如果你问令狐冲为啥要学武功，他肯定说：“我不想学呀，我宁愿还是在思过崖那样，没什么武功，天

天快乐”。看到这个回答，林平之真想阉了他。

张无忌呢？本身是武当弟子，机缘巧合下，学了医术、毒术、九阳神功、乾坤大挪移等高阶武功。每

次学武功，都是为了救命，而不是因为好学，在一次次救命中，成为了天下第一高手。

那么，张无忌学武功是为了什么呢？张无忌肯定会说：“为了治病，为了逃命”。

第一次华山论剑，王重阳独照鳌头，东邪西毒南帝北丐四人屈居其下。王重阳得到了《九阴真经》。

不过，他说他不学，为什呢？他的理由是：“我本来就是天下第一了，再学还是天下第一”，这个理由

看起来不错，看来王重阳学武功的目的是成为“天下第一”。

不过，这个道士很虚伪，他不但学了，而且还四处传播，给了林朝英一份（后来杨过得到了），给了

斗酒僧一份（成就了后来的《九阳真经》）。其实，王重阳学真经是非常可以理解的。因为他本来就

是反金的军队首领，他需要武功来提供自身的实力，并且在武功中找到编练军队的方法。

东邪西毒为什么要《九阴真经》呢？当然是为了得到天下第一的名分了。不同的是东邪后来有了女

婿，女婿武功天下第一了，他也就不争了。而西毒欧阳锋的儿子死了，他也就疯了。

南帝北丐为什么要《九阴真经》呢？都是为了治病，北丐是为了给自己治病，南帝是为了给自己治病

的同时，也给别人治病。

还有一个武功天下第一的人，就是东方不败。东方不败应该是个武痴。他在学习《葵花宝典》前，已

经被称为”不败“了，居然还是去自割练气。他为什么要学习武功呢？《葵花宝典》前应该是为了当老

大，当神教的教主。当了教主后呢？当他看到《葵花宝典》这样的武功时，刺激他的应该是好奇心

吧。

其实，对于江湖中的人来说，武功都是一个工具，是为了实现自己目标的工具，比如治病，比如权

力，比如带军队。作为一个江湖人，他们学习武功，一定有一个武功之外的目的。

不过，有两个例外，一个是周伯通，一个是韦小宝。

周伯通学习武功，只是为了学习武功。他好像没有什么目的，只是为了消耗用不尽的精力。而韦小宝

呢？当他发现他的智力、钱以及情商可以轻松地解决他遇到的问题时，他果断放弃了学武。

起身再拿那册子来看，依法打坐修习，过不多时，双眼又沉重之极，忍不住要睡，心想：“他们打定了

主意，要过河拆桥，我这座桥是青石板大桥也罢，是烂木头独木桥也罢，他们总是要拆的，我练不练

功夫，也不相干。”既找到了不练功夫的藉口，心下大宽，倒头呼呼大睡。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

12 MARCH

The Purpose of a Business

A business enterprise has two basic functions: marketing and innovation.

If we want to know what a business is, we have to start with its purpose.

And the purpose must lie outside the business itself.

In fact, it must lie in society, since a business enterprise is an organ of society.

There is only one valid definition of business purpose: to create a customer.

The customer is the foundation of a business and keeps it in existence.

He alone gives employment.

And it is to supply the customer that society entrusts wealth-producing resources to the business

enterprise.

Because it is the purpose to create a customer, any business enterprise has two—and only two—

basic functions: marketing and innovation.

These are the entrepreneurial functions.

Marketing is the distinguishing, the unique function of Business.

distinguishing：

V-T/V-I If you can distinguish one thing from another or distinguish between two things, you can see or

understand how they are different.

辨别; 区分

ACTION POINT:

Find out what needs your customers want fulfilled today.

fulfilled:

感到满足的；觉得满意的；满足的

feeling happy and satisfied that you are doing sth useful with your life

Determine how well your products are meeting the needs of your customers.

The Practice of Management

12 MARCH

The Purpose of a Business

A business enterprise has two basic functions: marketing and innovation.

If we want to know what a business is, we have to start with its purpose.

And the purpose must lie outside the business itself. In fact, it must lie in

society, since a business enterprise is an organ of society. There is only one

valid definition of business purpose: to create a customer. The customer is the

foundation of a business and keeps it in existence. He alone gives em-

ployment. And it is to supply the customer that society entrusts wealth-

producing resources to the business enterprise.

Because it is the purpose to create a customer, any business enterprise

has two—and only two—basic functions: marketing and innovation.

These are the entrepreneurial functions. Marketing is the distinguishing,

the unique function of Business.

ACTION POINT:

Find out what needs your customers want fulfilled today.

Determine how well your products are meeting the needs of your cus-

tomers.

The Practice of Management

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

今天咱们做一篇文言文的阅读理解。这是我们中学课文上学过的，名字叫做《为学》。

天下事有难易乎？为之，则难者亦易矣；不为，则易者亦难矣。人之为学有难易乎？学之，则难者亦

易矣；不学，则易者亦难矣。

蜀之鄙有二僧，其一贫，其一富。贫者语于富者曰：“吾欲之南海，何如？”富者曰：“子何恃而往？”

曰：“吾一瓶一钵足矣。” 富者曰：“吾数年来欲买舟而下，犹未能也。子何恃而往？”越明年，贫者自

南海还，以告富者。富者有惭色。

鄙是边远的地方，说的是四川边远的地方有两个和尚，有一个穷和尚，有一个富和尚。穷和尚对富和

尚说：“我想去南海观音的道场看看，你觉得如何?” 富和尚惊讶地说：”你凭啥去呀？穷的要命，我都

想去很多年了，都没去程，你凭啥呀，做梦吧？！！！“。

穷和尚说：”我计划明天出发，带着我们的水杯和饭碗就行了，然后出门往东。“

富和尚哈哈大笑道：”傻子，你都不认识路，还去南海，西天还差不多，哈哈哈哈“。

伴随着富和尚的笑声，穷和尚回到自己屋里，洗了洗碗，就去睡觉额，第二天天不亮，出门往东，穷

和尚出发了，富和尚哎等着穷和尚回来。

果然，一年后，穷和尚回来了，还是带着那个破水杯，还是带着那个破碗，还是穿着那个破袈裟，不

过，他是从南海回来的。

穷和尚给富和尚讲了一路有趣的事情，遇到的人生百态，以及南海僧人的生活，以及当地人的礼佛。

晚上，穷和尚说：”我想明年去文殊菩萨的道场，你和我一起去吧。“

这次，富和尚没有问他如何去，他知道，肯定是带着水杯，破碗，出门往北。

是呀，想做什么事，问一下自己：“下一步是什么？谁做？做到什么程度？”

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

13 MARCH

Converting Strategic Plans to Action

The best plan is only good intentions unless it degenerates into work.

degenerates：

ADJ If you describe a person or their behaviour as degenerate, you disapprove of them because you think they

have low standards of behaviour or morality.

degenerates into：简化成

堕落的

The distinction that marks a plan capable of producing results is the commitment of key people to

work on specific tasks.

distinction：

[ C ] ~ (between A and B) a clear difference or contrast especially between people or things that are similar or

related

差别；区别；对比

Unless such commitment is made, there are only promises and hopes, but no plan.

A plan needs to be tested by asking managers, “Which of your best people have you put on this

work today?”

The manager who comes back (as most of them do) and says, “But I can’t spare my best people

now. They have to finish what they are doing now before I can put them to work on tomorrow,” is

simply admitting that he does not have a plan.

spare：

不用的；闲置的

admitting：

[ usually before noun ] that is not being used or is not needed at the present time

V-T/V-I If you admit that something bad, unpleasant, or embarrassing is true, you agree, often unwillingly, that it is true.

承认 (不好、不快或尴尬的事实)

Work implies accountability, a deadline, and finally, the measurement of results, that is, feedback

from results on the work.

implies：

暗指

accountability：n. 有义务；有责任；可说明性

V-T If you imply that something is the case, you say something that indicates that it is the case in an indirect way.
