Given the ease and speed at which information travels, every institution in the knowledge society has to be globally competitive, even though most organizations will continue to be local in their activities and markets.

This is because the Internet will keep customers everywhere informed on what is available anywhere in the world, and at what price.

E-commerce will create new global channels for commerce and wealth distribution.

Here is an example.

An entrepreneur developed a highly successful engineering design firm in Mexico.

He complains that one of his toughest jobs is to convince associates and colleagues that the competition is no longer merely Mexican.

Even without the physical presence of competitors, the Internet allows customers to stay abreast of global offerings and demand the same quality of designs in Mexico.

This executive must convince his associates that the competition faced by the firm is global and the performance of the firm must be compared against global competitors, not just those in Mexico.

ACTION POINT:

Look at your domestic and foreign competitors’ Web sites and compare them to your organization’s Web site. If you don’t like what you see, invest more in e-commerce.

Management Challenges for the 21st Century
The Next Society (Corpedia Script for Online Program)

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

张三丰开启了一个新时代

在张三丰之前，武功是私密的，窃取武功是要死人的。一个男生不小心看了一眼昆仑派的武功，就被追杀了几千公里，最后被有毒的匕首刺伤。

少林号称藏经阁的武功秘籍不禁门人翻阅，真相呢？儿时的张三丰，也就是张君宝跟着一对铁罗汉学了几招少林的武功，就要被少林追杀。

萧远山在少林偷学了几十年武功，少林僧知道后的第一反应是：“今日说甚么也不能让此人活着下山。”

为什么呢？少林的七十二绝技，以及很多门派的核心武功，如七伤拳，乾坤大挪移等，一旦获得了这些武功，就会实现人生逆袭。

当张三丰带着张无忌上少林时，少林的三大神僧是非常抗拒武功交换的，因为武功的输出会给少林的地位带来巨大的冲击。

这些是张三丰之前的江湖情况。

后来张三丰发明了太极剑和太极拳。他的第一个徒弟是张无忌。

当他要教无忌太极剑以和方东白比武时。按照武林道德，方东白主动要求回避。张三丰表示不用，直接看着就行，现教现学现用。

这是武林中第一个开源的武功。

武功的心法，武功的每一个招式都是公开的。

这对整个武林是好消息！

这对真个武林是好消息么？

在张三丰时代，一项伟大的，有完整体系的武功被开源了，彻底公开了。也就意味着，只要你努力，就可以学会这个最厉害的武功。

这就带来了几个变化，

首先是无边界，以前的人，跟谁学，就会是谁的派，现在好了，只要你足够的聪明，你自己就可以

学，或者找几个人一起学。

其次是整体向上移动，在之前，你学一点，就可以对付几个普通人，可以行走江湖了。现在你不敢

了，因为任何人都可能拥有最高深的武功。

以前你的对手很明确地是少林、武当、崆峒等，现在可能是任何一个人。

最后，就是你失败的概率和成功一样都成为概率了。以前你只要学习、练习，就有可以成功；现在你需要不停的努力，而不管你多努力，也会有其他人比你更努力。你的努力和成功之间的关系越来越远了。

这是一个新时代，这个时代可以被称为“知识时代”，这个时代，武学知识不再被门派垄断，而是在江湖上自由流通。

这个时代带来的三个特征：无边界、整体向上移动以及学习后失败概率的提升，让这个时代的竞争变得异常激烈。

这是是一个全面竞争的时代。

百字摘要

知识时代的三个特征：无边界、整体向上移动以及向上和向下的同等可能。让竞争在这个时代更加激

烈。

即使你只是一个本地化的企业，你的客户也对通过信息获得对你的产品的价格的了解。从而让你失去

价格信息不对称的利润，或者失去整个客户。

金庸案例

4 MAY

Characteristics of the Next Society

  • Characteristics:特征;特点;品质;

Every institution in the knowledge society has to be globally competitive.

The next society will be a knowledge society. Its three main characteristics will be:

  • Borderlessness, because knowledge travels even more effortlessly than money.

  • Upward mobility, available to everyone through easily acquired formal education.

  • mobility:流动性;移动的能力;(住处、社会阶层、职业方面的)流动能力;易于行走的能力;

  • The potential for failure as well as success. Anyone can acquire the “means of production,” that is, the knowledge required for the job, but not everyone can win.

  • potential:潜在的;可能的;

  • means of production: 生产资料；生产手段；生产工具;

Together, those three characteristics will make the knowledge society a highly competitive one, for organizations and individuals alike.

Information technology, although only one of many new features of the next society, is already having one hugely important effect: it is allowing knowledge to spread near-instantly, and making it accessible to everyone.

Given the ease and speed at which information travels, every institution in the knowledge society—not only businesses, but also schools, universities, hospitals, and increasingly, government agencies, too has to be globally competitive, even though most organizations will continue to be local in their activities and in their markets.

This is because the Internet will keep customers everywhere informed on what is available anywhere in the world, and at what price.

ACTION POINT:

Find out how many customers you are losing because the Internet is making them more savvy about price. Decide whether to cut your prices to compete.

  • savvy:有见识的;通情达理的;懂实际知识的;
Managing in the Next Society

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

曾经，江湖是不存在的

在很久很久之前，江湖是不存在的，并不像现在这样，所有的人都在关注反清复明，关注吴三桂的恩

爱情仇，关注小宝是否做天地会的总舵主。

在第一次华山论剑的时代，王重阳只是关注那本经书的下落，想着不要落入歹人之手；黄药师只是关

注自己的妻子，跟着自己去桃花岛会不会委屈；周伯通只是关注自己喜欢的武功，会不会很快就学完

了，师兄会不会不喜欢自己了；欧阳锋只是关注那个成为自己嫂子的爱侣以后怎么相处；南帝段兴智

只是在是否遁入佛门之间纠结徘徊。

他们的江湖并不大，就是那么小小的一个地方。重阳宫、活死人墓而已；桃花岛而已；西域白陀山庄

而已；无人找得到的流浪而已；大理的皇宫里而已。

他们并没有着眼整个江湖，对他们来说，自己的生活就是一切，各自过着非常肆意的生活。

一本书把大家串联在了一起。那本薄薄的《九阴真经》。

天真的王重阳想一次性解决所有问题，就把当时他知道的最厉害的人邀请到了一起，大家比武了好几

天，最后选出一个武功最好的人，也就是自己来保存这本书。同时建议几个人形成联盟，共同保护这

本书直到下次华山论剑。

然而，这个联盟是松散的，这个松散的联盟通过这本薄薄的册子的串联，开始着眼整个江湖了。

整个江湖都在为这本书疯狂，哪怕是哪些没被王重阳邀请的人。

王重阳的邀请，开启了一个新的时代：一元化的时代，在第一次华山论剑前，江湖是散落在江和湖之

间的。所有的大家或者普通人都把自己的周边当成世界的中心，当成最终的价值观，当成真正有意义

的事情。

华山论剑之后，所有人都知道了一个更大的江湖，那个在华山之巅的江湖。那些散落在江和湖的青年

们曾经的爱恋都变成了对华山的艳羡：总有一天，我要去华山之巅。

百字摘要

金庸案例

5 MAY

The New Pluralism

新多元主义

Pluralism：

the existence of many different groups of people in one society, for example people of different races or of different

political or religious beliefs

多元化，多元性（不同种族、不同政治或宗教信仰的多种群体共存）

Each of the new institutions perceives its own purpose as central, as ultimate value, and as the one

thing that really matters.

perceives：

感知到

ultimate：

最后的；最终的；终极的

If you perceive something, you see, notice, or realize it, especially when it is not obvious.

happening at the end of a long process

The new pluralist organization of society has no interest in government or governance.

Unlike the earlier pluralist institutions, it is not a “whole.” As such, its results are entirely on the

outside.

The product of a business is a satisfied customer. The product of a hospital is a cured patient. The

“product” of the school is a student who ten years later puts to work what he or she has learned.

In some ways the new pluralism is thus far more flexible, far less divisive than the old pluralism.

The new institutions do not encroach on political power as did the old pluralist institutions, whether

the medieval church, feudal baron, or free city. The new institutions, however, unlike the old ones,

do not share identical concerns or see the same world.

encroach：

to begin to affect or use up too much of sb’s time, rights, personal life, etc.

利）；扰乱（某人的生活等）

medieval church：中世纪教会

feudal baron：

identical：

concern：

(to/with sb/sth) similar in every detail

侵占（某人的时间）；侵犯（某人的权

完全同样的；相同的

(about/for/over sth/sb) | ~ (that…) a feeling of worry, especially one that is shared by many people

的）担心，忧虑

（尤指许多人共同

Each of the new institutions perceives its own purpose as central, as ultimate value, and as the one

thing that really matters. Every institution speaks its own language, has its own knowledge, its own

career ladder, and above all, its own values.

No one of them sees itself as responsible for the community as a whole.

That is somebody else’s business. But whose?

ACTION POINT: Reflect on the political disease of single-interest pluralism of our society.

The New Realities

5 MAY

The New Pluralism

Each of the new institutions perceives its own purpose as central,

as ultimate value, and as the one thing that really matters.

The new pluralist organization of society has no interest in government or

governance. Unlike the earlier pluralist institutions, it is not a “whole.” As

such, its results are entirely on the outside. The product of a business is

Asatisfied customer. The product of a hospital is a cured patient. The “product”

of the school is a student who ten years later puts to work

what he or she has learned.

In some ways the new pluralism is thus far more flexible, far less

divisive than the old pluralism. The new institutions do not encroach on

political power as did the old pluralist institutions, whether the medieval

church, feudal baron, or free city. The new institutions, however, unlike

the old ones, do not share identical concerns or see the same world. Each

of the new institutions perceives its own purpose as central, as ultimate

value, and as the one thing that really matters. Every institution speaks its

own lan-guage, has its own knowledge, its own career ladder, and above

all, its own values. No one of them sees itself as responsible for the

community as a whole. That is somebody else’s business. But whose?

ACTION POINT:

Reflect on the political disease of single-interest plural-ism

of our society.

The New Realities

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

如果没有九阳神功，强练乾坤大挪移会是什么后果？

张无忌出生在冰火岛，按现在的法律，他应该是美国人。虽然是美国，当时的冰火岛却非常荒凉，在

无忌出生前这个岛上只有三位居民：明教护教金毛狮王谢逊，武当二代第五弟子张翠山以及天鹰教紫

薇堂堂主殷素素。

张无忌出生后，作为冰火岛的第四位公民，收到了很热烈的欢迎。谢逊成为他的义父，张翠山是他的

父亲，殷素素自然就是他的妈妈了。

谢逊、张翠山都是内外兼修的武功佼佼者，岛上左右无事，他们就教无忌学一些武功。无忌也就慢慢

地联系。

后来某一天，义父谢逊突然认真起来，让无忌天天“背武功”。张翠山看着直摇头，私下里也教无忌一

些武当的入门内功。

后来谢逊告诉他们说，他知道了回中原的方式，他的武功太深奥，无忌学不会，所以他让无忌背过，

等以后长大了，内功基础好了就可以学会了。说道这里，谢逊哭了。因为他知道，他要和无忌分别

了。

后来，无忌跟着父母回到中原，紧接着就是一堆的事情：先是自己被抓，被毒打，然后又是被带到武

当父母身边逼迫父母，然后父母双双自尽。然后师祖带着自己四处求医，然后在蝴蝶谷几年也没治

好，然后护送小姑娘不悔去昆仑山，然后在昆仑山遇见朱九真，然后被朱九真的爹爹骗下一个悬崖。

然后，在悬崖，张无忌遇见了九阳神功。已经绝望的张无忌开始修炼九阳神功，居然自愈了。因为张

无忌受的是内伤，九阳神功自然可以修正自己的内伤。

学会了九阳神功的张无忌在出来后又被朱长岭骗的掉下悬崖摔断了腿。

这时的张无忌武功说不上高低，虽然九阳神功让他内里充沛，他却不会太多武功。除了儿时爹爹教他

的一些武当入门武功，那就是义父逼他背诵的那些了。

然后，无忌就遇见了六大派围攻光明顶，当他看到灭绝师太杀厚土旗时，他站出来劝架。

百字摘要

金庸案例

张无忌的九阳神功和乾坤大挪移

6 MAY

Knowledge Does Not Eliminate Skill

Eliminate：

排除；清除；消除

to remove or get rid of sth/sb

Knowledge without skill is unproductive.

unproductive：

not producing very much; not producing good results

产量少的；效果不佳的；无益的

At present, the term “knowledge worker” is widely used to describe people with considerable

theoretical knowledge and learning: doctors, lawyers, teachers, accountants, chemical engineers.

present：

现存的；当前的

theoretical ：

existing or happening now

concerned with the ideas and principles on which a particular subject is based, rather than with practice and

理论上的

considerable：great in amount, size, importance, etc. 相当多（或大、重要等）的

experiment

But, the most striking growth will be in “knowledge technologists”: computer technicians, software

designers, analysts in clinical labs, manufacturing technologists, paralegals.

striking：

引人注目的；异乎寻常的；显著的

clinical：

临床的；临床诊断的

paralegals：

律师助理

interesting and unusual enough to attract attention

relating to the examination and treatment of patients and their illnesses

A paralegal is someone who is paid to help lawyers with their work but is not qualified as a lawyer.

These people are as much manual workers as they are knowledge workers; in fact, they usually

spend far more time working with their hands than with their brains.

So, knowledge does not eliminate skill. On the contrary, knowledge is fast becoming the foundation

for skill.

We are using knowledge more and more to enable people to acquire skills of a very advanced kind

fast and successfully.

Only when knowledge is used as a foundation for skill does it become productive.

For example, surgeons preparing for an operation to correct a brain aneurysm before it produces a

lethal brain hemorrhage spend hours in diagnosis before they cut—and that requires specialized

knowledge of the highest order.

surgeon：

外科医生

aneurysm：

动脉瘤

hemorrhage：[病理] 出血

lethal：

致命的；可致死的

a doctor who is trained to perform surgery (= medical operations that involve cutting open a person’s body)

an area of extreme swelling on the wall of an artery

causing or able to cause death

The surgery itself, however, is manual work—and manual work consisting of repetitive manual

operations in which the emphasis is on speed, accuracy, uniformity.

surgery：

medical treatment of injuries or diseases that involves cutting open a person’s body and often removing or replacing some

parts; the branch of medicine connected with this treatment

repetitive：

emphasis：

accuracy：

uniformity：

外科手术；外科学

saying or doing the same thing many times, so that it becomes boring

special importance that is given to sth

强调；重视；重要性

重复乏味的

准确（性）；精确（程度）

the quality of being or looking the same as all other members of a group 相同(性)；统一(性)；一致(性)

the state of being exact or correct; the ability to do sth skilfully without making mistakes

And these operations are studied, organized, learned, and practiced exactly like any other manual

work.

ACTION POINT: Outline the skills required in your work. Analyze and refine these skills for optimum

quality and productivity.

optimum ：

最佳的；最适宜的

the best possible; producing the best possible results

The Age of Discontinuity

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

Managing in the Next Society

6 MAY

Knowledge Does Not Eliminate Skill

Knowledge without skill is unproductive.

At present, the term “knowledge worker” is widely used to describe peo-

ple with considerable theoretical knowledge and learning: doctors, lawyers,

teachers, accountants, chemical engineers. But, the most striking growth will

be in “knowledge technologists”: computer technicians, soft-ware designers,

analysts in clinical labs, manufacturing technologists, para-legals. These

people are as much manual workers as they are knowledge workers; in fact,

they usually spend far more time working with their hands

than with their brains.

So, knowledge does not eliminate skill. On the contrary, knowledge is

fast becoming the foundation for skill. We are using knowledge more and

more to enable people to acquire skills of a very advanced kind fast and

suc-cessfully. Only when knowledge is used as a foundation for skill does

it be-come productive. For example, surgeons preparing for an operation

to correct a brain aneurysm before it produces a lethal brain hemorrhage

spend hours in diagnosis before they cut—and that requires specialized

knowledge of the highest order. The surgery itself, however, is manual

work—and manual work consisting of repetitive manual operations in

which the emphasis is on speed, accuracy, uniformity. And these opera-

tions are studied, organized, learned, and practiced exactly like any other

manual work.

ACTION POINT:

Outline the skills required in your work. Analyze and re-

fine these skills for optimum quality and productivity.

The Age of Discontinuity

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

Managing in the Next Society

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

吴六奇为什么要加入天地会

吴六奇是一个武术大家，年轻时加入丐帮，凭证武功和人品做到了八袋弟子。后来犯了错误，被逐出

丐帮，自我放弃，流浪江湖。

再后来努力振作，想着不能这么混下去，要找个出路，居然加入了大清的武官，镇压反清义士。

再后来遇见了丐帮的一个长老，基于旧情，吴六奇释放了这位长老，这位长老也知道他是个武功大

家，而且忠心可佳，就劝他反清复明。

这个本来也是吴六奇的想法，他接受了长老的建议，重新加入丐帮，从一袋弟子做起。

丐帮长老又推荐他加入了天地会，也就是以反清复明为主要目标的一个准军事化帮会。吴六奇一看正

合心意，就加入了天地会广州洪顺堂。在一年多的考察后，吴六奇凭借武功和人品被天地会总舵主任

命了洪顺堂红旗香主。成为天地会高级干部。

那么吴六奇为什么要加入天地会呢？天地会为什么要接受吴六奇的加入呢？

吴六奇本是丐帮长老，反抗异族入侵一直是丐帮的主要工作之一，也是吴六奇的本意。只是后来在丐

帮犯了错误，被处分后心情有些低落，受到挫折才流浪江湖，甚至后来加入大清官员体系。

后来被点化后，吴六奇立即回到了反清复明的路上来。

然而，反清复明是一个非常大的主题，并不是靠个人意志或者武力可以完成的。哪怕吴六奇当时已经

是广东军区的司令员（广东省通省水陆提督），和反清复明的力量还是差的很远。

这时的吴六奇需要借助更大的组织的力量。

而天地会是天地会是台湾国姓爷郑大帅手下谋主陈永华陈先生所创，近年来在福建、浙江、广东一带

好生兴旺。正好可以帮助吴六奇实现自己的愿望。

德鲁克认为 只有组织才能提供知识工作者有效所需要的基本连续性，只有组织才能把知识型员工的专

业知识转化为绩效。

也就是说，只有借助天地会这样的组织，吴六奇这样的奇男子才可以发挥自己的才智，让反清复明的

事业成为可能。

那么，天地会又为什么要接受吴六奇呢？因为他武功高？因为他在清廷身居要职？因为丐帮长老推

荐？

德鲁克认为，一个组织的管理者把知识工人的知识看作达到组织绩效目标的一种手段。也就是说，对

于天地会来说，对于天地会的陈近南来说，吴六奇的武功，吴六奇的身份，吴六奇的义气都是天地会

为了实现自己最终目标：反清复明所需要的一种手段。

吴六奇需要平台实现梦想，天地会需要吴六奇的武功、身份、义气作为实现梦想的手段。

所以吴六奇很快加入了天地会，并且得到了很快的提升。

吴六奇有了新的平台，天地会多了一位红旗香主。

百字摘要

金庸案例

7 MAY

A Knowledge Society and Society of Organizations

Specialized knowledge by itself produces nothing.

Postcapitalist society is both a knowledge society and a society of organizations, each

dependent on the other and yet each very different in its concepts, views, and values.

Specialized knowledge by itself produces nothing. It can become productive only when it is

integrated into a task.

Postcapitalist：后资本主义

productive：

integrated：

生产的；（尤指）多产的

in which many different parts are closely connected and work successfully together 各部分密切协调的；综合的；完整

making goods or growing crops, especially in large quantities

统一的

And this is why the knowledge society is also a society of organizations: the purpose and function

of every organization, business and nonbusiness alike, is the integration of specialized

knowledges into a common task.

It is only the organization that can provide the basic continuity that knowledge workers need to

be effective.

continuity：

连续性；持续性

the fact of not stopping or not changing

It is only the organization that can convert the specialized knowledge of the knowledge worker into

performance.

Intellectuals see the organization as a tool; it enables them to practice their techne, their

specialized knowledge.

Intellectual：n. 知识分子；凭理智做事者

Managers see knowledge as a means to the end of organizational performance.

Both are right.

They are opposites; but they relate to each other as poles rather than as contradictions.

pole：

柱子；杆子；

棍；杖

a long thin straight piece of wood or metal, especially one with the end placed in the ground, used as a support

contradiction：

致，矛盾，对立

(between A and B) a lack of agreement between facts, opinions, actions, etc.

（事实、看法、行动等的）不一

If the two balance each other there can be creativity and order, fulfillment and mission.

ACTION POINT: Write a letter to your boss and colleagues describing the contributions you expect

to make.

contribution：

贡献；促成作用

an action or a service that helps to cause or increase sth

Indicate your understanding of how your contributions integrate into the contributions of your

colleagues to produce results for the organization.

Indicate into：成为一体，融入；使…并入

Managing in a Time of Great Change

Post-Capitalist Society

7 MAY

A Knowledge Society and

Society of Organizations

Specialized knowledge by itself produces nothing.

Postcapitalist society is both a knowledge society and a society of organi-

zations, each dependent on the other and yet each very different in its

concepts, views, and values. Specialized knowledge by itself produces

nothing. It can become productive only when it is integrated into a task. And

this is why the knowledge society is also a society of organizations: the

purpose and function of every organization, business and nonbusiness alike,

is the integration of specialized knowledges into a common task. It is only the

organization that can provide the basic continuity that knowledge workers

need to be effective. It is only the organization that can convert the

specialized knowledge of the knowledge worker into performance.

Intellectuals see the organization as a tool; it enables them to practice

their techne, their specialized knowledge. Managers see knowledge as

Ameans to the end of organizational performance. Both are right. They are

opposites; but they relate to each other as poles rather than as contradic-

tions. If the two balance each other there can be creativity and order, ful-

fillment and mission.

ACTION POINT:

Write a letter to your boss and colleagues describing the

contributions you expect to make. Indicate your understanding of how

your contributions integrate into the contributions of your colleagues to

produce results for the organization.

Managing in a Time of Great Change

Post-Capitalist Society

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

知识时代的黑暗森林法则

德鲁克在世纪初对“未来”社会做了一个预测。

百字摘要

金庸案例

8 MAY

Price of Success in the Knowledge Society

The fear of failure has already permeated the knowledge society.

permeated：

If an idea, feeling, or attitude permeates a system or permeatessociety, it affects every part of it or is present

throughout it. (

思想、情感或态度) 全面影响

The upward mobility of the knowledge society comes at a high price:

the psychological pressures and emotional traumas of the rat race. There can be winners only if

there are losers. This was not true of earlier societies.

psychological：

心灵的；心理的；精神上的

traumas：

精神上的 创伤 痛

connected with a person’s mind and the way in which it works

苦经历

Trauma is a very severe shock or very upsetting experience, which may cause psychological damage. (

rat race：

)

;

the way of life of people living and working in a large city where people compete in an aggressive way with each other in

order to be more successful, earn more money, etc.

（大城市里为财富、权力等的）疯狂竞争，你死我活的竞争

Japanese youngsters suffer sleep deprivation because they spend their evenings at a crammer to

help them pass their exams.

deprivation：

缺乏；贫

the fact of not having sth that you need, like enough food, money or a home; the process that causes this

困；丧失；剥夺

crammer：a school or book that prepares people quickly for exams （应付考试的）强化训练补习学校；（为应付考试而编写的）强

化训练用书

Otherwise they will not get into the prestige university of their choice, and thus into a good job.

prestige:

令人敬仰的；受尊重的；重要的

that brings respect and admiration; important

Other countries, such as America, Britain, and France, are also allowing their schools to become

viciously competitive.

viciously:adv. 邪恶地；敌意地

That this has happened over such a short time—no more than thirty or forty years—indicates how

much the fear of failure has already permeated the knowledge society.

Given this competitive struggle, a growing number of highly successful knowledge workers—

business managers, university teachers, museum directors, doctors—“plateau” in their forties.

struggle:

(with sb) (for/against sth) | ~ (with sb) (to do sth) | ~ (between A and B) a hard fight in which people try to obtain or

斗争；奋斗；努力

plateau:a time of little or no change after a period of growth or progress （发展、增长后的）稳定期，停滞期

achieve sth, especially sth that sb else does not want them to have

If their work is all they have, they are in trouble.

Knowledge workers therefore need to develop some serious outside interest.

ACTION POINT: Develop a serious satisfying outside interest.

Managing in the Next Society

8 MAY

Price of Success in the Knowledge Society

The fear of failure has already permeated the knowledge society.

The upward mobility of the knowledge society comes at a high price:

the psychological pressures and emotional traumas of the rat race.

There can be winners only if there are losers. This was not true of earlier

societies.

Japanese youngsters suffer sleep deprivation because they spend their

evenings at a crammer to help them pass their exams. Otherwise they will

not get into the prestige university of their choice, and thus into a good

job. Other countries, such as America, Britain, and France, are also

allowing their schools to become viciously competitive. That this has

happened over such a short time—no more than thirty or forty years—

indicates how much the fear of failure has already permeated the

knowledge society. Given this competitive struggle, a growing number of

highly successful knowledge workers—business managers, university

teachers, museum directors, doc-tors—“plateau” in their forties. If their

work is all they have, they are in trouble. Knowledge workers therefore

need to develop some serious out-side interest.

ACTION POINT:

Develop a serious satisfying outside interest.

Managing in the Next Society

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

般若堂澄覌的一天

澄覌是般若堂的首座，般若堂是少林寺的一个武术研究机构，专门负责研究少林之外的武学。当有外

出弟子回来后，第一件事就是去戒律堂汇报自己的持戒情况，其次就是去般若堂汇报此行见到的别门

别派的武功。般若堂负责记录、分析。从隋朝末年开始就有了这个制度，积累千年，少林于天下各门

派武功了若指掌，这就保证了即使寺中并无才智卓杰的人才，也能领袖群伦，在江湖有一定话语权。

所以，般若堂虽然武功以及重要性都不及达摩院，却也是少林不可或缺的重要部门。

这一年般若堂的首座是澄覌，这一年澄覌已经80多岁了，也做了般若堂几十年了，如果没有意外，澄

覌会一直是般若堂的首座，直到坐化。

因为澄覌确实是几百年来最适合做般若堂首座的人选。

这一天，四点三十，澄覌像平时一样起床了。先在院子里练了一会波罗密手，又练了一套罗汉拳，最

后又练了一套大慈大悲千手式。

这时已经七点了，澄覌去斋房吃了早斋，就回到了自己的办公室，也就是般若堂的大殿边上的一个小

屋子，在那里看昨天回来的弟子们写的所遇见的其他派的武功。这一天看到了铁剑门的分筋错骨手，

感到很是惊奇，因为按照以前的记录，铁剑门应该已经消失了。而且消失了很多年了。看来江湖又要

起风云了。

看完了所有的武功记录有，澄覌决定去见一下那个汇报铁剑门武功的净虚，看一下铁剑门的分筋错骨

手是怎么回事。从报告看起来对方武功并不高，不过铁剑门却是一个很厉害的门派，里面曾经有很多

高手。

和净虚聊了后，还是没什么思路。澄覌就去达摩院找澄心，和他聊聊可能的应对策略。澄心也觉得这

个事不小，两个人就一起去藏经阁查阅一些武功资料以及历史资料。

查完资料后已经下午4点了，还好，澄覌和澄心已经有了一些思路，一套新的武功被设计了出来。澄心

吧这个武功的设计方案整理后交给达摩堂讨论、研发，应该可以应对未来可能的一些风险了。

然后澄覌和澄心一起去吃晚饭，在吃饭时有弟子过来请教澄心武功，澄覌也在边上看着。

澄覌很喜欢看年轻的弟子们演习武功。澄覌对这些武功非常了解，正因为非常了解，经常可以看出弟

子们的一些异想天开的错误，而这些错误正是武功创新的机会。

这时天已经黑了，澄覌要准备睡觉了，回到自己的禅房后，澄覌闭上眼睛思考了一下今天遇见的所有

和武功有关的事情，然后又练习了两遍易筋经，这时澄覌已经非常空灵了，很快就进入了睡眠。

这一天澄覌觉得非常充实，这位八十多岁的大和尚觉得自己是世界上最勤奋的人，自己也必将被记录

在少林的历史上。因为自己如此勤奋，如此努力，而且天赋并不低。

时间到了21世纪，到了10年代末期。这个时代已经是德鲁克预言的知识时代。这个时代的人已经习惯

了终生学习，他们丝毫不敢停滞学习，并不是为了研究什么，只是为了避免被淘汰。

他们学习，当不知道什么才是学习，他们关注”教育“，但不知道如何衡量教育。他们非常的迷茫，不

知道该如何应对这个需要不断学习的时代。他们知道的只是不停地学习。直到坐化，或者死掉。

每天晚上他们睡觉前会在内心告诉自己：知识时代，教育为王。

然后每天早上起来在内心告诉自己：终生学习，从我做起。

百字摘要

【翻译】

教育将是知识社会的核心，并且教育他们的关键机构。

历史上，工匠在学徒期学习五到七年后，也就是在18、19岁时，已经学会了他一生需要的技能。

今天的工作需要大量的正规教育以及获取和应用理论和分析的能力。

他们需要不同的工作方法和不同的心态。

最重要的是，他们需要一种不断学习的习惯。

每个人都需要什么样的知识组合？

学习和教学的“质量”是什么？

所有这些必然成为知识社会的中心问题甚至政治问题。

事实上，期望获得和分配正式知识将在知识社会的政治中占有一席之地，也许并非是太异想天开，在

资本主义时代的两三百年中，财产和收入的获得已经占据了这个位置。

行动建议：把学习当成终生习惯。

金庸案例

9 MAY

The Center of the Knowledge Society

Education will become the center of the knowledge society, and schooling its key institution.

institution：

（大学、银行等规模大

的）机构

a large important organization that has a particular purpose, for example, a university or bank

Throughout history, the craftsman who had learned a trade after five or seven years of

apprenticeship had learned, by age eighteen or nineteen, everything he would ever need to use

during his lifetime.

Throughout：

craftsman：

apprenticeship：

in or into every part of sth

各处；遍及

工匠；手艺人；工艺师

a period of time working as an apprentice ; a job as an apprentice 学徒期；学徒工作

a skilled person, especially one who makes beautiful things by hand

Today the new jobs require a good deal of formal education and the ability to acquire and apply

theoretical and analytical knowledge.

a good deal of：大量的；很多的

theoretical ：

concerned with the ideas and principles on which a particular subject is based, rather than with practice and

理论上的

analytical：using a logical method of thinking about sth in order to understand it, especially by looking at all the parts separately 分

析的；解析的；分析性的

experiment

他们需要不同的

They require a different approach to work and a different mindset.

Above all they require a habit of continuous learning.

What mix of knowledges is required for everybody?

What is “quality” in learning and teaching?

All these will, of necessity, become central concerns of the knowledge society, and central political

issues.

necessity：

必然；必要；需要

the fact that sth must happen or be done; the need for sth

In fact, it may not be too fanciful to anticipate that the acquisition and distribution of formal

knowledge will come to occupy the place in the politics of the knowledge society that the

acquisition of property and income have occupied in the two or three centuries that we have come

to call the Age of Capitalism.

知识、财产、收入

fanciful：

anticipate：

acquisition：

distribution：

property：

based on imagination and not facts or reason

to expect sth

预料；预期

空想的；想象的

the act of getting sth, especially knowledge, a skill, etc.

（知识、技能等的）获得，得到

the way that sth is shared or exists over a particular area or among a particular group of people

a thing or things that are owned by sb; a possession or possessions

ACTION POINT: Make learning a lifelong habit.

Managing in a Time of Great Change

所有物；财产；财物

分配；分布

9 MAY

The Center of the Knowledge Society

Education will become the center of the knowledge society,

and schooling its key institution.

Throughout history, the craftsman who had learned a trade after five or

seven years of apprenticeship had learned, by age eighteen or nine-teen,

everything he would ever need to use during his lifetime. Today the new jobs

require a good deal of formal education and the ability to acquire and apply

theoretical and analytical knowledge. They require a different approach to

work and a different mind-set. Above all they require a habit of

continuous learning.

What mix of knowledges is required for everybody? What is “quality” in

learning and teaching? All these will, of necessity, become central con-cerns

of the knowledge society, and central political issues. In fact, it may not be

too fanciful to anticipate that the acquisition and distribution of for-mal

knowledge will come to occupy the place in the politics of the knowl-edge

society that the acquisition of property and income have occupied in the two

or three centuries that we have come to call the Age of Capitalism.

ACTION POINT:

Make learning a lifelong habit.

Managing in a Time of Great Change

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

德鲁克说了一个很有趣的观点，就是在1918年到1960年之间，民众对政府有着无限的依赖。那个时间

正好经历的两次世界大战。

1960年之后，民众和政府的热恋期结束了，因为政府一次次让民众失望。

在蜜月期，民众习惯性把自己需要的东西告诉政府，然后就认为这件事解决的，而有时候这件事也确

实解决了。

后来，越来越多的事情，政府解决不了，民众就会提出修改的方案，并且认为政府还是会解决的。

再后来，越来越多的事情政府解决不了。热恋期就结束了。

亚当斯密对君主的职责有个定义：

君主只有三种应尽的职责，这三条职责虽然极其重要，但对于常人都是简单易懂的：

第一，保护社会不受其他独立社会之侵犯；

第二，尽可能保护社会任何成员不受其他任何成员的侵犯和压迫，即设立完全公正的司法机构；

第三，建立和维护个人或小团体所不感兴趣投入的某些公共设施和公共机构，因为这些设施和机构产

生的利润绝不可能补偿个人和小团体的投入，尽管对社会整体来说，常常是不仅能收回投入，而且还

能得到大得多的回报。

热恋期的民众期待政府做更多的事情，政府也确实的努力做更多的事情，然而政府的能力是有限的。

并做不了更多的事情。

最后，德鲁克给出了一个建议：用企业的逻辑来解决社会问题。

百字摘要

金庸案例

10 MAY

Sickness of Government

Our love affair with government is over, although we keep the old mistress around.

mistress：

（尤指旧时雇用仆人的）女主人，主妇

he female head of a house, especially one who employed servants

Rarely has there been a more torrid political love affair than that between government and the

generations that reached adulthood between 1918 and 1960.

torrid ：

（尤指情爱）热烈的，狂热的，热情洋溢的

political：

政治的；政府的；政权的

generations ：

full of strong emotions, especially connected with sex and love

connected with the state, government or public affairs

A generation is all the people in a group or country who are of a similar age, especially when they are considered

as having the same experiences or attitudes.

一代人

Anything anyone felt needed doing during this period was to be turned over to government—and

this, everyone seemed to believe, made sure that the job was already done.

turned over：移交给；

But now our attitudes are in transition.

transition：

the process or a period of changing from one state or condition to another

过渡；转变；变革；变迁

We are rapidly moving to doubt and distrust of government.

We still, if only out of habit, turn social tasks over to government.

We still revise unsuccessful programs over and over again, and assert that nothing is wrong with

them that a change in procedures will not cure.

revise:

改变，修改（意见或计划）

to change your opinions or plans, for example because of sth you have learned

But we no longer believe these promises when we reform a bungled program for the third time.

reform:

改革；改进；改良

bungled

搞砸

to improve a system, an organization, a law, etc. by making changes to it

:If you bungle something, you fail to do it properly, because you make mistakes or are clumsy.

We no longer expect results from government.

Who, for instance, believes anymore that changes in the foreign aid program of the United States

(or of the United Nations) will really produce rapid worldwide development?

What was a torrid romance between the people and government for so very long has now become

a tired, middleaged liaison that we do not know how to break off but that only becomes

exacerbated by being dragged out.

ACTION POINT: Propose a program to your congressional representative that applies logic from the

work of your enterprise to solve a social problem and that doesn’t require new government funds.

The Age of Discontinuity

10 MAY

Sickness of Government

Our love affair with government is over,

although we keep the old mistress around.

Rarely has there been a more torrid political love affair than that be-tween

government and the generations that reached adulthood be-tween 1918 and

  1. Anything anyone felt needed doing during this period was to be turned

over to government—and this, everyone seemed to

believe, made sure that the job was already done.

But now our attitudes are in transition. We are rapidly moving to doubt

and distrust of government. We still, if only out of habit, turn social tasks

over to government. We still revise unsuccessful programs over and over

again, and assert that nothing is wrong with them that a change in proce-

dures will not cure. But we no longer believe these promises when we re-

form a bungled program for the third time. We no longer expect results

from government. Who, for instance, believes anymore that changes in

the foreign aid program of the United States (or of the United Nations)

will re-ally produce rapid worldwide development? What was a torrid

romance between the people and government for so very long has now

become a tired, middle-aged liaison that we do not know how to break off

but that only becomes exacerbated by being dragged out.

ACTION POINT:

Propose a program to your congressional representative

that applies logic from the work of your enterprise to solve a social

problem and that doesn’t require new government funds.

The Age of Discontinuity

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

慕容复是慕容家后代，慕容

虽然过去了很多年，慕容家还是觉得帝王之位，他家是有份的，所以，一代一代，他家都在为称帝做

着准备。而这种准备也无外乎人、财、物。

人，包括儿子和下属。在慕容家的努力下，也在上天的眷顾下，慕容一支一直有儿子，虽然不多，也

没断。而且慕容家的家臣也一直有儿子，一直跟着慕容家做各种准备。

财，也就是钱，要当皇帝，肯定需要很多钱，不然谁给你打战呀。慕容家一方面做点生意，一方面也

做点黑道生意，钱的来路或黑或明，也算不少了。

物，也就是兵器什么的，那些倒是还不急。

在当时的社会上，除了人财物外，还有一个稀缺资源需要重点关注，就是武功。在宋末，武功是一个

可以影响江湖格局的重要战略资源。

而慕容家在这个资源上做了充足的准备。

慕容家自己有号称“以彼之道还施彼身”的斗转星移。这个神奇的武功让他们在江湖中一直以神话的方

式存在。

另一方面，慕容家又充分收集和研究所出现的所有武功，包括很多神级的武功，如降龙十八掌、打狗

棍法、一阳指、凌波微步等。这就保证了慕容家在拥有足够的武力的同时，可以对江湖的武功又一个

大概的整体了解。

为了防止慕容家的某一代出现弱智儿子，慕容家把这些武功是用文字记录下来的，不只是自己的斗转

星移，也包括江湖上所有的武功。这样，万一有某个儿子没出息，也不影响后续儿子后来居上。根据

古籍学习高深武功。

虽然慕容家以自己的武功为傲，但慕容的老祖宗知道，每个孩子的资质不同，适合的武功也就不同，

所以，他们并不要求自己的孩子只学自己的武功，而是让他们根据自己的兴趣和特质尽可能学习适合

自己的武功。

就像慕容复那样的，混了一个不识字，居然还学了很多刀法，棍法，也在江湖上混出了“北乔峰，南慕

容”的名号。

也算慕容家老祖先的安排得当了。

【全真教的衰落】

全真教的衰落也是够快的，从第一代的五绝之首王重阳开始，到第二代的全真七子勉强在江湖混混，

到第三代已经没法行走江湖了。很快，到了元末时，江湖上就没有了全真教的声音。

【武当的衰落】

武当起自张三丰，张三丰一路开挂，开到了

【郭家的衰落】

当第三次华山论剑时，郭靖是非常意气风发的，东邪黄药师是自己的岳父，西狂杨过是自己的侄子，

南僧一灯大师是自己的师父，北侠就是自己，而中顽童是自己的结义兄弟老顽童。这时郭靖在江湖的

地位之高，不可名状。

然后不久后，襄阳城破，自己已经妻子黄蓉被杀，大女儿和小儿子不知去向。二女儿郭襄在外出家创

办峨眉派。二女儿死后，曾经无比辉煌的郭家也随风而散。

【帮派的崛起】

除了少林外，大多数单一的门派或者家族在迅速崛起后，都面临着迅速的瓦解。长则几十年，短则十

几年。这里固然有不孝弟子的拼命作死，更多是

百字摘要

金庸案例

11 MAY

Managing Foreign Currency Exposure

Exposure：

(to sth) the state of being in a place or situation where there is no protection from sth harmful or unpleasant

受（危险或不快）

面临，遭

Foreign exchange risks make speculators out of the most conservative managements.

外汇风险让最保守的管理变成投机者（的行为）。

speculator：

conservative

managements:

A speculator is a person who speculates financially.

投机者

opposed to great or sudden social change; showing that you prefer traditional styles and values

保守的；守旧的

Old and amply tested wisdom holds that unless a company’s business is primarily the trading of

currencies or commodities, the firm inevitably will lose, and heavily, if it speculates in either.

古老经验告诉我们，除非一个公司的主营业务是货币或者商品交易，那么它一定会在货币以及商品交

易中受损，如果他们试图投机，那么损失就会更大。

amply：充足地；广大地

commodities：

inevitably：

enough, extensively

A commodity is something that is sold for money.

as is certain to happen

不可避免地；必然地

商品

Yet foreign exchange risks make speculators out of the most conservative managements.

然而，外汇风险让常见的管理手段充满投机。

Executives will have to learn to protect their enterprises against several kinds of foreign exchange

risks: losses on sales or purchases in foreign currencies, and loss of sales and market standing in

both foreign and domestic markets.

管理者需要学会保护他们的企业防止多重外汇风险：销售以及外汇结算的损耗，国内、国外的销售及

市场地位的损失。

domestic：

of or inside a particular country; not foreign or international

本国的；国内的

These risks cannot be eliminated.

这些风险不可避免。

eliminated：

To eliminate something, especially something you do not want or need, means to remove it completely.

But they can be minimized or at least contained.

但它们可以减到最小，至少可以在可接受范围内。

contained：

If you contain something, you control it and prevent it from spreading or increasing.

根除

控制; 阻止

Above all, they can be converted into a known, predictable, and controlled cost of doing business

not too different from any other insurance premium by the use of hedging and options.

总体来说。它们可以被转化为已知的，可预测的，损失可控的商业行为，就像为了预防所支付的保险

费。

premium ：

hedging：

an amount of money that you pay once or regularly for an insurance policy

保险费

If you hedge against something unpleasant or unwanted that might affect you, especially losing money, you do

something which will protect you from it.

防备 (尤指金钱损失)

“Internationalizing” the company’s finances is also the best—perhaps the only—way in which a

purely domestic firm can protect itself to some degree against foreign competition based on

currency rates.

对于本地公司涞水，国际化是公司财务是最好的，有可能是唯一的稍微保护自己对冲汇率方面的国际

竞争的方法。

ACTION POINT: Protect your business against foreign-exchange risk by hedging your exposure.

用对冲风险保护你的公司免于外汇风险。

hedging：

If you hedge against something unpleasant or unwanted that might affect you, especially losing money, you do

something which will protect you from it.

The Frontiers of Management

防备 (尤指金钱损失)

The New Realities

11 MAY

Managing Foreign Currency Exposure

Foreign exchange risks make speculators out of the

most conservative managements.

Old and amply tested wisdom holds that unless a company’s business is

primarily the trading of currencies or commodities, the firm in-evitably will

lose, and heavily, if it speculates in either. Yet foreign ex-change risks make

speculators out of the most conservative managements. Executives will have

to learn to protect their enterprises against several kinds of foreign exchange

risks: losses on sales or purchases in foreign cur-rencies, and loss of sales and

market standing in both foreign and domestic markets. These risks cannot be

eliminated. But they can be minimized or at least contained. Above all, they

can be converted into a known, pre-dictable, and controlled cost of doing

business not too different from any other insurance premium by the use of

hedging and options. “Internation-alizing” the company’s finances is also the

best—perhaps the only—way in which a purely domestic firm can protect

itself to some degree against for-

eign competition based on currency rates.

ACTION POINT:

Protect your business against foreign-exchange risk by

hedging your exposure.

The Frontiers of Management

The New Realities

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

“傻儿子，生一个就够了，生那么多干嘛。”

桃花村的桃花姑娘嫁给了一个外来的张屠户。第二年就生了一个大胖小子，这小子刚生出来时不会

哭，长到快满月了才哭出了第一声，到了一岁还是不会坐，快到2岁了，走路还是摇摇晃晃。

村里人都说，张屠户杀生作孽，所以生了个傻儿子。老大快2岁时，桃花姑娘又生了一个儿子，这个儿

子生下来也是傻乎乎的。挺大了还是不会走路，快2岁了，还是爬来爬去，倒是爬的挺快。

村里说继续说张屠户作孽，生下的都是傻儿子。桃花姑娘白天去地里种地，晚上回到家里独自哭啼。

在老二2岁多时，桃花又怀孕了。

桃花姑娘和张屠户说：“这次生个健康的宝宝吧，哪怕是个姑娘，也好照顾着两个哥哥。”

十月怀胎，桃花姑娘这次生下了一对双胞胎，都是男孩。这两个男孩倒是一生出来就大声哭叫，可是

到了2岁多了。还是不会走路，也是爬的飞快，看着那么大的孩子在地上爬来爬去，桃花姑娘和张屠户

的心都要碎了。

倒是两个哥哥很喜欢这两个小家伙，护着两个小弟弟不让任何人欺负，而且两个哥哥长得五大三粗

地，倒也没人敢欺负他们，只是经常被村里人当傻子逗乐。

桃花姑娘不敢生了，一连四个傻儿子，说话都不打清楚，除了身强力壮，头脑确实不打清楚。桃花姑

娘和张屠户去了好几个庙，拜了各种菩萨，都不管用。随着四个儿子慢慢长大，这四个傻儿子不断在

村里招猫逗狗，欺负别的小孩子，有时连大人都欺负。

村里人找张屠户，让他们搬出去。张屠户没办法，就带着桃花姑娘去了山里。

在山里，桃花姑娘又怀孕了，然后又生了一个傻儿子。这个儿子到了2岁还不会走路，到了四岁还不会

说话。桃花姑娘心都要碎了。在老五4岁生日那天，张屠户（现在已经改成了猎户了），发誓以后不再

打猎，改成在山里种地。种些粮食，水果，蔬菜等。

这一年，桃花姑娘又怀孕了，张猎户自从桃花姑娘怀孕后，就不吃肉了。也管着5个儿子不让吃肉。把

五个儿子憋的那就一个难受。

五个儿子总算还是听话，听说又要有一个弟弟了，五个儿子居然非常有耐心地守在妈妈门口守了7天。

在第七天的时候，听到屋里一声婴儿哭声，张猎户和五个儿子都开心了。五个儿子大声叫了一声：“可

以吃肉啦”

这第六个儿子看起来很正常的样子，三个月学会儿翻身，六个月就可以坐着和哥哥们玩，九个月就四

处爬这让哥哥们追。1岁时就可以叫哥哥了，每天从大哥哥叫到五哥哥。叫的五个哥哥都乐开了花。

桃花姑娘看着第六个儿子，也很开心了。想着总算有一个健康的儿子了。就算小儿子辛苦一些，六个

儿子以后也有个照应了。

慢慢地，第六个儿子也长大了。也长到了十几岁了。整天跟着哥哥们跑来跑去，逗狗爬树，斗嘴，抓

狼。

好像看起来也没那么聪明了。不过，看着这6个儿子一天家在山里跑来跑去，桃花姑娘好像也忘记了那

个傻里傻气的大儿子。那个已经快30岁的大儿子好像还只有6岁孩子的智力。

看着这6个儿子的快乐，桃花姑娘好像觉得儿子们的智力没有那么重要，那些快乐才是重要的。

这一年山里来了老人，老人看着这六个孩子，就和桃花姑娘说：“这位夫人，我想收你这六个孩子为

徒，可以么？让他们跟我学一些武功。以后长大了也可以做个好人。”

桃花姑娘顿时哭了出来，这是第一次有人和她谈起这六个孩子的未来。

和张猎户商量后，桃花姑娘就留这位老人在家里教这六个儿子武功。

这六个儿子也出奇地听这位老人的话。这位老人也说这六个儿子是学武的奇才。

很快，二十年过去了。张屠户已经在几年前过世了。这一天，桃花姑娘感觉自己的日子也不多了。就

把六个儿子都叫到面前。

说：“儿子们呀，妈妈不识字，一直叫你们老大、老二、老三、老四、老五、老六。你们师傅给你们名

字，叫你们桃根，桃干，桃枝，桃叶，桃花，桃实，你们以后就用你们师傅给你的名字吧。妈妈要走

了，去找你们爸爸去了，我很开心有你们几个儿子，刚生下你们时，村里人说我，傻孩子生一个就好

了，生那么多干么，看着你们兄弟几个快快乐乐，我觉得真是幸福呀。妈妈走了后，你们要听你们师

傅的话，对人要真诚，不要随便欺负人，爸爸妈妈都是胆小的人，你们不要欺负别人呀。”

然后桃花姑娘就闭上了眼睛。

六个兄弟安静了一会，桃根说：“咱们把妈妈埋了吧，然后咱们就出去玩了。”

百字摘要

金庸案例

12 MAY

The Manufacturing Paradox

paradox：

How do you get far more output with far fewer workers?

The most believable forecast for 2020 suggests that manufacturing out-put in the developed

countries will at least double, while manufactur-ing employment will shrink to 10 to 12 percent of

the total workforce.

What has changed manufacturing, and sharply pushed up productivity, are new concepts, such as

“lean manufacturing.” Information and automation are less important than new theories of

manufacturing, which are an ad-vance comparable to the arrival of mass production eighty years

ago.

The decline in manufacturing as a creator of wealth and jobs will in-evitably bring about a new

protectionism, once again echoing what hap-pened earlier in agriculture. The fewer farm voters

there are, the more important the “farm vote” has become. As numbers have shrunk, farmers have

become a unified special-interest group that carries disproportionate clout in all rich countries.

ACTION POINT: Determine the rate of growth in output per person in your manufacturing or

operations functions. Is your organization experiencing the manufacturing paradox? Recommend

programs for retraining excess manufacturing workers.

Managing in the Next Society

12 MAY

The Manufacturing Paradox

How do you get far more output with far fewer workers?

The most believable forecast for 2020 suggests that manufacturing out-put

in the developed countries will at least double, while manufactur-ing

employment will shrink to 10 to 12 percent of the total workforce.

What has changed manufacturing, and sharply pushed up productivity, are

new concepts, such as “lean manufacturing.” Information and automation are

less important than new theories of manufacturing, which are an ad-vance

comparable to the arrival of mass production eighty years ago.

The decline in manufacturing as a creator of wealth and jobs will in-

evitably bring about a new protectionism, once again echoing what hap-

pened earlier in agriculture. The fewer farm voters there are, the more

important the “farm vote” has become. As numbers have shrunk, farmers

have become a unified special-interest group that carries disproportionate

clout in all rich countries.

ACTION POINT:

Determine the rate of growth in output per person in your

manufacturing or operations functions. Is your organization experi-encing

the manufacturing paradox? Recommend programs for retraining excess

manufacturing workers.

Managing in the Next Society

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

纪晓芙是出生武术世家，打小喜欢武功，而且武功也不错，不到10岁已经学会了家里的所有武功，如

果不是性别劣势的话，10岁的晓芙应该不输于她那20多岁的哥哥。

看着整体缠着要学功夫的晓芙，疼爱这个小女儿的纪老爷子就找人写信给峨眉派的掌门灭绝师太，想

让女儿拜到她门下学一些武功。

12岁那年，在武当大弟子宋远桥的撮合下，纪老爷子把女儿许配给了武当的第六个弟子殷梨亭。14岁

那年，灭绝师太回信，答应了纪老爷子的要求，纪老爷子亲自带着女儿晓芙到了四川，把晓芙送到了

峨眉门下，老爷子在峨眉又住了一年才回到汉阳。把女儿自己留在了峨眉。

时光如梭，几年的时间里，晓芙已经是峨眉派的佼佼者了。当年因为各种原因接收了纪晓芙的灭绝师

太也很庆幸这个弟子的加入。这几年，晓芙完成了从关系户到好弟子，到优秀弟子，到下一任掌门人

选，到下一任掌门最佳人选的成长。

而武当的宋远桥也多次写信给纪老爷子，催婚期。纪老爷子非常开心地说：“我女儿现在是灭绝师太的

弟子，婚配的事情，也需要师太的同意。”

这一年，金毛狮王在王盘山抢夺了屠龙刀后，灭绝师太派出十六名弟子去追查金毛狮王的下落。为了

让纪晓芙有一些历练，这次灭绝也派出另外晓芙在川西一带查询。晓芙很开心地接受了任务。

出来后没多久，晓芙就发现了有可疑的人跟随自己。用师父教的一些方法判断后，晓芙发现是一个白

色长袍的书生像的中年男子。就没有过多恶感，只是警告了他不要跟随自己。

那个书生并不搭理晓芙的警告，还是跟着晓芙，不管是打尖还是住店。晓芙看不下去了，就斥责他，

拿起剑来警告他。没想到那人却武功奇高，三招两式便夺下了晓芙的长剑。

晓芙一看打不过，就跑。那个人也不追。第二天晓芙醒来后，发现被那个人抢去的剑居然好端端放在

枕头边上。顿时大吃一惊。

出门后，看到那个书生打扮的男人在店里喝茶，就坐过去好生和他说：“这位大哥，咱们非亲非故，非

敌非友，也素不相识，而且男女有别，你这样跟着我有何居心呀。我武功虽不如你，可是我是峨眉派

的，我们峨眉派可是不好惹的。”

那人笑了笑，说道：“一个人武功分了派别，已自落了下乘。姑娘若跟着我去，包你一新耳目，教你得

知武学中别有天地。”

看着这位和蔼的陌生人，晓芙居然没有害怕，还觉得很亲切。心里马上就要答应了。嘴里却说：“你我

门派有别，这位大哥好自为之，我走了，你也别跟着我了。”

晓芙就出门骑马快走了。那个中年男人笑笑，继续喝茶。

晓芙骑了一天马，到了一个小镇入住后，发现那个中年男人已经在店里喝茶了。就像已经喝了一整天

一样。

半夜，中年男人到了晓芙房间，说：“来，我教你一些有用的武功……”

晓芙像着了魔一样，任由这个中年男人摆布。事后，这个男人说，他叫杨逍，是明教的光明左使者。

第二天杨逍命令她跟着，不要试图逃跑。晓芙木木地跟着他。仿佛一直就是这样。也仿佛会一直这样

下去。

几天后，他们来到一个叫做坐忘峰的地方。杨逍说，现在明教内部动乱，阳教主不知去向，有资格做

教主的有好几个，他不想让别人觉得他想做，就不去光明顶了，暂时在坐忘峰居住。

晓芙不知道他为什么要说这些，晓芙也好几天没说话了，也不知道他在说什么。

在坐忘峰，杨逍偶尔白天会出去做事，晚上回来就拉着晓芙说话，说明教的故事，说阳教主的故事，

说金毛狮王的故事，说紫衫龙王的故事。每每说道他们，杨逍都会非常开心。晓芙有时候也会开心，

却不知道那些事和自己有什么关系。

杨逍已经解开了晓芙的穴道，不过，晓芙知道杨逍的武功，知道在坐忘峰附近，不管自己跑多远，杨

逍都可以很快把自己找回来。而且晓芙好像也没有那么想跑。

慢慢的，晓芙挺期待阳光下，杨逍和他讲他们兄弟几个的故事，讲白眉鹰王的雄才大略，讲青翼蝠王

的病根。

后来，后一天，有几个敌人找到了坐忘峰，杨逍出去躲了起来。在躲开的过程中，晓芙和杨逍走散

了，晓芙也就顺着路跑了出来，跑会了成都。

没几天，晓芙发现自己怀孕了。就没有回峨眉报道，在九尺附近找了一个僻静的村庄，把孩子生了下

来。

又过了几年，晓芙把快三岁多的不悔安顿好后，就回到了峨眉。却什么都没有和峨眉说。

是的，那个女儿起名叫做“不悔”，晓芙和她说：“你姓杨，叫做杨不悔，你的爸爸是杨逍。”

在武当山上，当晓芙看到殷梨亭时，才想起了，自己和那个瘦弱而青涩的年轻人有婚姻，那个婚约像

上个世纪的事情。

再后来，灭绝知道后，让她去杀死杨逍。晓芙不愿意违抗师命，也不愿意伤害杨逍。就被灭绝师太杀

死了。

在死前，晓芙和张无忌说：“我求……求你……送她到她爹爹那里……我不肯……不肯害她爹爹……”

后来的张无忌知道，晓芙姑娘是爱上杨逍的。晓芙姑娘应该不知道，喜欢武功的她是在杨逍说“教你得

知武学中别有天地。”时爱上了那个男人？还是在那些一个个絮絮叨叨的下午爱上了杨逍？还是在那个

孩子出生的一瞬间爱上了杨逍。

看完了整个故事，我其实知道，真的知道，晓芙姑娘是在第一样看到那个“书生样”时就爱上了杨逍。

因为那个杨逍是那样的帅。

你想呀，如果晓芙遇见的是青翼蝠王（下面这货），她能芳心暗许才乖呢，肯定是一场复仇记。

百字摘要

金庸案例

13 MAY

Protectionism

保护主义

Some of the greatest impediments to effectiveness are the issues of yesterday, which still confine

our vision.

impediment：

妨碍；阻碍；障碍

confine：

限制；限定

something that delays or stops the progress of sth SYN obstacle

sb/sth to sth [ often passive ] to keep sb/sth inside the limits of a particular activity, subject, area, etc.

The decline in manufacturing as a creator of wealth and jobs will inevitably bring about a new

protectionism.

制造业对财富以及就业岗位的创造力的下降会带来新的保护主义。

For the first reaction to a period of turbulence is to try to build a wall that shields one’s own garden

from the cold winds outside.

面对骚乱的第一个行为往往是搭建一个围墙来把我们的花园保护起来。

turbulence：

动荡；混乱

a situation in which there is a lot of sudden change, confusion, disagreement and sometimes violence

shield：

sb/sth (from sb/sth) to protect sb/sth from danger, harm or sth unpleasant

骚乱；动乱；

保护某人或某物（免遭危险、伤害或不快）

But such walls no longer protect institutions—and especially businesses—that do not perform up to

world standards.

但这样的墙并不会保护我们那些非国际化的机构，特别是我们的商业。

It will only make them more vulnerable.

它只会让它更加脆弱。

vulnerable：

weak and easily hurt physically or emotionally

（身体上或感情上）脆弱的，易受…伤害的

The best example is Mexico, which for fifty years from 1929 on had a deliberate policy of building

its domestic economy independent of the outside world.

最好的例子就是墨西哥，1929年之后的50年里，墨西哥通过了一个规则：让自己的经济独立于外部世

界。

deliberate：

故意的；蓄意的；存心的

domestic：

done on purpose rather than by accident

It did this not only by building high walls of protectionism to keep foreign competition out.

墨西哥不但修建了保护外部经济力量进入的墙。

It did it—and this was uniquely Mexican in the twentieth-century world—by practically forbidding its

own companies to export.

也限制了自己的经济力量的对外输出。

This attempt to create a modern but purely Mexican economy failed dismally.

他们试图建立一个纯粹的墨西哥自己的经济环境，然而这个试图悄悄地失败了。

dismally：沉闷地；阴暗地

heavily, tediously

Mexico actually became increasingly dependent on imports, both of food and of manufactured

products, from the outside world.

墨西哥变得越来越依赖进口，包括食物和工业品。

increasingly:

越来越多地；不断增加地

more and more all the time

It was finally forced to open itself to the outside world, since it simply could no longer pay for the

needed imports.

最后，他们被迫向外部世界开放，因为他们已经没能力支付那些进口了。

And then Mexico found that a good deal of its industry could not survive.

而且，墨西哥人发现，他们大量的工厂没法存活了。

ACTION POINT: When manufacturing jobs decline, is the country’s manufacturing base

threatened? Why is it so difficult to accept that society and the economy are no longer dominated

by manual work in developed economies?

行动建议：当制造业岗位减少时，这个国家的制造了基础受到威胁了么？为什么我们那么难以接受我

们的手工业不再是经济发展的主动力？

threatened:

dominated:

受到威胁的; 感到危险的

To dominate a situation means to be the most powerful or important person or thing in it. 占据支配地位

If you feel threatened, you feel as if someone is trying to harm you.

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

The New Realities

Managing in the Next Society

13 MAY

Protectionism

Some of the greatest impediments to effectiveness are the issues

of yesterday, which still confine our vision.

The decline in manufacturing as a creator of wealth and jobs will in-

evitably bring about a new protectionism. For the first reaction to a pe-

riod of turbulence is to try to build a wall that shields one’s own garden

from the cold winds outside. But such walls no longer protect institu-tions

—and especially businesses—that do not perform up to world stan-

dards. It will only make them more vulnerable.

The best example is Mexico, which for fifty years from 1929 on had

Ade-liberate policy of building its domestic economy independent of the

out-side world. It did this not only by building high walls of

protectionism to keep foreign competition out. It did it—and this was

uniquely Mexican in the twentieth-century world—by practically

forbidding its own companies to export. This attempt to create a modern

but purely Mexican economy failed dismally. Mexico actually became

increasingly dependent on im-ports, both of food and of manufactured

products, from the outside world. It was finally forced to open itself to the

outside world, since it simply could no longer pay for the needed imports.

And then Mexico found that a good deal of its industry could not survive.

ACTION POINT:

When manufacturing jobs decline, is the country’s man-

ufacturing base threatened? Why is it so difficult to accept that society

and the economy are no longer dominated by manual work in developed

economies?

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

The New Realities

Managing in the Next Society

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

金庸笔下第一神医是谁？有人说是平一指，也就是给桃实仙开膛破肚治病的那个。平一指可以精确检

查出令狐冲体内有桃谷六仙的六股真气，还有不戒和尚的两股真气，后来在给令狐冲治病过程中发现

令狐冲没有求生欲望，感觉愧对所托之人，选择了自杀。

有人说是“见死不救”的胡青牛，胡青牛是张无忌的医学老师，对人体和医学熟悉到了极致，所有的病

痛到了他那么都是手到病除。后来被金花婆婆寻仇杀死。还好在死前把全部医学修为都教给了张无

忌。

有人说是一灯大师的师兄天竺僧，精研医术，死后还救了杨过等人，发现了情花的解毒药方。

有人说是薛慕华，也就是“阎王敌”，也就是救助阿朱的那个医生，他是阿碧的师父，是聋哑先生的弟

子，是无崖子的徒孙。

薛慕华可以很容易地救治各种疑难杂症。

甚至还有人说是一灯大师，一灯大师精通医学，而且有精通一阳指。不管多中的内伤都可以治愈。就

是治疗后自己需要休息几年。

当然，也有人说是张无忌，因为张无忌天资聪慧，又跟着蝶谷医仙胡青牛学习实践了很多年，长大后

又练会了九阳神功。

这些神医各个都有惊人的技艺和辉煌的经历，那么哪位才是金庸笔下的第一神医呢？

大家都是神医，当然都懂药。每个人都有一些神奇的药，比如黄药师有九花玉露丸，一灯大师也有一

颗大大的丸药，据说很补的，小龙女就吃了一颗。

大家都是武林中人，既然要做医生，内功当然少不了，毕竟内功是治病最好的方式。张无忌就用九阳

神功治好了自己的“玄冥神掌”，也治好了青翼蝠王吸血的毛病。一灯大师治病也是主要靠内功。

大家都是神医，当然不能只是内科了，多少要做点外科，虚竹子换眼睛，平一指开膛破肚，程灵素刮

骨疗伤。也都不在话下。

那么谁才是第一神医呢？

我觉得有另一个角度分析这个问题。

黄药师和一灯大师都是直接给病人药，大多也不问病人什么病，就是给药。仿佛那些药都是神药。

平一指也是把师父传下来的药仔细收藏，给了令狐冲。天竺僧也是去找药，从大自然中去找药，一起

的都是从零开始。

而有一个人并不是这样的。

在光明顶，张无忌给唐文亮接断骨时，对常敬之道：“拿些回阳五龙膏给我。”然后又说：“请去向武当

派讨一服三黄宝腊丸，向华山派讨一些玉真散。”

这个行为把大家看的都目瞪口呆。围攻光明顶的六大派都是威震江湖的大门派，各大派的主业都是打

打杀杀，当然有他们经验所得的最好的救伤药了。而唐文亮的断骨也是最常见的武林伤害。在这种情

况下，张无忌并没有采用任何一个单独门派的药，也没有自己拿出什么神药来，而是选择用崆峒派+武

当派+华山派的药的一个综合体。

并且，张无忌给出了解释：“劳驾！贵派的回阳五龙膏中，所用草乌是极好的；武当派三黄宝腊丸中的

麻黄、雄黄、藤黄三黄什是有用，再加上玉真散，唐前辈调养两个月后，四肢当能完好如初。”

也就是说，别看大家经常打打杀杀，受伤是家常便饭，大家的救伤药却并不是最好的。每种药都有其

特色，但并不是最佳。而最佳的选择是把这些药集中起来，各自选择其中最佳的成分，组成最佳的解

决方案。

而这个，也就是现在的联合办公。也就是德鲁克提议的企业功能“外包”的一个直接推论。

每个公司，每个活下来的公司，一定有一些优秀的技能，但这种技能又不能太多。如果有那么一个地

方，可以汇集这些公司，让大家在一起办公。同时大家各自展示自己优秀的地方，同时接受了利用其

他人优秀的地方，把那些可以外包的企业功能外包给他们，这样的一个整体就可以达到最佳的配置。

效率也就最高了。

所以，我觉得，张无忌才是金庸笔下第一神医，因为他并不依赖某种神药，而是对每一个药物仔细研

究，了解其优势，在特定的环境中把这些优势重新组合以应对市场的需要。

就像周菜正在做的联合办公一样。

如果你觉得这个事情不错，可以联系周菜，至于周菜的联系方式，大家自己想办法把。

百字摘要

金庸案例

金庸案例

金庸笔下的神医们

  1. 平一指

  2. 薛慕华

  3. 胡青牛

  4. 程灵素

  5. 天竺僧

  6. 张无忌 1

  7. 段兴智（一灯）

  8. 虚竹（灵鹫宫）

  9. 黄药师

  10. 无嗔

张无忌俯下身来，接续唐文亮的断骨，对常敬之道：“拿些回阳五龙膏给我。”常敬之从身边取了出来

给他。张无忌道：“请去向武当派讨一服三黄宝腊丸，向华山派讨一些玉真散。”常敬之依言讨到，递

了给他。张无忌道：“劳驾！贵派的回阳五龙膏中，所用草乌是极好的；武当派三黄宝腊丸中的麻黄、

雄黄、藤黄三黄什是有用，再加上玉真散，唐前辈调养两个月后，四肢当能完好如初。”说着续骨敷

药，片刻间整治完毕。

14 MAY

Splintered Nature of Knowledge Work

Splinter ：vt. 使分裂；使裂成碎片

Knowledge work is deeply splintered in most organizations.

Knowledge work is specialized, and because it is so specialized, it is deeply splintered in most

organizations.

Managing all of these specialties effectively is a big challenge for knowledge-based organizations.

For example, hospitals may use outsourcing, PEOs (Professional Employer Organizations), and

temp agencies to manage, place, and satisfy the highly specialized knowledge worker.

This results in outsourcing part of the management task.

The modern hospital provides a great example of the management complexities created by the

splintering of knowledge work and the resultant use of outsourcing, PEOs as well as temp

agencies.

resultant ：

( formal ) caused by the thing that has just been mentioned

因而发生的；因此而产生的

Even a fair-size community hospital with 275 to 300 beds will have approximately 3,000 people

working for it.

Close to half will be knowledge workers of one kind or another. Two of these groups, nurses and

specialists in the business departments, are fairly large, numbering several hundred people each.

But there are around thirty “paramedic specialties”: the physical therapists and the people in the

clinical lab; the psychiatric case workers; the oncological technicians; the two dozen people who

prepare people for surgery; the people in sleep clinics; the ultrasound technicians; the cardiacclinic technicians; and many, many more.

Managing all these specialties makes the modern hospital the most complex of modern

organizations.

ACTION POINT: Identify functions in your organization that could be outsourced. Make plans to

outsource these functions and to monitor per-formance and quality.

找到你组织里可以外包的职能，然后把它们外包出去，并且检测他们的性能和质量。

Managing in the Next Society

The Next Society (Corpedia Online Program)

14 MAY

Splintered Nature of Knowledge Work

Knowledge work is deeply splintered in most organizations.

Knowledge work is specialized, and because it is so specialized, it is

deeply splintered in most organizations. Managing all of these spe-cialties

effectively is a big challenge for knowledge-based organizations. For

example, hospitals may use outsourcing, PEOs (Professional Employer

Organizations), and temp agencies to manage, place, and satisfy the highly

specialized knowledge worker. This results in outsourcing part of the man-

agement task. The modern hospital provides a great example of the man-

agement complexities created by the splintering of knowledge work and

the resultant use of outsourcing, PEOs as well as temp agencies.

Even a fair-size community hospital with 275 to 300 beds will have ap-

proximately 3,000 people working for it. Close to half will be knowledge

workers of one kind or another. Two of these groups, nurses and specialists in

the business departments, are fairly large, numbering several hundred people

each. But there are around thirty “paramedic specialties”: the physi-cal

therapists and the people in the clinical lab; the psychiatric case workers; the

oncological technicians; the two dozen people who prepare people for

surgery; the people in sleep clinics; the ultrasound technicians; the cardiac-

clinic technicians; and many, many more. Managing all these specialties

makes the modern hospital the most complex of modern organizations.

ACTION POINT:

Identify functions in your organization that could be

outsourced. Make plans to outsource these functions and to monitor per-

formance and quality.

Managing in the Next Society

The Next Society (Corpedia Online Program)

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

福威镖局成为了青城派的目标后，很快就惨遭灭门了。

青城派在江湖上不算太厉害，比少林武当自然差的很远，比五岳剑派也差的很远，甚至比很多大一点

的门派也不如。

福威镖局是江湖第一大镖局，创始人是福威镖局现任掌门人林震南的祖父林远图，当年，林远图凭借

72路辟邪剑法打遍天下英豪，开创了百年基业。

到了林震南这一代，福威镖局以“福”为主，以“威”为辅，生意也越做越大，在全国设置了10处镖局，有

上百名武师。林震南多交朋友，再加上百年前林远图的威名，福威镖局面子上还是过得去的。

青城派要攻打福威镖局，这并不是秘密，岳不群也知道了。不过，很多人应该会觉得，这场战役应该

会持续一段时间，毕竟福威镖局有是十处分支，还有金刀无敌的王家做为后援，还有其他亲朋好友。

攻打开始后，短短十多天，福威镖局惨遭灭门，只有林震南夫妇以及独自林平之逃脱，而这个逃脱只

是青城派的设计，因为青城派的目的并不是灭门，也不少报仇，而是林家的《辟邪剑谱》。

林震南夫妇从福威镖局跑出后，一路向北，往洛阳跑去，在路上被木高峰截获，逼问后因伤重死亡，

临死前向唯一在身边的令狐冲交代了后事。

看了福威镖局的这段突如其来的灭门，我在想，如果我是林震南，如何才能避免这种突如其来的灭门

呢？如何才能在遇见这种大灾难时有更多的躲避地方，而不是千里迢迢赶到洛阳，去找一个自身难保

的金刀王家。

福威镖局的掌门人林震南自己在教林平之武功。估计门下那些趟子手大多也是武功平平，也就是力气

大。多数从街坊邻居或者市井里找人，或者家人里培养。

一方面，这些人肯定武功不会太高，另一方面，这些人的社交圈子也基本上就是林家。

如果，当时林家换一个思路呢？会不会好一些呢？

比如，林家不再自己教授武师武功，而是把这些武师派到少林、武当、华山、嵩山等学习。一方面可

以学习一些真正有用的武功，另一方面也多认识一些其他派的师兄、师弟、师父。

或者更进一步，林家定期从少林俗家弟子、武当俗家弟子、华山弟子等招录一些作为武师。一方面较

少了选人的成本，一方面也提高了自己镖局的能力和社交圈子。

可以设想一下，如果林平之是少林方生的记名弟子，青城派在攻打福威镖局时会那么肆无忌惮么？

在面临灭门时，林震南让他的家人独自逃命，有的家人走了，有的家人没走，最后不管是走的还是没

走的，都死了。

这一方面是武力的绝对劣势，另一方面是人员的配置：大家都是家人，都是学的林家的“假”的辟邪剑

法，怎么和人家打呀。

如果当时林家的武师，有10个是华山的弟子，有6个是少林俗家弟子，有8个是武当俗家弟子，有12个

嵩山记名弟子，有25个衡山的弟子，这些弟子还多少娶了一些恒山的俗家弟子。

面对这样一张网，余沧海敢打林家的主意么？

就算攻打了林家，林家可以选择的逃亡之地，也远远多过一个洛阳。

所以，德鲁克给企业一个很重要的建议，就是人事资源的外包，而不是自己负责从招募到培训的等

等。让那些真正有实力的机构去帮你找人、培养人，然后，你用人就用了。关注自己的核心业务，用

最合适的人。

百字摘要

金庸案例

人力资源外包和业务流程外包

15 MAY

Use of PEOs and BPOs

Outsourcing human resources management can save up to 30 percent of the cost and increase

employee satisfaction as well.

Companies are experiencing important changes in human resources management and the

Professional Employer Organizations, or PEOs, have been one response to these changes.

Primary factors driving the growth of the industry include an increase in the complexity of laws and

regulations governing the human resource function and the subse-quent need for professional

expertise to manage and maintain a workforce to deal with these new realities.

PEOs concentrate mainly on small- and medium-size companies.

The use of PEOs frees up managers to focus on their core competencies rather than on

employment-related rules, regulations, and paperwork.

This industry, which twenty years ago barely existed, is now growing at a rate of 30 percent a year.

In contrast to PEOs, Business Process Outsourcing firms, or BPOs, assume full responsibility for

performing the work of the human resource function in large enterprises, companies typically with

twenty thousand or more employees.

The innovator and leader in the BPO industry, Exult, founded in 1998, now manages the full

spectrum of employee process such as payroll, recruiting and staffing, training administration,

employee-data manage-ment, relocation, and severance administration for a number of Global

For-tune 500 companies.

According to a study by McKinsey, the management consultancy, outsourcing human resources

management in these ways can save up to 30 percent of the cost and increase employee

satisfaction as well.

ACTION POINT: Are you outsourcing part of your human resource function? Why or why not?

Managing in the Next Society

The Next Society (Corpedia Online Program)

15 MAY

Use of PEOs and BPOs

Outsourcing human resources management can save up to 30 percent

of the cost and increase employee satisfaction as well.

Companies are experiencing important changes in human resources

management and the Professional Employer Organizations, or PEOs, have

been one response to these changes. Primary factors driving the growth of the

industry include an increase in the complexity of laws and regulations

governing the human resource function and the subse-quent need for

professional expertise to manage and maintain a workforce to deal with these

new realities. PEOs concentrate mainly on small- and medium-size

companies. The use of PEOs frees up managers to focus on their core

competencies rather than on employment-related rules, regula-tions, and

paperwork. This industry, which twenty years ago barely existed,

is now growing at a rate of 30 percent a year.

In contrast to PEOs, Business Process Outsourcing firms, or BPOs, as-

sume full responsibility for performing the work of the human resource func-

tion in large enterprises, companies typically with twenty thousand or more

employees. The innovator and leader in the BPO industry, Exult, founded in

1998, now manages the full spectrum of employee process such as payroll,

recruiting and staffing, training administration, employee-data manage-ment,

relocation, and severance administration for a number of Global For-tune 500

companies. According to a study by McKinsey, the management consultancy,

outsourcing human resources management in these ways can save up to 30

percent of the cost and increase employee satisfaction as well.

ACTION POINT:

Are you outsourcing part of your human resource func-

tion? Why or why not?

Managing in the Next Society

The Next Society (Corpedia Online Program)

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

对于很多存在很久的帮派，都会面临一个老领导退休的问题。

这个老领导不只是一把手，还包括同代的其他师兄弟，这种情况在少林和丐帮最为明显。

洪七公在岛上受伤后，感觉不久于人世了，就选择了黄蓉做下一任帮主，交给了他打狗棍法以及打狗

棍。后来机缘巧合，在《九阴真经》的帮助下，洪老帮主居然活了下来，而这时黄蓉以及是帮主了。

洪七公对黄蓉说，现在他只是卸任的帮主了，大约相当于长老，并不能决定帮内的大事，只是可以给

帮主一些建议和支持。

同样，在杏子林，时任丐帮帮主乔峰要拆开西夏给丐帮的信件时，突然听到一身补钉累累的徐长老让

他不要拆，很是惊讶。虽然徐长老在丐帮中辈分极高，连前任帮主汪剑通都称呼他一声“师叔”，但这

时乔峰是丐帮版主，辈分虽然比徐长老为底，但遇见帮中大事，终究还是乔峰说了算，别说徐长老，

就是前任帮主的职权也是在其下的。所以，乔峰才会惊讶，当然，乔峰还是听从了徐长老的话。

在同一个江湖，为了两大长长久久的门派，少林也差不多是同样的规则。少林方丈除了收戒律院约束

外，在决策层面基本上不受前辈的影响。

其实，对于这两大派来说，长辈是巨大的财富，而不是负担。固然徐长老给乔峰和丐帮带来了一些伤

害和混淆。而更多的长老还是为丐帮或者少林的发展做出过并且持续做着贡献。

当张无忌攻打少林时，少林三僧的金刚伏魔圈成功地为少林取得了谈判话语权和尊严。华山的风清扬

也为华山的存亡贡献了自己的力量。而泰山派的长辈却做出了有损于泰山的事情，让泰山面临灭亡的

境地。

老领导，或者说那些退休的老人，应该如何处理呢？

他们一方面没有太多的负担，可以自由地安排自己的生活。地位也比较尊贵，也可以获得大家的尊

重，

同时，他们还有丰富的经验，对帮会的了解，对江湖的了解。他们如果不参与帮派内的事物是一件很

浪费的事情。

但他们的过度参与又会带来巨大的问题。

对于一个管理者来说，如何管理这些“退休员工”，以及类似的“外部员工”就是一个很大的挑战了。

特别是那些很优秀的人，如少林的渡厄、渡劫、渡难三僧，华山的高矮二老等。这些人对帮派都有很

深的情节，即使被赶走了，仍然心心念兹，如华山的风清扬等。

德鲁克建议，应该吸引和团结这些“外部员工”，让他们做出适当的贡献。

群里的杜鹏说，对于这些人可以区别对待，上者作为资源纽带， 中者作为专家攻坚难题，下者可以低

成本返聘，也可以干活。

百字摘要

金庸案例

16 MAY

Managing Nontraditional Employees

The challenge to executives is to coordinate efforts of all categories of workers.

Along with fulltime employees, PEOs, and temp workers, there may also be a closely linked but

separately managed organization made up of nontraditional employees in the new corporation.

Increasingly, employees take early retirement but they do not stop working.

Instead, their “second career” often takes an unconventional form.

They may work freelance, or part-time, or as temporaries, or for an outsourcing contractor, or as

contractors themselves.

Such “early retirement to keep on working” is particularly common among knowledge workers.

Attracting and holding these diverse groups will become the central tasks of people management

in the new corporation.

These people do not have permanent relationships with the business.

They may not have to be managed, but they have to be made productive.

They will therefore have to be deployed where their specialized knowledge can make the greatest

contribution.

Managers need to work closely with their counterparts in the outsource contractor organization on

the professional development, moti-vation, satisfaction, and productivity of these nontraditional

workers.

ACTION POINT: Attract and integrate nontraditional employees effectively into your organization.

Managing in the Next Society

The Next Society (Corpedia Online Program)

16 MAY

Managing Nontraditional Employees

The challenge to executives is to coordinate efforts

of all categories of workers.

Along with full-time employees, PEOs, and temp workers, there may also

be a closely linked but separately managed organization made up of

nontraditional employees in the new corporation. Increasingly, employ-

ees take early retirement but they do not stop working. Instead, their “sec-

ond career” often takes an unconventional form. They may work

freelance, or part-time, or as temporaries, or for an outsourcing

contractor, or as con-tractors themselves. Such “early retirement to keep

on working” is particu-larly common among knowledge workers.

Attracting and holding these diverse groups will become the central tasks

of people management in the new corporation. These people do not have

permanent relationships with the business. They may not have to be managed,

but they have to be made productive. They will therefore have to be deployed

where their specialized knowledge can make the greatest con-tribution.

Managers need to work closely with their counterparts in the outsource

contractor organization on the professional development, moti-vation,

satisfaction, and productivity of these nontraditional workers.

ACTION POINT:

Attract and integrate nontraditional employees effec-tively

into your organization.

Managing in the Next Society

The Next Society (Corpedia Online Program)

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

从五岳剑派到五岳派

中国历来有五岳：东岳泰山、西岳华山、南岳衡山、北岳恒山、中岳嵩山。武侠人士也喜欢住在山

上，一来占山为王，作为落脚地可以避免一些不必要的打扰。另一方面，高高的山也会让附近的村民

感到敬畏。

很快，这五座山都有了门派，也就是泰山派、华山派、衡山派、恒山派和嵩山派，各个派在当地占山

为王，作威作福，偶尔也做点保护周围老百姓的事情，大家也都感觉不错。

一切看起来都是那么美好，直到出现了一个叫做日月神教的帮派。

日月神教本来是那些非主流门派的个人爱好者组织起来的一个非正常组织。在各大派之间，他们一直

努力寻找生存空间，在各种冲突中，他们慢慢地聚集到了一起和各大门派争夺资源。

由于他们的一盘散沙状态，在各次冲突中他们都处于弱势的状态。

后来出了一个叫做任我行的高手，他凭借武力和威望很快把那些散沙聚集到了一切，并且抢了一个叫

做黑木崖的大石头作为落脚地。

有了落脚地后，任我行又给这些乌合之众齐了个名字叫做：“日月神教”，也就是说，只有日月可以和

他们争光，明摆着要和一直欺负他们的少林、武当、五岳、青城等大派一较高低。

有了落脚地，有了派名后，在任我行的感召下，很多江湖独行侠都加入了日月神教，其中颇多武功不

错的，比如向问天、童柏熊等。随着这些武林高手的加入，再加上任我行的领导和管理才能，短短十

几年里，日月神教俨然成了江湖武力的高点。

某次日月神教偷袭武当派，重创了武当派，并且抢走了张三丰用过的宝剑。

某次，日月神教偷袭华山，抢走了华山的“葵花宝典”。

两次对正派的袭击导致武当和华山损失惨重，日月神教的崛起也真正引起了江湖的担忧。有识之士开

始考虑应对之策。

第一个站出来的是嵩山的左冷禅。

左冷禅亲自跑到华山、泰山、衡山、恒山，劝说四大派和嵩山形成战略联盟，一旦遭遇魔教（这是正

派称日月神教为“魔教”，称自己为正派）攻击，大家互相救助。

左冷禅当时是正派第一高手，并且在亲自跑来跑去中得到了大家的信任，同时在魔教巨大压力的影响

来，五岳派的各个掌门终于在嵩山签署了互相救助的协议，这就是“五岳剑派”。

五岳剑派成立后，魔教果然有所收敛了。好几年没有再发生过大规模的攻击事件，只是偶尔会出现一

些遭遇性的打斗，也是互有损伤。

作为五岳剑派的盟主，左冷禅并不甘心，他知道魔教也不甘心。也在积蓄力量应对正派的联盟。

左冷禅一边努力经营五岳剑派的联盟，建立联盟之间的互动机制，同时多多收留江湖上无派的一些知

名高手，不论好坏，尽可能地收入到嵩山派，一方面可以壮大嵩山派的实力，以应对以后可能的变

化，一方面削弱魔教的实力。

在保持了十几年的平衡后，某一天左冷禅在路上遇见了任我行。两个人随机展开了搏斗，长时间消耗

战后，两人都发现了各自武功的缺陷，两为聪明人都机智地选择了罢斗，各自修复自己的身体以及武

功。

回到嵩山的左冷禅意识到，松散的联盟并不能应对帮派化管理的魔教，五岳剑派要想对抗魔教，需要

有更强的协作关系，以及更高效的执行力。

所以左冷禅选择了并派，也就是把五岳剑派变成一个五岳派，在同一个规则下极大地放大武力，以应

对帮派化的魔教。

任我行也选择了立东方不败为副教主，自己潜心研究吸星大法，以应对左冷禅可能是扩张。

左冷禅开始实行并派，而任我行却被东方不败囚禁了起来。

左冷禅在并派的过程中，遇到了极大的抵抗，各派掌门人并不愿意放弃自己的控制权，而左冷禅又需

要一个极权的大五岳派以应对随时会崛起的魔教。

庆幸的是，东方不败在囚禁了任我行后，居然消失了，并没有发生正派预期的大规模攻打行为。

在并派过程中，左冷禅为了逼迫各大派掌门的退让，不惜动用之前收留的那些江湖无派高手。

在左冷禅的极力推动下，并派的大会在嵩山召开了。左冷禅做好了所有准备，准备在完成仪式后享受

荣耀。

站在台上，看着台下五岳派几千人的汇集，左冷禅不禁为自己的雄才感到欣慰：这二十多年的梦想终

于实现了。正派终于有了和魔教抗衡的实力了。甚至有了消灭魔教的实力了。

随着社会的发展，以及工业的发展，超大型公司开始出现，超大型公司对公司的结构提出了新的要

求，这个要求简单就是表现了联盟。

联盟的出现让公司可以应对更大范围的危机，也为更大的公司提供了结构。目前这种结构大体有两大

类。

一类就是通用的模式，通用公司通过参股和控制生产环节的企业，以及竞争对手的企业达成对产业链

的控制。另一类就是Toyota，Toyota通过生产能力的约束开控制生产环节的企业，让他们相当于自己

的子公司。

这两种模式成为了超大型公司的典型模式

在面对魔教的威胁中，左冷禅选择了通用模式，直接控制生产环节所有的公司，以减低内部风险以应

对外部风险。

最后左冷禅失败了，令狐冲代表的正派和任盈盈代表的魔教睡到了一张床上，江湖和谐了。

而在现实中，通用成功了。一直持续到了现在。

百字摘要

金庸案例

  1. 为什么要反对并派

17 MAY

The Corporation as Confederation

Confederation：

an organization consisting of countries, businesses, etc. that have joined together in order to help each other

盟；联合体

联

From corporation to confederation.

Here are two prominent examples of the corporation as a confederation.

prominent：

重要的；著名的；杰出的

important or well known

Eighty years ago General Motors first developed both the organizational concepts and the

organizational structure upon which today’s large corporations everywhere are based.

And it was based for seventy-five of these eighty years on two basic principles.

We own as much as possible of whatever we manufacture and we own everything we do.

Now it is experimenting with becoming the minority partner in competing companies: Saab in

Sweden, Suzuki and Isuzu in Japan, and it’s about to become the controlling minority partner of

Fiat. At the same time, it has divested itself of 70 or 80 percent of what it manufactures.

experimenting ：

If you experiment with something or experiment on it, you do a scientific test on it in order to discover what

happens to it in particular conditions.

minority：

少数群体

做实验

a small group within a community or country that is different because of race, religion, language, etc.

competing ：

competing stories, ideas etc cannot all be right or accepted

少数派；少数民族；

互相矛盾的，相互抵触的

The second example goes exactly the other way.

It’s Toyota, which for the last twenty years or so has been the most successful automotive

company.

It is restructuring itself around its core competency—manufacturing.

It is moving away from having multiple suppliers of parts and accessories to having only one or two

everyplace.

At the same time, it uses its manufacturing competence to manage these suppliers.

They remain independent companies but they are basically part of Toyota in terms of management.

ACTION POINT: Understand the structure of your industry by analyzing whether your organization

and its competitors are more like GM or Toyota.

Managing in the Next Society

The Next Society (Corpedia Online Program)

17 MAY

The Corporation as Confederation

From corporation to confederation.

Here are two prominent examples of the corporation as a confedera-tion.

Eighty years ago General Motors first developed both the orga-nizational

concepts and the organizational structure upon which today’s large

corporations everywhere are based. And it was based for seventy-five of these

eighty years on two basic principles. We own as much as possible of

whatever we manufacture and we own everything we do. Now it is experi-

menting with becoming the minority partner in competing companies: Saab

in Sweden, Suzuki and Isuzu in Japan, and it’s about to become the

controlling minority partner of Fiat. At the same time, it has divested itself

of 70 or 80 percent of what it manufactures.

The second example goes exactly the other way. It’s Toyota, which for the

last twenty years or so has been the most successful automotive com-pany. It

is restructuring itself around its core competency—manufacturing. It is

moving away from having multiple suppliers of parts and accessories to

having only one or two everyplace. At the same time, it uses its manufac-

turing competence to manage these suppliers. They remain independent

companies but they are basically part of Toyota in terms of management.

ACTION POINT:

Understand the structure of your industry by analyzing

whether your organization and its competitors are more like GM or Toyota.

Managing in the Next Society

The Next Society (Corpedia Online Program)

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

华为的海思这几天突然火了，华为说，面临美国的断奶威胁，我们华为有海思，我们的备胎上线了。

恭喜各位，很快就可以用上配置了备胎的手机了。

其实并不是，你只是用的库存。海思只是一个战略，而战略就是告诉别人，我也在做了。

德鲁克今天讲了一个叫做辛迪加的组织模式，这是一个非企业的组织模式。这本模式的起源是十九世

纪的欧洲农村合作社。这是一个垄断的模式，目前在中国也有很多人在尝试。

辛迪加模式中，每一个公司都是独立的公司，都在某个以细分领域占有领导地位，公司之间的均以交

易为主。

在全球市场，这也是一个垄断的局，在这个局中不同公司有不同的位置，每个公司都尽可能保持独

立，并且独立设计产品，他们在自己的工厂生产自己的产品，并且销售到自己的市场中。对于其他市

场，他们或者按计划生产，或者在当地设置工厂生产。

辛迪加负责所有产品的销售交付，并且负责所有市场的服务。

最后，最重要的，辛迪加会“拥有”所有企业的一个小额股份，而每一个企业也有“拥有”辛迪加的小额股

份。这样，大家就是一个利益共同体，

到这里，大家可以看出来，这其实是一个垄断机制。辛迪加拥有很大的控制权以及对“不听话”的公司

的处罚权。

那么，在这个全球市场上，华为是什么位置呢？他有什么权利和义务呢？他布局的海思有什么意义和

价值呢？

目前大家知道的华为的主要业务是手机，在手机这个业务线上，华为拥有的是“中国劳动力”以及“中国

市场”，还有其他国际市场。

而ARM拥有芯片的技术，GOOGLE拥有操作系统的技术，三星拥有玻璃（屏幕）的技术，这些技术的

拥有者形成了一个整体。在这些技术的末端，各国的手机生产商生产手机卖给各国的国民。

中国的优势是“最大的制造国”以及“最大的贸易国”，这个在辛迪加体系就是他们对“其他市场”的安排。

而华为就是那个“当地的生产商”。

在这个持续细分的市场里，一个单独的公司越来越难完成整个生产链了。当这个辛迪加系统要惩罚一

个外围市场的生产者时，下游几乎没有反抗的模式。

华为对（国）内展示的应对手段是：核心技术的研发，包括芯片、操作系统、屏幕等。但真实情况

呢？不能想象，在这个时代，一家公司可以同时拥有芯片的设计、生产能力，又可以同时拥有操作系

统的设计生产能力，有同时拥有手机的生产、销售能力。至少的短期内不可能。

而华为又是一家没有上市的公司，他在利益上和西方的巨头关系不大。所以，西方在惩罚时就少了很

多顾虑。

海思什么样，还没有上市，我并不知道，我知道的是，华为在之前已经屯了很多芯片以应对这场贸易

战。这应该是华为公布海思“备胎计划”的底气吧。

那些囤货用完后呢？希望贸易战可以结束吧。

德鲁克最后给出了一个思考，思考一下，如果你的企业在某个辛迪加体系你，或者加入一个新的辛迪

加体系，日子会过的好一些么？

百字摘要

金庸案例

18 MAY

The Corporation as a Syndicate

Syndicate：

a group of people or companies who work together and help each other in order to achieve a particular aim

企业联合组织；财团；私人联合会

辛迪加；

The model for the syndicate is the nineteenth-century farmers’ cooperative.

cooperative：

合作的；协作的；同心协力的

involving doing sth together or working together with others towards a shared aim

The approaches at GM and Toyota, however different, still take the traditional corporation as their

point of departure.

approaches:

走近

departure

离开；起程；出发

When you approach something, you get closer to it.

:the act of leaving a place; an example of this

But there are also some new ideas that do away with the corporate model altogether.

do away with:

To do away with something means to remove it completely or put an end to it.

消除; 终结

One example is a “syndicate” being tested by several noncompeting manufacturers in the

European Union.

Each of the constituent companies is medium-sized, family-owned, and owner-managed.

constituent:

成分；构成要素

one of the parts of sth that combine to form the whole

Each is a leader in a narrow, highly engineered product line.

Each is heavily export-dependent.

The individual companies intend to remain independent, and to continue to design their products

separately.

They will also continue to make them in their own plants for their main markets, and to sell them in

these markets.

But for other markets, and especially for emerging or less-developed countries, the syndicate will

arrange for the making of the products, either in syndicate-owned plants producing for several of

the members or by local contract manufacturers.

The syndicate will handle the delivery of all members’ products, and service them in all markets.

Each member will own a share of the syndicate, and the syndicate, in turn, will own a small share of

each member’s capital.

If this sounds familiar, it is because the model is the nineteenth-century farmers’ cooperative.

ACTION POINT: Decide whether your organization would benefit from being part of an existing or a

new syndicate.

Managing in the Next Society

18 MAY

The Corporation as a Syndicate

The model for the syndicate is the nineteenth-century farmers’ cooperative.

The approaches at GM and Toyota, however different, still take the tra-ditional

corporation as their point of departure. But there are also

some new ideas that do away with the corporate model altogether.

One example is a “syndicate” being tested by several noncompeting

manufacturers in the European Union. Each of the constituent companies is

medium-sized, family-owned, and owner-managed. Each is a leader in

Anarrow, highly engineered product line. Each is heavily export-dependent.

The individual companies intend to remain independent, and to continue to

design their products separately. They will also continue to make them in

their own plants for their main markets, and to sell them in these mar-kets.

But for other markets, and especially for emerging or less-developed

countries, the syndicate will arrange for the making of the products, either in

syndicate-owned plants producing for several of the members or by local

contract manufacturers. The syndicate will handle the delivery of all mem-

bers’ products, and service them in all markets. Each member will own

Ashare of the syndicate, and the syndicate, in turn, will own a small share of

each member’s capital. If this sounds familiar, it is because the model is the

nineteenth-century farmers’ cooperative.

ACTION POINT:

Decide whether your organization would benefit from

being part of an existing or a new syndicate.

Managing in the Next Society

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

江南七怪：为什么我们要教郭靖武功？

话说江南七怪和丘处机打赌后，就开始四处寻找郭靖，一路上也不知道吃了多少苦，收了多少累，历

经很多年后，居然在一个大草原上遇见了郭靖。

看到郭靖那一瞬间，江南七怪非常开心，因为终于找到郭靖了。边上不知所谓的郭靖也为他们开心，

觉得这几个外地来的大爷和阿姨都是很好的人。

然而没开心多久，江南七怪就不开心了，因为他们发现郭靖很笨，笨的超出了他们的想象。

在七位师父用心教授了半年后，不知是哪位怪在吃饭中使劲锤了一下饭桌：“这他妈的什么时候是个头

呀。”

是呀，花了那么多时间终于找到了郭靖，大家已经很辛苦了，又要花不知道多少时间来培养这个小

哥，啥时候是个头呀。

江南七怪的心血、生命、时间都浪费在了这个小哥身上。唯一女生韩小莹也年华不少。七怪感觉为了

那样一个小小的赌注就赔上了兄弟几个的一生，真的不值得。

后来，郭靖遇见了马钰，遇见了黄蓉，遇见了洪七公，遇见了老顽童，一系列奇遇后，郭靖的武功突

飞猛进。

再后来和黄蓉结婚后入住桃花岛，在随后的几十年里，郭大侠名满江湖，在被欧阳锋、欧阳克等杀死

了其他兄弟后，江南七怪的老大柯镇恶在郭靖的庇护下，俨然也成了江湖一个不忍忽视的力量，也是

很多人最喜爱的江湖人物。

那么对于江南七怪来说，郭靖究竟是什么呢？

遇见郭靖之前，郭靖是他们要努力寻找的一个孩子，是他们证明自己侠义的一个工具，所以江南七怪

花很大的代价去寻找他。

遇见郭靖之后，郭靖是他们需要教导的一个弟子，是他们证明自己尊严的一个工具，所以江南七怪花

很大代价去教导他。

后来，郭靖成人了，成为了江湖上的大侠，郭靖又成为了他（这时的江南七怪只有老大柯镇恶活着

了）赖以生存和资源。

对于江南七怪来说，郭靖经历了一个从成本到资源的变迁。在初期，对于江南七怪来说，郭靖是一个

需要不断付出的成本中心：付出时间、生命、体力、智力；而后期则是一个巨大的资源中心：几乎取

之不尽用之不竭。

因为江南七怪不但在学习武功这件事上影响了郭靖，也影响了郭靖的整个生命。就像郭靖彻底影响了

江南七怪的一生。

德鲁克认为，当管理者把员工当资源而不是成本时，员工就会有更好的工作积极性，而积极性可以让

员工更好地达到公司的目标。公司和员工也就可以共同成长，达到新的高度。

就像江南七个和郭靖那样。

百字摘要

金庸案例

19 MAY

People as Resources

People are a resource and not just a cost.

The Japanese heeded first and best my point of view that people must be viewed as your

colleagues and as one of your prime resources.

It is only through such respect of the workers that true productivity is achieved. People are a

resource and not just a cost.

The most enlightened managers have started to understand what could be realized by managing

people toward a desired end or goal.

Management is so much more than exercising rank and privilege; it’s so much more than “making

deals.”

Management affects people and their lives, both in business and in many other aspects as well.

ACTION POINT: Look at people as resources to be developed. Take steps to expose your people

and yourself to the best ideas and see to it that they are trained in how to apply them.

Managing in a Time of Great Change

19 MAY

People as Resources

People are a resource and not just a cost.

The Japanese heeded first and best my point of view that people must be

viewed as your colleagues and as one of your prime resources. It is only

through such respect of the workers that true productivity is achieved.

People are a resource and not just a cost. The most enlightened man-

agers have started to understand what could be realized by managing peo-

ple toward a desired end or goal. Management is so much more than

exercising rank and privilege; it’s so much more than “making deals.”

Man-agement affects people and their lives, both in business and in many

other aspects as well.

ACTION POINT:

Look at people as resources to be developed. Take steps to

expose your people and yourself to the best ideas and see to it that they

are trained in how to apply them.

Managing in a Time of Great Change

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

一句话说出了教育的本质

最近接触了很多做“教育”的，有的称呼自己为“K12”的，有的称呼自己为做“培训”的，有的说自己是“商

学院”，有的自称为“院长”。

随着年龄的增长，慢慢也有人叫我“老师”了，我常常的回答是“老则老矣，师则不敢”。

这些做“教育”的，有的说“孩子教育问题，首先是家长的教育”，有的说“多读书，一年要多50本书”，

有的说，要有知识体系，来， “我帮你更换一下你的底层操作系统”。 有的说，教育就是“好好学习”。

那么，什么是教育呢？

其实，我们的老祖宗早就用一句话说清楚了。这句话就是论语的开篇。

也就是“学而时习之”。

我们的老祖先认为，教育就是学习，而学习就是两件事：学和习。

学之的是知识的理论而习指的是知识的实践。

德鲁克把工人分为知识工人和体力劳动者。这两者都是需要教育的。知识教育的方式略有不同。

体力劳动者有少量的学，更多的是习。他们简单地学一下，然后反复地习，通过习让自己变得更加熟

练，更加高效和不容易出错。

在工业时代，有一个叫做弗雷德里克·温斯洛·泰勒的人觉得，体力劳动者个体的习会有问题，由于个体的差

异已经时间的加持，大家的水平会不一致，所以，弗雷德里克·温斯洛·泰勒针对工业时代的习给出了建议：

  1. 对体力劳动的工作进行分析，把它分解成一些动作。

  2. 记录每一个动作，记录这个动作的时间以及效果

  3. 通过科学分析，消除不必要的动作。

4.剩下的动作就是必需而且有效的动作，并且需要最少的体力，最少的时间

  1. 把这些动作按逻辑连接起来，变成一个“工作”。

  2. 最后根据这个“工作”设计工具，或者反复练习。

对于体力工作来说，习就是主要的，比如做一个钳工，比如车工，都是简单学习后就是反复练习，直

到成为最佳。这个习的方式对所有的体力劳动者都是有效的。

那么对于知识工人呢？特别是在发达国家，或者发达的区域，这里的工人以知识工人为主。如果让他

们高效呢？

他们工作所需要的技能需要以“学”为主。他们需要学习高深的理论才可以应对所遇见的工作。比如外

科医生，机械师，律师，高级经理等。

然后，学习并不能让他们成为优秀而高效的外科医生、机械师、律师等，他们还是需要“习”，甚至也

是大量的习。

因为在他们面临工作时，不只要“动脑”，这部分是没办法大大提高效率的；还要进行大量的体力劳

动，比如外科医生十七八个小时的手术。

对于他们来说，他们在需要“学”的同时，也需要“习”。而他们面临的这个“习”，可以用弗雷德里克·温斯洛·

泰勒的方式优化。

学习，就是学和习。几千年前的老祖宗孔子告诉我们的“学而时习之”，就是教育的本质。

对于体力劳动者，今天你习了么？

对于脑力劳动者，今天你“学”了么，学了后“习”了么？

对于知识工人，也就是脑力劳动者，德鲁克给出了一个建议：把你工作中的脑力劳动和体力劳动分

开，用弗雷德里克·温斯洛·泰勒的方式来优化你的体力劳动。

百字摘要

金庸案例

20 MAY

Making Manual Work Productive

Knowledge work includes manual operations that require industrial engineering.

Frederick Winslow Taylor’s principles sound deceptively simple.

deceptively:adv. 看似；不像看上去那么；比实际更显得

The first step in making the manual worker productive is to look at the task and to analyze its

constituent motions.

constituent:

成分；构成要素

one of the parts of sth that combine to form the whole

The next step is to record each motion, the physical effort it takes and the time it takes.

Then motions that are not needed can be eliminated.

eliminated:

V-T To eliminate something, especially something you do not want or need, means to remove it completely.

根除

Then each of the motions that remain as essential to obtaining the finished product is set up so as

to be done the simplest way, the easiest way, the way that puts the least physical and mental strain

on the operator, the way that requires the least time.

Then these motions are put together again into a “job” that is in logical sequence.

Finally, the tools needed to do the motions are redesigned.

Taylor’s approach is still going to be the organizing principle in countries in which manual work is

the growth sector of society and economy.

In developed countries the challenge is no longer to make manual work productive.

The central challenge will be to make knowledge workers productive.

But, there is a tremendous amount of knowledge work—including work requiring highly advanced

and theoretical knowledge—that includes manual operations.

tremendous:

巨大的；极大的

very great

theoretical

experiment

:concerned with the ideas and principles on which a particular subject is based, rather than with practice and

理论上的

And the productivity of these operations also requires Industrial Engineering, the name by which

Taylor’s methodology now goes.
