Failure to go out and look is the typical reason for persisting in a course of action long

after it has ceased to be appropriate or even rational. This is true for business decisions

as well as for governmental policies. It explains in large measure the failure of Stalin’s

postwar policy in Europe but also the inability of the United States to adjust its policies to

the realities of de Gaulle’s Europe or the failure of the British to accept, until too late, the

reality of the European Common Market.

One needs organized information for the feedback. One needs reports and

figures. But unless one builds one’s feedback around direct exposure to reality— unless

one disciplines oneself to go out and look—one condemns oneself to a sterile dogmatism

and with it to ineffectiveness.

These are the elements of the decision process. But what about the decision itself?

3 OCTOBER

Decision Making

Start with what is right rather than what is acceptable.

One has to start out with what is right rather than what is acceptable

precisely because one always has to compromise in the end. But if one does

not know what is right, one cannot distinguish between the right

compromise and the wrong compromise—and will end up by making the

wrong compromise. I was taught this when I started in 1944 on my first big

consulting assignment, a study of the management structure and manage-

ment policies of the General Motors Corporation. Alfred P. Sloan, Jr., who

was then chairman and chief executive officer of the company, called me to

his office at the start of my study and said: “I shall not tell you what to study,

what to write, or what conclusions to come to. My only instruction to you is

to put down what you think is right as you see it. Don’t you worry about our

reaction. And don’t you, above all, concern yourself with the compromises

that might be needed to make your recommendations ac-ceptable. There is

not one executive in this company who does not know how to make

Acompromise without any help from you. But he can’t make the right

compromise unless you first tell him what ‘right’ is.”

The executive thinking through a decision might put this in front of

him- or herself in neon lights.

ACTION POINT:

Define an outcome for the decision in the previous read-

ing that would perfectly satisfy your requirements.

The Effective Executive

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

令狐冲和林平之

令狐冲是一个很多人喜欢的角色，喜欢他的放荡不羁，喜欢他的爽朗豁达，喜欢他的豪迈潇洒，喜欢

他的不拘小节。每次读到笑傲江湖时，总觉得这样的才是人生。

林平之则是一个对立面，林平之以主角的姿态出场：少爷救酒女、惨遭灭门、酒女原来是大家闺秀、

投入华山派、和小师妹恋爱。

然后迎娶了小师妹岳林姗，一切看起来都是那么的流畅，如果没有太大意外的话，林平之会成为下一

任华山掌门，林家也就完成了从镖局到入主华山的过渡。至于当了掌门后，举华山之力来灭青城报

仇，那应该就是另一个故事了。

不过，在关键时刻，林平之做了一个重大的决定：挥刀自宫、练习辟邪剑法。这个决定是在婚前几天

做出的，林平之得到辟邪剑谱后随机自宫练剑。林平之并没有兄弟姐妹，也就是说，按传统意义，林

家自此绝了。

后来的林平之辜恩寡义，恩仇不分。居然莫名其妙地恨上了令狐冲，把令狐冲当成了敌人。

那么令狐冲是个什么样的人呢？

其实，令狐冲是一个“无足轻重”的人，因为令狐冲所有的成就，都是“别人塞给他”的，并不是他自己选

择的。

首先，独孤九剑是风清扬硬塞给他的，他并不想要，可是风清扬硬塞给了他，甚至，风清扬还说：“倒

是我来求你学艺了。”

接着，他的病是别人塞给他的。桃谷六仙硬生生地给他体内注入了六股真气，接着不戒和尚又给他体

内注入了两股真气。这个和他的选择无关。

后来，他被关进梅庄地狱，在狱中，他“被迫”学了吸星大法，等到他再次出现在江湖上已经是超一流的

高手了。

最后，他在“被哄骗下”学了易经筋，治好了吸星大法的后遗症。这时，独孤九剑|+一堆人的真气+吸星

大法+易经筋。在各种被动下，令狐冲完成了自己的武功路径。

回过头来在看林平之，林平之加入华山后学习也是非常努力，没多久就超过六师兄陆大有了。华山派

武功虽然不是一流的，不过以他的资质和努力，超过青城派余沧海还是有可能的。

不过，林平之心里有个心结，就是师父岳不群砍他那一剑。

是的，林平之知道到岳不群是什么样的人，知道自己没有可能在华山这么一直下去：努力学习武功，

接任掌门，然后报仇。他知道岳不群迟早会杀了他的。除非岳不群杀不了他。

初期，林平之一直和岳林姗在一起，没有给岳不群机会，当林平之拿到辟邪剑谱后，林平之面临着这

个人生中最大的选择：自己是学会辟邪剑法，从而彻底摆脱岳不群对自己的威胁？还是继续这么装下

去，随时面临对岳不群灭口？

这个抉择不好拿，经过了良久，面对着岳不群越来越大的压力，林平之做出了自己的选择：自宫练

剑。

我不认为林平之是为了报仇而自宫练剑的，对于林平之来说，活下来是报仇的前提，而失去了生育能

力的活下来对于父母来说，并不算报仇。

真正让林平之决定自宫练剑的是来自岳不群的压力：如果林平之没有在短时间内增加自己的武力，那

就意味着自己随时会被岳不群灭口。自己要活着，就必须“尽快有足够强大的武力”。

在反复权衡后，林平之做出了选择。

而令狐冲不一样。虽然号称黑白两道都在追杀他，可是真正要杀令狐冲的人几乎没有。东方不败对他

也是好奇，并不想杀他；任盈盈的那些手下更是把他当成主人一样；正派中恒山认他为掌门；华山的

弟子、师娘都对他很好。岳不群虽有杀他的动机，但也有不杀他的动机（杀他了，谁来背锅？）。更

何况，令狐冲一直在江湖上，而林平之却一直在岳不群身边。

令狐冲是个什么样的人呢？他是大家认为的那样放荡不羁，爽朗豁达，豪迈潇洒，不拘小节么？或许

是，不过，他并没有经历太多的选择，命运之神精准地把他推到了那个神位上。

而林平之呢？这位历经磨难的少年，在关键时刻做了一个大家都不能理解的抉择。却不知，这可能是

唯一的答案。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

4 OCTOBER

The Right Compromise

“Half a loaf is better than no bread.”

One has to start out with what is right rather than what is acceptable (let alone who is right)

precisely because one always has to compromise in the end.

But if one does not know what is right to satisfy the specifications and boundary conditions, one

cannot distinguish between the right compromise and the wrong compromise—and will end up by

making the wrong compromise.

There are two different kinds of compromise.

One kind is expressed in the old proverb, “Half a loaf is better than no bread.”

The other kind is expressed in the story of the Judgment of Solomon, which was clearly based on

the realization that “half a baby is worse than no baby at all.”

In the first instance, the boundary conditions are still being satisfied.

The purpose of bread is to provide food, and half a loaf is still food.

Half a baby, however, does not satisfy the boundary conditions.

For half a baby is not half of a living and growing child.

It is a corpse in two pieces.

ACTION POINT:

Now think through the problem you specified in the two previous readings.

Make a decision that represents a compromise, half a loaf, but goes in the right direction toward

the ideal solution.

Then think of a compromise that is “no bread at all.”

The Effective Executive

4 OCTOBER

The Right Compromise

“Half a loaf is better than no bread.”

One has to start out with what is right rather than what is acceptable (let

alone who is right) precisely because one always has to compromise in the

end. But if one does not know what is right to satisfy the specifica-

tions and boundary conditions, one cannot distinguish between the right

compromise and the wrong compromise—and will end up by making the

wrong compromise.

There are two different kinds of compromise. One kind is expressed in

the old proverb, “Half a loaf is better than no bread.” The other kind is

ex-pressed in the story of the Judgment of Solomon, which was clearly

based on the realization that “half a baby is worse than no baby at all.” In

the first instance, the boundary conditions are still being satisfied. The

purpose of bread is to provide food, and half a loaf is still food. Half

Ababy, however, does not satisfy the boundary conditions. For half a baby

is not half of a liv-ing and growing child. It is a corpse in two pieces.

ACTION POINT:

Now think through the problem you specified in the two

previous readings. Make a decision that represents a compromise, half

Aloaf, but goes in the right direction toward the ideal solution. Then think

of a compromise that is “no bread at all.”

The Effective Executive

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

金庸笔下的五大决策

德鲁克认为，一个好的决策必须是包含执行的。如果没有执行，不管看上去多美完美的决策，都会只

是梦想，没有任何意义。

德鲁克进一步对好决策的执行做了定义，首先是，谁需要知道这个决策，为了完成这个决策需要做哪

些事情？谁来做这些事情？执行这个决策的人有没有相应的能力？

按这个标准，我发现了金庸笔下很多优秀的决策，今天整理五个出来，凑个五大。不过，排名第一的

似乎不符合德鲁克的这个标准。

第五名：

决策人：陈近南

决策内容：我任命韦小宝为青木堂堂主

陈近南是天地会的总舵主，在天地会拥有无与伦比的决策权和影响力。天地会下辖十堂，分别是天地

会共有十堂，前五房五堂，后五房五堂。前五房莲花堂、洪顺堂、家后堂、参太堂、宏化堂。后五房

青木堂、赤火堂、西金堂、玄水堂、黄土堂。各堂的负责人被称为香主。

青木堂是后五房的长房，而且主要活动地方在河北北京一带，地位比较特殊。青木堂的尹香主被鳌拜

杀后，青木堂的众人在尹香主灵位前发誓要诛杀鳌拜，并且发誓，谁杀了鳌拜，就奉谁了青木堂香

主。

机缘巧合，韦小宝杀死了鳌拜。青木堂陷入了权力斗争。

这时，陈近南出现了。当陈近南了解了韦小宝的身份后，随机做出了一个重要决定：收韦小宝为自己

的关门弟子，并且任命韦小宝为青木堂堂主。

这个决策其实是比较取巧的。这个决策中收徒的部分，这是陈近南的私事。收徒后，韦小宝是陈近南

弟子，这个事情只和他们两人有关。毕竟，这个门派就这两个人了。

做青木堂香主这个决策，就比较复杂了。首先，这个决策需要通知的面比较广。青木堂的所有人肯定

都要知道；天地会其他九堂的香主以及主要负责人也要知道；甚至一个天地会外的门派负责人也需要

知会。毕竟这是一个天地会的高级管理职位。

为了这个决策，需要做什么事情么？其实，收徒就是做的一个事情，天地会的香主，武功肯定不能太

差，所以，陈近南收了他做弟子，其次，天地会的香主，脑子不能糊涂，毕竟管理者上百号人，糊涂

人也管不了。还有就是，要有利于天地会的事业。天地会的事业是什么呢？反清复明。韦小宝的公开

身份是太监。这个身份会对反清复明的大业提供非常多的帮助。

这些事情，一部分要由陈近南来完成，比如教授韦小宝武功，引导韦小宝做人做事；另一部分要由小

宝来完成，比如学武，判断，做事。

陈近南部分，陈近南知道自己可以完成的很好；韦小宝部分呢？陈近南并没有把握，所以，陈近南觉

得自己的这个决策是以个赌博。

收你为徒，只怕是我生平所做的一件大错事。但以天下大事为重，只好冒一冒险。

最后，陈近南算赌赢了，韦小宝还算是一个称职的香主。

第四名：

决策人：洪七公

决策内容：蓉儿，你来做丐帮帮主吧

洪七公是丐帮帮主，天下五绝中的北丐；黄蓉是五绝中东邪黄药师的女儿，也是洪七公的弟子。当洪

七公和黄蓉被困在明霞岛时，洪七公身受重伤，武功也废了，按当时的情况，没有意外发生的话，七

公应该要归天了。

这时的黄蓉学会了七公的逍遥游以及一些其他武功。在学习武功中，黄蓉表现出了强大的智慧和学习

能力。还有处理事情的能力。

在这样一个孤岛上，在自己随时倒下起不来的情况下，洪七公做了一个重大的决定：蓉儿，你来做丐

帮帮主吧。

而丐帮当时是天下第一大帮。

这个决策需要所有的丐帮人都知道，毕竟，这是丐帮新帮主的就任。至少丐帮的最高管理层，也就是

九代长老需要知道。这时的七公已经没有能力给他们传递信息了。好在，丐帮有一个传统，就是用打

狗棒法和打狗棒来确定帮主的身份和能力。

七公随即传授给黄蓉打狗棒法，并且吧打狗棒也给了黄蓉。

为了完成这个任务，需要做哪些事呢？首先，如果七公死了。黄蓉需要自己证明自己是合法的改变帮

主，其次，做了改变帮主后，黄蓉需要带领丐帮的几十万人做一些事情，比如行侠仗义、抵抗外族入

侵啥的。

这些事情，谁来做呢？教授黄蓉武功，肯定是七公来做，七公虽然受伤了，但一时还死不了，口述教

给黄蓉武功还是可以的。至于黄蓉能不能证明自己是帮主（七公认为自己大概率活不了了），能不能

带领丐帮继续走下去，七公觉得是可以的。

毕竟，他对黄蓉的能力还是非常认可的。

后来的事实也证明了七公这个决策的正确性。

第三名：

决策人：定闲师太

决策内容：我传你令狐冲，为恒山派掌门人

定闲师太是恒山派掌门人，恒山派是五岳派之一，五岳派指的是嵩山派、泰山派、恒山派、衡山派、

华山派。恒山派大多都是女子，所以武功也以阴柔为主。

五岳派的盟主嵩山派左冷禅意图把五岳派合并成一个门派，在短短的几个月里定静师太被谋杀，定闲

和定逸师太在少林寺内也中暗器，定逸师太已经死亡，定闲师太忍着一口气。这时令狐冲带着一大帮

江湖人士出现了。

定闲师太看到令狐冲冲，很少欣慰，这应该是她最期待的人，在少林寺受伤后躺着的这段时间，定闲

虽然已经不可救，但脑子没坏，她早就做出了最重要的决策：我传你令狐冲，为恒山派掌门人。

这件是需要谁知道呢？恒山派知道就好了。因为定闲师太并不想接受并派。那么，恒山派会接受么？

当然会，恒山派的众尼姑和令狐冲的关系不要太好，他们当然知道令狐冲的放荡不羁，爽朗豁达，豪

迈潇洒，不拘小节，也知道定闲对令狐冲的器重，这个事情（令狐冲做掌门），只要令狐冲说出了，

恒山派的人肯定相信，而且非常乐意。

为了完成这个决策，定闲需要做的只是要求令狐冲答应。天幸，定闲在弥留之际见到了令狐冲，逼迫

令狐冲答应了。剩下的就是令狐冲要做的了：带领恒山派在左冷禅、岳不群、任我行之间权衡，给恒

山、给江湖留下一个火种。

令狐冲有这个能力么？定闲认为令狐冲是有的。令狐冲武功非常高，应该不低于当世任何高手了。同

时令狐冲豪迈潇洒，为人正派，答应的事情，肯定会做到，而且会很好的完成。

后来事实也证明了定闲师太的判断。

第二名：

决策人：江南七怪

决策内容：我们要和丘处机打赌，18年后，谁的弟子更厉害

江南七怪是一个不入流的武术团体。说为人侠义吧，也算不上。倒是挺古怪的。

江南七怪被一个叫做段天德的人利用，和丘处机胡乱打斗了一番，导致郭啸天的媳妇李萍被抓走了。

江南七怪和丘处机也结下了仇恨。

当场就要火拼。

丘处机是全真教的弟子，全真教是当时的武林第一大派。七怪和丘处机的火拼不管结果如何，七怪都

讨不了好去。

这时，丘处机提出了一个赌局：双方不再比武，而是各自培养一个弟子来比武。丘处机去找杨铁心的

儿子杨康；七怪去找郭啸天的儿子郭靖。

找到了，两批人分别培养这两个人，到18岁后，让这两个人比武，看谁赢。

江南七怪的老大，瞎眼的柯镇恶想了想，答应了。因为他知道，不答应的话，他们在道义上先输了。

而且单凭武功，自己7个人也不少丘处机的对手呀。

这个决策如何呢？咱们来分析一下。

这个决策的通知范围是江南七怪和丘处机，所有相关人都在现场。丘处机回去后或许会告诉自己的师

兄弟。

为了完成这个决策，大家需要做什么呢？七怪需要去追上段天德，救回李萍和李萍肚里的郭靖；丘处

机需要找到杨铁心的媳妇包惜弱。然后两批人分别教他们武功，18年后让他们比武。

七怪肯定打不过丘处机，当自己的徒弟未必打不过丘处机的徒弟，而且，七怪是7个人，久经江湖，找

人更容易一些。丘处机虽然可以借用全真教的力量，但这点小事他威逼会借用。

所以，这个赌博对七怪来说，是一个相对合理的。

更主要的是，七怪向来以侠义自居，这件事在侠义上非常正确，一定程度上，柯镇恶是被自己的“侠义”

裹挟了。

至于能力，大家都有这个能力。

那就干吧。

这个小小的赌局，关于两个未出生孩子的赌局，谁曾想到居然直接影响了未来七、八十年的武林历

史。

所以这个决策排名第二。

第一名

决策人：段正淳

决策内容：大丈夫恩怨分明，尽力而为，以死相报。

这个决策很愚蠢，而且完全不符合德鲁克的对有效决策的定义。不过，我每次看到这句话，都会感动

的崇高起来。

这是在少林寺，萧峰为了救阿紫，带着燕云十八骑来到了少林。在武功上，萧峰应该不输于任何一个

人，不过，在少室山上，目前有这少林、星宿派、丐帮、慕容家族等上千人要杀萧峰，有的是为仇，

有的是为义，有的是为了收买人心。而萧峰这边只有燕云十八骑。一共十九个人。

突然，段誉跑了出来，大叫“大哥”，萧峰这边有20个人了。突然有跑出来一个和尚，也叫“大哥”，这时

萧峰这边有21个人了。

突然，那十九匹马也死了。丐帮的帮助庄聚贤、慕容家的慕容复，还有星宿派的丁春秋开始围攻萧

峰。

少林也摆下了大阵：绝对不能让萧峰活着下山！

这时的段正淳也做了一个重大的决策。

段正淳低声向华赫艮、范骅、巴天石诸人道：“这位萧大侠于我有救命之恩，待会危急之际，咱们冲入

人群，助他脱险。”范骅道：“是！”向拔刃相向的数千豪杰瞧了几眼，说道：“对方人多，不知主公有何

妙策？”段正淳摇摇头，说道：“大丈夫恩怨分明，尽力而为，以死相报。”大理众士齐声道：“自当如

此！”

这个决策如何呢？咱们也分析一下。

这个决策应该通知谁呢？段正淳是大理的黄太弟，华赫艮、范骅、巴天石是大理的三公。这个决策肯

定应该通知大理的皇帝段正明，能通知到么？不能。

为了完成这个决策，需要做哪些事呢？和少室山山数千豪杰对抗。谁来呢？段正淳以及自己的部署，

加起来十几个人。而且会为自己的国家（大理）埋下仇恨。

段正淳以及华赫艮、范骅、巴天石诸人有能力完成这个决策么？

看起来只能是“以死相报”。每次读到这里，我都会两眼含泪。这一刻，段正淳好像也没有那么渣了。

段正淳的决策：全力帮助萧峰

江南七怪：我们要和丘处机打赌

洪七公：蓉儿，你来做丐帮帮主

定闲：我传你令狐冲，为恒山派掌门人

陈近南：我任命小宝为青木堂香主

大纲

百字摘要

一个好的决定，如果没有相应的落实细则，那就是一个梦想。

一个好的决定，需要

金庸案例

谁去给老虎系铃铛

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

5 OCTOBER

Building Action into the Decision

一个决定只是一个希望，直到它成为某人的工作任务和责任，并有最后期限。

A decision is only a hope until carrying it out has become somebody’s work assignment and

responsibility, with a deadline.

carrying it out:落实

A decision is a commitment to action.

commitment:

[ C U ] ~ (to sb/sth) | ~ to do sth a promise to do sth or to behave in a particular way; a promise to support sb/sth;

the fact of committing yourself

承诺；许诺；允诺承担；保证

Until the right thing happens, there has been no decision.

And one thing can be taken for granted: the people who have to take the action are rarely the

people who have made the decision.

No decision has, in fact, been made until carrying it out has become somebody’s work assignment

and responsibility—and with a deadline.

Until then, it’s still only a hope.

A decision will not become effective unless needed actions have been built into it from the start.

Converting a decision into action requires answering several questions:

Who has to know of this decision?

What action has to be taken?

Who is to take it?

What does the action have to be so that the people who have to do it can do it?

The action must be appropriate to the capacities of the people who have to carry it out.

appropriate:

合适的；恰当的

(for/to sth) suitable, acceptable or correct for the particular circumstances

This is especially important if people have to change their behavior, habits, or attitudes for the

decision to become effective.

ACTION POINT:

Think through a decision you have made.

Who has to know of the decision?

What action has to be taken?

Who has to take the ac-tion?

Make sure the people who have to take the action are able to do so.

The Effective Executive

The Elements of Decision Making (Corpedia Online Program)

5 OCTOBER

Building Action into the Decision

A decision is only a hope until carrying it out has become somebody’s

work assignment and responsibility, with a deadline.

Adecision is a commitment to action. Until the right thing happens, there

has been no decision. And one thing can be taken for granted: the people who

have to take the action are rarely the people who have

made the decision. No decision has, in fact, been made until carrying it

out has become somebody’s work assignment and responsibility—and

with a deadline. Until then, it’s still only a hope.

A decision will not become effective unless needed actions have been

built into it from the start. Converting a decision into action requires an-

swering several questions:

•Who has to know of this decision?

•What action has to be taken?

•Who is to take it?

•What does the action have to be so that the people who have to do

it can do it?

The action must be appropriate to the capacities of the people who have

to carry it out. This is especially important if people have to change their

be-havior, habits, or attitudes for the decision to become effective.

ACTION POINT:

Think through a decision you have made. Who has to know of

the decision? What action has to be taken? Who has to take the ac-tion? Make

sure the people who have to take the action are able to do so.

The Effective Executive

The Elements of Decision Making (Corpedia Online Program)

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

包不同之死

包不同是一个无足轻重的人物：武功不高，身份不高，职责也不重要。

包不同是慕容复的家将，慕容复是慕容家的独子。慕容复武功很高，江湖上人称北乔峰南慕容。

慕容复有四个家将。这四个家将按武功和地位排了个序，包不同排老三。这一切都说明包三爷是个无

足轻重的人。

而且包三爷话还多，特别惹人讨厌。别人说啥，他都要所反对意见。你让他来，他肯定去，你让有抓

狗，他肯定撵鸡。

你看，王语嫣和阿朱阿碧他们面临着那么多坏人，让他来，他就是不来。躲起来在一旁偷看。

接下来，包三爷就开始了保证不同的人生，自号包不同。

包不同第一个怼的人是段誉，怼的段誉直接哭鼻子了；然后又怼乔峰，怼丁春秋，对鸠摩智，这个人

虽然不厉害，可是怼人却很厉害，所有厉害的人都被他怼过。

还好，他怼的那些人都是一些很厉害人，而厉害的人大多修养不错，也没有和这个二流人物的家将中

的老三去纠结。

包不同就这么一直怼着各种人，偶尔还赚点便宜。

记得有一次，他怼丐帮的长老，丐帮长老的修养可不大好，直接就要杀他。包不同多鸡贼呀，拿出了

别人委托他给丐帮传递的重要信息，着实要挟了丐帮一把，还把丐帮和慕容家略微绑了一下，让丐帮

哭笑不得。

就这样一个人，一个怼天怼地本事普通的人，谁都不知道哪天他出去被人打死。

后来，他果然被打死了，也是因为怼人被打死了，而且怼的是一个他怼过很多次，他以为绝对不会伤

害他的人。

就是慕容复，也就是他的主公。

慕容复比他小很多， 包不同看着他长大的；慕容复也是看着包不同怼各种人长大的，这其间肯定怼过

自己的父亲慕容博。

不过，这次包不同怼他了。这肯定不是第一次，甚至不是第100次，不过这次很严重。

这时，慕容复正要拜四大恶人之首的段延庆为义父，帮助段延庆获取大理皇位。这时慕容复的一个小

算盘：通过段延庆让自己获得大理皇位，进一步光复大燕。对于慕容复来说，这时一个战略决策。

这个决策对么？不好说。不过，这个决策慕容复肯定没和自己的四个家将商量。因为四大家将都不知

道。

当慕容复公开对段延庆说出这个方案后，包不同马上“非也非也”地冲了过来，说慕容复的方案有大大

的问题，是一个“不忠不孝不仁不义”的方案，这个方案必须终止。

慕容复恼羞成怒，一掌拍死了他。临死前，包不同流下了两行清泪，他肯定没想到自己会死在自己嘴

下，死在少爷手里。

慕容复其实并不算生气被他怼，慕容复生气的是，包不同居然反对他的决定，这个决定是自己多么精

明的决策呀，包不同这个二货居然反对，而且居然公开反对。让自己下不了台。

包不同死后，其他的三个家将兔死狐悲，潸然离去。慕容复成了光棍司令。

随后，慕容复被段延庆用计构陷，还好跑的快，不然命都没了。

最后，慕容复疯了，彻底疯了。不知道他这个疯和杀害看着自己长大的包不同有没有关系，不过，他

真的疯了。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

6 OCTOBER

Organize Dissent

Dissent：

意见，异议

[ U ] the fact of having or expressing opinions that are different from those that are officially accepted

（与官方的）不同

The effective decision-maker organizes dissent.

Decisions of the kind the executive has to make are not made well by acclamation.

acclamation：

喝彩；欢呼；欢迎

( formal ) loud and enthusiastic approval or welcome

They are made well only if based on the clash of conflicting views, the dialogue between different

points of view, the choice between different judgments.

The first rule in decision making is that one does not make a decision unless there is

disagreement.

Alfred P. Sloan, Jr., is reported to have said at a meeting of one of the GM top committees,

“Gentlemen, I take it we are all in complete agreement on the decision here.”

Everyone around the table nodded assent.

assent：

[ U ] ~ (to sth) ( formal ) official agreement to or approval of sth

同意；赞成

“Then,” continued Mr. Sloan, “I propose we postpone further discussion of this matter until our

next meeting to give ourselves time to develop disagreement and perhaps gain some

understanding of what the decision is all about.”

postpone：

延迟；延期；展缓

sth (to/until sth) to arrange for an event, etc. to take place at a later time or date

There are three reasons why dissent is needed.

It first safeguards the decision maker against becoming the prisoner of the organization.

Everybody is a special pleader, trying—often in perfectly good faith—to obtain the decision he

favors.

pleader：n. 答辩人；辩论者

Second, disagreement alone can provide alternatives to a decision.

And a decision without an alternative is a desperate gambler’s throw, no matter how carefully

thought through it might be.

desperate:

feeling or showing that you have little hope and are ready to do anything without worrying about danger to yourself or

others

（因绝望而）不惜冒险的，不顾一切的，拼命的

gambler

:N-COUNT A gambler is someone who gambles regularly, for example in card games or on horse racing.

赌徒

Above all, disagreement is needed to stimulate the imagination.

stimulate：

促进；激发；激励

[ VN ] to make sth develop or become more active; to encourage sth

ACTION POINT:

Organize dissent for a particular decision by bringing people with diverse points of view into the

decision process. Choose on the basis of “what is right,” not “who is right.”

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

6 OCTOBER

Organize Dissent

The effective decision-maker organizes dissent.

Decisions of the kind the executive has to make are not made well by

acclamation. They are made well only if based on the clash of con-flicting

views, the dialogue between different points of view, the choice be-tween

different judgments. The first rule in decision making is that one

does not make a decision unless there is disagreement.

Alfred P. Sloan, Jr., is reported to have said at a meeting of one of the GM

top committees, “Gentlemen, I take it we are all in complete agree-ment on

the decision here.” Everyone around the table nodded assent. “Then,”

continued Mr. Sloan, “I propose we postpone further discussion of this matter

until our next meeting to give ourselves time to develop dis-agreement and

perhaps gain some understanding of what the decision is all about.” There are

three reasons why dissent is needed. It first safeguards the decision maker

against becoming the prisoner of the organization. Every-body is a special

pleader, trying—often in perfectly good faith—to obtain the decision he

favors. Second, disagreement alone can provide alterna-tives to a decision.

And a decision without an alternative is a desperate gambler’s throw, no

matter how carefully thought through it might be. Above all, disagreement is

needed to stimulate the imagination.

ACTION POINT:

Organize dissent for a particular decision by bringing

people with diverse points of view into the decision process. Choose on

the basis of “what is right,” not “who is right.”

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

前几天写了一个《金庸笔下五大牛逼大的决策》，写了几个比较成功的决策。其实金庸笔下也有很多

很烂的决策，这些决策的制定者都是一些非常牛逼的人，而且是牛逼的一塌糊涂的人。这说明，这些

牛逼的人脑子真不一定够用。

今天说说今天笔下的两个烂决策。

一个是无崖子的决策，一个是阳顶天的决策。

无崖子被徒弟丁春秋打伤后堕下悬崖，在各种机缘下捡了一条命。无崖子这时需要做一个决策。

无崖子是逍遥派的掌门人，他被打伤后，他还是逍遥派合法的掌门人。所以，他的决策涉及几个问

题：首先是逍遥派接任掌门人的问题，其次是为自己报仇，诛杀叛徒丁春秋的问题，最后就是光大，

至少是延续逍遥派的问题。

德鲁克认为，一个决策的进程需要考虑几个要素。首先是这个决策什么时候需要，其次是这个决策针

对的是那个问题，然后就是，这个问题的本质是什么，这个问题最好应该如何解决？根据现状，我需

要做出哪些妥协。

毕竟，决策是妥协的艺术。

那么无崖子是如何做这个决策的呢？不管是逍遥派掌门接任人的问题，还是诛杀丁春秋的问题，都是

需要马上解决的问题。虽然逍遥派不大，人数不多，可是对于任何门派来说，掌门人问题都是最大的

问题，当掌门人出现空缺不能执行日常工作时，必须马上解决。无崖子呢？他老人家干脆躲起来，不

言不语，让逍遥派在长达几十年里没有掌门人。也让丁春秋在几十年里逍遥自在，居然发展处了偌大

个星宿派。

其次，这个决策要解决的是接任掌门的人和报仇的问题，其本质是找一个人才的问题。无崖子是如何

做的呢？无崖子摆了一个珍珑局，要找一些聪明的人来，然后把自己的内功传递给他，把掌门之位传

给他，最后，让他拿着一幅画去找李秋水学习武功。而李秋水会不会传武功，并不在于掌门指环，而

在于这个接任的掌门人是不是帅，是不是风流！

也就是说，无崖子的这个决策的关键点居然是让接任人通过帅来获得李秋水的青睐，以及传授武功。

这不是扯淡么？

这个问题最好的解决方案是什么呢？他明明有个徒弟，也就是苏星河一直在什么，他应该把内力传给

苏星河，他掌门之位传给他，让他再去找英才。这样，总比用一个珍珑局找来的英才靠谱吧。

几十年来，无崖子坚持自己这个不靠谱的决策，丝毫不妥协，让自己的弟子苏星河装聋作哑，自己被

吊在石洞中苦苦坚持。

到了最后时刻，只好做出最大的妥协，找了一个丑的要命的和尚做了传人。

这时，他估计在想，不妥协就是最大的妥协吧。

再说说另一个同样扯淡的决策，就是阳顶天的决策。

阳顶天是当世武功第一高手，也是权势最大的人。他是明教的教主。

作为明教教主，他经常到明教的密道里习练乾坤大挪移。他也带自己的夫人到这个密道来。

他的夫人经常带她的情人成昆到这个密道来，孤男寡女来了后就卿卿我我，给阳顶天好大一定绿帽

子。

阳顶天很快知道了这件事。知道这件事后，阳顶天还在练武，阳顶天当时就震惊了。不过，他还是有

点理智的。这时他需要做个决策。

先说一下当时的情况，阳顶天走火入魔了。凭直觉，他知道自己应该活不下去了。所以，他的决策需

要考虑两个事情：指定明教接班人，以及杀死成昆。

这个决策必须马上做，因为阳顶天随时会死去。所以，阳顶天写了一封信，一封给明教高级管理层的

信。

在这封信里，阳顶天指定了金毛狮王谢逊暂摄教主之位，等待新的教主。写完这封信后，这位绿帽哥

居然拿着信直接去找正在偷晴的媳妇和成昆！！！

这个操作也是醉了。

他居然想要媳妇带着这封信出去给明教高管说明情况，自己留下来和成昆同归于尽？？？！！！

这是操作真是够骚的。

你在你媳妇心里什么地位，你没点数么？成昆在你媳妇心里什么地位，你没点数么？

结果，亲眼看到媳妇和成昆偷情的画面，当成心肌梗塞死完。媳妇出于内疚当成自杀，成昆出于恐

惧，直接跑了。

这个事情最好的方式是，自己用那个“推动大石头”的力气悄悄地走出密道，找来明教的管理层，自己

解释清楚问题，然后自己去养伤，即使自己死了，也是死在明教教众身边，不管是接班人，还是杀成

昆，都不是问题。

哎，堂堂当世第一高手，堂堂明教教主，居然一点脑子都没有。

无崖子，阳顶天，都是当世第一高手。却都做出了匪夷所思的糊涂决策，看来，专业技能并不能代替

管理技能。既然做了老大，还是要学习一些管理。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

7 OCTOBER

Elements of the Decision Process

Ignore a single element in the process and the decision will tumble down like a badly built wall in

an earthquake.

tumble：

[ adv./prep. ] to fall downwards, often hitting the ground several times, but usually without serious injury; to make sb/sth

fall in this way

（使）跌倒，摔倒，滚落，翻滚下来

Good decision makers know that decision making has its own process and its own clearly defined

elements and steps.

Every decision is risky: it is a commitment of present resources to an uncertain and unknown

future.

commitment:

[ C U ] ~ (to sb/sth) | ~ to do sth a promise to do sth or to behave in a particular way; a promise to support sb/sth;

the fact of committing yourself

承诺；许诺；允诺承担；保证

But if the process is faithfully observed and if the necessary steps are taken, the risk will be

minimized and the decision will have a good chance of turning out successful.

Good decision makers

Know when a decision is necessary

这个决策什么时候需要？

Know that the most important part of decision making is to make sure that the decision is about

the right problem

这个决策是针对哪个问题的？

Know how to define the problem

这个问题是什么？

Don’t even think about what is acceptable until they have thought through what the right decision

is

这个问题应该如何解决？

Know that, in all likelihood, they will have to make compromises in the end

根据现实，我应该做出哪些妥协？

决策是妥协的艺术

Know that they haven’t made a decision until they build its implementation and effectiveness into

it

我应该如果吧履行和效果方静决策中。

implementation：n. [计] 实现；履行；安装启用

effectiveness：n. 效力

ACTION POINT:

Take a predicament you are facing right now.

predicament：

尴尬的处境；困境；窘境

What is the problem?

Do not take any steps toward making a decision until you are sure that you have diagnosed the

problem completely and correctly.

diagnosed：

a difficult or unpleasant situation, especially one where it is difficult to know what to do

V-T If someone or something is diagnosed as having a particular illness or problem, their illness or problem is

identified. If an illness or problem is diagnosed, it is identified.

诊断

The Effective Executive

The Elements of Decision Making (Corpedia Online Program)

7 OCTOBER

Elements of the Decision Process

Ignore a single element in the process and the decision will

tumble down like a badly built wall in an earthquake.

Good decision makers know that decision making has its own process and its

own clearly defined elements and steps. Every decision is

risky: it is a commitment of present resources to an uncertain and

unknown future. But if the process is faithfully observed and if the

necessary steps are taken, the risk will be minimized and the decision will

have a good chance of turning out successful. Good decision makers

•Know when a decision is necessary

•Know that the most important part of decision making is to

make sure that the decision is about the right problem

•Know how to define the problem

•Don’t even think about what is acceptable until they have thought

through what the right decision is

•Know that, in all likelihood, they will have to make compromises

in the end

•Know that they haven’t made a decision until they build

its implementation and effectiveness into it

ACTION POINT:

Take a predicament you are facing right now. What is the

problem? Do not take any steps toward making a decision until you are

sure that you have diagnosed the problem completely and correctly.

The Effective Executive

The Elements of Decision Making (Corpedia Online Program)

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

岳不群做了一个决定

岳不群是华山派的掌门，华山派是掌门负责制，所以，岳不群是华山派的老大、领导、老板、总裁，

等等一切表明最高身份的名词。

领导的主要工作就一个，就是决策。甚至有人说，领导的唯一工作就是决策。岳不群也不例外，他每

天都要做决策。

让不让女儿跟着劳德诺去福建呢？要不要收林平之做弟子呢？该不该惩罚令狐冲呢？岳不群一直在小

心翼翼地做着各种决策，毕竟，自己不止是华山派的掌门，还是江湖里的君子剑。自己也是有人设的

人呀。

这一天，岳不群决定和夫人宁女侠还有大弟子令狐冲一起去除掉江湖上臭名昭著的采花大盗田伯光。

同时决定传授“紫霞功”给令狐冲。

令狐冲正在山上受罚面壁。岳不群带着夫人宁女侠还有几个弟子来到山上，见到令狐冲。

令狐冲已经在山上面壁了半年了，岳不群也想看看这半年来，令狐冲的武功长进有多少。就让夫人和

令狐冲试招。试了几招后，发现令狐冲学了一些稀奇古怪的招数，而且，居然打败了宁女侠。

这算是一个突发事件，特别是对于正要传“紫霞功”给令狐冲的岳不群来说，这是一个很大的事件，岳

不群需要做一个决策了。

岳不群如何做的呢？

岳不群抢到令狐冲面前，伸出右掌，啪啪连声，接连打了他两个耳光，怒声喝道：“小畜牲，干甚么来

着？”

岳不群恼怒已极，喝道：“这半年之中，你在思过崖上思甚么过？练甚么功？”

令狐冲吓坏了，头晕脑胀，跪倒在地，连说弟子该死。

然后，岳不群决定让令狐冲继续面壁，彻底忘记那些武功，并且暂停了“紫霞功”的传授。事实上，这

个暂停就是永久的停止。

那么岳不群这么做正确么？

德鲁克认为，领导不要去做没必要的决策，没必要的决策不只是浪费资源，而且会削弱你决策的权威

性。德鲁克把决策分成三类，用来决策的必要性。

第一类是不需要决策的，就是那种放着他，慢慢他就变好了，或者消失了。就像你摔了一下，破了

皮，你需要做的是用手压一压，然后该干嘛干嘛。

第二类是那种和明显需要决策的，比如，你的腿断了，你的选择肯定是去医院，而且是立刻、马上。

第三类就是介于这两者之间的，你不能确定他很快就好了，也没有到那种立刻、马上就要救治的程

度。这种时候，领导者的区别就显示出来了，优秀的领导者会做出好的决策，而愚蠢的领导者会做出

愚蠢的决策。

令狐冲学了几招武功，还不小心打败了宁女侠，这本身是个技术问题。岳不群应该怎么决策呢？

毕竟，华山现在是气宗当道，找令狐冲来谈谈心，告诉他说，还是要以气功为重。也就行了。

或者坐下了，和他一起分析一下他那几招有什么优劣。和他谈谈剑宗和气宗的故事，也就这样了。

岳不群怎么做的呢？打两个耳光，然后骂“小畜生”，然后给一个定性：“这半年之中，你在思过崖上思

甚么过？练甚么功？”把一个技术问题，马上上升成了路线问题。

你岳不群是会处理路线问题的人么？好吧，你就处理吧，结果只能是令狐冲离开华山派。

哎，

大纲

百字摘要

没必要的决定不止是浪费资源，还会让所有的决定的权威性受损。所以，区分必要决定和没必要决定

就很重要。外科大夫提供了最佳的区分方法：

  1. 可以自愈的，常规检查就好了。不用做手术

  2. 恶性的，而且威胁生命的，并且我们可以有效改善的，那就尽快做。

  3. 居于两者之间的，那就是权衡了。在机会很风险之间权衡。这类决策区分开优秀医师和普通医师。

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

8 OCTOBER

Is a Decision Necessary?

One does not make unnecessary decisions any more than a good surgeon does unnecessary

surgery.

surgeon：

外科医生

surgery：

a doctor who is trained to perform surgery (= medical operations that involve cutting open a person’s body)

[ U ] medical treatment of injuries or diseases that involves cutting open a person’s body and often removing or replacing

some parts; the branch of medicine connected with this treatment

外科手术；外科学

Unnecessary decisions not only waste time and resources, but they also threaten to make all

decisions ineffectual. Therefore, it is important that you be able to distinguish between

necessary and unnecessary decisions.

threaten：

扬言要；威胁；恐吓

ineffectual：

无能的；软弱的；达不到目的的

sb (with sth) to say that you will cause trouble, hurt sb, etc. if you do not get what you want

( formal ) without the ability to achieve much; weak; not achieving what you want to

distinguish：

(between) A and B | ~ A from B to recognize the difference between two people or things

区分；辨别；分清

Surgeons provide perhaps the best example of effective decision-making, as they have had to

make risk-taking decisions on a daily basis for thousands of years now.

Since there is no such thing as risk-free surgery, unnecessary operations must be avoided.

The rules used by surgeons to make decisions are:

Rule one:

In a condition that is likely to cure itself or to stabilize itself without risk or danger or great pain

to the patient, you put it on watch and check regularly.

stabilize：

（使）稳定，稳固

to become or to make sth become firm, steady and unlikely to change; to make sth stable

But you don’t cut. To do surgery in such a condition is an unnecessary decision.

Rule two:

If the condition is degenerative or life-threatening and there is something you can do, you do

it—fast and radically. It is a necessary decision despite the risk.

degenerative：

术语

疾病

（随着时间的推移）变性

( technical

的，退化的

) ( of an illness

) getting or likely to get worse as time passes

despite：

used to show that sth happened or is true although sth else might have happened to prevent it

即使；尽管

Rule three:

This is the problem in between, and it’s probably the largest single category—the condition that

is not degenerative and not life-threatening but still not self-correcting and quite serious.

degenerative：

术语

疾病

（随着时间的推移）变性

( technical

的，退化的

) ( of an illness

) getting or likely to get worse as time passes

This is where the surgeon has to weigh opportunity against risk.

And it is this decision that distinguishes the first-rate surgeon from the also-ran.

also-ran：

失败者；（尤指竞赛或竞选的）失利者

a person who is not successful, especially in a competition or an election

ACTION POINT:

List three problems you are facing right now.

Classify these problems as falling under rules 1, 2, or 3.

Do not make unnecessary decisions.

The Effective Executive

The Elements of Decision Making (Corpedia Online Program)

8 OCTOBER

Is a Decision Necessary?

One does not make unnecessary decisions any more than a good

surgeon does unnecessary surgery.

Unnecessary decisions not only waste time and resources, but they also

threaten to make all decisions ineffectual. Therefore, it is important that you

be able to distinguish between necessary and unnecessary deci-

sions. Surgeons provide perhaps the best example of effective decision-

making, as they have had to make risk-taking decisions on a daily basis

for thousands of years now. Since there is no such thing as risk-free

surgery, unnecessary operations must be avoided. The rules used by

surgeons to make decisions are:

Rule one: In a condition that is likely to cure itself or to stabilize itself

without risk or danger or great pain to the patient, you put it on watch

and check regularly. But you don’t cut. To do surgery in such a condi-

tion is an unnecessary decision.

Rule two: If the condition is degenerative or life-threatening and there

is something you can do, you do it—fast and radically. It is a necessary

de-cision despite the risk.

Rule three: This is the problem in between, and it’s probably the

largest single category—the condition that is not degenerative and not

life-threatening but still not self-correcting and quite serious. This is

where the surgeon has to weigh opportunity against risk. And it is this

deci-sion that distinguishes the first-rate surgeon from the also-ran.

ACTION POINT:

List three problems you are facing right now. Classify

these problems as falling under rules 1, 2, or 3. Do not make unnecessary

decisions.

The Effective Executive

The Elements of Decision Making (Corpedia Online Program)

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

莫雷，灌篮高手，香港，是些什么事?

最近，我们的香港出现了一些事情。先是一个渣男在台湾杀了一个女生，然后是政府推动引渡法修正

案，然后是香港民众上街表示抗议，然后就是事情愈演愈烈。

后来引渡法修正案也终止了，特首也道歉了，香港却更乱了。

香港是中国的香港，中国也就这么一个香港，这么多年来，香港一直稳定而高速地发展，到了今天，

突然乱了起来，这是很多人想不到的，这是一个非常突然的事情。

我们如何看这个事情呢？

香港事情的表面是香港内部两拨人，或者更多波人的观点、矛盾冲突，既然是冲突，肯定是各说各有

理。我们中国人肯定向着香港政府，那么多外国人，肯定有向着香港政府的，有向着香港警察的，有

向着普通老百姓的，当然也有向着那些“暴徒”的。

毕竟是有冲突么，那就是说明大家都有一些道理。

这不，莫雷说话了，说的什么我也没看见，只是听说他同情香港的“暴徒”。莫雷是火箭队的总经理，

火箭队是NBA的一支球队。他们都是深受西方文化熏陶的人，他们应该不懂的中国文化里国的重要

性。所以，他们经常管不住自己的嘴，张嘴就满大街胡咧咧，也没人管。

不过，我们又如何看莫雷说话这个事情呢？

灌篮感受是80后喜欢看的一个动画片，我没看过，也没有喜欢，也没有不喜欢。突然听说，画这个漫

画的人也针对香港发表了一些言论，这些言论好像也是我们国人不喜欢的，不过，我还是没看到。朋

友里有很多喜欢灌篮高手的，他们以后还会看灌篮高手么？

我们又如何看我们喜欢的艺术家（姑且称灌篮高手的画家为艺术家吧）说出伤害我们感情的话呢？

这些都是一些意外的事件，谁也没想到一个渣男在台湾杀死了自己的女友，最后导致了全大陆看不了

NBA？当然，看NBA一点都不重要，因为我只看兵乓。

那么，问题来了，当我们遇到这些意外时，我们应该如何处理呢？至少，如何“看”呢？

德鲁克认为，所有的事件可以分为四类：

  1. 这个事情在你的组织内以及整个行业都是是常见的

  2. 这个事情在你组织内是一个独特的，但在整个行业都是常见的

  3. 这个事情真的非常独特

  4. 这个事情看起来很独特，但它可能是未来一系列事件的起点

第一类就像，在公司，每天都有人迟到，你公司有人迟到，别的公司也有人迟到，迟到问题是一个大

家习以为常的行为，虽然它不对。。

第二类呢？就像你是一个坚持早起，从不迟到的30岁老处男，某一天突然晚起了，你非常惶恐，你觉

得自己非常颓废，可是，你要知道全世界绝大多数人是随意早起和晚起，偶尔迟到的呀。

第三类呢？就像你刚到公司，突然有个客户上门，非要给你100万的小费，你不要还和你急，后来你才

知道，原来你无意间帮他解决了一个1000万的大问题。

第四类呢？某一天，你服务的一个客户突然给了你一笔10per的服务费，这个事非常独特，因为你从来

没有受过服务费。这可能是你第一次收到服务费。你和客户聊天后，他告诉你，因为你的服务非常到

位，让他节省了时间和金钱，为了表示感谢，所以他愿意支付更多的费用给你。你可能觉得这是一个

不错的途径，你就开始优化自己的服务，后来果然经常可以收到小费了。

德鲁克认为，所以的事件都可以分到这四类里，这四类里，除了第三类外，其他的都应该用通用的规

则来处理，而不是单独处理。一旦确定了正确的原则，就可以通过应用标准原则来处理同一通用事件

的所有表现。这样，对于组织来说，是成本最低，效果最好的。

再回来看香港事件，莫雷事件，灌篮高手事件，他们分别是那里类呢？我们应该如何去处理呢？或

者，至少，我们应该如何看呢？

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

9 OCTOBER

Classifying the Problem

Classifying：v. 把……分类；把……分等级；将……定为机密（classify 的现在分词）

By far the most common mistake is to treat a generic situation as if it were a series of unique

events.

Executives face four basic types of problems:

Generic events that are common within the organization and throughout the industry

industry：

工业；生产制造

[ U ] the production of goods from raw materials, especially in factories

Generic events that are unique for the organization but common throughout the industry

Truly unique events

Events that appear to be unique but are really the first appearance of a new generic problem

All but the truly unique event requires a generic solution.

Generic problems can be answered with standard rules and practices.

Once the right principle has been developed, all manifestations of the same generic event can be

handled by applying the standard principle.

All the executive must do is adapt the principle to the concrete circumstances of the specific

problem.

Unique events, however, require a unique solution and must be treated individually.

Unique：

唯一的；独一无二的

being the only one of its kind

Truly unique events are quite rare; someone else has solved virtually every problem an

organization faces already.

virtually：

几乎；差不多；事实上；实际上

almost or very nearly, so that any slight difference is not important

Applying a standard rule or principle can solve most types of problems.

ACTION POINT:

Cite an example of a problem you are facing that has a generic solution to it.

Cite:

提及（原因）；举出（示

sth (as sth) to mention sth as a reason or an example, or in order to support what you are saying

例）；列举

What is that solution? Cite a problem you are facing that requires a unique solution.

Develop the unique solution by following the rules for effective decision-making.

The Effective Executive

The Elements of Decision Making (Corpedia Online Program)

9 OCTOBER

Classifying the Problem

By far the most common mistake is to treat a generic situation

as if it were a series of unique events.

Executives face four basic types of problems:

Generic events that are common within the organization and

throughout the industry

Generic events that are unique for the organization but common

throughout the industry

Truly unique events

Events that appear to be unique but are really the first appearance

of a new generic problem

All but the truly unique event requires a generic solution. Generic prob-

lems can be answered with standard rules and practices. Once the right

principle has been developed, all manifestations of the same generic event

can be handled by applying the standard principle. All the executive must

do is adapt the principle to the concrete circumstances of the specific

prob-lem. Unique events, however, require a unique solution and must be

treated individually. Truly unique events are quite rare; someone else has

solved virtually every problem an organization faces already. Applying

Astandard rule or principle can solve most types of problems.

ACTION POINT:

Cite an example of a problem you are facing that has

Ageneric solution to it. What is that solution? Cite a problem you are facing

that requires a unique solution. Develop the unique solution by following

the rules for effective decision-making.

The Effective Executive

The Elements of Decision Making (Corpedia Online Program)

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

为什么何铁手没有男朋友？金庸笔下的何铁手在《碧血剑》和《鹿鼎记》里都出现过，是一位非常漂亮的女生。

书里说她千娇百媚，艳若桃李。

何铁手的武功也很高，小时候为了练武，割掉了左手，装了一个铁钩。

在她出江湖时，已经是一流的武林高手了。

而且，何铁手性格也很好，她的姑姑何红药因为被金蛇郎君欺骗，性格变得怪癖，嗜杀。

何铁手的心态却一直非常平和，待人接物也都有礼有节。

何铁手的性取向也正常，看到喜欢的男人也会去显示妩媚，也会勾搭，也会有爱慕之心。

而且，看到那个帅帅的金蛇郎君的公子夏青青后，更是一发不可收拾，一下子就堕入了爱河。

这样一个女子，堕入爱河可是一件不得了的事情，何铁手爱上了夏青青，决定对夏青青好。

如何个好法么？当然是非常好的那种了。

首先肯定是照顾，自己的姑姑何红药抓住了夏青青，想虐待他，铁手姑娘假借教主的权势禁止了姑姑对心上人的虐待，还给安排了一个很舒服的所在。

夏青青的爸爸金蛇郎君夏雪宜是五毒教的死敌，何铁手爸爸的死可以说和夏雪宜有直接的关系，所以，当五毒教抓住夏青青后，大家理所当然地认为应该处死夏青青，找回被夏雪宜偷走的那些宝贝。

可是，当一个女人爱上一个男人后，会如何呢？大家也都想得到。

五毒教的教主何铁手女士完全忘记了父仇，教仇。

各种花样，想方设法要救夏青青，当然，夏青青也感受到了铁手姑娘对自己的眷顾。

何铁手虽然是教主，可是，这种明显违反教派利益的事情，还是被大家反对，进而导致自己的教主之位被弹劾。

自己下野了。

幸运的是，自己的青青还在自己身边，在自己受伤时，青青还在身边照顾自己，自己预算情感得到了满足。

想着自己付出了这么大的代价，总算救出了自己心爱的人的性命和安全，这时的铁手姑娘是幸福的。

是呀，一个女子，一个堕入爱河的女子，还有什么是比这个更幸福的么？这时，一个背叛自己的人来求自己谅解，五毒教是个邪教，之所以是邪教，就是因为他们有很多邪术，这个人叫做何，他为了让何铁手重新接受自己，他用了一个“九刀穿洞，为奴尽忠”的邪术来证明自己的忠诚，也就是说，他给自己下了毒，然后把唯一的解药给何铁手，这样，他就肯定会听何铁手的任何指令了。

何铁手当然接受了这个，看着自己心爱的青青在身边，想着青青武功不高。

就想把这个武功高强的奴隶送给青青做保镖。

这时夏青青说：“我一个女孩儿家，要这臭男人跟在身旁干甚么？”何铁手大吃一惊！仔细看了看夏青青，才发现这个“公子”确实是个女生，还是为美女！哈哈。

想到自己为了自己爱上的这位“夏公子”，背叛了自己的教派，搞得自己众叛亲离，偌大一个五毒教也毁于一旦。

自己也身受重伤，差点死掉。

而对方居然是个女的。

一气之下就要自杀，还好，被袁承志救了下来。

心灰意冷的何铁手就拜了袁承志为师，加入了华山派，人了自己心爱的夏青青为师娘。

在后来的《鹿鼎记》里，还是单身的何铁手已经六、七十岁了，可是依然一张脸庞却又白又嫩，瞧头发已有六十来岁，容貌却不过三十岁上下。

这时的何铁手传给了小宝一个叫做“含沙射影”的暗器，然后就消失了。

孤独一生的女人。

其实，普通来说，一个女生追一个男生，总是追的上的，女追男隔层纱么。

何铁手也不笨，要才华有才华，要容貌有容貌，追了一个夏青青，居然追不上。

而根本原因居然是：夏青青本身就是一个女生。

看了，追男朋友这个事，技巧、方法固然重要，更重要的则是追对人呀，好歹追个男生呀。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

10 OCTOBER

Defining the Problem: An Example

The right answer to the wrong problem is very difficult to fix.

Defining the problem may be the most important element in making effective decisions—and the one executives pay the least attention to.

A wrong answer to the right problem can, as a rule, be repaired and salvaged.

But the right answer to the wrong problem, that’s very difficult to fix, if only because it’s so difficult to diagnose.

The management of one of America’s largest manufacturing companies prided itself on its safety record.

The company had the lowest number of accidents per one thousand employees of any company in its industry and one of the very lowest of any manufacturing place in the world.

Yet its labor union constantly berated it for its horrendous accident rate, and so did OSHA.

And yet the union attacks continued.

Once the company segregated its accidents and reported them in a number of categories it found, almost immediately, that there was a very small number of places, about 3 percent of all units, that had above-average accident rates.

And an even smaller number of places had very high accident rates.

But they were the places the union got its complaints from, the places whose accidents got into the papers and into OSHA reports.

ACTION POINT:

The manufacturing company described above defined the problem of its accidents as a publicrelations problem.

What “facts” did this problem definition ignore, making it the wrong definition?

The Effective Executive

The Elements of Decision Making (Corpedia Online Program)

10 OCTOBER

Defining the Problem: An Example

The right answer to the wrong problem is very difficult to fix.

Defining the problem may be the most important element in making effective

decisions—and the one executives pay the least attention to.

A wrong answer to the right problem can, as a rule, be repaired and sal-

vaged. But the right answer to the wrong problem, that’s very difficult to

fix, if only because it’s so difficult to diagnose.

The management of one of America’s largest manufacturing

companies prided itself on its safety record. The company had the lowest

number of accidents per one thousand employees of any company in its

industry and one of the very lowest of any manufacturing place in the

world. Yet its labor union constantly berated it for its horrendous accident

rate, and so did OSHA. The company thought this a public-relations

problem and spent large sums of money advertising its near-perfect safety

record. And yet the union attacks continued. By aggregating all accidents

and showing them as accidents per thousand workers, the company did

not see the places where there was a very high accident rate. Once the

company segregated its acci-dents and reported them in a number of

categories it found, almost imme-diately, that there was a very small

number of places, about 3 percent of all units, that had above-average

accident rates. And an even smaller number of places had very high

accident rates. But they were the places the union got its complaints from,

the places whose accidents got into the papers and into OSHA reports.

ACTION POINT:

The manufacturing company described above defined the

problem of its accidents as a public-relations problem. What “facts” did

this problem definition ignore, making it the wrong definition?

The Effective Executive

The Elements of Decision Making (Corpedia Online Program)

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

乔峰帮主卸任之谜

乔峰本来是丐帮帮主，而且是江湖中的知名人物。“北乔峰，南慕容”中的被乔峰说的就是这位丐帮帮

主。

丐帮帮主，这个身份在乔峰、洪七公、黄蓉等人的烘托下，变成了一个炙手可热的高位。降龙十八

掌，打狗棒法等神功，也在给这个草莽英雄加分。好像丐帮帮主是多么了不得的一个职位。

其实，在乔峰之前，丐帮并不是天下第一大帮，并且经常陷入灭亡的险境。乔帮主在泰山一役中，连

克九名强敌，丐帮转危为安。在接下来的几年里，乔峰凭着自己的领导力，把这样一个丐帮带成了天

下第一大帮。

然而，在某一年，在无锡附近的一个杏子林中，丐帮的一些人要废黜乔峰的帮主之位。

先是大智分舵的舵主全冠清和奚宋陈吴四位长老关押了执法长老白世镜和传功长老吕长老，还有大

仁、大勇、大礼、大信各舵的舵主，趁乔峰落单时，想武力杀死乔峰。

当然，他们杀不死乔峰，还被乔峰控制住了全冠清，迅速掌握了局势。

接着，徐长老来了。徐长老是一个很老很老的长老，在丐帮的身份也非常高。这个人来了后，公布了

两封信，一封是乔峰的师父，丐帮上一任帮主汪剑通给丐帮长老写的；另一封是少林的方丈玄慈写给

汪剑通的。

通过这两封信，乔峰知道自己的身世有疑点。这时他果断放弃了丐帮帮主之位。把打狗棒扔给了徐长

老为首的一众人，萧然而去。

不过，还是有很多丐帮内部的人认为乔峰是丐帮帮主。

再后来，乔峰到了雁门关外，寻找到了当年父亲在大石头上刻的字的拓片，确定了自己契丹人的身

份。这时，他决定离开中原江湖，远赴契丹去生活，本来，这个冷漠的江湖，他也不愿意待下去了。

就这样，丐帮彻底失去了萧峰（乔峰知道的自己的姓氏，就改成了萧峰）。萧峰也失去了丐帮。

在杏子林之前，有不少人知道萧峰的身世，比如马大元，比如白世镜，比如康敏，比如徐长老，比如

全冠清，比如吕长老。

知道了萧峰的身世后，有的人想加以利用，比如康敏，有的人选择忽略，比如吕长老。

为什么吕长老选择忽略呢？因为他知道丐帮需要乔峰这样一个人。

在乔峰接任帮主之前就有几个人知道萧峰的身份，比如汪剑通，比如玄慈，比如玄苦。玄慈认为乔峰

不能做帮主，因为，做了帮主的乔峰，一旦发现自己的身份后（这个其实很容易，萧峰身上有狼图

腾），后果不堪设想。以萧峰的能力和实力，整个江湖都不一定能约束住。

但汪剑通还是决定把帮主之位传给萧峰。我想，汪剑通是相信萧峰的。不过，考虑到玄慈的担心，汪

剑通还是留了一个遗命。就是在杏子林徐长老拿出来的那个：一旦萧峰偏袒胡人，格杀勿论。

汪剑通的这个信，其实很有水平。他写了一个先决条件是萧峰偏袒胡人，而不是大家知道萧峰的身

份。

但这只是汪剑通的一厢情愿，问题是，知道了自己身份的萧峰，会继续做丐帮帮主么？

这个就是吕长老，白世镜他们考虑的问题了。

当吕长老、白世镜知道了萧峰的身份后，他们很快判断出丐帮不能没有萧峰这个事实，所以，对于萧

峰的身世，即使全世界所有人都知道，也是一定要瞒着萧峰的。

想利用这个信息的人也很清楚，他们杀死萧峰的机会并不多，他们的目的也不少杀死萧峰。而是让萧

峰退位。把位置让出来，这样，他们就可以坐上这个“天下第一大帮”帮主的位置了。

所以，在萧峰知道这个信息前，双方的攻防的点是如何让萧峰（不）知道（并且相信）自己的身世。

康敏、徐长老一方知道，只要萧峰确定自己的契丹人身份，丐帮帮主的位置就算空出来了。而白世

镜、吕长老也知道，只要萧峰知道自己的身份，丐帮就算没帮主了。

所以，在杏子林，大家争论的问题本质，并不是萧峰是不是契丹人，而是丐帮需不需要萧峰。

因为，大家都很清楚，萧峰并不需要丐帮。没有丐帮，萧峰还是萧峰；而没有了萧峰，丐帮就真的去

讨饭了。

后来，在徐长老等的努力下，萧峰确定了自己的身份。萧峰也就正式离开了丐帮。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

11 OCTOBER

Defining the Problem: The Principles

Until the definition of a problem explains and encompasses all observable facts, the definition is

incomplete or wrong.

encompasses：

包含

observable：

能看得到的；能察觉到的

V-T If something encompasses particular things, it includes them.

that can be seen or noticed

How do effective decision makers determine what the right problem is?

Effective decision makers ask:

What is this all about?

What is pertinent here?

pertinent：

(to sth) ( formal ) appropriate to a particular situation

有关的；恰当的；相宜的

What is key to this situation?

Questions such as these are not new, yet they are of critical importance in defining the problem.

The problem must be considered from all angles to ensure that the right problem is being tackled.

tackled：

处理

V-T If you tackle a difficult problem or task, you deal with it in a very determined or efficient way.

The one way to make sure that the problem is correctly defined is to check it against the

observable facts.

Until problem definition explains and encompasses all observable facts, the definition is either still

incomplete or, more likely, the wrong definition.

But once the problem has been correctly defined, the decision itself is usually pretty easy.

ACTION POINT:

Describe an occasion where you or someone else in your organization implemented the right

answer to the wrong problem.

occasion：[ C ] a particular time when sth happens 某次；…的时候

implemented：

V-T If you implement something such as a plan, you ensure that what has been planned is done.

实施; 执行

What could you have done differently to ensure that the right problem was being tackled?

The Effective Executive

The Elements of Decision Making (Corpedia Online Program)

11 OCTOBER

Defining the Problem: The Principles

Until the definition of a problem explains and encompasses all

observable facts, the definition is incomplete or wrong.

How do effective decision makers determine what the right problem is?

Effective decision makers ask:

•What is this all about?

•What is pertinent here?

•What is key to this situation?

Questions such as these are not new, yet they are of critical importance in

defining the problem. The problem must be considered from all angles to

ensure that the right problem is being tackled. The one way to make sure

that the problem is correctly defined is to check it against the observable

facts. Until problem definition explains and encompasses all observable

facts, the definition is either still incomplete or, more likely, the wrong

def-inition. But once the problem has been correctly defined, the decision

it-self is usually pretty easy.

ACTION POINT:

Describe an occasion where you or someone else in your

organization implemented the right answer to the wrong problem. What

could you have done differently to ensure that the right problem was

being tackled?

The Effective Executive

The Elements of Decision Making (Corpedia Online Program)

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

左冷禅：并派是大事，必须大搞

万事俱备，虽然没有十足的把握，左冷禅还是决定在三月十五日并派，并且推举新的五岳派的掌门

人。

按理来说，开大会都是为了解决小问题，开小会才是为了解决大问题的。五岳派并派，是个大问题，

为什么左冷禅没有私下和各大掌门都商量好，而是直接开大会来解决呢？

五岳派并派虽然发生在三月十五日，在这之前，左冷禅已经做了充足的准备，至少他自认为是充足

的。

针对华山派，左冷禅派了自己的弟子劳德诺去做卧底，劳德诺偷了华山派的《紫霞神功》，还偷了岳

不群的《辟邪剑法》，还通过离间计让华山派上下不和。而且，根据劳德诺的信息，岳不群的武功虽

然不低，但也不高，华山派也没有其他高手。

衡山派呢？衡山派掌门莫大的师弟刘正风被左冷禅派人给干掉了。莫大一直不在衡山派，而且据说在

派里名声也不大好。左冷禅本来想派人干掉莫大，居然也找不到，算了，不找了，这样的人也不会有

多大干扰，而且，听说莫大胆小怕事。好对付。

恒山派呢？恒山派的掌门是定闲，她有一个师姐定静，还有一个师妹定逸，还有好些徒弟。恒山三定

武功不错，所以，左冷禅派人去仙霞岭、水月庵两处遭伏击，定静师太死掉了，恒山派也差点全军覆

没。后来被令狐冲救了下来，奇怪的是，没多久，定闲、定逸也死在了少林寺里，恒山也就无足挂齿

了。

虽然定闲临死前遗命令狐冲做恒山掌门，一个后生弟子，何足畏惧。

泰山派呢？泰山派的天门道人不好说服，也没必要杀死，泰山本身内部矛盾重重，左冷禅买通了天门

道长的师叔玉玑子。打算让他们内斗一下。

左冷禅还买通了很多邪道的高手，如青海一枭。这些人都是玩命之徒，也听从左冷禅的命令做事。

这是在三月十五日钱左冷禅做好的准备。

其实，左冷禅也想把岳不群、莫大、天门道人、定闲召集在一起，大家坐下了商量商量，选自己为五

岳派掌门，其他四位做副掌门啥的。可是大家都不同意，左冷禅只好召开大会了。

是的，左冷禅召开大会，是因为小会他搞不定。只好通过大会来强行达到小会的效果。

通过几年的筹划，左冷禅认为，他有能力组织这个大会了。并且通过大会来完成小会完成不了的事

情，让自己成为五岳派的真正掌权人，也就是五岳派的掌门。

为什么大会可以帮左冷禅搞定他小会搞不定的事情呢？在小会上，定闲可以直接拒绝，岳不群也可以

直接拒绝，一共就5个人，谁都可以拒绝。

但大会就不一样了，在几千人的会场，少数人的意见就没有那么重要了，当很多人整齐划一地说一件

事时，少数的声音就听不见了。

首先，弱者就不敢说话了，比如莫大，岳不群等；其次，敢说话的，杀几个就好了，比如天门等。最

后留下来的，那就打一架吧，左冷禅认为自己打架，还是不会输给任何一个人的。

而且，最重要的是，五岳派并派，并的是五派的门人（甚至所有的掌门人都可以杀掉），并派后，如

果各派原来的掌门人不配合，对各派弟子的传达以及教育也会有问题，甚至会出现并派很久后，还有

某些派的弟子不知道。

所以，大会也是一个对各派弟子的“教育”工作，让他们身临其境，让他们知道“这个并派已经发生了”，

五个剑派已经不存在了，现在只有一个五岳派了，而我左冷禅是五岳派的掌门人。

基于这两点，左冷禅决定召开大会，在大会上一举完成自己的荣耀之旅，登上自己的人生巅峰。

三月十五日，嵩山，五岳派的弟子们，我，左冷禅，来了。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

12 OCTOBER

Getting Others to Buy The Decision

If you wait until you have made the decision and then start to “sell” it, it’s unlikely to ever become

effective.

Unless the organization has “bought” the decision, it will remain ineffectual; it will remain a good

intention.

ineffectual：

无能的；软弱的；达不到目的的

intention：

打算；计划；意图；目的

( formal ) without the ability to achieve much; weak; not achieving what you want to

[ C U ] ~ (of doing sth) | ~ (to do sth) | ~ (that…) what you intend or plan to do; your aim

And for a decision to be effective, being bought has to be built into it from the start of the

decision-making process.

This is one lesson to learn from Japanese management.

As soon as it starts the decision-making process, and long before the final decision is made,

Japanese management sells the decision.

吴晓波：一个公司在成立之初，就需要是可以交易的。

Everyone who is likely to be affected by a decision—say, to go into a joint venture with a Western

company or to acquire a minority stake in a potential U.S. distributor—is asked to write down

how such a decision would affect his work, job, and unit.

venture:

（尤指有风险的）企业，商业，投机活动，经营项目

acquire

（通过努力、能力、行为表现）获得，得到

minority

少数；少数派；少数

a business project or activity, especially one that involves taking risks

to gain sth by your own efforts, ability or behaviour

人

[ sing.+sing./pl.v. ] the smaller part of a group; less than half of the people or things in a large group

stake

potential

distributor

[ C ] money that sb invests in a company

股本；股份

潜在的；可能的

a person or company that supplies goods to shops/stores, etc. 经销商；分销商

:[ only before noun ] that can develop into sth or be developed in the future

He is expressly forbidden to have an opinion and to recommend or to object to the possible move.

expressly:

清楚地；明确地；确切地

clearly; definitely

But he is expected to think it through.

And top management, in turn, then knows where each of these people stands.

Then top management makes the decision from the top down.

There isn’t much “participatory management” in Japanese organizations.

participatory：

a participatory way of organizing something, making decisions etc is one that involves everyone who will be

affected

〔组织、决策等〕众人参与的

But everyone who will be affected by the decision knows what it is all about—whether he likes it or

not—and is prepared for it.

There is no need to sell it—it’s been sold.

ACTION POINT:

Involve everyone who will have to carry out a decision in the process of making the decision.

Then, based upon their contributions, decide who is most likely to carry out the decision

effectively.

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

The Elements of Decision Making (Corpedia Online Program)

12 OCTOBER

Getting Others to Buy The Decision

If you wait until you have made the decision and then start to “sell” it,

it’s unlikely to ever become effective.

Unless the organization has “bought” the decision, it will remain

ineffectual; it will remain a good intention. And for a decision to be ef-

fective, being bought has to be built into it from the start of the decision-

making process. This is one lesson to learn from Japanese management. As

soon as it starts the decision-making process, and long before the final deci-

sion is made, Japanese management sells the decision.

Everyone who is likely to be affected by a decision—say, to go into

Ajoint venture with a Western company or to acquire a minority stake in

Apotential U.S. distributor—is asked to write down how such a decision

would affect his work, job, and unit. He is expressly forbidden to have an

opinion and to recommend or to object to the possible move. But he is ex-

pected to think it through. And top management, in turn, then knows

where each of these people stands. Then top management makes the deci-

sion from the top down. There isn’t much “participatory management” in

Japanese organizations. But everyone who will be affected by the

decision knows what it is all about—whether he likes it or not—and is

prepared for it. There is no need to sell it—it’s been sold.

ACTION POINT:

Involve everyone who will have to carry out a decision in

the process of making the decision. Then, based upon their contributions,

decide who is most likely to carry out the decision effectively.

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

The Elements of Decision Making (Corpedia Online Program)

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

萧峰：空，空，空你个大秃头呀

我是萧峰的粉丝，我认为萧峰是个战神。

萧峰的会的武功不多，大概就是降龙廿八掌、打狗棒法、擒龙功，还有些少林的基本功。他却战无不

胜。

在萧峰做帮主之前，他就经历的大小战役无数，那一招亢龙有悔，估计他用了成千上万次，和高手对

打过，和低手对打够，和一个人打过，也和一群人打过。

而且萧峰对于打架非常谨慎，每次打架前，萧峰都先看看逃跑的路线：

（乔峰）正要暗传号令，命帮众先行向西、向南分别撤走，自己和四长老及蒋舵主断后，忽听得西方

和南方同时有脚步杂沓之声。却是四面八方都来了敌人。

乔峰低声道：“蒋舵主，南方敌人力道最弱，待会见我手势，立时便率领众兄弟向南退走。”蒋舵主应

道：“是！”

丰富的打架经验，加上谨慎，让萧峰几乎立于不败之地。

萧峰的分寸感也特别好，随后一扔，就可以把铁杖扔进石头四尺多，高度让敌人恰好够不着，这些分

寸感都是几百次上千次打架得来的。

是呀，萧峰每一次推出亢龙有悔，每一次扔出一个兵器，每一次提起一个敌人，每一次点敌人的穴

位，敌人都会做出相应的反应，或者躲闪，或者抵抗，或者对打。

常年累月下来，萧峰对所有的敌人都可以做出非常精确的判断，比如，他就判断：

大理段氏若有像今日段延庆这样的好手，五六个同时攻我，你大哥便应付不了。

所以，在每一次打架钱，萧峰都可以快速做出判断，根据判断，很快就给出对应方案：打？跑？几分

力？打死还是留活口？对于这些，萧峰的分寸把握的都很好。

只是有一次，萧峰差点死掉，那次，萧峰做出了一个错误的判断，把自己放在了死亡的边缘。

那是在天台山前。

那时 ，萧峰正要和阿朱去天台山找智光和尚询问“带头大哥”的身份。萧峰正在被智光和尚高尚人格打

动，想着，不管智光和尚如何回答，都要一笔勾销。

这时，突然来了5个黑衣人，这五个黑衣人自称姓杜、迟、金、褚、孙。这五个人提议每人和他对一掌

来表明自己的武功修养。

接着杜、金、褚、孙一一和萧峰对掌，四位高手用的都是不用的少林掌法，萧峰用的只是一招亢龙有

悔。萧峰很轻松判断出对方的掌力，自己出的力也是恰到好吃：既不会打伤对方，也不会给对方伤害

自己的机会。这样四掌下来，大家都是不输不赢。

最后，迟姓老者出来了，也要和萧峰对掌。只见迟姓老者左右手分别划圈，使出了般若掌。萧峰也双

手划圈，又使出一招亢龙有悔。

像平常一样，萧峰也根据自己的判断确定了力量的大小，角度。萧峰并不想伤害对方，也不想对对方

伤害。力量还是内七外三。洪厚的掌力向迟姓老者推出。

四掌相交，乔峰突觉对方掌力忽而消失，刹那间不知去向，不禁大吃一惊。他双掌推出之力虽只三

成，却也是排山倒海，势不可当，对方竟不以掌力相挡，自己掌力雷霆万钧的击去，势不免将对方打

得肋骨齐断，心肺碎裂。惊惶中忙回收掌力，心知此举危险万分，对手这一下如是诱招，自己回收掌

力时，若乘机加强掌力击来，两股掌力合并齐发，自己虽留有馀力，势不免重伤。

想到身边的阿朱，萧峰心中闪过一个念头：“我这一死，阿朱就此无人照顾了！”不禁惨然变色。

岂知自力甫回，那迟姓老者急速撤掌，退后一步，一躬到地，说道：“多谢乔帮主大仁大义，助我悟成

这‘般若掌’的‘一空到底’。”

乔峰额头汗水涔涔而下，适才可说死里逃生，这时与阿朱实是再世相逢，激动之下，忍不住过去握住

了阿朱的手。

自己也被高的丈二和尚摸不着头脑。

只听那个迟姓老者解释道：“阿朱姑娘，刚才我跟乔大爷对掌，使的是‘般若掌’，这路掌法是佛门掌法

中的最高功夫。般若佛法讲究空无，使到最后一招‘一空到底’之时，既不是空，也不是非空，掌力化于

无形，没有了色，没有了受想行识，色是空，声香味触法也都是空，掌力是空，空即是掌力。我过去

总是差了一点，出掌之时心中总是有滞，可以空了自己掌力，却空不了对方的力道。这次跟乔大爷对

掌，如此高手，世所罕见，我不肯错过这难逢机缘，便又使‘一空到底’。万想不到乔大爷大仁大义，一

觉到我掌上无力，也于刹那间回收自己掌力，拚着我诱招发力，反击自身。我突然之间明白了，我自

己空了，连对手也空了，这才是真正的‘一空到底’。如不是有这样一位不顾自己性命、不肯轻易伤人的

仁义英雄，这一招如何能够悟成？”

听到这里，阿朱笑容满面：“恭喜老爷爷悟得神功”，心里却为萧大哥担心死了。

萧峰心想：“你神经病呀，在老子面前装好人，老子当你好人，居然放弃了自己对反馈的要求，让自己

置于死地，让我的小阿朱没人照顾。这种傻事，老子再也不干了。”

“空，空，空，空你个秃头呀！”

萧峰越想越后怕，晚上回到家后，对着阿朱发誓，以后“与人对掌时决不容情”。

毕竟，大部分人都是正常的反馈。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

13 OCTOBER

Testing the Decision Against Results

“Poor Ike. . . . Now . . . he’ll give an order and not a damn thing

is going to happen.”

Feedback has to be built into the decision to provide a continuous test-ing, against actual events,

of the expectations that underlie the deci-sion. Decisions are made by people. People are fallible;

at their best, their works do not last long. Even the best decision has a high probability of

being wrong. Even the most effective one eventually becomes obsolete. When General Dwight D.

Eisenhower was elected president, his predecessor, Harry S. Truman, said: “Poor Ike; when he was a general, he gave an order and it was

carried out. Now he is going to sit in that big office and he’ll give an order and not a damn thing is

going to happen.” The reason why “not a damn thing is going to happen” is, however, not that

generals have more authority than presidents. It is that military organizations learned long ago that

futility is the lot of most orders and organized the feedback to check on the execution of the order.

They learned long ago that to go oneself and look is the only reliable feedback. Reports—all a

president is normally able to mobilize—are not much help.

ACTION POINT: Make sure you go out and “kick the tires” and get on-site feedback. Find out if

decisions have accomplished their intended results.

The Effective Executive

13 OCTOBER

Testing the Decision Against Results

“Poor Ike. . . . Now . . . he’ll give an order and not a damn thing

is going to happen.”

Feedback has to be built into the decision to provide a continuous test-ing,

against actual events, of the expectations that underlie the deci-sion.

Decisions are made by people. People are fallible; at their best, their works do

not last long. Even the best decision has a high probability of

being wrong. Even the most effective one eventually becomes obsolete.

When General Dwight D. Eisenhower was elected president, his prede-

cessor, Harry S. Truman, said: “Poor Ike; when he was a general, he gave

an order and it was carried out. Now he is going to sit in that big office

and he’ll give an order and not a damn thing is going to happen.” The

reason why “not a damn thing is going to happen” is, however, not that

generals have more authority than presidents. It is that military

organizations learned long ago that futility is the lot of most orders and

organized the feedback to check on the execution of the order. They

learned long ago that to go oneself and look is the only reliable feedback.

Reports—all a president is normally able to mobilize—are not much help.

ACTION POINT:

Make sure you go out and “kick the tires” and get on-site

feedback. Find out if decisions have accomplished their intended results.

The Effective Executive

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

对于女人来说，最残忍的无过于把她放在一个摆满世界上最漂亮的衣服的屋子里，但没有给她镜子。

知识付费是前两年兴起的一个行业，像每一个行业一样，这个行业在伊始也出现了很多奇迹。

有个人回答了一个问题，就赚了上百万；有个人随便讲了一个话题，就卖了10万份；有个人给别人讲

他的读书笔记，也卖了上百万份，每年十几亿的市场；有个人随便做了一个课程，也卖了5000份，赚

了50多万。

据说，有个小孩凭借在朋友圈发发推广海报，还赚了一笔不小的钱，而且，居然卖起了朋友圈的广

告。

是呀，每个行业都是这样的，伊始都是这样的疯狂。

不过，今年好像没有那么火了。

和一个座营销的朋友聊这个话题，她说，今年的下滑非常大，今年课程的成交不到去年同类质量课程

的10per。甚至更低。

下滑到不到10per，这个属于断崖式下跌。这个行业出现什么本质性的问题了么？

这两年，我买了不少课，大多是名师的课，也有一些是名声不大，但口碑不错的课。买了这么多课，

我发现我并没有学会什么。不知道给我讲课的那些老师有没有进步。

问题出在哪里呢？

我很少去医院，有点小病都自己看了。偶尔需要去医院，也都是去社区医院。朋友中喜欢去大医院的

多，即使感个冒也非要去301挂号。

我问他为什么，他说大医院的医生好。

我由问他，大医院的医生为什么好？

他说大医院的医生看的病人多，有经验。

其实，我倒觉得，社区医院的医生应该更有经验一些。

你想呀，你去大医院看病，医生按流程给你化验，给你开药，然后就走了。至于他给你开的药，你吃

了么，吃了后效果如何？这些信息他都不知道，也就是说，大医院的医生只是看到的病多，但并不知

道他是不是治好了，也不知道他给的处方是否有效。

又来一个病人，还是按那个流程化验吧，开药吧，然后送走病人。

病人好不好？不知道。

社区医院可能还好些，你看了病后，过几天出门遇到大夫，还可以和大夫唠叨两句，说说自己的病，

大夫多少还知道一些自己是否把他治好了。也有助于他的改进。

其实，知识付费也一样。

当你购买一个知识付费的产品时，就像病人去开药。这个医生按他的知识给你开了一味药，这可是一

味好药呀，你开开心心拿回去了。或者吃了，或者放在橱柜里忘记了。

当然，那些生产知识的人并不知道你是谁，也不知道你用了他的产品后，有什么变化，这个产品对你

有没有意义和价值，有没有帮到你。

所以，这个东西卖出后，也就结束了。知识生产者不知道消费者的反馈，当然也就不知道自己生产的

内容是否真的有效，真的帮到消费者了。

而那个知识生产者，在哪里不辞辛苦地持续生产，生产那些他认为足够用心足够精彩的知识。知识这

些产品没有得到使用者的反馈。你觉得这些知识生产者会有进步么？

那么，消费者呢？也就是我这样的？会进步么？

我花了199，或者365买了课，听了后，或者对我有帮助，或者对我没帮助，不过，我很快就忘记了。

就像你在301医院看过病后，不管好或者不好，你都不会再去找以前那个大夫了。

这其实就是现在知识付费产品的一个逻辑问题：不管是生产者，还是消费者，都没有有效的反馈。而

没有反馈的生产和学习，其实没啥意思。

有一次我看到一个销售在5000份，大概赚了50多万的一个知识产品，每一集的点播只有100-200次。

这个产品我听了，内容真心不错，5000多人购买，播放却只有200次。这样的课程，对生产者和消费

者的意义在哪里？

除了赚钱。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

14 OCTOBER

Continuous Learning in Decision Making

Feedback from the results of a decision compared against the expectations when it was being

made makes even moderately endowed executives into competent decision makers.

In no area is it more important than in decision making to build continuous learning into the

executive’s work. And the way to do this is to feed back from results of the decision to the

expectations when it was being made.

Whenever executives make an important decision, they put down in writing what results are

expected and when.

And then the executive, nine months or a year later, begins to feed back from the actual results to

the ex-pected ones and keeps on doing this as long as the decision is in force.

So in an acquisition, for example, an executive compares the actual results to the expected ones

for the two to five years it takes fully to integrate an acquisition.

It’s amazing how much we learn by doing this and how fast.

And physicians have been taught since Hippocrates in Greece 2,400 years ago to write down what

course they expect a patient’s condition to take as a result of the treatment the physician

prescribes, that is, as a result of the physi-cian’s decision.

And that, as every experienced physician will tell you, is what makes even moderately endowed

doctors into competent practition-ers within a few years.

ACTION POINT: When you make an important decision, make sure to write down the expected

“prognosis.”

Then at a time appropriate for the particular decision, go out and look at what results have

transpired.

Compare results to your prognosis. Use what you learn in subsequent decision situations.

The Effective Executive

The Elements of Decision Making (Corpedia Online Program)

14 OCTOBER

Continuous Learning in Decision Making

Feedback from the results of a decision compared against the expectations when

it was being made makes even moderately endowed executives into competent

decision makers.

In no area is it more important than in decision making to build continu-ous

learning into the executive’s work. And the way to do this is to feed back from

results of the decision to the expectations when it was being made. Whenever

executives make an important decision, they put down in writing what results are

expected and when. And then the executive, nine months or a year later, begins

to feed back from the actual results to the ex-pected ones and keeps on doing this

as long as the decision is in force. So in an acquisition, for example, an executive

compares the actual results to the expected ones for the two to five years it takes

fully to integrate an ac-

quisition.

It’s amazing how much we learn by doing this and how fast. And

physi-cians have been taught since Hippocrates in Greece 2,400 years ago

to write down what course they expect a patient’s condition to take as

Aresult of the treatment the physician prescribes, that is, as a result of the

physi-cian’s decision. And that, as every experienced physician will tell

you, is what makes even moderately endowed doctors into competent

practition-ers within a few years.

ACTION POINT:

When you make an important decision, make sure to write

down the expected “prognosis.” Then at a time appropriate for the

particular decision, go out and look at what results have transpired. Com-

pare results to your prognosis. Use what you learn in subsequent decision

situations.

The Effective Executive

The Elements of Decision Making (Corpedia Online Program)

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

康敏的阴谋

康敏是大理镇南王段正淳的情人，是丐帮副帮主马大元的夫人，是丐帮耆老徐长老的情人，是丐帮执

法长老白世镜的情人，是丐帮八袋弟子，大智分舵舵主全冠清的情人。

康敏本来想做乔峰的情人，没有做到，所以，这个女人决定毁掉乔峰。这个事件是《天龙八部》里最

大的一个黑天鹅事件，天龙八部的大部分事情都和这个事件有关。

康敏做这么多人的情人，她的目的是什么呢？康敏想要的是什么呢？

其实，康敏的目的一直很清楚：她要获取尽可能高的权势。

段正淳自诩风流倜傥，勾搭的女人遍布华夏，有甘宝宝，秦红棉，阮星竹，王夫人，还有康敏。这些

女人大多对她死心塌地，偶尔对他不满，也会把这种不满转化到其他女人身上，觉得自己的段郎是完

美无瑕的，坏的只是其他女人。

这些女儿对老段的爱，都是毫无保留的，也几乎没有杂质，他们的诉求也只是和老段待在一起，至于

是老段跟着他还是她跟着老段，没什么区别。

只有康敏除外。

只有康敏提出了一个可以操作的实际要求：做正妃。

当然，老段不会让她做正妃的，毕竟，自己的正妃是刀白凤，不要说什么先来后到，光是刀白凤的背

后势力，就不是段正淳惹得起的，毕竟，老段首先是一个政治人物，其次才是浪荡公子。

康敏意识到这个问题就，就退而求其次，去寻求别的有权势的位置，她找到了丐帮的副帮主马大元，

这应该是她能找到的最高的社会地位了。毕竟，丐帮是江湖第一大帮。

后来，她看到了乔峰，乔峰是丐帮帮主，她觉得，她应该嫁给乔峰，做丐帮帮主。结果，万花丛中，

乔峰居然看都不看她，这让她很生气。

不过，她又能如何呢？乖乖地做自己的副帮主夫人吧。

如果没有发现汪剑通的那封遗属。

一个偶然的机会，康敏发现了自己的老公马大元藏有一封前帮主汪剑通的遗嘱。遗嘱里写了乔峰的契

丹人身份，以及当出现乔峰背叛汉族时，丐帮长老需要不惜一切代价杀死乔峰的遗令。

看到这个遗嘱后，康敏感觉自己的机会到了，自己应该有做帮主夫人的机会。

首先，这封信可以威胁乔峰，如果乔峰答应的话，自己就可以做帮主夫人了。

其次，可以让自己的老公马大元出面揭露乔峰，如果乔峰离开丐帮，自己的老公就会成为丐帮帮主，

自己也就是帮主夫人了。

这两个方案都不错。可是，康敏发现，自己根本没机会联系到乔峰，掂量了几天后，康敏决定执行第

二个方案：让自己老公做丐帮帮主。

没想到，自己的老公，平时看着怂的要命，却对乔峰异常忠诚。当自己让他揭露乔峰身世，赶乔峰出

丐帮时，这个怂货居然打了自己。而且威胁自己说，要是自己说出去，就杀了自己。

康敏当然不怕马大元这个怂货。不过，这条路也走不通，就只好走第三条路了。

康敏决定在丐帮高层寻找同盟。很快，康敏就锁定了执法长老白世镜。白世镜武功很高，地位也很

高。而且二十多年没有女人，应该好突破。

果然，康敏略微勾搭，白世镜就上钩了。当白世镜恋奸情热时，康敏向他提出揭露乔峰身世的问题，

没想到白世镜这家伙对乔峰也忠诚的要命，不管自己怎么威胁，他都不答应，甚至宁愿自己自杀。

没办法，康敏继续在丐帮找目标。康敏又找到了丐帮的一个退休长老徐长老，徐长老的地位很高。如

果可以的话，他的话语权会比较大。

略作勾搭，徐长老也上钩了。温存了几天后，康敏再次提出自己的诉求，这次徐长老答应了，毕竟，

他对乔峰没什么感情。而且，想到自己有可能当几天帮主，在丐帮历史上留下一点痕迹，也是非常开

心。

不过，徐长老太老了，而且身份也太高了，做很多事不方便，康敏还需要新的同盟。

这时，康敏把目光放到了大智分舵舵主全冠清的身上，这人是乔峰的左右手，能力、身份、年龄都不

错。康敏想着，乔峰倒台后，徐长老太老了，做帮主肯定不合适，而全冠清会是一个很好的帮助人

选。

所以，康敏再次出身，勾搭了全冠清，才睡了三晚，全冠清就答应了她所有要求，并且为她出谋划

策。当然，这也符合全冠清的利益：全冠清确实是最佳的后乔峰时期帮主。

一切谋定后，康敏就发起了史上有名的杏子林事件。

果然，按康敏的筹划，乔峰离开了丐帮。丐帮陷入了没有帮主的混乱时期，徐长老以特殊的身份暂时

署理帮主权力。

康敏的策划眼看就要完成了。帮主夫人眼看就要到手了。

谁知，某一天，白世镜来了，这个白世镜说了很多莫名其妙的话，康敏判断出这是白世镜是假的白世

镜。看了一眼白世镜身边的那个大个子。康敏知道那个人就是乔峰。

康敏清楚，丐帮帮主夫人地地位虽然尊崇，但这个位置取决于帮主是谁，而更好的位置则是大理的皇

后。

所以，康敏决定把乔峰引向段正淳，当段正淳受到威胁时，想办法救助老段，从而获得大理皇后的身

份。

乔峰去杀段正淳了，计算好时间，康敏派人告诉老段自己的地址，老段果然来找自己了。

唯一遗憾的是，白世镜也知道了老段过来，白世镜要杀死老段，康敏也没办法。保命要紧。

没想到，命还是没保住，小小的一个康敏家，陆陆续续来了秦红棉、阮星竹、萧峰、萧远山、阿紫、

木婉清。

先是被点了穴道，然后又被阿紫挑断全身经脉，涂上蜂蜜，引来了无数蚂蚁嗜咬。

康敏知道自己逃不过这一劫了，自己的生命已经走到了末路，她的两大优势：权谋和美貌也都帮不了

她了。这时的她，还想让乔峰抱抱她，或许她还想让段正淳抱抱她吧。

她知道自己很聪明，也知道自己很美貌，她也知道自己快要死了。她对乔峰说：“你抱抱我吧。”

她告诉知己，即使自己要死了，自己也是美貌的惊人。

知道看到那个可恶的阿紫放到自己面前的镜子。

哎。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

15 OCTOBER

Placing Decision Responsibility

Executives should be high enough to have the authority needed to make the decisions and low

enough to have the detailed knowledge.

There are four basic characteristics that determine the nature of any business decision.

First, there is the degree of futurity in the decision.

futurity：[ U ] ( formal ) the time that will come after the present and what will happen then 将

来；未来

For how long into the future does it commit the company?

commit：

做出（错或非法的事）；犯（罪或错等）

[ VN ] ( ~ a crime, etc. ) to do sth wrong or illegal

The second criterion is the impact a decision has on other functions, on other areas, or on the

business as a whole.

criterion：a

（评判或作决定的）

标准，准则，原则

standard or principle by which sth is judged, or with the help of which a decision is made

The character of a decision is also determined by the number of qualitative factors that enter

into it: basic principles of conduct, ethical values, social and political beliefs, and so on.

qualitative:

质量的；定性的；

性质的

[ usually before noun ] connected with how good sth is, rather than with how much of it there is

ethical

connected with beliefs and principles about what is right and wrong

（有关）道德的；伦理的

Finally, decisions can be classified according to whether they are periodically recurrent or rare,

if not unique, decisions.

A decision should always be made at the lowest possible level and as close to the scene of action

as possible.

However, a decision should always be made at a level ensuring that all activities and objectives

affected are fully considered.

The first rule tells us how far down a decision should be made.

The second how far down it can be made, as well as which managers must share in the decision

and which must be informed of it.

The two together tell us where certain activities should be placed.

ACTION POINT:

Push decision making down to as close to the action as possible.

But remember: The longer a decision commits the organization, the wider its impact upon other

functions, the greater the number of qualitative factors involved and finally, the rarer the decision,

the higher in the organization the decision should be made.

impact：~ (of sth) (on sb/sth) the powerful effect that sth has on sb/sth 巨大影响；强大作用

rarer：adj. 更稀罕的；更珍贵的（rare的比较级）

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

【原书原文】

15 OCTOBER

Placing Decision Responsibility

Executives should be high enough to have the authority needed

to make the decisions and low enough to have the detailed knowledge.

There are four basic characteristics that determine the nature of any business

decision. First, there is the degree of futurity in the decision.

For how long into the future does it commit the company? The second

cri-terion is the impact a decision has on other functions, on other areas,

or on the business as a whole. The character of a decision is also

determined by the number of qualitative factors that enter into it: basic

principles of con-duct, ethical values, social and political beliefs, and so

on. Finally, deci-sions can be classified according to whether they are

periodically recurrent or rare, if not unique, decisions.

A decision should always be made at the lowest possible level and as close

to the scene of action as possible. However, a decision should always be

made at a level ensuring that all activities and objectives affected are fully

considered. The first rule tells us how far down a decision should be made.

The second how far down it can be made, as well as which managers must

share in the decision and which must be informed of it. The two to-gether tell

us where certain activities should be placed.

ACTION POINT:

Push decision making down to as close to the action as

possible. But remember: The longer a decision commits the organization,

the wider its impact upon other functions, the greater the number of quali-

tative factors involved and finally, the rarer the decision, the higher in the

organization the decision should be made.

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

《天龙八部》究竟是一本什么书？

有人说，天龙八部是一本爸爸去哪儿的书，书里的各位大侠都在找爸爸。丐帮帮主乔峰每天喝酒打架

正开心的时候，突然有人对他说你爸爸不是你爸爸，快去找爸爸吧；少林的虚竹自出生就在少林寺，

以为自己是天生地养的佛门弟子，突然来了个妈妈，当然也就有个爸爸；大理镇南王世子段誉，整天

在父母身边撒娇，突然某一天，妈妈和他说，你爸爸不是你爸爸，那个高度残疾人才是你爸爸。

木婉清在找爸爸，阿朱、阿紫在找爸爸，王语嫣在找爸爸，仿佛上演着现代社会的爸爸缺失。

也有人说，《天龙八部》是一本讲父母坑孩子的书。萧峰的爸爸萧远山四处杀人，然后家伙给孩子，

让孩子各种为难；慕容复的爸爸慕容博四处杀人，嫁祸给儿子，让儿子四处为难；段誉的“爸爸”段正

淳四处沾花惹草，搞得段誉泡一个妞，是自己妹妹，泡一个妞，又是自己妹妹。

秦红棉自己欠下的债，结果木婉清伤透了心；阮星竹欠下的债，阿朱送了命；父母对孩子仿佛没有一

点爱心，好像真的只是快乐的遗物。

还有人说，《天龙八部》是一本讲三个主人公的“求不得”的故事。萧峰求民族大义而不得；段誉求爱

情而不得；虚竹求精神寄托而不得。

这些说的都对，而且颇为有趣。我今天给一个新的视角，我认为，《天龙八部》讲的是在权力的追逐

下，会有写什么事情。

《天龙八部》的分类是武侠小说，里面的主人公都有高深、奇妙的武功，配角也都身手敏捷。不过，

这本书和金庸的其他小说比，多了更多的权力追逐。

首先，这本说的官府是最多的。有大宋，有大理，有西夏，有辽，还有金。这些官府都和武林人士勾

结在一起，武林人士也都依靠某一个官府。

比如，段延庆为首的四大恶人一旦遇到挫折，就投靠了西夏，加入了一品堂。

除了这些正式的官府外，整个江湖也充满着官府的气息，如丐帮、少林、星宿派、逍遥派、灵鹫派，

甚至无量派等，无不沾染这权力的气息。

丐帮，这个最穷的，最没有路的人集合在一起的一个门派，居然也成了天下第一大帮。这样一来，帮

主也就成了很有权势的人。

武林之中，单是一句话便能调动数万人众的，以前有丐帮帮主。嗯，少林弟子遍天下，少林派掌门

方丈一句话，那也能调动数万人众……

也就是说，丐帮也成了一方势力，这个势力甚至和大理的镇南王不相上下。

少林自然也是如此，天下武功出少林，几百年来，江湖上各大门派，或多或少都和少林有千丝万缕的

联系。这样一来，少林的方丈也就成了炙手可热的一方势力。

丐帮、少林，本来是两个最与世无争的清净之地，居然也有了官府气息，也充满权力的博弈。

这不，乔峰在这个博弈中去找爸爸去了；而少林听到有人来抢他家的武功秘籍，居然派人去截杀。逍

遥派的无崖子被徒弟丁春秋收拾后，师妹李秋水也去了西夏，做了太后，谋求更大的权力空间。

南慕容，本身就是政治势力，每天都在收割江湖上那些七零八碎的闲散势力，意图拼凑一个大燕国。

段延庆和段正明之间的明争暗斗，灵鹫宫和西夏国之间的权力相争。康敏意图借助丐帮和大理抗衡，

辽国希望通过萧峰一统大宋。

在这个时代，江湖中都是政府，政府中也充满武林。武力，作为稀缺品，不断寻求世俗权力的红利。

大理干脆就是武术世家的建国。小小的吐蕃国也豢养了鸠摩智这样的牛人。

丐帮的帮主，少林的方丈，其权势不次于大理西夏这样的君主。

在《天龙八部》里，金庸就是构建了这样一个世界，在这个世界里，武林人物，都是政治人物，包括

辛双清这样的女子，也要学会站队。

底层都在活命，中层都在站队，高层都在斗争。而所谓的爸爸去哪里，所谓的父子、母女亲情的缺

失，所谓的求不得，其实只是高层斗争的产物而已。

权力是什么？权力的来源在哪里？

在这个时代，武力是权力的唯一来源，钟万仇是没法和大理段家斗的。萧峰父子，慕容复父子，加一

个鸠摩智，就可以决定大宋、大辽、大燕、大理、吐蕃的局势。

而扫地僧则可以更高层决定这个局势。

那么他们的权力合法么？当然合法，在之后100年，到了五绝时代，这些江湖人物只能在江和湖之间笑

傲了。到了明末清初，这些武林人物就只能依靠在官府身边，被官府豢养了。

这些人的武功还是不错，比如陈近南，比如吴六奇，然而，在清政府面前，这些人的武功又有多大的

意义呢？

这时，个人的武功已经被世俗权力的网给锁得死死的，再也没什么作为了。

建国后，有一个叫做李成福的人，自称是唐代后人，在河南省嵩县称帝，建立万顺天国，被乡政府的

三名民警干掉了。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

16 OCTOBER

Legitimate Power in Society

Legitimate：

for which there is a fair and acceptable reason

正当合理的；合情合理的

No society can function as a society unless the decisive social power is legitimate.

decisive：

决定性的；关键的

very important for the final result of a particular situation

Legitimate power stems from the same basic belief of society regarding man’s nature and

fulfillment on which the individual’s social status and function rest.

stems：

起源于

fulfillment：n. 履行；实行；满足（感）

V-I If a condition or problem stems from something, it was caused originally by that thing.

Indeed legitimate power can be defined as rulership that finds its justification in the basic ethos of

society.

In every society there are many powers that have nothing to do with such a principle, and

institutions that in no way are either designed or devoted to its fulfillment.

In other words, there are always a great many “unfree” institutions in a free society, a great many

inequalities in an equal society, and a great many sinners among the saints.

But as long as the decisive social power that we call ruler-ship is based upon the claim of freedom,

equality, or saintliness, and is exercised through institutions that are designed toward the fulfillment

of these ideal purposes, society can function as a free, equal, or saintly society.

For its institutional structure is one of legitimate power.

ACTION POINT:

Think about the problem of creating legitimate power in Iraq after the fall of Saddam Hussein.

What “unfree” institutions are likely to remain? What inequalities are likely to persist once legitimate

power is established?

The Future of Industrial Man

16 OCTOBER

Legitimate Power in Society

No society can function as a society unless

the decisive social power is legitimate.

Legitimate power stems from the same basic belief of society regarding

man’s nature and fulfillment on which the individual’s social status and

function rest. Indeed legitimate power can be defined as rulership that finds

its justification in the basic ethos of society. In every society there are many

powers that have nothing to do with such a principle, and institutions that in

no way are either designed or devoted to its fulfillment. In other words, there

are always a great many “unfree” institutions in a free society, a great many

inequalities in an equal society, and a great many sinners among the saints.

But as long as the decisive social power that we call ruler-ship is based upon

the claim of freedom, equality, or saintliness, and is ex-ercised through

institutions that are designed toward the fulfillment of these ideal purposes,

society can function as a free, equal, or saintly society.

For its institutional structure is one of legitimate power.

ACTION POINT:

Think about the problem of creating legitimate power in

Iraq after the fall of Saddam Hussein. What “unfree” institutions are

likely to remain? What inequalities are likely to persist once legitimate

power is established?

The Future of Industrial Man

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

朱元璋：我为什么摧毁明教

朱元璋本来是个和尚。小时候，朱元璋的家乡闹了饥荒，爸爸妈妈姐姐都饿死了，只留下了哥哥和自

己还活着，两个孩子都不大，在那个乱世，只好各自讨饭去了。

走了几天后，朱元璋来到一个小寺庙，想在寺庙里讨点吃的，庙里的老和尚看他可怜，就收了他做小

和尚，虽然还是吃不饱，却也饿不死了。

长大些后，遍地都是叛军，这其中最有名的也就明教的军队了朱元璋在一次救了一个叫做张无忌的小

孩后，就加入了明教的洪水旗，做了一名士兵。

从小就是穷人的朱元璋非常喜欢明教，因为明教的兄弟让他有了家的感觉，当朱元璋宣誓成为明尊的

弟子后，顿时觉得自己充满了力量。

朱元璋很聪明，也很会交朋友，很快，他就成为了洪水旗的一个首领。在一次行军中，他发现了一群

武林人士被元军俘虏，他探听清楚信息后，就近对明教总坛汇报。

在总坛，他发现他几年前救的那个张无忌，居然成了明教的教主。朱元璋很是开心。

张无忌教主看到朱元璋也非常开心，张无忌知道朱元璋是个人才，就重用了他。

在张无忌的支持下，也在自己的军功下，朱元璋成为了一位将军，归韩山童管。而且，朱元璋是一位

权势很大的将军。

这些年，朱元璋带领明军东征西战，立下了汗马功劳，同时，自己的势力也大了起来，明教的军对有

一半的在自己麾下。

朱元璋是一个很有权谋的人，这一点，他自己知道，张无忌也知道。

所以，张无忌一直不给朱元璋总坛的身份，也就是不给她宗教方面的地位。毕竟，这个明教，不管是

法王，还是散人，还是五行旗的军队，大多都是用明教的教义聚集在一起的。

毕竟，在这个乱世，大家都要靠明尊、圣火等等宗教的东西才可以活下去。

次日清晨，诸路人众向张无忌告别。众人虽均是意气慷慨的豪杰，但想到此后血战四野，不知谁存谁

亡，大事纵成，今日蝴蝶谷大会中的群豪只怕活不到一半，不免俱有惜别之意。是时蝴蝶谷前圣火高

烧，也不知是谁忽然朗声唱了起来：

“焚我残躯，熊熊圣火。生亦何欢，死亦何苦？”众人齐声相和：“焚我残躯，熊熊圣火。生亦何欢，死

亦何苦？为善除恶，惟光明故。喜乐悲愁，皆归尘土。万事为民，不图私我。怜我世人，忧患实多！

怜我世人，忧患实多！”

那“怜我世人，忧患实多！怜我世人，忧患实多！”的歌声，飘扬在蝴蝶谷中。群豪白衣如雪，一个个

走到张无忌面前，躬身行礼，昂首而出，再不回顾。张无忌想到如许大好男儿，此后一二十年之中，

行将鲜血洒遍中原大地，忍不住热泪盈眶。

又打了几年战，朱元璋的权势越来越大了，自称为吴王。眼看明教就要打败元军，以及其他的起义

军。整个国家即将进入一个新的阶段，所有人都知道，新的朝代即将到来。

起义军是聚集在明尊之下的，张无忌理所当然应该是新朝廷的皇帝。大家都这么想，除了朱元璋。

目前大部分军队都掌握在朱元璋手里。虽然明教的高层则表示支持张无忌，底层的军官却表示支持朱

元璋。

对于这些军官来说，他们虽然也是明尊的弟子，却已经摆脱了生存的压力，他们更期待的是建国后的

生活：大门大院，妻妾成群，子孙满堂。

在这些高级官员心里，明尊那熊熊烈火以及是很久远前的事了。

甚至，很多底层士兵也这么想。

当然，朱元璋也这么想。可以预见，和平即将打来，明尊的那一套，对于普通民众来说已经没有意义

了。而这一套，对于新的政权却会有致命的伤害：他们还会继续批判新的政权。甚至继续点燃暴乱的

火种。

考虑良久后，朱元璋决定摧毁明教总坛，摧毁明教，完成明教从宗教到世俗权力的过度。

朱元璋先是通过陷害让张无忌自动离开明教，朱元璋知道，如果杀了张无忌的话，会引起明教的地

震。

张无忌之后，杨逍成为了教主，没多久，杨逍就成了朱元璋的傀儡。

又过了几年，朱元璋势力充沛后，随即登基成为皇帝。

做了皇帝的朱元璋开始随对明教的最后清洗：诛杀明教的高层。一年多时间，明教的高层诛杀殆尽。

明朝政权也就正式成为去处了宗教阴影的世俗权力代言人。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

17 OCTOBER

The Conscience of Society

Conscience：

[ C U ] the part of your mind that tells you whether your actions are right or wrong

Religion cannot accept any society without abandoning its true Kingdom.

Religion：

教信仰

良心；良知

[ U ] the belief in the existence of a god or gods, and the activities that are connected with the worship of them

宗教；宗

The End of Economic Man reached the conclusion that the churches could not, after all, furnish

the basis for European society and European politics.

furnish：

向（某人╱某事物）供应，提供

basis：

基准；准则；方式

sb/sth with sth | ~ sth ( formal ) to supply or provide sb/sth with sth; to supply sth to sb

[ sing. ] the way things are organized or arranged

They had to fail, though not for the reasons for which the contemporaries tended to ignore them.

contemporaries：

当代的

ADJ Contemporary things are modern and relate to the present time.

Religion could indeed offer an answer to the despair of the individual and to his existential agony.

despair：

绝望

existential：

关于人类存在的；与人类存在有关的

agony：

（精神或肉体的）极度痛苦

[ U ] the feeling of having lost all hope

( formal ) connected with human existence

[ U C ] extreme physical or mental pain

But, it could not offer an answer to the despair of the masses.

masses：

群众

N-PLURAL the body of common people

I am afraid that this conclusion still holds today.

Western Man—indeed today Man altogether—is not ready to renounce this world.

renounce：

声明放弃；宣布放弃

to state officially that you are no longer going to keep a title, position, etc.

Indeed he still looks for secular salvation, if he expects salvation at all.

salvation：

基督教

得救；救恩；救世

secular：

现世的；世俗的；非宗教的

( in Christianity

) the state of being saved from the power of evil

not connected with spiritual or religious matters

And churches, especially Christian churches, can (and should) preach a “social gospel.”

gospel：

福音（《圣经》中关于耶稣生平

( also Gospel ) [ C ] one of the four books in the Bible about the life and teaching of Jesus

和教诲的四福音书之一）

preach：to give a religious talk in a public place, especially in a church during a service 布道，讲道（尤指教堂中礼拜时）

But they cannot (and should not) substitute politics for Grace, and social science for

Redemption.

substitute:

代替者；代替物；代用

品

(for sb/sth) a person or thing that you use or have instead of the one you normally use or have

Grace

:[ U ] the kindness that God shows towards the human race

恩宠；恩典

Redemption

:( formal ) the act of saving or state of being saved from the power of evil; the act of redeeming

拯救；救赎

Religion, the critic of any society, cannot accept any society or even any social program, without

abandoning its true Kingdom, that of a Soul alone with its God.

critic:

批评者；挑剔的人

a person who expresses disapproval of sb/sth and talks about their bad qualities, especially publicly

Therein lies both the strength of the churches as the conscience of society and their incurable

weakness as political and social forces of society.

conscience:

良心；良知

incurable

不能治愈的

[ C U ] the part of your mind that tells you whether your actions are right or wrong

that cannot be cured

ACTION POINT:

Religion should serve as a critic of society and not as a political force.

How does this principle compare with the role of religion in the U.S. at the present time?

The End of Economic Man

17 OCTOBER

The Conscience of Society

Religion cannot accept any society without abandoning its true Kingdom.

The End of Economic Man reached the conclusion that the churches could

not, after all, furnish the basis for European society and Euro-pean politics.

They had to fail, though not for the reasons for which the contemporaries

tended to ignore them. Religion could indeed offer an an-swer to the despair

of the individual and to his existential agony. But, it could not offer an answer

to the despair of the masses. I am afraid that this conclusion still holds today.

Western Man—indeed today Man alto-gether—is not ready to renounce this

world. Indeed he still looks for secu-lar salvation, if he expects salvation at

all. And churches, especially Christian churches, can (and should) preach

A“social gospel.” But they cannot (and should not) substitute politics for

Grace, and social science for Redemption. Religion, the critic of any society,

cannot accept any society or even any social program, without abandoning its

true Kingdom, that of a Soul alone with its God. Therein lies both the strength

of the churches as the conscience of society and their incurable weakness as

political and so-

cial forces of society.

ACTION POINT:

Religion should serve as a critic of society and not as a po-

litical force. How does this principle compare with the role of religion in

the U.S. at the present time?

The End of Economic Man

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

何三七：馄饨十文钱一碗

摘要：小本生意，现银交易，至亲好友，赊欠免问。

何三七是一个生意人。

说他是生意人有点夸大，因为何三七只是一个卖馄饨的。每天早上4点多醒来，和面，剁馅，包馄饨。

忙活到6点多，开始出早摊卖馄饨，馄饨十文钱一碗，童叟无欺。

大概到了中午，何三七的混沌就卖完了，赚的钱也够几天花的了。下午的时间就属于何三七自己了。

何三七还喜欢练武，到了下午，何三七收摊后，就会在院子里练习武功。何三七天赋并不好，不过，

这是一个大家都练习武功的时代，何三七也请了一个师父，每天练习几个小时。没几年，何三七的武

功也可圈可点了。在馄饨圈里，武功肯定是最好的。

而在所谓的武术圈里，何三七是馄饨做的最好的。

何三七年龄慢慢大了，孩子也有了，也大了。何三七也就不需要去卖馄饨了。儿子、儿媳妇也孝顺，

何三七每天也就是当当老太爷。

这一年何三七50岁。

待了几年后，何三七还是决定出去卖馄饨，而且四处走着卖馄饨，走到哪里算哪里，孩子们都大了，

自己也就自由一些了。

这些年，何三七在武术圈里也有一些知名度，五岳派，魔教等人多少也都给一些面子。看到何三七的

摊摊，想打架的也就不打架了。想吃馄饨的也就来吃了，几十年了，何三七还是十文钱一碗。

有一次，有一个朋友来找何三七。来到老何的摊摊上，和老何聊了挺久。然后说，老何，咱们去吃

饭，我请你吃饭。

何三七说：“为什么不吃我的馄饨呢？”

朋友尴尬的看了看，说，那就给我一碗馄饨吧。

吃完后，朋友想走，何三七说：“馄饨十文钱一碗，谢谢”。

朋友又尴尬地看看他，拿了十两银子给他了，说不用找了。

何三七说：“找不开，给我零的”。

看到何三七认真的样子，朋友找了十文钱，小心翼翼地递给了何三七。

何三七武功并不高，走南闯北，也颇有不少武林中大有身份的人来吃，何三七一直是“馄饨十文钱一

碗”。

有好朋友建议他不要卖馄饨了，又不缺那点钱。何三七说，我就是卖馄饨的，凭什么不卖？

我的朋友中有保险业务员，有餐厅的服务员，也有收房子出租房子的二房东，还有在各种线上课程中
