The modern enterprise needs organization.

But the pioneers were wrong in their assumption that there is—or should be— one right

organization.

Instead of searching for the right organization, management needs to learn to look for, to

develop, to test, the organization that fits the task.

There are some “principles” of organization.

One is that organization has to be transparent.

People have to know and have to understand the organization structure they are supposed to work

in.

supposed ：

[ only before noun ] used to show that you think that a claim, statement or way of describing sb/sth is not true or

correct, although it is generally believed to be

误以为的；误信的；所谓的

Someone in the organization must have the authority to make the final decision in a given area.

组织内必须有一个拍板的老大。

It also is a sound principle that authority be commensurate with responsibility.

commensurate：

（在大小、重要性、质量等方面）相称的，

相当的

(with sth) ( formal ) matching sth in size, importance, quality, etc.

这个老大必须要承担对等的责任。

It is a sound principle that any one person in an organization should have only one “master.”

组织中每个人也要有自己的老板。

These principles are not too different from the ones that inform an architect’s work.

这些规则就像建筑师的工作一样。

They do not tell him what kind of building to build.

他们关注改什么样的大楼。

They tell him what the restraints are.

restraints：

N-VAR Restraints are rules or conditions that limit or restrict someone or something.

限制

And this is pretty much what the various principles of organization structure do.

various：

各种不同的；各种各样的

several different

ACTION POINT:

Reflect on whether your organization is transparent, if decision-making authority is clear,

whether authority is commensurate with responsibility, and whether each person has only one

master.

Reflect ：

认真思考；沉思

transparent：

语言、信息等

易懂的

authority：

权力；威权；当权（地位）

(on/upon sth) to think carefully and deeply about sth

( of language, information, etc.

[ U ] the power to give orders to people

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

) easy to understand

16 NOVEMBER

The Right Organization

The only things that evolve by themselves in an organization

are disorder, friction, malperformance.

The pioneers of management a century ago were right: organizational

structure is needed. The modern enterprise needs organization. But the

pioneers were wrong in their assumption that there is—or should be—

one right organization. Instead of searching for the right organization,

management needs to learn to look for, to develop, to test, the

organization that fits the task.

There are some “principles” of organization. One is that organization has

to be transparent. People have to know and have to understand the or-

ganization structure they are supposed to work in. Someone in the organi-

zation must have the authority to make the final decision in a given area. It

also is a sound principle that authority be commensurate with responsibil-ity.

It is a sound principle that any one person in an organization should have only

one “master.” These principles are not too different from the ones that inform

an architect’s work. They do not tell him what kind of building to build. They

tell him what the restraints are. And this is pretty much what the various

principles of organization structure do.

ACTION POINT:

Reflect on whether your organization is transparent, if

decision-making authority is clear, whether authority is commensurate

with responsibility, and whether each person has only one master.

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

萧峰：我好后悔

一

乔峰峰是一个天不怕地不怕的人，一生光明磊落。从一个山民的孩子，到少林高僧的弟子，然后是丐

帮帮主的弟子，最后成长成为丐帮帮主。

乔峰喜欢打打杀杀，遇到战斗，小心谨慎却无所畏惧。凭着惊人的武功，谨慎的性格还有丐帮的势

力，乔峰的人生应该很顺才对。

没成想，某一天，突然被揭露出自己的契丹人的真相，自己也就从乔峰变成了萧峰。

紧接着，自己的养父养母被杀，自己的师父被杀，自己身世的知情人一个个被杀，而自己背上了杀人

的恶名。

好容易有一个女子喜欢自己，也死在了自己掌下；这个女子在临死前委托自己照顾她妹妹，结果她妹

妹也差点死在自己手里。

然后，自己这个粗鲁的汉子，和那个把细而鬼机灵的小丫头阿紫开始了长时间的感情纠结。最后，间

接死在了这位妹子手里：半截长枪插入心脏。

而这位妹子也挖去了双眼，抱着这位自己心爱的男人跳下了悬崖。

而这一切的起点，只是在某年丐帮在洛阳开一个百花会，在会上，萧峰只顾着和丐帮兄弟们喝酒，没

有留意与会的一位美女，也就是马大元的媳妇康敏。

康敏觉得，自己这么漂亮，所有男人都应该看自己，而，那位男人中权势最高，武功最高，最帅气的

乔峰，居然都不看自己。

怎么办？搞他！安排！

然后，萧峰就悲剧了。

我在想，萧峰知道了这件事的前因后果后，会不会后悔在百花会上没看康敏那一眼？

二、

其实更后悔的应该是包惜弱。这个可怜的女儿，一向怜惜各种小动物。所以，当她看到柴火房里有一

个受伤的人时，她毫不犹豫地救了一下，帮他包扎，止血。

包扎好后，包惜弱想去告诉老公杨铁心，可是那个酒鬼醉的什么似的。

包惜弱再回来看那个受伤的人时，发现他已经走了。包惜弱想了想，也就算了。

没想多，几个月后，来了一群人围观郭杨两家，郭啸天当场死亡。杨铁心好像也死了，郭啸天的媳妇

李萍好像也死了。

只有自己被一个人救了。

没想到这个人是大金国的王爷完颜洪烈。然后，她生下了一个小孩子，名字叫做完颜康。自己也做了

完颜洪烈的妃子。

十几年后，自己的老公找到自己，带着自己从完颜洪烈的王府逃出，在路上，杨铁心和自己死在了一

起。

几年后，自己的儿子也在意外中死亡。

我在想，在临死前，包惜弱有没有后悔去救那个柴火房的受伤之人？

三、

我想，即使回到百花会上，乔峰也不会去看康敏；即使再次回到柴火房，包惜弱也不会不救那个完颜

洪烈。这是他们的性格。

虽然这两件不起眼的小事都引起了悲剧性的泼天大事，在事情的开始，乔峰或者包惜弱也不会去对这

样的事情做思考。

因为，这样的事情是没法思考的。

记得有人做过一个推测，关于丘处机路过牛家村的。

1、假如当时丘处机没有路过牛家村。 那么，秘密跟踪他的那些金兵就不会死在郭，杨二人的院子里，

同样，完颜洪烈也不会见到包惜弱而对她念念不忘。

2、那些金兵不会死在丘处机手里，而郭，杨两家以后不会受到牵连。

3、郭，杨两家不受波及，李萍不会流亡大漠，郭靖和杨康将会平平安安出生在牛家村。江南七怪自然

也不会前往大漠。

4、而要是没有郭靖和七怪相助，铁木真就会死在扎木合他们手里，蒙古各部也就不能统一。

5、蒙古不能统一，也就不会有什么西征。火药就不会传入欧洲。

6、没有火药，铁甲士在欧洲的统治就不会动摇。因此，黑暗的中世纪将延长一千年，也就没有文艺复

兴。

7、没有了文艺复兴，自然也没有大航海。北美洲将始终是游牧的印第安人的家园。

8、同样，西班牙人不会将铁炮传入日本。长筱会战是武田方面获胜，日本战国时代将一直持续不能统

一。

9、在另一国度，完颜洪烈没有包惜弱，只能全力参加争。金国因此会内乱。

10、没有蒙古，金国又内乱，因此，宋不但不会灭亡，反而会统一。宋朝注重商贸，因此，资本主义

萌芽将在中国出现。

11、如果发展到今天，中国将是最发达的国家，远远领先于日本，西班牙，西欧，美洲。

12、今天的金融危机也就不会出现，所有的一切，都怪丘处机，你说你一道士，没事干嘛路过什么牛

家村嘛

都怪丘处机！！

所以，在我们普通人眼里，上帝就是掷骰子的，而你身边发生的一起，其实都已经是最好的安排。

你能做的是接受现实，用你的智力和体力，让自己的未来更舒服一些。

如此而已。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

17 NOVEMBER

Limits of Quantification

Quantification： n. [统计] 定量，量化

Quantification for most of the phenomena in a social ecology is misleading or at best useless.

phenomena：

现象

ecology：

生态；生态学

a fact or an event in nature or society, especially one that is not fully understood

[ U ] the relation of plants and living creatures to each other and to their environment; the study of this

The most important reason why I am not a quantifier is that in social affairs, events that matter

cannot be quantified.

For example, Henry Ford’s ignorance in 1900 or 1903 of the prevailing economic wisdom that the

way to maximize profit was to be a monopolist—that is, to keep production low and prices high—

led him to assume that the way to make money was to keep prices low and production high.

prevailing：

普遍的；盛行的；流行的

monopolist：

术语

垄断者；专卖者；专营者

production：

产量

existing or most common at a particular time

( technical

) a person or company that has a monopoly

[ U ] the quantity of goods that is produced

This, the invention of “mass production,” totally changed industrial economics.

It would have been impossible, however, to quantify the impact even as late as 1918 or 1920, years

after Ford’s success had made him the richest industrialist in the United States, and probably in

the world.

impact：

巨大影响；强大作用

industrialist：

工业家；实业家；工厂主

(of sth) (on sb/sth) the powerful effect that sth has on sb/sth

a person who owns or runs a large factory or industrial company

He had revolutionized industrial production, the automobile industry, and the economy in general,

and had, above all, completely changed our perception of industry.

perception：

看

法；见解

[ U C ] ~ (that…) ( formal ) an idea, a belief or an image you have as a result of how you see or understand sth

The unique event that changes the universe is an event “at the margin.”

unique：

唯一的；独一无二的

event：

发生的事情；（尤指）重要事情，大事

being the only one of its kind

a thing that happens, especially sth important

By the time it becomes statistically significant, it is no longer “future”; it is, indeed, no longer even

“present.” It is already “past.”

statistically：adv. 统计地；统计学上

ACTION POINT:

Identify a unique event with an impact that is unquantifiable now, but is likely to transform your

organization in the next decade.

Be out in front and take advantage of the opportunities it will afford.

The Ecological Vision

17 NOVEMBER

Limits of Quantification

Quantification for most of the phenomena in a social ecology

is misleading or at best useless.

The most important reason why I am not a quantifier is that in social af-

fairs, events that matter cannot be quantified. For example, Henry Ford’s

ignorance in 1900 or 1903 of the prevailing economic wisdom that the way to

maximize profit was to be a monopolist—that is, to keep pro-duction low and

prices high—led him to assume that the way to make money was to keep

prices low and production high. This, the invention of “mass production,”

totally changed industrial economics. It would have been impossible,

however, to quantify the impact even as late as 1918 or 1920, years after

Ford’s success had made him the richest industrialist in the United States, and

probably in the world. He had revolutionized indus-trial production, the

automobile industry, and the economy in general,

and had, above all, completely changed our perception of industry.

The unique event that changes the universe is an event “at the margin.”

By the time it becomes statistically significant, it is no longer “future”; it

is, indeed, no longer even “present.” It is already “past.”

ACTION POINT:

Identify a unique event with an impact that is unquantifi-

able now, but is likely to transform your organization in the next decade.

Be out in front and take advantage of the opportunities it will afford.

The Ecological Vision

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

自私的创业者

今天上午我在群里做了一个调查：你认为你公司内所有人都是平等的么？投票的结果和我的预期差不多，却也出乎我的意料。

25个投票者，只有一个认为公司内所有人都是平等的，其他的24人都认为是不平等的。

有一个同学直接回答说：“绩效就不透明，如何平等？”这个投票其实很难选择，因为这里涉及到一个不大清晰的概念：平等。

什么是平等？是财富（工资）平等？还是机会（升职、加薪、旅游）平等，还是人格平等？百度百科对平等有一个定义：平等是指社会主体在社会关系、社会生活中处于同等的地位，具有相同的发展机会，享有同等的权利。

百度百科认为平等包括三层含义：人格平等、机会平等和权力平等。

在公司内部说权力平等，大家可能会觉得有点夸张，董事长的权力肯定比我要大的多；我的经理更是直接决定我的奖金，哪来的平等？公司本来就是一个金字塔型的等级制机构，哪来的平等？至于说到人格平等，这个还可以议论一下，毕竟，公司不是强制机构，也不是黑涩会，你觉得你的人格受到侮辱，完全可以离开。

你的老板觉得你侮辱了他，也同样会让你离开。

所以，在表面上，大家的人格还是平等的。

不过，在企业中还是有一些不同，或者说一个组织，大家凑在一起是为了做一件事。

既然你加入了这个组织，说明这个组织的运行需要你。

不管你是总经理还是董事长还是清洁工。

公司离开你就没法运转。

或者说，公司失去这个岗位就是没法正常运转的。

所以，对于公司来说，每一个岗位都是不可或缺的，不管是销售还是研发还是厨师。

只要存在，就说明公司需要。

而所谓的公正，也就意味着对于不同的贡献给出不同的奖励：给销售业绩最好的员工股的奖励肯定要超过业绩最差的员工的简历。

这才是公正和平等。

而所谓的上级和下级，只是工作内容、工作能力、工作经历（经验）不同而根据公司的需要设定的一些区别，这些区别展示出来的是平等，而不是不平等。

那么，为什么那么多人认为公司是不平等的呢？认为董事长比清洁工要高等？

中国一直有一句俗话：宁为鸡头，毋为牛后。

我对这句话一直有一些不认可。

只是说不出这种不认可。

看到今天的投票，我发现了这句话的底层逻辑：这其实是对不平等的确认。

如果在一个公司，大家都是平等的，从董事长到清洁工，大家从自己的能力、兴趣和各种资源出发，选择一个适合自己的岗位，如软件工程师，如项目经理，如销售，如清洁工，如制图；如部门经理、如总经理等等等等。

如果你是普通的员工，完成你的领导安排的工作，拿到你应得的收入，过你喜欢的生活。

如果你的领导，尽你的管理职责，统筹和设计以及管理你的团队实现你领导要求的目标。

如果你是老板，你投入巨大的精力和资源，努力实现自己的目标。

一切只是你的选择而已。

当然，更多人没有选择。

这是另一个问题了。

现在问题来了，我们的文化中，一直认为老大是“很厉害的”，认为只有做老大才是厉害的，认为在企业中只有主子和奴才，不是主子，就是奴才。

而在企业中，只有老大才不是奴才。

所以，大家才觉得：宁为鸡头，毋为牛后。

那些选“不平等”的人，肯定会努力往上派，这个对年轻人来说很正确。

有一些更厉害的人，则会选择出来创业，直接做老大，直接做主子。

其实，在一个正常成长的企业，肯定要建立平等的文化，这个平等，值得是机会上的平等，人格上的平等。

企业中的每一个人，只有在平等的基础上，才可以通过自我控制，尽最大可能，最优地完成自己的工作，完成组织、领导和自己的目标。

说道老板，说道主子，我可以讲个段子，其实，做了主子才知道，这哪是主子呀，这完全就是灰孙子。

我认识一个女生，很漂亮的女生，那种可以随意放男生鸽子男生也不会生气的女生，那种男生会想各种办法约的女生。

自从创业后，就各种约别人，陪这笑脸，还老被放鸽子。

有一次我和这个女生说：“卿本佳人，奈何创业”。

如果你保持“主子奴才”思维的话，真的做了主子后，你就会发现，满大街的客户都是你的“主子”，甚至你的“奴才”也是你的主子：爷，您好歹动一动呀。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

18 NOVEMBER

Hierarchy and Equality

One hears a great deal today about “the end of hierarchy.” That is blatant nonsense.

To attack industrial society, as would the sentimental equalitarian, be- cause it is based on subordination instead of on formal equality is Amisunderstanding of the nature of both industry and society.

Like every other institution that coordinates human efforts to a social end, the corpo- ration must be organized on hierarchical lines.

But, also, everybody from the boss to the sweeper must be seen as equally necessary to the success of the common enterprise.

At the same time, the large corporation must offer equal opportunities for advancement.

This is simply the traditional demand for justice, a consequence of the Christian concept of human dignity.

The demand for equal opportunities is not, as is often mistakenly as- sumed, a demand for absolute equality of rewards.

On the contrary, equal opportunities automatically assume an inequality of rewards.

For the very concept of justice implies rewards graduated according to unequal performance and unequal responsibility.

ACTION POINT:

Does your organization value the contribution of the bossand the sweeper, or just the boss?

Concept of the Corporation

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

A Functioning Society

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

微信群应该聊什么

一

每个人都有很多群，少的几十个，多的几千个。有一次我在杭州参加一个自媒体的活动时，有一个女

生提了一个问题：老师，我有10万个500人的群，应该如何管理呢？

我不知道一个微信有没有可能在10万个群，不过，对于个人来说，10万个群，每个群500人，这是

5000万人。这个人数是很惊人的。

我自己应该在1000个群以上，大部分群都不活跃，有少数群又非常活跃。人多的群反而不活跃，那些

七八个，十几个人的群反而一天天几百条信息。

这应该是大多数人的情况。

又有人问我，应该如何维持一个群的活跃呢？发红包么？我都发了好几千的红包了，还是不活跃呀。

我说：“下次你发红包前，拉我进去。”

然后我又问他：“你为什么需要群活跃呢？”

二

每个群都有一个名字，这个名字就有一些意思。比如：六神磊磊读唐诗，说明这个群是和六神磊磊有

关的，和读唐诗有关的。

比如群名叫做德鲁克小组，说明这个群里会讨论和德鲁克有关的话题；比如3公里跑步群，群里肯定就

是讨论跑步有关的话题。

又比如 洪洞一中171班，这就说明这是一个班级群；如果群名是 小鹅通对接群，那就说明这是也小鹅

通业务有关的群。

如此种种，这样的群每个人都应该有很多。

根据每个群的名字，每个群的话题其实都是受限制的。你不应该在德鲁克群里发红楼梦的信息；如果

你跑到跑步群里，发领养小动物的信息，然后不断说应该如何如何爱护小动物，我想，群主大概率会

直接踢掉你。

并不是群主没有爱心，而且因为，既然那个群是因为跑步而起的，那就让大家关注跑步，关注健康，

关注马拉松，关注运动受伤，装备等等等等。这和对小动物的爱心一点关系都没有。

三

每一个群就像一家公司，起个名字，就有了业务方向，根据业务方向增加人，随着人的增加，这个群

也就慢慢大了起来，也就有了管理的需求。

比如，有一个群叫做我爱PPT，这个群来自我的一篇文章：目前这个群有207人，群里有几个PPT的高

手每天和大家交流PPT的各种知识，大家学的不亦乐乎。有时群里还会设计一些小作业，群友们做出作

业后，就发到群里，很是开心。

目前群设置了一个小门槛，就是进群支付一个19.9元。这样一来，群就更活跃了。大家的交流也更有

趣了。

如果你在这个群里，偶尔发一个Word的使用技巧，应该不算违和，如果你在群里去讨论某某电影呢？

我觉得肯定就不合适了。毕竟，大家来这里是因为关注PPT。

四

一个稍微大一些的群，如果想要有价值的话，一定要有明确的目的，并且通过这个目的吸引群友。因

为这个目的来的群友，经过一个小的门槛后，肯定会非常热心地讨论起来。

这种因为讨论而形成的热闹，是有意义的，除此之外，通过红包等形成的热闹，并没有意义：大家为

啥来的嘛。

而且，如果要群高质量的话，群最好只有一个目的，这个目的越明确越好。我认为“我爱PPT”这个群名

就非常好，至少比“办公软件交流群”要好；同样，“德鲁克小组”比“管理兴趣小组”要好；“有趣的易经”

比“国学的天空”要好。

因为这些群的定位很清晰明确，你一看就知道他是干嘛的，你所要做的就是加入或者不加入，而不是

在问：“这是啥群”

五

一个优质的群，还应该有一个特质，就是让群友知道这个群的终极目标，也就是它的结果是什么样

的。PPT群就有一个目标：让每个人有一份属于自己的PPT；“有趣的易经”呢？，它的目标是通过一年

的时间，让大家对易经有个基础的了解；

有了这个目标后，每个群友就更加明确自己和这个群的关系了，以及自己和这个群的距离，以及自己

应该做什么。

这样一来，这个群才成为真正的高质量。

六

其实一个优秀的群和一个优秀的公司是很像的。你想要，你做一个公司，是不是也要有一个明确的目

标？并且通过这个目标吸引一群人？让这群人在实现公司目标的同时，实现自己的目标？

既然这个目标需要大家聚集在一起，就说明这个目标不是一个人可以完成的，所以，这个目标应该越

明确越好，越单一越好。

这样才可以集中人力、物力去实现。这样才是公司，或者组织应该有的样子，应该做的事情。

七

如果你要加入PPT小组，或者加入上面那些微信群，可以加小宝微信（dtsxiaobao，注明对应的群

名）。当然，你也可以和小宝讨论一个优质群应该有的样子。

最后，可以再提一下，每一个群都是会死的，既然大部分公司的寿命不超过3年，那么，大部分微信群

的寿命应该不超过3天。所以，用心对待每一个让你有收获的群吧，因为这是最低成本所能获得的最多

内容：知识、社交以及其他。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

19 NOVEMBER

Characteristics of Organizations

Organization is a tool. As with any tool, the more specialized its given task, the greater its

performance capacity.

Organizations are special-purpose institutions.

They are effective because they concentrate on one task.

If you were to go to the American Lung Association and say, “Ninety percent of all adult Americans

suffer from ingrown toenails; we need your expertise in research, health education, and prevention

to stamp out this dreadful scourge,” you’d get the answer: “We are interested only in what lies

between the hips and the shoulders.”

expertise:

专门知识；专门技能；专长

stamp out

杜绝

dreadful

糟糕透顶的；讨厌的；令人不快的

[ U ] ~ (in sth/in doing sth) expert knowledge or skill in a particular subject, activity or job

:PHRASAL VERB If you stamp something out, you put an end to it.

:very bad or unpleasant

That explains why the American Lung Association or the American Heart Association or any of the

other organizations in the health field get results.

Society, community, family, have to deal with whatever problem arises.

To do so in an organization is “diversification.”

diversification：n. 多样化；变化

And in an organization, diversification means splintering.

splintering：

V-T/V-I If something splinters or is splintered, it breaks into thin, sharp pieces.

使碎成片; 碎成片

It destroys the performance capacity of any organization—whether business, labor union, school,

hospital, community service, or church.

Because the organization is composed of specialists, each with his or her own narrow knowledge

area, its mission must be crystal clear.

The organization must be single-minded, otherwise its members become confused.

They will follow their specialty rather than applying it to the common task.

They will each define “results” in terms of that specialty, imposing their own values on the

organization. Only a clear, focused, and common mission can hold the organization together and

enable it to produce results.

ACTION POINT:

Make sure your organization has a clear focus, a mission that everyone can identify with, and that it

concentrates on producing results.

Post-Capitalist Society

19 NOVEMBER

Characteristics of Organizations

Organization is a tool. As with any tool, the more specialized its given task,

the greater its performance capacity.

Organizations are special-purpose institutions. They are effective be-

cause they concentrate on one task. If you were to go to the American Lung

Association and say, “Ninety percent of all adult Americans suffer from

ingrown toenails; we need your expertise in research, health educa-tion, and

prevention to stamp out this dreadful scourge,” you’d get the an-swer: “We

are interested only in what lies between the hips and the shoulders.” That

explains why the American Lung Association or the American Heart

Association or any of the other organizations in the health

field get results.

Society, community, family, have to deal with whatever problem

arises. To do so in an organization is “diversification.” And in an

organization, di-versification means splintering. It destroys the

performance capacity of any organization—whether business, labor

union, school, hospital, commu-nity service, or church. Because the

organization is composed of special-ists, each with his or her own narrow

knowledge area, its mission must be crystal clear. The organization must

be single-minded, otherwise its mem-bers become confused. They will

follow their specialty rather than apply-ing it to the common task. They

will each define “results” in terms of that specialty, imposing their own

values on the organization. Only a clear, fo-cused, and common mission

can hold the organization together and en-able it to produce results.

ACTION POINT:

Make sure your organization has a clear focus, a mission

that everyone can identify with, and that it concentrates on producing re-

sults.

Post-Capitalist Society

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

书友会应该是什么样子的

一

北京书友会，原来叫做“吴晓波北京书友会”，是一个半自发性的社群组织，由喜欢财经的书友汇集而

成。慢慢地，这些同学到一些后，开始了各种玩，也就有了这么一群人。

书友会是班长负责制，班长之下还有班委，如活动委员、福利委员。班长的主要职责有两个，一方面

是和吴晓波频道对接，执行频道安排的一些商业的或者非商业的任务，一方面根据自己的理解和想

法，对书友会有一个整体的规划，进而维持书友会的正常运转。

书友会并不是一个商业机构，甚至也不是一个有明确界限的组织。在吴晓波频道会员推出之前，书友

会的成员是没有任何标识的：QQ群有6000多人，微信群有2000多人，这就是当时所有的成员。

当时的活动都是班委组织的，偶尔一次的线下分析《大败局》，讨论《从0到1》等。而所谓的班委组

织，其实是班长组织，或者说是整个班委团队组织。

所以，当时活动非常少，一个月最多也就一次。

对于几千人的群体来说，这个活动频次是不对等的。

二

今天有一个书友和我说：“龙哥，我想组织读《魔鬼经济学》，应该如何组织呢？这套书太厚了，我自

己读不下去了”。

我说，你写一个组织的想法，然后发出来就好了。

其实，在很久以前，书友会的班委就鼓励普通书友自发地组织活动。先是任何人只要提出合理的活

动，班委们都会编好活动的报名文章发出来。

再后来，在书友会之下成立了一些个人名次的小班级，如“战略导弹班”等。这些小班书友们可以自由

加入。有的班也有几十人了。

这样的班级我记得有七八个，各个班级也都做过一些活动，这些活动不再有班委发布，而是有“小班班

长”在自己班级群里发布。我记得我参加过周辉班的好几次活动，也着实结识了一些不错的朋友，如王

永斌、曲丽莉等等。

三

书友会一直有各种兴趣小组，户外小组是第一个成立的，是我成立的。当时做了比较详细的规划。加

入户外小组的人需要交纳100元的费用并且填写一个复杂的表格。加入户外小组的书友，可以随时参加

各种户外的活动，我记得第一次去的是香山好汉坡。

成立没多久，户外小组就交给其他人组织了。每次活动的收入也就归活动的组织者了。

还有就是金融小组、红酒小组、宏观经济小组、历史小组、美食小组（一度被称为厨娘小组）等。这

些小组大多有专门的发起人和负责人，他们需要收取加入的费用，这个费用归发起人自己，并不需要

分给班委。

只是他们组织活动需要受到班委的约束，而且需要对“基础会员”提供会员同等的福利。

四

基础会员是书友会为了做标识提供的一种身份。基础会员实行了一年，也就是我做班长时的那一年。

基础会员需要交纳一个相对较多的年费（980元），然后享受 一系列的身份标识和福利。

各个小组的设计活动时，也需要给基础会员提供同等的会员价格或者条件。

五

这几年来，书友会就是这么坐着尝试：让更多人发起活动，让活动可以更容易地发起，让更多人可以

方便地参与活动。

到了2018年，书友会提供了统一的活动报名接口，任何人都可以发起活动，在统一的报名处进行发

布。

而各个活动还是由普通书友发起，如窦鹏旭讲三体，如隗洁发起的PPT小组，如我发起的德鲁克小组。

这些活动，大多是非商业的，或者用一个资格审核，或者用一定的费用（几十块钱）设为门槛。

有一次，和现任班委聊天，我说，大家应该每个人都用自己的兴趣做一个兴趣小组，然后集中在自己

的兴趣小组里，把自己的兴趣和内容做到最好。

至于书友会整体，则由每年轮换的年轻人，新人去操心。

六

在这种模式下，每一个个体，每一个有些许知识生产能力的个体都根据自己的能力和兴趣组建一个兴

趣小组，或者收费，或者免费。只是大家共同在书友会这个牌子下。

而作为班委的那个班长小团体，则负责制定一些和大家都相关的规则，当然，这些规则应该是鼓励而

不是限制各个兴趣个人或许小组的活动。鼓励大家可以通过商业或者非商业的行为在这个社群里获得

各自的需要。

书友会整体肯定是非商业的，而书友会下面的兴趣小组，却可以根据实际情况做一些商业的行为。只

要不违反一些基本的原则就好，比如诚信，互利等。

七

我觉得，这应该是让每个人都最舒服的架构了，也可能是一个最佳的非商业化社群的架构了。一个指

定规则，发现人才的班委团队，加上几个，几十个有内容生产能力或者活动组织能力的个体发起的兴

趣小组。这样的相互扶持，才可以走的长远。才更接近生活。

毕竟，社群只是生活本身。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

20 NOVEMBER

The Federal Principle

Federal：

having a system of government in which the individual states of a country have control over their own affairs, but are

controlled by a central government for national decisions, etc.

联邦制的

Federalism relieves top management from operating duties and sets it free to devote itself to its

proper functions.

Federalism： 联邦制；联邦主义

relieves：

unionism

V-T If something relieves an unpleasant feeling or situation, it makes it less unpleasant or causes it to disappear

completely.

缓解; 减轻; 解除

What the enterprise needs is a principle that gives both the center and the parts genuine

managerial functions and powers.

genuine：

真的；名副其实的

managerial：

经理的；管理的

real; exactly what it appears to be; not artificial

[ usually before noun ] connected with the work of a manager

This principle is federalism, in which the whole of the enterprise is conceived as made up of

autonomous units.

conceived：

认为

autonomous：

国家、地区、组织

自治

V-T/V-I If you conceive something as a particular thing, you consider it to be that thing.

的；有自治权的

( of a country, a region or an organization

) able to govern itself or control its own affairs

The federal enterprise and all its units are in the same business.

The same economic factors determine the future of the whole as well as of all units; the same

basic decisions have to be made for all of them; the same kind and type of executive is needed.

factors：

因素

executive：

（统称公司或机构的）行政领导，领导层

N-COUNT A factor is one of the things that affects an event, decision, or situation.

[ C+sing./pl.v. ] a group of people who run a company or an organization

Hence the whole requires a unified management in charge of the basic functions: the decision

what business the enterprise is in, the organization of the human resources, and the

selection, training, and testing of future leaders.

Hence：

因此；由此

( formal ) for this reason

业务范围的确定，人力资源，以及领导的培养。

广泛的自主权，自己未来的目标

At the same time, each unit is a business by itself.

It produces its own products for a distinct market.

distinct ：

清晰的；清楚的；明白的；明显的

easily or clearly heard, seen, felt, etc.

Each unit must, therefore, have wide autonomy within limits set by the general decisions of the

management of the whole.

Each unit has to have its own management.

The local management will be primarily an operating management; it will be concerned mainly with

the present and immediate future rather than with basic policy.

primarily： 主要地；根本地

mainly

But within a limited scope it will have also to discharge real top-management functions.

discharge：

释放

[ VN ] [ often passive ] to allow sb to leave prison or court

ACTION POINT:

Make maximum use of the federal principle.

The New Society

20 NOVEMBER

The Federal Principle

Federalism relieves top management from operating duties

and sets it free to devote itself to its proper functions.

What the enterprise needs is a principle that gives both the center and the

parts genuine managerial functions and powers. This principle is federalism,

in which the whole of the enterprise is conceived as made up

of autonomous units. The federal enterprise and all its units are in the

same business. The same economic factors determine the future of the

whole as well as of all units; the same basic decisions have to be made for

all of them; the same kind and type of executive is needed. Hence the

whole requires a unified management in charge of the basic functions: the

decision what business the enterprise is in, the organization of the human

resources, and the selection, training, and testing of future leaders.

At the same time, each unit is a business by itself. It produces its own

products for a distinct market. Each unit must, therefore, have wide

auton-omy within limits set by the general decisions of the management

of the whole. Each unit has to have its own management. The local

management will be primarily an operating management; it will be

concerned mainly with the present and immediate future rather than with

basic policy. But within a limited scope it will have also to discharge real

top-management functions.

ACTION POINT:

Make maximum use of the federal principle.

The New Society

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

人是从哪里跳出来的？

吴晓波老师曾经说过：“社群里的活跃分子，领导者都是自己跳出来的。”

这句话一直影响着我，而且，这几年也确实有很多书友就是这么跳出来的。书友会也在这种磕磕绊绊

中走过了5年。

这5年间，也经历了5任班长，几十为班委，上百位各个小组的组长，为社群的活跃和价值、情感传递

做出了有趣的链接。

那么，书友会的这些班长，这些班委，这些小组的组长是怎么跳出来的呢？他们是不是就在在某个场

合突然举起手说：“我要做班长”，或者说“我要做活动委员”，或者说“我要发起红酒小组”？

其实，还真差不过。

第一次班长改选时，还缺一个社群观察的负责人，这个职位没有报名。现场有一个小伙子当即举手

说：“我来做这个吧”。然后，他作为唯一的候选人就成了班委成员，负责社群观察工作。

某一天，一个女生说：“我是卖红酒的，我要组织一个红酒小组。”然后，红酒小组就成立了。大家去

酒庄参观，品鉴红酒，也吃了不少好吃的。

还有美食小组，就是一次和北京营养协会的几个朋友聊天时，现场的一个朋友当即决定组织美食小

组，第一场活动：一碗米饭的故事，也就这么决定了。

第四任班长程华也是这么跳出来的，他说他喜欢做活动，喜欢认识不同的朋友。所以，他加入了班

委，做了一年活动，积累了大量的人气和人脉，成为了第四任班长。

所以，在这个社群里，只要你愿意，就可以跳出来，然后做一些事情。

是呀，跳出来是要从做事情开始的，你总不能跳出来说：“你看我跳的好看么？”，而是应该说：“我来

组织一个溜冰的活动吧”， “我来带领大家吃遍北京的驻京办吧”， “我来带大家了解BAT吧”

然后，你就开始了在书友会的玩乐历程。你组织的活动，一定是你喜欢的，在你组织的这些活动中，

书友会的班委会非常支持你，你的活动会从几个人到十几个人，到几十个人。

或许在某个时刻，你会停止组织活动。不过，这不重要，你开心就好。

或者，你会一直做下去，在你喜欢的这个领域，在书友会里，以最低的成本做一个常识。或者取得快

乐，或者取得经验。

然后，做了挺久后，你想挑战一下做班长的感觉，然后你去申请做班长，到了改选的日期，只要你足

够的努力，你就会是下一任班长。然后，在为了的一年或者两年里，实践一下自己的想法。

就这样，你就是一个成功跳出来的班长。

在你，以及很多个你在组织兴趣小组时，你对于兴趣小组的活动组织有足够的决定权。你可以按自己

的想法，在书友会的大框架下自由地发挥。

因为，只有这样，你才可以自由地体验管理一个社群（注意，不是微信群），才可以体验组织一些对

社交有需求的人是一件多美开心而有创意的事情。你才可以对做班长有足够的期待。

这样的你，跳出来后，经过兴趣小组的发挥，才可以做的更好。

你，准备跳出来了么？如果是，请加微信dtsxiaobao（备注：书友会）。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

21 NOVEMBER

Federal Decentralization: Strengths

Decentralization:n. 分散；非集权化；（人口、工业等的）疏散

Strengths:n. 优势，强项（strength的复数形式）；长处

The greatest strength of the federal principle is that it alone of all known principles of organization

prepares and tests people for top-management responsibility at an early stage.

In “federal decentralization” a company is organized into a number of autonomous businesses.

Each unit has responsibility for its own performance, its own results, and its own contribution to the

total company.

Each unit has its own management which, in effect, runs its own “autonomous business.”

In a federally organized structure, each manager is close enough to business performance and

business results to focus on them.

The federal principle therefore enables us to divide large and complex organizations into a number

of businesses that are small and simple enough that managers know what they are doing and can

direct themselves toward the performance of the whole instead of becoming prisoners of their own

work, effort, and skill.

Because management by objectives and self-control become effective, the number of people or

units under one manager is no longer limited by the span of control; it is limited only by the much

wider span of managerial responsibility.

span：

the length of time that sth lasts or is able to continue

持续时间

The greatest strength of the federal principle is, however, with respect to manager development.

with respect to：关于；至于

This by itself makes it the principle to be used in preference to any other.

ACTION POINT:

Give people maximum responsibility by organizing according to the federal principle.

Become an organization that develops numerous people.

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

21 NOVEMBER

Federal Decentralization: Strengths

The greatest strength of the federal principle is that it alone of all known

principles of organization prepares and tests people for top-management

responsibility at an early stage.

In “federal decentralization” a company is organized into a number of au-

tonomous businesses. Each unit has responsibility for its own perfor-mance, its

own results, and its own contribution to the total company. Each unit has its own

management which, in effect, runs its own “au-

tonomous business.”

In a federally organized structure, each manager is close enough to

business performance and business results to focus on them. The federal

principle therefore enables us to divide large and complex organizations

into a number of businesses that are small and simple enough that man-

agers know what they are doing and can direct themselves toward the per-

formance of the whole instead of becoming prisoners of their own work,

effort, and skill. Because management by objectives and self-control

become effective, the number of people or units under one manager is no

longer limited by the span of control; it is limited only by the much wider

span of managerial responsibility. The greatest strength of the federal

principle is, however, with respect to manager development. This by itself

makes it the principle to be used in preference to any other.

ACTION POINT:

Give people maximum responsibility by organizing ac-

cording to the federal principle. Become an organization that develops

nu-merous people.

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

包不同之死

包不同是《天龙八部》里的一个配角，戏份不多不少，却很有意思。

首先，他是金风庄庄主，这是太湖上的一个庄子，金庸没有说这个庄子多大，总不会小过阿朱的听香

水榭和阿碧的琴韵小筑吧。

而且，包不同武功相当不错，他拿着慕容家的黑旗也收罗了不少下属，这个人还算有一定的势力。

同时，他又是慕容家的家臣。慕容家这一代的掌门人，或者说家长是慕容复。慕容家是鲜卑族燕国皇

室后裔，世代以恢复皇权为己任。而作为家臣的包不同也在为慕容家的这个目标奋斗。

最后，包不同还是个杠精，一出面就杠段誉，后来又杠萧峰，我每次看他出场都在想，这家伙会死在

谁手里呢？

只是没想到他居然死在了自己的主公慕容复手里。

包不同是老三，慕容家有四个家臣，老大是青云庄庄主邓百川，老二是赤霞庄庄主公冶乾，老三是金

风庄庄主包不同，老四是玄霜庄庄主风波恶。

慕容复居中，住在参合庄，形成了守卫和互相呼应的布局。

很显然，在这个架构中，慕容家是绝对的老大，四大家臣则是慕容家恢复皇权，或者称霸江湖的护佑

力量：以参合庄为中心，其他四庄全力护佑、协助，为大燕国的复兴竭尽全力。

这就是慕容家的整体架构。

虽然包不同是家臣，可也是金风庄庄主，这就意味着，包不同是有很大的处事权的；同理，邓百川、

公冶乾、风波恶也有很大的处事权，只要不违反大燕复国的目标，四大家臣是可以根据自己的能力、

理解以及现实情况做自己认为最正确的事情。

比如，风波恶就可以按照自己的性子去和丐帮打架。而包不同则会收拾闯入阿朱妹子的听香水榭的青

城派和蓬莱派，然后根据情况，又把他们收入麾下。

这些事情的处置，金风庄庄主都不需要请示慕容复。

就像邓百川去找萧峰单挑也不需要慕容复的批准。

显然，慕容家的这个架构是德鲁克笔下的联邦架构：慕容复只是确定整体的方向，而各个庄主根据自

己的情况独自完整各自的业务，需要配合时，就完全配合。

后来，大家都聚集到了慕容复身边，去闯缥缈峰，闯少林寺，最后在曼陀罗庄，慕容复做了一个决

定。

这个决定很诡异，慕容复要拜失势的大理前太子段延庆为义父，要协助段延庆恢复大理国皇帝的身

份，同时自己获得拥立之功。进而成为大理国皇帝。

这个决定听起来像是脑袋被驴踢了。不过，这是在那个环境下慕容复自认为自己做出的最好的选择。

而这时，包不同站了出来，当场表示反对，还发表了一篇慷慨激昂的演讲，用常年抬杠的经验来痛斥

慕容复为不忠不孝不仁不义之人。

你投靠大理，日后再行反叛，那是不忠；你拜段延庆为父，孝于段氏，于慕容氏为不孝，孝于慕容，

于段氏为不孝；你日后残杀大理群臣，是为不仁，你……

在包不同话没说完，即被慕容复一掌打中后背心，当场死亡。

包不同死后，邓百川、公冶乾，风波恶也兔死狐悲，收拾了包不同的尸体， 和慕容家永远说了再见。

今天我在想，包不同该死么？慕容复杀他啥错了么？这件事的本质是什么呢？

邓公孙包风四大家臣，虽然各自有庄，称为庄主，甚至还有自己的武装力量和江湖地位（邓百川人称

掌法江南第二），究其本质，还是慕容家的家臣，其开庄固然为自己的能力以及各字的目的，然后，

他们整体的目的还是慕容家的复国。

这个人物是包括参合庄在内的五庄共同的目的，甚至是唯一目的。

而这个团体的最高领导人是慕容复，在那种紧急情况下，当慕容复做出决定后，作为家臣的四个人应

该全力支持，而不是当众给出反对意见。

德鲁克认为，联邦的最高管理层，也就是慕容复拥有，也必须拥有最高的决策权。四个庄，不管他们

武功多高，势力多大，多么有有理有据，他们也必须执行最高管理层的命令。毕竟，他们是自治，但

不是独立，而且永远不是独立。

而且，他们之所以自治，之所以有很高的自治权，独立权，是因为这样可以更佳地实现大家的共同目

标：复国，而不是其他的。

今天我在群里说，包不同该死，加入我是慕容复，我也想一掌打死包不同。不过，我会考虑邓、公

冶、风三人的感受，也可能做出不同的选择。

不过，我坚定地认为，包不同该死。

大纲

  1. 交代包不同的身份、经历以及死因。

百字摘要

金庸案例

老大，邓百川，青云庄庄主

老二，公冶乾，赤霞庄庄主

老三，包不同，金风庄庄主

老四，风波恶，玄霜庄庄主

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

22 NOVEMBER

Federal Decentralization: Requirements

Decentralization：n. 分散；非集权化；（人口、工业等的）疏散

As a minimum the unit must contribute a profit to the company rather than merely contribute to the

profit of the company.

Federal decentralization has stringent requirements.

stringent：

法律、规则、规章等

( of a law, rule, regulation, etc.

) very strict and that must be obeyed

严格的；严厉的

Federal decentralization is applicable only where a company can truly be organized into a number

of genuine “businesses.”

This is its basic limitation.

As a minimum the unit must contribute a profit to the company.

And it must be a genuine profit determined by the objective judgment of the marketplace.

genuine：

真的；名副其实的

judgment：n. 判断；裁判；判决书；辨别力

marketplace：

real; exactly what it appears to be; not artificial

场竞争

( the marketplace ) [ sing. ] the activity of competing with other companies to buy and sell goods, services, etc.

Federal decentralization will work only if the top-management job is clearly defined and thought

through. Federalization, if properly applied, makes top management capable of doing its own job

precisely because it does not have to worry about operations, but can concentrate on direction,

strategy, objectives, and key decisions for the future.

The federal principle demands great responsibility from the operating units, the autonomous

businesses.

联邦体系对自治的组织有很高的责任要求。

市

They are given the maximum of autonomy; and this requires that they assume the maximum of

responsibility.

他给予他们最大的自治，也就要求了他们最大的责任。

Federal decentralization requires centralized controls and common measurements.

联邦分权要求集中控制也统一的考核。

Both the managers of the autonomous businesses and top management must know what is

expected of each business, what is meant by “performance,” and what developments are

important.

自治组织的领导层和最高领导层都应该清楚每个组织的目标，绩效，以及发展目标。

To be able to give autonomy one must have confidence.

confidence：

信心；信任；信赖

[ U ] ~ (in sb/sth) the feeling that you can trust, believe in and be sure about the abilities or good qualities of sb/sth

自治的人必须证明自己值得信任。

And this requires controls that make opinions unnecessary.

这就意味着，对于控制来说，意见不重要。

A federal unit of a company is autonomous, but it is not independent and should not be.

联邦的单元是自治的，但它不是独立的，而且永远都都不应该是。

Its autonomy is a means toward better performance for the entire company.

他的自治，是为了人整个企业有更好的业绩。

ACTION POINT:

Ensure that executives of your autonomous units have maximum autonomy and maximum

responsibility. Implement this by establishing a system of controls that makes performance or the

lack of performance very evident.

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

22 NOVEMBER

Federal Decentralization: Requirements

As a minimum the unit must contribute a profit to the company

rather than merely contribute to the profit of the company.

Federal decentralization has stringent requirements. Federal decentral-

ization is applicable only where a company can truly be organized into

Anumber of genuine “businesses.” This is its basic limitation. As a mini-

mum the unit must contribute a profit to the company. And it must be

Agenuine profit determined by the objective judgment of the marketplace.

Federal decentralization will work only if the top-management job is

clearly defined and thought through. Federalization, if properly applied,

makes top management capable of doing its own job precisely because it does

not have to worry about operations, but can concentrate on direction, strategy,

objectives, and key decisions for the future. The federal principle demands

great responsibility from the operating units, the autonomous busi-nesses.

They are given the maximum of autonomy; and this requires that they assume

the maximum of responsibility. Federal decentralization requires centralized

controls and common measurements. Both the managers of the autonomous

businesses and top management must know what is expected of each

business, what is meant by “performance,” and what developments are

important. To be able to give autonomy one must have confidence. And this

requires controls that make opinions unnecessary. A federal unit of a com-

pany is autonomous, but it is not independent and should not be. Its auton-

omy is a means toward better performance for the entire company.

ACTION POINT:

Ensure that executives of your autonomous units have

maximum autonomy and maximum responsibility. Implement this by es-

tablishing a system of controls that makes performance or the lack of per-

formance very evident.

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

陈近南的一天

听说青木堂的负责人尹香主被鳌拜害死后，陈近南就一直在考虑青木堂香主的人选。

按惯例，这个人应该从青木堂里成长出来，当老的香主根据自己的判断制定一个接任人报给陈近南，

陈近南通过各方面考察后，觉得还可以，这个人也就成了我新香主了。

目前的香主都是信得过的，他们推荐的接任人也都是可以的，所以，这个也就成了惯例。

尹香主是意外死的，而且正当壮年，所以，没有接班人。

青木堂有两个人有能力接任香主，这两个人是李力世和关安基。这两人的能力和资历都不错，只是按

惯例，没有人报上来。陈近南也就没法直接任命。

尹香主死后，在李力世和关安基的带领下，整个青木堂发誓要为尹香主报仇，并且在万云龙面前发下

来誓愿：谁杀了鳌拜，就认谁为青木堂堂主。

在他们想来，杀鳌拜的也就是青木堂的这几个人，最大可能也就是李力世和关安基了。

李力世和关安基各自做着各种准备，准备杀死鳌拜，准备做青木堂的香主。

陈近南看出两个人的争竞后，一方面觉得是好事，一方面也当心事件恶化。考虑一段时间后，决定亲

自到北京来解决青木堂香主的事情。

这一天，陈近南接到青木堂的报告，鳌拜已经被关，青木堂决定冒险去狱中杀死鳌拜，带队人是关安

基。陈近南预感到不管杀死鳌拜与否，青木堂香主的事情都应该告一个段落了。

随即，陈近南带着其他九个香主，来到北京。

到北京后，陈近南叫来李力世和关安基，还有几个首领，听过他们汇报后，已经了解了情况：

  1. 在这次攻击监狱事件中，鳌拜被杀

  2. 杀鳌拜的人是一个小太监

  3. 目前李力世和关安基还在争夺香主一职，并没有好的解决方案

陈近南了解了一下杀死鳌拜的小太监的情况，随即做出了一个决定：任命这个小太监为青木堂堂主。

有了这个决定后，陈近南先是松了一口气，随即开始对韦小宝做基本的调查。

小宝是茅十八带入江湖的，就先从茅十八开始吧。

一名汉子向韦小宝道：“韦爷请到这里喝杯茶，总舵主想先和茅爷谈谈。”当下将茅十八抬了进去。

从茅十八处了解到基本情况后，陈近南就直接叫来小宝了解。在了解到小宝的经历，在清宫中的地

位，小宝的智慧后，陈近南就下了决定了：收小宝为弟子，同时让他做青木堂的香主。一方面了解青

木堂香主的问题，一方面天地会也确实需要小宝这样的香主，天地会武功高的不少，脑子清楚的却没

几个：

总舵主微笑道：“不是笑你！我见了心中欢喜，觉得你记性、悟性都不错，是个可造之材。那一招‘白马

翻蹄’，海大富故意教错了，但你转到‘鲤鱼托鳃’之时，能自行略加变化，并不拘泥于死招。那好得

很！”

接下来，陈近南就收了小宝为自己弟子，简单完成拜师之礼后，陈近南就带着自己的弟子到了外面，

和其他就位香主还有李力世、关安基等见面。

陈近南道：“众位兄弟，今日我收了个小徒。”向韦小宝一指，道：“就是他！”

陈近南待韦小宝和众人相见已毕，说道：“众位兄弟，我收了这小徒后，想要他入我天地会。”众人齐

声道：“那再好也没有了。”

看到总舵主收了弟子，并且加入了天地会，李力世、关安基等马上就知道什么意思了。李力世马上

说：“大夥儿在万云龙大哥灵位之前发过的誓，决不能说了不算。如这样的立誓等如放屁，以后还能在

万云龙大哥的灵位之前立什么誓，许什么愿？韦小宝兄弟年纪虽小，我李力世愿拥他为本堂香主。”

关安基看到李力世表态了，自己也马上表态：”李大哥的话什是。韦兄弟机警过人，在总舵主调教之

下，他日定是一位威震江湖的少年英侠。关安基愿拥韦小宝兄弟为青木堂香主。“

小宝这香主就算做成了。

陈近南的心也就放下了。接下来，陈近南和11个香主开了一个闭门会议，聊各地的情况，包括收成

（也就是赚钱情况），人员情况（西南死的人比较多，香主还被剁了一条胳膊），零零总总，就散会

了。

陈近南看天不早了，就让小宝先回皇宫去，自己收拾一下这里，让小宝报告皇帝后来搜一些东西出

来，也算给小宝一场功劳。

临走前，陈近南对小宝说：“三天后，我在XX处教你武功。”

这一天也就结束了，陈近南完成了一件很重要的事情，因为，对于他来说，任命香主是第一重要的事

情。而且这件事，只能是自己做。

而且只能是自己做的，还有和新香主明确天地会的目标：

你要入会，倒也可以。不过我们干的是反清复明的大事，以汉人的江山为重，自己的身家性命为轻。

再者，会里规矩严得很，如果犯了，处罚很重，你须得好好想一想。

同时，陈近南还把自己的决定权和天地会的目标写到了入会誓词里：

“天地万有，回复大明，灭绝胡虏。吾人当同生同死，仿桃园故事，约为兄弟，姓洪名金兰，合为一

家。拜天为父，拜地为母，日为兄，月为姊妹，复拜五祖及始祖万云龙为洪家之全神灵。吾人以甲寅

七月二十五日丑时为生时。凡昔二京十三省，当一心同体。今朝廷王侯非王侯，将相非将相，人心动

摇，即为明朝回复、胡虏剿灭之天兆。吾人当行陈近南之命令，历五湖四海，以求英雄豪杰。焚香设

誓，顺天行道，恢复明朝，报仇雪耻。歃血誓盟，神明降鉴。”

这些，也都是他，陈近南，天地会总舵主才有的权力，所以，他才要快马加鞭，带着九位香主，来到

北京，处理青木堂香主的事情。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

23 NOVEMBER

Reservation of Authority

Reservation：

( also re·serve ) [ C ] an area of land in the US that is kept separate for Native Americans to live in

美洲人划出的）保留地，居留地

Authority：[ U ] the power to give orders to people 权力；威权；当权（地位）

（美国为土著

There must be a kind of “supremacy clause” reserving to central management the decisions that

affect the business as a whole and its long-range future welfare.

supremacy：

至高无上；最大

[ U ] ~ (over sb/sth) a position in which you have more power, authority or status than anyone else

权力；最高权威；最高地位

clause：an item in a legal document that says that a particular thing must or must not be done （法律文件等的）条款

welfare：the general health, happiness and safety of a person, an animal or a group （个体或群体的）幸福，安全与健康

Top management in a decentralized company must think through carefully what decisions it

reserves for itself.

decentralized：

V-T/V-I To decentralize government or a large organization means to move some departments away from the

main administrative area, or to give more power to local departments.

分权

For there are decisions that have to do with the entire company, its integrity, and its future.

integrity：

完整；完好

( formal ) the state of being whole and not divided

These decisions can be made only by somebody who sees the whole and is responsible for

the whole.

Specifically, there must be three reserved areas if the business is to remain a whole rather than

splinter into fragments.

splinter：

（木头、金属、玻璃等的）尖碎片，

尖细条

a small thin sharp piece of wood, metal, glass, etc. that has broken off a larger piece

fragments：

N-COUNT A fragment of something is a small piece or part of it.

碎片; 片段

Top management, and top management alone, can make the decision on what technologies,

markets, and products to go into, what businesses to start and what businesses to abandon, and

also what the basic values, beliefs, and principles of the company are.

目标、财权、人权。

Second, top management must reserve to itself the control of the allocation of the key resource

of capital.

Both the supply of capital and its investment are top-management responsibilities that cannot be

turned over to the autonomous units of a federal organization.

Third, the other key resource is people.

The people in a federally organized company, and especially managers and key professionals, are a

resource of the entire company rather than of any one unit.

The company’s policies with respect to people and decisions on key appointments in the

decentralized autonomous businesses are top-management decisions— though of course,

autonomous business managers need to take an active part in them.

ACTION POINT:

Reserve certain key decisions for top management, especially those having to do with the mission,

values, and direction of the organization； the allocation of capital; and the selection of key

people。

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

23 NOVEMBER

Reservation of Authority

There must be a kind of “supremacy clause” reserving to central

management the decisions that affect the business as a whole and its long-

range future welfare.

Top management in a decentralized company must think through care-

fully what decisions it reserves for itself. For there are decisions that have to

do with the entire company, its integrity, and its future. These deci-sions can

be made only by somebody who sees the whole and is responsible for the

whole. Specifically, there must be three reserved areas if the business is to

remain a whole rather than splinter into fragments. Top management, and top

management alone, can make the decision on what technologies, markets, and

products to go into, what businesses to start and what busi-nesses to abandon,

and also what the basic values, beliefs, and principles of the company are.

Second, top management must reserve to itself the con-trol of the allocation

of the key resource of capital. Both the supply of capi-tal and its investment

are top-management responsibilities that cannot be

turned over to the autonomous units of a federal organization.

Third, the other key resource is people. The people in a federally orga-

nized company, and especially managers and key professionals, are a re-

source of the entire company rather than of any one unit. The company’s

policies with respect to people and decisions on key appointments in the

decentralized autonomous businesses are top-management decisions—

though of course, autonomous business managers need to take an active

part in them.

ACTION POINT:

Reserve certain key decisions for top management, espe-

cially those having to do with the mission, values, and direction of the

orga-nization; the allocation of capital; and the selection of key people.

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

有钱人的烦恼

你们现在很幸福，因为你们只有一个烦恼 —– “没钱”；等你们有钱了，你们的烦恼就多了！

颜怀江博士在私人银行家培训中的讲话

颜博士的这句话好有道理，我现在就一个烦恼：没钱。所以，我现在需要做事来赚钱，我每天想的也

是如何赚钱，我总想着，只要赚够足够多的钱，我现在的那些烦恼就没有了。

今天李丹在群里说了一句话：生活中百分之九十的烦恼可以用钱来解决。然后我加了一句，剩下的

10per可以用钱来缓解。

这个观点大部分“穷人”是相信的。比如你，比如我。

颜博士是为富人服务的，颜博士对富人有很多研究，他说了这句话后，有几个专业人士就总结了富人

的十大烦恼：

一曰巨额财产带来的心态失衡；二曰缺乏规划带来的不堪后果；三曰信息泄露带来的安全风险；四曰

财富失控带来的危机；五曰婚姻变化带来的财富损失；六曰不孝儿孙的败家行为；七曰公私不分带来

的财富风险；八曰意外变化带来的财产损失；九曰税收处理带来的财产风险；十曰移民身份安排带来

的财富损失。

这十大烦恼，统称为富人的十大烦恼，而我是没有这些烦恼的，我有两个儿子，既不担心他们胡乱花

钱，也不担心他们抢夺财产：本来就没有嘛。

看了这些问题，然后我再问你，你愿意做穷人？还是愿意做富人？

你肯定假装沉思半响，然后说：“我还是做富人吧。”

是呀，既然有机会做富人，为啥不做富人呢？难道我不要子女争夺财富，像侯耀文遗产问题；难道就

不要别人整天惦记你的钱，搞得我生活乱七八糟？

当然怕，可是，作为穷人的我，根本不能理解这些。怕啥？能有多怕？

然后，我就开始想象我的有钱生活了：我找人帮我解决规划问题呀，颜博士就是很好的人选嘛，你

贵？没事，我有钱。

是呀，对于有钱人来说，虽然有很多烦恼，可是我是有钱可以解决这些烦恼的。解决完这些烦恼后，

我还是有很多钱，我还是可以享受我的生活。

这就是有钱的快乐。

唯一遗憾的是，我没钱，所以只好去学论语，去学颜回：一箪食，一瓢饮，挤在廉租房，我也不改其

乐。乐哉，我也！

是呀，我只是接受贫穷，却并不享受贫穷。因为对于我来说，快乐是我的底线。而在底线之上，我也

会享受财富。

等我有钱了，我会天天吃红烧肉。至于那十大烦恼？找老颜来帮我解决，反正我有钱。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

24 NOVEMBER

Simulated Decentralization

The main rule is to look upon simulated decentralization as a last resort only.

resort：

( the first/last/final ~ ) the first or last course of action that you should or can take in a particular situation

应急措施；可首先

（或最后）采取的手段

look upon：PHRASAL VERB If you look on or look upon someone or something in a particular way, you think of them in that way.

把…当作

Whenever a unit can be set up as a business, no design principle can match federal

decentralization.

We have learned, however, that a great many large companies cannot be divided into genuine

businesses.

Yet they have clearly outgrown the limits of size and complexity of the functional or of the team

structure.

These are the companies that are increasingly turning to “simulated decentralization” as the

answer to their organization problem.

Simulated decentralization forms structural units that are not businesses but which are still set up

as if they were businesses, with maximum possible autonomy, with their own management, and

with at least a “simulation” of profit-and-loss responsibility.

They buy from and sell to each other using “transfer prices” determined internally rather than by an

outside market.

Or their “profits” are arrived at by internal allocation of costs to which then, often, a “standard fee,”

such as 20 percent of costs, is added.

ACTION POINT:

Produce internal competition by using “micro” profit-centers when feasible.

feasible：

可行的；行得通的

that is possible and likely to be achieved

Attribute revenue to each unit and match revenue with its cost.

revenue：

[ U ] ( also rev·enues [ pl. ] ) the money that a government receives from taxes or that an organization, etc. receives

from its business

Attribute：

财政收入；税收收入；收益

sth to sth to say or believe that sth is the result of a particular thing

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

把…归因于；认为…是由于

24 NOVEMBER

Simulated Decentralization

The main rule is to look upon simulated decentralization

as a last resort only.

Whenever a unit can be set up as a business, no design principle can

match federal decentralization. We have learned, however, that a great many

large companies cannot be divided into genuine businesses. Yet

they have clearly outgrown the limits of size and complexity of the func-

tional or of the team structure. These are the companies that are increas-

ingly turning to “simulated decentralization” as the answer to their

organization problem. Simulated decentralization forms structural units

that are not businesses but which are still set up as if they were

businesses, with maximum possible autonomy, with their own

management, and with at least a “simulation” of profit-and-loss

responsibility. They buy from and sell to each other using “transfer

prices” determined internally rather than by an outside market. Or their

“profits” are arrived at by internal allocation of costs to which then, often,

a “standard fee,” such as 20 percent of costs, is added.

ACTION POINT:

Produce internal competition by using “micro” profit-

centers when feasible. Attribute revenue to each unit and match revenue

with its cost.

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

东方不败的毁灭之路

东方不败死了，死在自己的闺房里。

前一秒，东方不败还在绣花，想着自己可以秀出和玫瑰争艳的手绢来给心爱的莲弟用，后一秒就被任

我行、令狐冲、向问天等人围攻受伤，然后被任我行一箭穿心刺死。

东方不败精心架构的江湖也就这么烟消云散了，任我行理所当然地接受了这一切，就像几年前东方不

败从任我行手中抢过去。

东方不败智计过人，在任我行佩服的三个人里，他排第一。几年的时间里，从日月神教的最底层爬到

了最高层，进入了神教的接班人序列，而且是唯一的接班人。

为了确保自己能接班，东方不败还设计囚禁了任我行，成为了权倾江湖的日月神教教主。

东方不败无功决定，他的名号既称不败，也确实没有败过。他号称武功天下第一，虽然有很多人唾弃

他的为人，却没有人质疑他的武功。在最后的实战中，他以一人之力对抗当世武功最强的几位：令狐

冲、任我行、向问天等等，还是不落败迹。要不是任盈盈凌辱他的莲弟，让东方不败分心，这场大战

孰笑道最后还真说不准。

而且，在任我行被囚禁的几年里，东方不败一直牢牢控制着日月神教。权势没得说。

那么，这样一个聪明人，这样一个武功高绝的人，这样一个权倾天下的人，怎么那么快就毁灭了呢？

而且输得那么彻底？

有人说是东方不败阴阳不分，这并不是问题呀，武则天还掌权呢；中国历史上女性掌权的时间不一定

被男热短；有人说东方不败是篡位自立，没有合法性，这更没问题了。燕王朱棣也是篡位，还成了千

古一帝，修大典、下西洋、建北京、改吏治等等等等，只要有功绩，篡位并不是问题。

那么，是什么让这位雄霸天下，不对，是雌霸天下的东方不败在这么短的时间里就失去了权柄，他的

智计，他的武功都摆不上用场呢？

这样从日月神教的架构说起。

简单来说，日月神教可以分为几部分：管理层、内勤、一线作战人员和一线辅助人员。

管理层就东方不败，莲弟代表他行使职权。这个也是符合权力的机制的，毕竟，不能要求老大都事必

躬亲吧。

然后就是内勤，也就是在内部帮主大家做记录，长老们抢回东西来，帮着整理、管理起来。长老们需

要什么支持，他们负责提供一下。如此而已。

接着就是一线作战人员，如风雷堂堂主童百熊，雕侠上官云、黄面尊者贾布等。这些人支撑着日月神

教的武力值，也保卫着黑木崖的安全以及日月神教的威望。

最后就是童百熊等人的身边助理以及相关的江湖势力了，他们不直接支撑神教的武力值，却会协助童

百熊们，共同为神教做着直接的贡献。

这个架构是很完美的。东方不败甚至不需要过多地关注就可以做一个不错的神教教主，他尽可以躲在

深宫绣花，前面有童百熊们帮我料理外部事情，内部有内勤帮他助理分配等问题。

童百熊们在组织内有足够的地位，就像天地会的十大香主，红花会的各位当家的。大家都会进全力为

神教服务的，毕竟，大家都是心系神教的呀。

可是，东方不败居然让内勤人员肆意侮辱一线人员，人内勤人员的身份高过一线人员，这就给自己埋

下了巨大的隐患：当外部风险来的时候，一线人员随即反水。

右首一间小石屋中出来四人，都身穿紫袍，走了过来。为首一人道：“恭喜上官长老立了大功，贾长老

怎地没来？”上官云道：“贾长老力战殉难，已报答了教主的大恩。”那人道：“原来如此，然则上官长老

立时便可升级了。”上官云道：“若蒙教主提拔，决不敢忘了老兄的好处。”那人听他答应行贿，眉花眼

笑的道：“我们可先谢谢你啦！”

随着上官云的反水，东方不败的一线作战体系也就瓦解了，他的管理层、内勤层在任我行面前没有任

何机会。

这次打斗中，东方不败死了，即使他侥幸没死，他还有为他卖力的人么？没有了童百熊、上官云等人

的东方不败，只是一个独夫而已。

日月神教的东方时代在内勤人员凌驾于童百熊等人之上时已经结束了，任我行只是做了这个踢门人。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

【其他】

八股文：

破题、承题、起讲、入题

起股、中股、后股、束股

破题：每篇开始以两句点破题意，称为“破题”。

承题：承接破题而进行阐发，称为“承题”

起讲：即开始议论

入题：起讲后的入手之处。

起股：

中股：

后股：

束股：

从起股到束股，每组都有两排排比对偶的文字，共为八股。

大结：尾又有数十字或百余字的总结性文字，也称大结

19.9.2

每篇开始以两句点破题意，称为“破题”。

英文原文

25 NOVEMBER

Building Blocks of Organization

Blocks：

Contribution determines ranking and placement.

“What activities belong together and what activities belong apart?”

A searching analysis is needed that groups activities by the kind of contribution they make.

There are four major groups of activities, if distinguished by their contribution.

distinguished:

区分；辨别；分清

(between) A and B | ~ A from B to recognize the difference between two people or things

First, result-producing activities—that is, activities that produce measurable results that can be

related, directly or indirectly, to the results and performance of the entire enterprise.

Second, support activities that, while needed and even essential, do not by themselves produce

results but have results only through the use made of their “output” by other components within

the business.

Third, activities that have no direct or indirect relationship to the results of the business,

activi-ties that are truly ancillary. They are hygiene and housekeeping activities.

ancillary：

辅助的；补充的

hygiene：

卫生

housekeeping：

家务（尤指采购和管理开

providing necessary support to the main work or activities of an organization

[ U ] the practice of keeping yourself and your living and working areas clean in order to prevent illness and disease

支）

the work involved in taking care of a house, especially shopping and managing money

Finally, is the top-management activity.

Among the result-producing activities, there are some that directly bring in revenues (or in service

institutions, directly produce “patient care” or “learning”).

revenues：

公司、组织或政

府的) 收入

N-UNCOUNT Revenue is money that a company, organization, or government receives from people. (

Here belong innovating activities, selling and all the work needed to do a systematic and

organized selling job.

innovating：

创新 革新

systematic：

成体系的；系统的；有条理的；有计划

V-I To innovate means to introduce changes and new ideas in the way something is done or made.

有步骤的

;

done according to a system or plan, in a thorough, efficient or determined way

Here also belongs the treasury function, that is, the supply and management of money in the

business.

treasury：

the Treasury ) [ sing.+sing./pl.v. ] (in Britain, the US and some other countries) the government department that controls

public money

（英国、美国和其他一些国家的）财政部

Key activities should never be subordinated to nonkey activities.

Revenue-producing activities should never be subordinated to nonrevenue-producing activities.

And support activities should never be mixed with revenue-producing and result-contributory

activities.

ACTION POINT:

Give result-producing activities high visibility in your organization.

Make sure support activities are subordinated to result-producing activities.

Consider delegating employee welfare activities to employee teams.

welfare：

（个体或群体的）幸福，安全与健康

delegating：

the general health, happiness and safety of a person, an animal or a group

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

25 NOVEMBER

Building Blocks of Organization

Contribution determines ranking and placement.

“What activities belong together and what activities belong apart?”

Asearching analysis is needed that groups activities by the kind of contribution

they make. There are four major groups of activities, if distin-guished by their

contribution. First, result-producing activities—that is, activities that produce

measurable results that can be related, directly or indirectly, to the results and

performance of the entire enterprise. Second, support activities that, while

needed and even essential, do not by them-selves produce results but have

results only through the use made of their “output” by other components

within the business. Third, activities that have no direct or indirect relationship

to the results of the business, activi-ties that are truly ancillary. They are

hygiene and housekeeping activities. Finally, is the top-management activity.

Among the result-producing activi-ties, there are some that directly bring in

revenues (or in service institutions, directly produce “patient care” or

“learning”). Here belong innovating ac-tivities, selling and all the work needed

to do a systematic and organized selling job. Here also belongs the treasury

function, that is, the supply and

management of money in the business.

Key activities should never be subordinated to nonkey activities.

Revenue-producing activities should never be subordinated to nonrev-

enue-producing activities. And support activities should never be mixed

with revenue-producing and result-contributory activities.

ACTION POINT:

Give result-producing activities high visibility in your or-

ganization. Make sure support activities are subordinated to result-

producing activities. Consider delegating employee welfare activities to

employee teams.

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

愤怒的妈妈么，你们是从哪里来的？

网上有很多愤怒的妈妈，也就是俗称不辅导作业，母慈子孝，一辅导作业，鸡飞狗跳。

按照网上那些段子，家里有个小学生、初中生的，家里就很难安宁了。而这些孩子长大后，依然很优

秀，只是他们有了孩子后，还是会对着孩子生气，还是会担心孩子长大在这个世界上没有竞争力。

他们的口头禅是：“时代不同了”

是呀，时代每天都在不同，唯一不变的就是，我们放心不下的那些孩子，终究会长大，终究会从我们

手里接过这个世界，终究从变成他们自己希望成为的样子，然后用他们的样子要求他们的孩子：你居

然！！！

那么这些愤怒的妈妈，他们的愤怒来自哪里呢？来自自己不管如何说，孩子都不听；来自已经初一的

孩子居然还不懂小学的英语词汇；来自那么简单的问题，自己也给孩子讲过那么多遍了，孩子还是不

懂。

然后，妈妈们就开始愤怒了。为什么？为什么？为什么我这么努力，孩子还是没有进步？

其实，妈妈们忘记了，忘记了自己的小时候，忘记了自己小时候，当自己的妈妈在吼的时候，自己其

实是在想：“啥时能出去玩？”

至于妈妈在吼什么，一点都没听，“她总是在吼，也就那样，吼过了就过了。”

如此而已。

两个人交流，如果你把孩子当人的话，那么，你和孩子之间的交流就是两个人的交流。

两个人交流，关键点并不在谁讲，不管是你讲，还是马拉松冠军讲，还是某个知名的幼教专家讲，都

不重要，重要的是谁在听。

是的，你的孩子在听，而你在讲。这场交流的主角是孩子，而不是你。因为孩子在听。

而你，为了促成这次交流的成功，你应该用孩子的方式来交流。你应该想孩子想着在想什么，他们想

要什么。

你给他讲多好的方法，他们没听，又有什么用？你吼叫他就听了么？你哭惨他就听了么？你有没有想

过，用心，而不是用语言想过：我的孩子，在这个时间点在想什么？

你不停地说，不停地说，仿佛只要你说，孩子就会听。其实，孩子早就神游天外了，等着你的吼完，

然后该干嘛干嘛。

你有没有想过，这种交流应该是孩子参与的，孩子提问的，甚至是孩子主导的。应该是孩子说：“妈

妈，我为什么做作业要做到12点呀？”“妈妈，我这个题为什么这么难呀？”“妈妈，我为什么要学习英语

呀”。

只有孩子有这些孩子气的问题时，只有他们对你说出这些问题是，你和孩子之间的交流才会有效，才

是交流。

孩子需要的不是你教个他知识，教给他方法，他什么都不需要。他需要的就是玩，以及其他。

而你不同，你需要了解孩子，和孩子交流，然后必要时做一些引导。

你需要知道孩子的思考模式，他的语言，他的关注点，他的优先级。然后，用他的语言和他说话，而

不是用你的。

因为交流，并不是由演讲方来决定交流方法的，更不是用由声音大的人来决定交流方法的，而是由听

的人决定交流方法的。

如果，你没有用孩子的方法去交流，那就闭嘴，因为你说的每一个字，都是噪音。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

26 NOVEMBER

Fundamentals of Communications

To improve communications, work not on the utterer but the recipient.

utterer：n. 发表人；说话人

recipient：

容器，接受者；容纳者 容易接

recipient n.

adj.

…

It is the recipient who communicates.

Unless there is someone who hears, there is no communication. There is only noise.

One can perceive only what one is capable of perceiving.

perceive：

注意到；意识到；察觉到

to notice or become aware of sth

One can communicate only in the recipients’ language or in recipients’/their terms.

And the terms have to be experience-based. We perceive, as a rule, what we expect to perceive.

We see largely what we expect to see, and we hear largely what we expect to hear.

The unexpected is usually not received at all.

Communication always makes demands.

It always demands that the recipient become somebody, do something, believe something.

It always appeals to motivation.

appeals：

motivation：n. 动机；积极性；推动

V-I If you appeal to someone to do something, you make a serious and urgent request to them.

呼吁

If it goes against her aspirations, her values, her motivations, it is likely not to be received at all or,

at best, to be resisted.

aspirations：

志向

resisted：

反抗

N-VAR Someone’s aspirations are their desire to achieve things.

V-T/V-I If you resist someone or resist an attack by them, you fight back against them.

Where communication is perception, information is logic.

perception：

术语

[ U ] ( technical

) ( formal ) the way you notice things, especially with the senses

知觉；感知

As such, information is purely formal and has no meaning.

Information is always encoded.

To be received, let alone to be used, the code must be known and understood by the recipient.

let alone：更不必说；听任；不打扰

This requires prior agreement, that is, some communication.

prior：

先前的；较早的；在前的

happening or existing before sth else or before a particular time

ACTION POINT:

Take steps to improve communications by asking recipients to initiate an information exchange.

让接受者构建交流环境。

Formulate questions such as, “What objectives do you believe are appropriate for your area of

responsibility next quarter?”

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

26 NOVEMBER

Fundamentals of Communications

To improve communications, work not on the utterer but the recipient.

It is the recipient who communicates. Unless there is someone who hears,

there is no communication. There is only noise. One can perceive only what

one is capable of perceiving. One can communicate only in the recipients’

language or in recipients’/their terms. And the terms have to be experience-

based. We perceive, as a rule, what we expect to perceive. We see largely

what we expect to see, and we hear largely what we expect to hear. The

unexpected is usually not received at all. Communication always makes

demands. It always demands that the recipient become somebody, do

something, believe something. It always appeals to motivation. If it goes

against her aspirations, her values, her motivations, it is likely not to be re-

ceived at all or, at best, to be resisted.

Where communication is perception, information is logic. As such, in-

formation is purely formal and has no meaning. Information is always en-

coded. To be received, let alone to be used, the code must be known and

understood by the recipient. This requires prior agreement, that is, some

communication.

ACTION POINT:

Take steps to improve communications by asking recipi-

ents to initiate an information exchange. Formulate questions such as,

“What objectives do you believe are appropriate for your area of

responsi-bility next quarter?”

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

锦衣卫、东厂、西厂和内厂

明朝是皇权时代汉人的最后一个政权，这个政权的创始人是乞丐出生的朱元璋，这位朱元璋凭着自己

多疑的性格，开创非常有中国特色的政权体系。

和宋朝一样，明朝也是有六部，政府的大部分职能都由六部完成。六部以及下属的州府县等官员支撑

着大明帝国的正常运行。这些人是大明这辆巨轮的核心部件。

不过，朱元璋是多疑的，他对办事人是不放心的，而且，中国古代一向认为“事即权”，皇帝需要交给

你办事，又怕你掌权。在这点上，朱元璋做到了极致。

这就有了锦衣卫。锦衣卫是国家的正式武装力量，是皇帝的侍卫军，朱元璋设置锦衣卫是为了“驾驭不

法群臣“。有了锦衣卫后，第一个被收拾的就是大功臣胡惟庸、蓝玉。《明史·刑法志》记载：“胡惟

庸、蓝玉两案，株连且四万。”

有了锦衣卫后，大明的官员就苦了，经常动不动被抓起来，打屁股。甚至悄悄死掉了。

不过，皇帝并不总是相信锦衣卫，”锦衣卫要是有坏人呢？“毕竟，那是一帮有鸡鸡的人，有鸡鸡的人

就有欲望，就有野心。

怎么办？朱元璋的儿子，明成祖决定用太监组成一个”东缉事厂“来对于锦衣卫的坏人，也应对可能和

锦衣卫勾结的大臣，这就是东厂。

和锦衣卫不同，东厂不属于国家机关，而是皇帝的亲信，他们直接代表皇权对大臣以及锦衣卫进行监

控，这样一来，大臣们就更惨了，锦衣卫也没那么舒服了。明成祖朱棣觉得自己更安全一些了。

那么，如果东厂也有坏人呢？东厂的负责人是太监，而且是皇帝的亲信太监，怎么会有坏人呢？当然

有坏人了，皇帝的另外一个亲信太监汪直就这么认为。

所以，在汪直的建议下，明宪宗又设立了”西缉事厂”，由汪直负责，西厂的权限就更大了。不但可以监

控大臣，监控锦衣卫，还可以监控东厂，成了皇帝的真正心腹。

那么，皇帝是不是就放心了呢？皇帝放不放心我不知道，其他太监看到太监可以拥有如此大的权力，

那就再来一个吧，反正也不是国家机关，就是皇宫大院里的事，只要说服皇帝就行了。

这部，没多久，司礼监太监刘瑾告诉皇帝说，西厂也不可靠，建议皇帝再设一个“内厂”，一边对大

臣、锦衣卫、东厂、西厂进行监控。

明武宗觉得刘瑾说的非常有道理，就让刘瑾做了内厂的厂公。

这样一来，堂堂的大明帝国的大臣，每天上班前都要和家人告别一下，不知道今天会被锦衣卫还是东

厂还是西厂还是内厂带走。

哎。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

27 NOVEMBER

Rules for Staff Work

Staff work is not done to advance knowledge; its only justification is the improvement of the

performance of operating people and of the entire organization.

justification:

正当理由

advance

商

（价格、价值的）上涨，提高

[ U C ] ~ (for sth/doing sth) a good reason why sth exists or is done

[ C ] ( business

) ~ (on sth) an increase in the price or value of sth

First, staff should concentrate on tasks of major importance that will continue for many years.

A task of major importance that will not last forever—for example, the reorganization of a

company’s management—is better handled as a one-time assignment.

forever:

( informal ) used with verbs in the progressive tenses to say that sb does sth very often and in a way that is annoying to

other people

（与动词进行时连用）老是，没完没了地

Staff work should be limited to a few tasks of high priority.

Proliferation of staff services deprives them of effectiveness.

Proliferation:

[ U sing. ] the sudden increase in the number or amount of sth; a large number of a particular thing

激增；涌现；增

殖；大量的事物

deprives：V-T If you deprive someone of something that they want or need, you take it away from them, or you prevent them from

having it. 剥夺; 使不能有

Worse, it destroys the effectiveness of the people who produce results, the operating people.

Unless the number of staff tasks is closely controlled, staff will gobble up more and more of

operating people’s scarcest resource: time.

gobble：

狼吞虎咽；贪婪地吃

scarcest：adj. 缺乏的，不足的；稀有的 (scarce的变形)

sth (up/down) to eat sth very fast, in a way that people consider rude or greedy

Effective staff work requires specific goals and objectives, clear targets, and deadlines.

“We expect to cut absenteeism in half within three years” or “Two years from now we expect to

understand the segmentation of our markets sufficiently to reduce the number of product lines by

at least one third.”

absenteeism：

（经常性无故的）旷

工，旷课

[ U ] the fact of being frequently away from work or school, especially without good reasons

Objectives like these make for productive staff work.

make for：

造就

PHRASAL VERB If something makes for another thing, it causes or helps to cause that thing to happen or exist.

促成;

Vague goals such as “getting a handle on employee behavior” or “a study of customer motivation”

do not. Every three years or so, it is important to sit down with every staff unit and ask, “What have

you contributed these last three years that makes a real difference to this company?”

Vague：

不具体的；不详细的；粗略的

(about sth) not having or giving enough information or details about sth

ACTION POINT: Keep support staff small and few. Establish specific goals and deadlines for all

staff work. Make sure goals are linked directly to one or more organizational goals.

The Frontiers of Management

27 NOVEMBER

Rules for Staff Work

Staff work is not done to advance knowledge; its only justification is the

improvement of the performance of operating people and of the entire

organization.

First, staff should concentrate on tasks of major importance that will con-

tinue for many years. A task of major importance that will not last for-ever—

for example, the reorganization of a company’s management—is better

handled as a one-time assignment. Staff work should be limited to a few tasks

of high priority. Proliferation of staff services deprives them of ef-fectiveness.

Worse, it destroys the effectiveness of the people who produce results, the

operating people. Unless the number of staff tasks is closely controlled, staff

will gobble up more and more of operating people’s

scarcest resource: time.

Effective staff work requires specific goals and objectives, clear

targets, and deadlines. “We expect to cut absenteeism in half within three

years” or “Two years from now we expect to understand the segmentation

of our markets sufficiently to reduce the number of product lines by at

least one third.” Objectives like these make for productive staff work.

Vague goals such as “getting a handle on employee behavior” or “a study

of customer motivation” do not. Every three years or so, it is important to

sit down with every staff unit and ask, “What have you contributed these

last three years that makes a real difference to this company?”

ACTION POINT:

Keep support staff small and few. Establish specific goals

and deadlines for all staff work. Make sure goals are linked directly to

one or more organizational goals.

The Frontiers of Management

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

大不了我去给比别人讲课去

小时候，在农村长大，村里的人偶尔也有去城里打工的，有的人去了城里里没多久就会来了，有的人

则在城里呆比较久。

每年春节后，年轻人都会一起喝酒，讨论要不要出去，大多这种讨论都以一句话结尾：“大不了回家种

地”。

是呀，大家都在农村长大，做为农民，大都是会种地的，家里也多少有几亩地。去城里打拼一下，成

功了，赚点小钱，失败了也大不了回家种地，仿佛只要有这门种地的收益，就饿不死。

到了现在，大家都进了城，没地了。也就没人说这句话了。那么，大家在说什么呢？

我最近听的最多的是：“大不了我去给别人讲书”。

”我什么也不会，做啥啥不行，就读书还可以，我给别人讲书吧，听说有个人讲书赚了好几亿“。

有的人会觉得，读那么多书干嘛，我读一本书就行了呀，不是有人半部论语治天下么？我不要治天

下，我只要混口饭吃。

我就讲一个东西吧，比如，我就讲如何提高领导力。我找几本书，然后整理一下，凭借我多年的学习

能力、做题能力，以及听课能力，我就讲课吧。

虽然我没有领导力，虽然我也没做过领导。可是我多了很多说，那我就讲领导力吧。

然后，你就讲领导力了，或者将“企业转型”，你讲的还不错，有表演天分，口才也不错。然后，很多

企业请你去讲领导力，你讲的越来越好，慢慢地，你觉得自己很牛逼了。每每看到企业的现象，你都

可以随口说出他们的问题，你觉得自己简直就是经营的天才、管理天才。虽然你从来没有管理过。

你给很多公司提了很多建议。而你的建议，也就是哪些套路，哪些公司一部分死了，一部分获得不

错，大部分不死不活。哪些活得不错的，都是因为你的原因，而那些不死不活的，都是因为不听你的

话。

然后，你讲领导力，或者企业转型，讲的越来越好，也赚了很多钱，慢慢地，大家觉得你是大师了，

你自己也觉得自己是个大师了。

然后，有人对你说，你开个公司吧，你这么懂领导力，又懂企业转型，一定可以做一个很牛逼的公

司；你自己也这么觉得，然后你就做了一个公司，简单一些吧，就做个咨询公司吧。

然后，你破产了。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

28 NOVEMBER

Rules for Staff People

Unless staff people have proved themselves in operations, they will lack credibility among

operating people and will be dismissed as “theoreticians.”

credibility：

可信性；可靠性

theoreticians：n. 理论家，精通于理论的人

[ U ] the quality that sb/sth has that makes people believe or trust them

dismissed：

理会

V-T If you dismiss something, you decide or say that it is not important enough for you to think about or consider.

不予

Rules for staff people are just as important as rules for staff work.

Don’t ever put anyone into a staff job unless he or she has successfully held a number of operating

jobs, preferably in more than one functional area.

For if staff people lack operating experience, they will be arrogant about operations, which always

look so simple to the “planner.”

arrogant：

傲慢的；自大的

behaving in a proud, unpleasant way, showing little thought for other people

But today, in government even more than in business, we put young people fresh out of business or

law school into fairly senior staff jobs as analysts or planners or staff counsel.

counsel：( law 律 ) a lawyer or group of lawyers representing sb in court 法律顾问；律师

Their arrogance and their rejection by the operating organization practically guarantee that they

will be totally unproductive.

arrogance：

[ U ] the behaviour of a person when they feel that they are more important than other people, so that they are rude

to them or do not consider them

guarantee：

傲慢；自大

(of sth) | ~ (that…) something that makes sth else certain to happen

起保证作用的事物

With rare exceptions, staff work should not be a person’s “career” but only be a part of his or her

career.

exceptions：

N-COUNT An exception is a particular thing, person, or situation that is not included in a general statement,

judgment, or rule.

例外

After five to seven years on a staff job, people ought to go back into operating work and not return

to a staff assignment for five years or so.

Otherwise, they will soon become behind-the-scene wire pullers, “gray eminences,”

“kingmakers,” “brilliant mischief-makers.”

wire pullers：

傀儡之牵线者

mischief-makers.： 挑拨离间的人

wire-pullers

ACTION POINT:

Rotate staff people in and out of operating work.

The Frontiers of Management

28 NOVEMBER

Rules for Staff People

Unless staff people have proved themselves in operations,

they will lack credibility among operating people

and will be dismissed as “theoreticians.”

Rules for staff people are just as important as rules for staff work. Don’t

ever put anyone into a staff job unless he or she has successfully held

Anumber of operating jobs, preferably in more than one functional area. For if

staff people lack operating experience, they will be arrogant about opera-

tions, which always look so simple to the “planner.” But today, in govern-

ment even more than in business, we put young people fresh out of business

or law school into fairly senior staff jobs as analysts or planners or staff

counsel. Their arrogance and their rejection by the operating organi-

zation practically guarantee that they will be totally unproductive.

With rare exceptions, staff work should not be a person’s “career” but

only be a part of his or her career. After five to seven years on a staff job,

people ought to go back into operating work and not return to a staff

assignment for five years or so. Otherwise, they will soon become

behind-the-scene wire pullers, “gray eminences,” “kingmakers,” “brilliant

mischief-makers.”

ACTION POINT:

Rotate staff people in and out of operating work.

The Frontiers of Management

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

我是小米的粉丝

事实上，我是雷军的粉丝，如果有人帮我把这篇文章发给雷军，我会非常开心。

我自己也是程序员，我用的第一款软件是WPS，求伯君写的，金山软件，当时雷军还是求伯君的兵，

后来，雷军成为金山的掌门人。

WPS从1995年开始用，一直到现在还在用，前几天还买了2年的WPS会员。每天用的不亦乐乎。

知道有雷军这个人后，就非常喜欢。后来听说他要做小米手机，我就开始关注小米手机。小米工程机

发布时，我还想去现场，没抢到票，就没去成。

那些抢到工程机的粉丝，在小米论坛，还有微信等社交平台各种秀，各种晒。我也只能看着大家的幸

福。

在那个时代，小米的用户都是粉丝，而且是“发烧”的粉丝。所以，小米就只关注发烧友。小米有一个

口号就是：“只为发烧而生”。

当然，有人说，这也导致了小米手机发热的问题，小米2、3、4等手机，经常性发热，也就导致用电很

快。我每天要充好多次电。

那时的小米，定价是1999，因为这是粉丝能接受的价格。他们每周更新一次OS，因为，他们的“发烧

友”对新鲜的东西充满了好奇。

后来，小米做的越来越大，买小米的人也不再是小米的粉丝了，普通的用户也开始买了。粉丝和普通

用户的区别在哪里呢？

当发现（手机的）问题是，粉丝会非常兴奋地整理所有想象、数据，然后在论坛提交，而用户会非常

愤怒地打客户电话。

这时的小米，也就从面对粉丝 转向了面对用户。

然后，小米开始出低端手机，因为有很多人没有钱，他们也想用很好的手机，所以，就用了红米；而

有一些人愿意为时尚买单，他们对价格不敏感，所以，小米也就有了高端手机（3000+），还请了一

个不认识的人做代言。

（这个人叫做王源，你认识么？）

小米越做越大，在刚过去的2019年第三季度，小米手机3210万部（我又买了一部，哈哈），累计在线

的小米手机超过2.9亿部，这个数字已经非常惊人了。

现在，小米手机已经不是小米粉丝的标识了。而我，还是经常对身边人说：“我是小米的粉丝，事实

上，我是雷军的粉丝”。

伴随着小米在香港的上市，小米也成为了一家公众公司，小米的每一个决策，以前只会影响我们几百

万的粉丝，现在就要影响几亿人了。这就是成长的标识和代价。

今天看到一个新闻，小米的总裁黎万强辞职了，这个新闻也引起了无数人的关注，也有书友发出疑

问：这是真的么？这意味着什么？是好事还是坏事？

而我作为粉丝，只会拿起自己的小米手机，浏览一下黎万强的辞职发言，然后继续去看别的新闻，我

知道，我还是小米的粉丝，我还是雷军的粉丝，只是，他们需要面对更大的公众了。

而我，还是会，也永远会祝福他们。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

29 NOVEMBER

Role of Public Relations

“Public Relations” has acquired a connotation of ballyhoo, propaganda, and whitewashing.

connotation :

含义；隐含意义

ballyhoo

大吹大擂；喧嚣

propaganda

an idea suggested by a word in addition to its main meaning

:[ U ] ( informal , disapproving ) unnecessary noise and excitement

:[ U ] ( usually disapproving ) ideas or statements that may be false or exaggerated and that are used in order to gain

support for a political leader, party, etc.

宣传；鼓吹

whitewashing v. 粉饰（whitewash的ing形式）；粉刷

:

To the general public, “public relations” means publicity—essentially an extension of advertising

from advertising a product to advertising its producer.

publicity:

（媒体的）关注，宣传，报道

the attention that is given to sb/sth by newspapers, television, etc.

But, the emphasis should be on acquainting the broad public with the problems of the enterprise

rather than on convincing it of the company’s virtues and achievements.

acquainting:

V-T If you acquaint someone with something, you tell them about it so that they know it. If you acquaint yourself

with something, you learn about it.

broad

convincing

virtues

使了解

涉及各种各样的人（或事物）的；广泛的

:that makes sb believe that sth is true 令人信服的；有说服力的

:[ U ] ( formal ) behaviour or attitudes that show high moral standards 高尚的道德；正直的品性；德行

including a great variety of people or things

This leads to the realization that to reach the public with its problems, the enterprise must

understand the public’s problems first.

Every major decision of a great corporation affects the public somehow, as workers, consumers,

citizens; hence the public will react consciously or subconsciously to every move the company

makes.

On this reaction depends, however, the effectiveness of the company’s decision—simply an-other

way of saying that any corporation lives in society.

Hence the effectiveness of the executive’s decision depends not only on his understanding the

problems of his business but also on his understanding the public attitude toward his problems.

决策取决于制定者对自己商业的理解，也去觉得他对群众对事件的观点的理解。

Hence the program of public relations is to give both central-office and divisional executives a

knowledge of public attitudes and beliefs, and an understanding of the reasons behind them.

公众的反馈展示后背后的真正原因。

ACTION POINT:

Understand public reaction to company decisions.

理解

Understand public attitudes toward the firm, and evaluate these attitudes.

evaluate:

估计；评价；评估

to form an opinion of the amount, value or quality of sth after thinking about it carefully

Recognize that an enterprise exists at the will of the public.

Concept of the Corporation

29 NOVEMBER

Role of Public Relations

“Public Relations” has acquired a connotation of ballyhoo,

propaganda, and whitewashing.

To the general public, “public relations” means publicity—essentially

an extension of advertising from advertising a product to advertising its

producer. But, the emphasis should be on acquainting the broad public

with the problems of the enterprise rather than on convincing it of the

company’s virtues and achievements. This leads to the realization that to

reach the public with its problems, the enterprise must understand the

public’s problems first.

Every major decision of a great corporation affects the public somehow, as

workers, consumers, citizens; hence the public will react consciously or

subconsciously to every move the company makes. On this reaction de-

pends, however, the effectiveness of the company’s decision—simply an-

other way of saying that any corporation lives in society. Hence the

effectiveness of the executive’s decision depends not only on his under-

standing the problems of his business but also on his understanding the public

attitude toward his problems. Hence the program of public relations is to give

both central-office and divisional executives a knowledge of pub-lic attitudes

and beliefs, and an understanding of the reasons behind them.

ACTION POINT:

Understand public reaction to company decisions. Un-

derstand public attitudes toward the firm, and evaluate these attitudes.

Recognize that an enterprise exists at the will of the public.

Concept of the Corporation

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

明教覆灭记

某年某月某日，大家突然发现，教主阳顶天有好久没有露面了。

虽然教主不露面是经常的事情，可是，这么长时间不露面也是不常见的。可能已经有一个月了，或者

两个月了。

紧接着，右使也不见了。右使是是个大帅哥，大家都喜欢。据说他喜欢紫衫龙王，自从紫衫龙王走

后，右使就魂不守舍，经常几天几天不见人，这次好像也消失了几个月了。

还有就是金毛狮王也不见了。狮王他老人家经常不在光明顶，偶尔也会回来，这次大概有半年多没回

来了。

五散人也不见了。据说，有人见到他们和杨左使吵架了，好像还动手了，之后他们就下了山，之后再

也没有回来。

殷鹰王也不见了，据说去别的地方当教主去了。韦蝠王也不见了，也不知道去哪里。

然后就是杨左使也不见了。光明顶一个领导都没有了，只有一些业务人员还在每天烧水、做饭。每天

给圣火添柴火。

听说左使现在去了坐忘峰，离光明顶也不远。和他同去的还有风云雷电四门的人。现在大事都在杨左

使那里处理，光明顶就这样冷下来了。大家每天看着日出日落。熬日子罢了。

江湖上，明教的弟子各自为战，五行旗孩子和元军对仗，只是没人来光明顶请示了。偶尔会有和杨左

使亲近的人去坐忘峰请示一下，也很少了。

某一天，光明顶来了很多人，这些人说要灭了圣火。这一天，杨左使来了，殷鹰王也来了，韦蝠王也

来了，连五散人也来了，还来了一些五行旗的旗主。不顾，大家还是打不过那些人，那些人据说是六

大派的，有武当、少林、峨眉、崆峒、华山、昆仑，还有很多不知名的门派。

眼看着圣火就要被他们熄灭了，这时，来了一位少年，这位少年据说是殷鹰王的外孙，也是武当派张

三丰的徒孙，这个人武功奇高，凭借一人之力，打败了全部的六大派。六大派就下山了。圣火也就保

住了。

这个年轻人也就成了明教的新教主，因为他同时还带来了阳教主死亡的确切信息。然后，这个年轻人

就被拥护成了明教的教主，据说，他同时还是狮王的义子。所以，大家都接受他做新教主。

我觉得，领导们应该是达成了某种妥协，不然怎么会让这个这么年轻的人做教主呢。就算武功高，能

有多高呢？

然后，这个年轻人带着杨左使、鹰王、蝠王、五散人等下山去了。他们下山后，发现整个江湖已经发

生了天翻地覆的变化。五行旗下的一些部门已经非常强悍了。这几年高层的缺位，居然丝毫没有影响

明教的发展，我们也涌现了常遇春、朱元璋等大将。对元朝造成了很大的伤害。

不过，大家还是很喜欢有一个教主的，看到教主后，各路的军队都兴奋起来了，大家都觉得，上天降

下这个教主（明王），就预示着我们即将打败元军，夺取天下。

至少大家都是这么说的，包括朱元璋。

是的，我也下山了，被安排在朱元璋麾下做文书，记录一下信息，偶尔也帮着朱元璋出出主意。

朱元璋没事也经常问我光明顶的事情。对于这些一线的底层员工来说，光明顶总是神秘的。

我和他讲了光明顶失去了所有高层后的那段时间，那段时间，我因为忙前忙后，也算不小的职位了。

因为没有给我提升，而又有同僚离开。我就兼任了很多职位，如采购、行政、眼线管理等等等等。说

句不要脸的话，在那几年间，我是实际上光明顶的负责人。

朱元璋对这段经历很有兴趣，他不停地问，不停地问。

这时 ，右使也回来了。脸被画花了，武功还是很帅。朱元璋又问我右使的事情，我也给他讲了。朱元

璋说，原来这些人都不在，对明教影响也不大呀。

我说，是呀。

有过了几年，有一次朱元帅问我话。

对，这时，朱元璋已经是元帅了，我成了他的亲随。他问我：“你说，如果张教主像阳教主那样消失1

年，明教会乱么？”

我想都没想说：“不会”。

朱元帅又问我：“如果左使右使和天王们也都消失呢？”

我想了想说：“还是不会”

朱元帅又问我：“如果五散人等也消失呢？”

我笑了笑收：“更不会了。他们本来就是闲散人。”

朱元帅笑了笑。

又过了几天，听说张教主带着夫人赵敏隐居了，传下号令，让杨逍接任教主。

杨逍躲在一个屋子里，也基本上不管事。

然后整个高层都不见了。不过，大家也不觉得有什么问题。

某一天，朱元帅又找到我，笑着对我说：”如果，我是说如果，你也消失了，你觉得明教会乱么？“

我……

我认为，我为大明帝国的崛起，是做了贡献的。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

30 NOVEMBER

Control Middle Management

Start middle-management weight control.

Now is the time to start middle-management weight control.

One means is attrition.

attrition：

a process of making sb/sth, especially your enemy, weaker by repeatedly attacking them or creating problems for them

（尤指给敌人造成的）削弱，消耗

As a job becomes vacant through retirement, death, or resignation, don’t automatically fill it.

vacant：

（职位）空缺的

resignation：

辞职

( formal ) if a job in a company is vacant , nobody is doing it and it is available for sb to take

[ U C ] the act of giving up your job or position; the occasion when you do this

Leave jobs open for six or eight months and see what happens; unless there is an overwhelming

clamor for filling the job, then abolish it.

overwhelming：

巨大的；压倒性的；无法

very great or very strong; so powerful that you cannot resist it or decide how to react

抗拒的

clamor： 喧闹，叫嚷；大声的要求

abolish：

rumpus, whoop-up

[ VN ] to officially end a law, a system or an institution

废除，废止（法律、制度、习俗等）

The few companies that have tried this report that about half the “vacancies” disappeared after six

months.

A second way to reduce middle-management bulk is to substitute job-enlargement for promotion.

bulk：

主体；大部分

substitute：

（以 ）

[ sing. ] the ~ (of sth) the main part of sth; most of sth

代替；取代

A (for B) | ~ B (with/by A) | ~ for sb/sth to take the place of sb/sth else; to use sb/sth instead of sb/sth else

…

The one and only way to provide satisfaction and achievement for young managers and executives

—and for the even younger people working under them—is to make jobs bigger, more challenging,

more demanding, and more autonomous, while increasingly using lateral transfers to different

assignments, rather than promotions, as a reward for outstanding performance.

Forty years ago we built into the performance review of managerial people the question, “Are they

ready for promotion?” Now we need to replace that question with “Are they ready for a bigger,

more demanding challenge and for the addition of new responsibilities to their existing job?”

ACTION POINT:

Create a flat organization.

Use information processing— its structure, its content, and its direction—to ensure that your

organization is agile and effective.

The Frontiers of Management

30 NOVEMBER

Control Middle Management

Start middle-management weight control.

Now is the time to start middle-management weight control. One means

is attrition. As a job becomes vacant through retirement, death, or resignation,

don’t automatically fill it. Leave jobs open for six or eight months and see

what happens; unless there is an overwhelming clamor for filling the job, then

abolish it. The few companies that have tried this report that about half the

“vacancies” disappeared after six months. A second way to reduce middle-

management bulk is to substitute job-enlargement for promotion. The one and

only way to provide satisfac-tion and achievement for young managers and

executives—and for the even younger people working under them—is to

make jobs bigger, more challenging, more demanding, and more autonomous,

while increasingly using lateral transfers to different assignments, rather than

promotions, as

Areward for outstanding performance.

Forty years ago we built into the performance review of managerial peo-

ple the question, “Are they ready for promotion?” Now we need to replace

that question with “Are they ready for a bigger, more demanding challenge

and for the addition of new responsibilities to their existing job?”

ACTION POINT:

Create a flat organization. Use information processing—

its structure, its content, and its direction—to ensure that your

organization is agile and effective.

The Frontiers of Management

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

德鲁克：我是社会生态学家

有人说德鲁克是“管理学大师”，“大师中的大师”，德鲁克一直认不对，他认为自己是“社会生态学家”。

我一直认为，这是德鲁克的谦虚，直到我了解了什么是“社会生态学家”。

那么，什么是“社会生态学家”呢？我本来以为，这是一个虚指。读了今天的《德鲁克日志》，我才知

道自己错了。我才更加明确了一点：德鲁克从来不虚指。

阿西莫夫是我最喜欢的科幻小说家之一，《银河帝国》是我最喜欢的科幻小说之一。《银河帝国》中

著名的“基地”组织，是一个叫做谢顿的人发明的。谢顿自认为是“心理史学家”，而整个银河帝国则是心
