And this is why EVA is growing in popularity.

It does not, by itself, tell us why a certain product or a certain service does not add value or what to

do about it.

It does show which products, services, operations, or activities have unusually high productivity

and add unusually high value.

Then we should ask ourselves, “What can we learn from these successes?”

ACTION POINT:

Calculate the “economic value added” for your organization or for a product or service that you

provide.

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

From Data to Information Literacy (Corpedia Online Program)

8 DECEMBER

EVA as a Productivity Measure

Until a business returns a profit that is greater than its cost of capital,

it does not create wealth, it destroys it.

Measuring total-factor productivity is one of the major challenges con-

fronting the executive in the age of knowledge work. For manual work,

measuring quantity is usually sufficient. In knowledge work, we have to

manage both quantity and quality, and we do not know yet how to do that. We

must try to assess total-factor productivity using the common de-nominator of

revenues and expenses. By measuring the value added over all costs,

including the cost of capital, EVA (economic value added analy-sis)

measures, in effect, the productivity of all factors of production [or the

true economic costs produced by all resources used].

Never mind that a business pays taxes as if it had earned a profit. It does

not cover its full costs until reported profits exceed its cost of capital. Until

Abusiness returns a profit that is greater than its cost of capital, it operates at

Aloss. And this is why EVA is growing in popularity. It does not, by itself, tell

us why a certain product or a certain service does not add value or what to do

about it. It does show which products, services, operations, or activities have

unusually high productivity and add unusually high value. Then we should

ask ourselves, “What can we learn from these successes?”

ACTION POINT:

Calculate the “economic value added” for your organi-

zation or for a product or service that you provide.

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

From Data to Information Literacy (Corpedia Online Program)

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

我写过几篇人物小传

我写过几篇人物小传，有范蠡，有李白，有杜甫，还有王振，刘备、萧绎、德鲁克、陈子昂等等等

等。

比如，我写范蠡，我发现，范蠡在42岁前就是个屌丝，42岁后的人生才开始开挂，走出了一个又一个

的高峰。

李白也差不多，42岁前虽然很有才华，却四处碰壁，42岁时才得到达官贵人的赏识，被唐玄宗任命为

翰林。不到44岁又被贬了，一生颠破流离。

这两个人是我随即选的，我写他们时，我也是42岁，当我发现他们42岁前都在迷茫时，我有些放心

了。

看来，不只是我一个人迷茫。这些伟人也在迷茫。

我很少读人物传记，碳9的人喜欢读人物传记，碳9的发起人冯新老师总结了读人物传记的一些方法

论，称为创始人对标。

冯新老师认为：拿自己的情况与对标的创始人逐项对比，寻找差距和启示。每一个成功的创业者都是

不可复制的，研究他不是为了成为他，研究他人的目的在于发现自己；研究他人走过的道路，目的为

了找到自己前行的道路。

当然，这和碳9是一个创业型社区有关系，碳9从初始的碳9学社，成长为碳9加速器，然后是现在的碳

9资本，一步步的成长，都是在关注创业者的成长。

冯新老师认为，创业者的成长必须要学习，而且最佳的是阅读传记。

查理芒格也非常喜欢读人物传记，不要问我查理芒格是谁，如果你不知道他，就自己去百度吧。在某

一次采访中，查理芒格说自己每年要阅读100本人物传记。这个数量是非常惊人的，至少惊了我。

那么，阅读人物传记是怎么样的一回事呢？我去话一天或者半天时间去写人物小传是为了什么呢？

其实，都是为了给我们的自己人生找个标杆，告诉自己，原来人生是可以“那么过的”。

比如，我读过范蠡后，就发现，原来42岁是可以开始做很多事的，我读过礼拜后就知道，原来有才华

和生活舒适是两回事。我读过《乔布斯传》后才知道，原来不懂技术的乔布斯也可以成为伟大的发明

家。

早上在群里聊天，有同学说，找个人对标是有问题的，这样会“削足适履”。看到“削足适履”这个词，我

有点懵，为什么你看到一双好的鞋，就要去砍自己的脚呢？

我觉得，人物传记的阅读，只是给我们打开一个窗口，让我们知道人生可以如此地精彩，人生遇到问

题时可以如此地解决。

比如，前段时间，我非常郁闷，甚至怀疑自己得了抑郁症，我不断寻求生命的意义。然后我遇到了两

本书，都是传记性质的书。

一本是托尔斯泰的《忏悔录》 ，记录的是托尔斯泰通过理性思考来寻找生命的意义，无比富足的托尔

斯泰为了避免自杀，绞尽脑汁寻找生命的意义。而另一个书是《活出生命的意义》，作者维克多·弗兰

克尔记录了自己的纳粹集中营里，每天被各种虐待，随时面临死亡，在这种人间地狱中，作者在也在

寻求活下去的意义。

当我看到这两个人，一个在九天之上思考人生的意义，一个在十八层地狱思考人生的意义。而且他们

都找到了时，我就知道自己一定也可以找到，即使找不到也没关系。我也就坦然了。

所以，我们读人物传记，并不是要去学习某个人的成功或者躲避某个人的失败。而是当我们面临具体

问题是，我们可以知道，某某人曾经如何做过。

到目前为止，我读过的人物传记还是很少，我曾经发愿，要写出1000个人的人物小传。现在也就写了

不到10个。我想我以后不一定会完成这个愿望了，不过，我会读更多的人物传记，比如韩愈的，比如

苏轼的，比如鲁迅的，比如矛盾的。

读这些人，可以让我在后续的人生中更加坦然，而不是为了成为某个人。

如此而已。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

9 DECEMBER

Benchmarking for Competitiveness

Competitiveness：n. 竞争力，好竞争

Benchmarking assumes that being at least as good as the leader is a prerequisite to being

competitive.

Benchmarking: 标杆分析法， 就是将本企业各项活动与从事该项活动最佳者进行比较，从而提出行动

方法，以弥补自身的不足。Benchmarking是将本企业经营的各方面状况和环节与竞争对手或行业内外

一流的企业进行对照分析的过程，是一种评价自身企业和研究其他组织的手段，是将外部企业的持久

业绩作为自身企业的内部发展目标并将外界的最佳做法移植到本企业的经营环节中去的一种方法。实

施benchmarking的公司必须不断对竞争对手或一流企业的产品、服务、经营业绩等进行评价来发现优

势和不足。

prerequisite：

[ usually sing. ] ~ (for/of/to sth) ( formal ) something that must exist or happen before sth else can happen or be

先决条件；前提；必备条件

competitive： ~ (with sb/sth) as good as or better than others （与…）一样好的；（比…）更好的；有竞争力的

done

EVA (economic value added analysis) is a good start to assess the competitiveness of an

enterprise in the global marketplace, but to it we must add benchmarking.

assess：

估算，估定，核定（数量、价值）

competitiveness：n. 竞争力

[ VN ] ~ sth (at sth) to calculate the amount or value of sth

Benchmarking is a tool that helps a firm tell whether or not it is globally competitive.

Benchmarking assumes, correctly, that what one company does another company can always do

as well.

assumes：

假设

V-T If you assume that something is true, you imagine that it is true, sometimes wrongly.

“Best performers” are often found in identical services or functions inside an organization, in

competitor organizations, but also in organizations outside the industry.

performers: n. 表演者；执行者

identical:

完全同样的；相同的

(to/with sb/sth) similar in every detail

Together, EVA and benchmarking provide the diagnostic tools needed to measure totalfactor productivity and to manage it.

diagnostic:

术语

诊断的；判断的

[ usually before noun ] ( technical

) connected with identifying sth, especially an illness

They are examples of the new tools executives should understand to measure and manage what

goes on inside the enterprise.

Combined, they are the best measures we have so far available.

Combined：adj. 结合的；[数] 组合的

ACTION POINT:

Instigate a benchmarking study by gathering data on a product, service, or process from a

comparable organization, even from one outside your industry.

Instigate：

comparable：

industry：

使（正式）开始；使发生

(to/with sb/sth) similar to sb/sth else and able to be compared 类似的；可比较的

[ U ] the production of goods from raw materials, especially in factories 工业；生产制造

( especially BrE ) to make sth start or happen, usually sth official

Set performance measures to ensure that you are competitive with the best performers.

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

From Data to Information Literacy (Corpedia Online Program)

9 DECEMBER

Benchmarking for Competitiveness

Benchmarking assumes that being at least as good as the leader

is a prerequisite to being competitive.

EVA (economic value added analysis) is a good start to assess the com-

petitiveness of an enterprise in the global marketplace, but to it we must add

benchmarking. Benchmarking is a tool that helps a firm tell whether or not it

is globally competitive. Benchmarking assumes, cor-rectly, that what one

company does another company can always do as well. “Best performers” are

often found in identical services or functions in-side an organization, in

competitor organizations, but also in organizations outside the industry.

Together, EVA and benchmarking provide the diag-nostic tools needed to

measure total-factor productivity and to manage it. They are examples of the

new tools executives should understand to mea-sure and manage what goes

on inside the enterprise. Combined, they are

the best measures we have so far available.

ACTION POINT:

Instigate a benchmarking study by gathering data on

Aproduct, service, or process from a comparable organization, even from

one outside your industry. Set performance measures to ensure that you

are competitive with the best performers.

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

From Data to Information Literacy (Corpedia Online Program)

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

有一个和一个创投圈的大佬聊天，大佬说，所谓的创业，无外乎找人找钱找方向。

我赶忙点头称是，毕竟，人家是大佬呀。可是，我心里想的却是：你没人没钱没方向，创啥业呀，这

不是闹着玩么？

后来，和创业者接触多了，我越来越发现，这个大佬说的太对了。我遇到的每一个创业者，每天思考

的都是这三个问题：人在哪里？钱在哪里？方向在哪里？

不管是草根创业者，还是口含金匙的精英创业者。

然后，我又想了一下，其实，人生又何尝不是如此呢？我们孤零零来到这个世界上，每时每刻都是在

找人找钱找方向，何曾有过例外？

有一个人叫做亚伯拉罕·马斯洛，他对人的需求做了分析、总结，总结出了人的五种需求。这个总结被

称为马斯洛需求层次理论，今天偶尔看到这个理论，突然发现，这个所谓的五层需求，每一层也都是

找人找钱找方向呀。只是每一层略有不同而已。

马斯洛认为，人类具有一些先天需求，人的需求越是低级的需求就越基本，越与动物相似；越是高级

的需求就越为人类所特有。同时这些需求都是按照先后顺序出现的，当一个人满足了较低的需求之

后，才能出现较高级的需求，即需求层次。

马斯洛的第一层是生理上的需求，也就是食色的需求，具体可以表现为空气、水、食物、睡眠、性

等。

马斯洛认为，只有这些最基本的需要满足到维持生存所必需的程度后，其他的需要才能成为新的激励

因素，而到了此时，这些已相对满足的需要也就不再成为激励因素了。

那么，如何满足这些需求呢？除了性需要找人外，空气、水、食物、睡眠，都是需要找钱的，处于这

个阶段的人，如何找钱呢?大概率是工作，也就是出卖自己有的东西：体力、脑力、身体。

处于这个阶段的人需要方向么？或许需要，不过，对于他们来说，任何方向都是可以的，只要给他们

空气、水、食物、睡眠、性，他们几乎可以接受任何方向。

当第一层的需求得到满足后，人就开始追求第二层的需求了：安全上的需求，这一层的需求具体表现

在人身安全、健康保障、工作职位保障、家庭安全。

马斯洛认为，整个有机体是一个追求安全的机制，人的感受器官、效应器官、智能和其他能量主要是

寻求安全的工具。

那么，处于这一层的人，如何满足这个需求呢？当人吃饱、穿暖有住所后，人就不愿意再冒险了。妓

女赚了比较多的前后，就想着从良，毕竟，性交易是有很高的人身风险的。男人从事危险工作一段时

间后，一旦赚到足够的钱，就不想再去了，毕竟，在有钱的情况下，命比钱重要。

这个层级的人，可以寻找一些朋友，事业上能帮助自己的。也会通过工作来赚更多地钱，通过这些钱

和朋友让自己获得安全的工作环境、身体有健康的保障，家庭有健康的保障。

通过这一层后，人就进入了第三层需求，也就是情感和归属的需求。这一层具体表现在友情、爱情、

性亲密等。这时的你，吃穿不用愁了，也有比较强的安全感了。你的需求就表现在需要别人的关心，

需要别人爱。对性的需求也不是交配的需求了，而是想和自己心爱的人享受温柔，柔情。

如何做到呢？肯定还是找人，找钱，找方向。友情、爱情，都是非常挑剔的，你需要找到合适的人，

或许你或遇到很多很多人，你却需要找到那个特别的人来疼你，爱你。你可以花钱买到easy girl，你需

要的确实和某个人在温柔乡里缠绵。当然，美妙的爱情不能是无源之水，你还是需要钱。

有了这些后，你就开始有了新的需求，这就是马斯洛定义的第四层的需求：尊重的需求。这一层次的

需求具体表现在自我尊重、信心、成就、对他人的尊重以及被他人尊重。

这时的你，对圈子以及很挑剔了。你不会接受你不喜欢的人在你的圈子里走来走去， 你会用心去挑选

进入你生活圈子的人。当然，你也需要找更好地找钱的方法，因为，这种需求对钱的消耗也会大一

些。如果找不到足够的钱，你就没法满足自己的这个需求。

在这个层级的人，对他人是非常尊重的，他尊重身边的每一个人，一方面因为他认为做人是值得尊重

的，另一方便，身边的人本来就是他选的值得尊重的那些，而这些人也会尊重他。

满足了这些需求后，这个人已经非常非常优秀了。他会进入会后一个层级的需求：自我实现的需求。

对于处于这一层的人来说，他们对生活以及对生活的周边以及没有更多的诉求了，他们更多是要实现

自我。而实现自我无外乎立德、立功、立言（太上有立德，其次有立功，其次有立言）。不管这个人

是想立德，还是立功，还是立言，他都需要找人，这些都不是自己一个人可以做的，他也需要找钱，

不然事情也没法做，更主要的是，他需要找方向。德于什么？功在何处？言在何方？

其实，除了第一层，你不需要考虑方向外，其他层，你都需要找到适合的人，找到适合的钱，然后明

确自己的方向，否则，你的需求就很难被满足。

而且，在这些层级，人无疑要比钱重要的多，人对了，钱就来了，人和钱来了，需求也就满足了。人

生也就圆满了。

如果一个人，满足了所有的五层需求，是不是就成为”五全人“了呢？就像乾隆的十全老人。

你目前正在哪个层级努力呢？你在努力时，是关注人多一些？还是钱多一些？还是其他？

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

10 DECEMBER

Resource-Allocation Decisions

Resource-Allocation：资源配置

The allocation of capital and people determine whether the organization will do well or poorly.

The allocation of capital and performing people converts into action all that management knows

about its business—they determine whether the organization will do well or poorly.

An organization should allocate human resources as purposefully and as thoughtfully as it

allocates capital.

purposefully: 有目的地；自觉地

thoughtfully 沉思地；体贴地，亲切地

:n.

consciously, self-consciously

warmly, meditatively

To understand a capital investment, a company has to look at four measures: return on

investment, payback period, cash flow, and discounted present value.

Each of these four measures tells the executive something different about a prospective capital

investment.

prospective:

有望的；可能的；预期的；潜在的

expected to do sth or to become sth

Each looks at the investment through a different lens.

lens:

a curved piece of glass or plastic that makes things look larger, smaller or clearer when you look through it

透镜；镜片

Decision makers should not evaluate capital investments in isolation, but as part of a cluster of

projects.

evaluate:

估计；评价；评估

isolation：

隔离；隔离状态

cluster：

（同类物丛生或聚集的）簇，团，束，串

to form an opinion of the amount, value or quality of sth after thinking about it carefully

the act of separating sb/sth; the state of being separate

a group of things of the same type that grow or appear close together

They should then select the cluster that shows the best ratio between opportunity and risk.

The results of capital spending should be assessed against expectations in the post audit

procedure.

assessed：

V-T When you assess a person, thing, or situation, you consider them in order to make a judgment about them.

评估

Information gathered from the procedure can then be used to help make decisions about future

investments.

The decisions to hire, to fire, and to promote are among the most important decisions of the

executive.

They are more difficult than the capital allocation decision.

An organization needs to have a systematic process for making people decisions that is just as

rigorous as the one it has for making decisions about capital.

rigorous：

done carefully and with a lot of attention to detail SYN thorough

谨慎的；细致的；彻底的

Executives need to evaluate people against expectations.

evaluate:

expectations：

to form an opinion of the amount, value or quality of sth after thinking about it carefully

估计；评价；评估

N-UNCOUNT Your expectations are your strong hopes or beliefs that something will happen or that you will get

something that you want.

期盼

ACTION POINT:

Review your capital allocation decisions of the past year.

Are they meeting your expectations?

Review your hiring and promotion decisions of the past year. Are they meeting your expectations?

Make changes to your resource allocation procedures based on feedback analysis.

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

From Data to Information Literacy (Corpedia Online Program).

10 DECEMBER

Resource-Allocation Decisions

The allocation of capital and people determine whether the organization

will do well or poorly.

The allocation of capital and performing people converts into action all

that management knows about its business—they determine whether the

organization will do well or poorly. An organization should allocate

human resources as purposefully and as thoughtfully as it allocates capital. To

understand a capital investment, a company has to look at four mea-sures:

return on investment, payback period, cash flow, and discounted present

value. Each of these four measures tells the executive something different

about a prospective capital investment. Each looks at the invest-ment through

a different lens. Decision makers should not evaluate capital investments in

isolation, but as part of a cluster of projects. They should then select the

cluster that shows the best ratio between opportunity and risk. The results of

capital spending should be assessed against expectations in the postaudit

procedure. Information gathered from the procedure can then be used to help

make decisions about future investments.

The decisions to hire, to fire, and to promote are among the most impor-

tant decisions of the executive. They are more difficult than the capital alloca-

tion decision. An organization needs to have a systematic process for making

people decisions that is just as rigorous as the one it has for making decisions

about capital. Executives need to evaluate people against expectations.

ACTION POINT:

Review your capital allocation decisions of the past year. Are

they meeting your expectations? Review your hiring and promotion decisions

of the past year. Are they meeting your expectations? Make changes to your

resource allocation procedures based on feedback analysis.

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

From Data to Information Literacy (Corpedia Online Program).

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

任我行、左冷禅、岳不群，谁最行？

《笑傲江湖》有三个大反派，这三个人共同的特点都是要统一武林。

任我行靠的是实力，凭借自己的吸星大法，凭借魔教的恐怖势力，带着三山五岳的江湖人士，人挡杀

人，佛单杀佛。在各种机缘巧合下，成为了武林中最有势力的人，如果不是心肌梗塞猝死，他是很有

可能成为武林第一人的。

左冷禅有点不同，他一方面用阳谋：作为五岳派盟主，他觉得做个盟主不如做掌门实惠，而且，为了

对抗日益嚣张的魔教，把五岳派并称一个五岳剑派，也是一个非常优秀的途径。所以，左冷禅发起了

五岳派的并派提议。并且得到了部分人的附议。

同时，左冷禅也用阴谋，他在华山派派出了自己的弟子劳德诺做卧底；在泰山派收买了玉玑子等人；

在恒山派，左冷禅派出了一些武功高强的师弟去围剿恒山三定，一举杀死了三人，让恒山派群龙无

首；衡山派，左冷禅抓住了掌门人莫大的师弟刘正风和魔教长老曲洋勾结（其实是交好）的证据，借

机杀死了刘正风，削弱了衡山的实力。

凭借左手阳谋，右手阴谋，左冷禅认为自己可以完成五岳派的并购。

岳不群完全不同，岳不群是有阴谋。岳不群认为，既然左冷禅要做，就让他去做，自己扮猪吃虎，让

左冷禅去下聘礼，雇乐队，定日子，娶媳妇；而自己，只需要在入洞房时抢先就好了。

然后，在左冷禅左手阳谋，右手阴谋折腾了很久后，果然让岳不群入了洞房。

这就是这三个人的区别，也是这三个人的性格所在。

今天我们在群里聊天，聊起了雄才大略。大家讨论任我行、左冷禅和岳不群谁有雄才大略。

然后，我提出了一个直接的问题：啥是雄才？啥是大略？这时，马云峰说道：’张学良评价父亲张作霖

“有雄才，无大略”，评价蒋介石“有大略，无雄才”，这么看就是有区别的。’

我想了想，这确实是最好的注脚。

那么，用这个角度来看这三个人呢？

我个人认为，并派也好，统一江湖也好，这个是符合大家的期待的，毕竟，大家都喜欢和平的年代，

和平的江湖。在这一点上，任我行、左冷禅、岳不群并没有什么不同。

不同的是他们的做事方法。

任我行有目的，有方法，也有势力，逐步推进，如果不是意外猝死，他大概会成功。所以，任我行算

有雄才，有大略。

左冷禅明面上搞阳谋，却夹带了太多的私货，用阴谋来处理如此大的江湖事项。明明是可以拿到台面

上的事情，却搞成了偷鸡摸狗。显示出小鸡子气。所以，左冷禅算有雄才，却无大略，做事手段不够

高明。

岳不群呢？岳不群没有雄才，他应该也想象不出并派这样的格局。不过，他却有很强的执行力，当他

看到左冷禅的谋略后，随即设计出了可以算计左冷禅的谋略，让左冷禅白白辛苦一场，为他人做了嫁

衣。

所以说，岳不群虽然没有雄才，却有大略。

我们从五岳派合并后岳不群的动作，也可以看出岳不群的大略。

首先，左冷禅并派，就是强推，他觉得联盟转为门派是自然的事情。他通过收买、陷害的方式，企图

用武力来并派；而岳不群则不同，他是从并派可以消除争议，减少仇杀的角度来看待并说服大家同意

并派的。这是一个战略的考虑，而不是一个武力的考虑。

其次，岳不群让女儿岳灵珊演示了各个门派的武功。通过这个演示，岳不群告诉大家，并派后，五岳

派的武功可以融会贯通，达到新的高度。

接着，岳不群提到了并派的规则和操作手法：让武功类似的门派合并，让地缘接近的门派合并。武功

接近则容易形成新的武功，地缘接近则容易形成血亲关系。而五岳剑派，都是用的剑，确实适合合

并。

接下来，岳不群做了五岳派掌门人后，第一件事就是用原来各个门派的负责人来管理。这一方面表达

了对各个门派的尊重，一方面也迅速地稳定了局势。

其实，大家应该可以推断，用不了多久，新的管理团队就会代替这个现在的团队来管理这个五岳派。

这只是时间问题。

最后，岳不群说出了思过崖后的武学宝库，告诉所有人可以去华山学习武学宝库，为五岳剑派的每个

人提升武功提供了很好的机会。

如果不是左冷禅捣乱，如果不是令狐冲追杀，如果不是恒山复仇，如果不是岳不群为了并派欠下了太

多的血债，凭借这六步，岳不群是可以完成一个完美的江湖第一大并购：五岳剑派合并。

江湖没有假设。左冷禅的雄才没有搭配上岳不群的大略，而有雄才大略的任我行则心肌梗塞死掉了。

留下一个吊儿郎当的令狐冲在笑傲江湖。

那么令狐冲笑傲江湖的代价是什么呢？是他已经成了事实上的武林第一人：孤独九剑、吸星大法、易

筋经的集合体。

在这个令狐冲笑傲的江湖里，还是一个最原始的规则：武力最强者才可以笑。

惜哉，并派！

本来这个江湖是可以让普通人笑的，最后还是只能强者大笑。

  1. 收购需要基于商业战略，而不是财务战略

  2. 收购需要考虑收购者可以为收购做哪些事情

  3. 收购者和被收购者需要共享一个核心：如市场和营销，或技术，或核心竞争力。

  4. 收购者必须尊重被收购着的业务、产品、客户以及价值观。

  5. 收购人必须准备在相当短的时间内(最多一年)向被收购企业提供最高管理层。

  6. 收购必须迅速为双方人员创造明显的发展机会。

大纲

  1. 岳不群是个反派

  2. 岳不群的雄才

  3. 岳不群的大略

  4. 所谓的伟人，都是被万人唾骂的

  5. 谁在笑傲？令狐冲？任盈盈？方证和尚？他们凭什么笑傲？

  6. 岳不群的江湖

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

一小时运动

英文原文

11 DECEMBER

Six Rules of Successful Acquisitions

Acquisitions:

企业并购；兼并与收购

mergers and acquisitions

Acquisitions should be successful, but few are, in fact.

Acquisitions:

企业并购；兼并与收购

mergers and acquisitions

Acquisitions should be successful, but few are, in fact. The reason for this nonperformance is

always the same: disregard of the well-known and well-tested rules for successful acquisitions.

disregard:

不理会；不顾；漠视

[ VN ] to not consider sth; to treat sth as unimportant

The six rules of successful acquisitions are:

  1. The successful Acquisitions must be based on business strategy, not financial strategy.

Acquisitions:

企业并购；兼并与收购

mergers and acquisitions

  1. The successful acquisition must be based on what the acquirer contributes to the

acquisition.

acquirer ：n. 收买者；受让人；需方；捕捉器

收购者能为收购做出哪些贡献。

  1. The two entities must share a common core of unity, such as markets and marketing, or

technology, or core competencies.

这两个实体必须共享一个统一的共同核心，如市场和营销，或技术，或核心竞争力。

  1. The acquirer must respect the business, products, and customers of the acquired company, as

well as its values.

收购者必须尊重被收购着的业务、产品、客户以及价值观。

respect:

acquired

[ U sing. ] ~ (for sb/sth) a feeling of admiration for sb/sth because of their good qualities or achievements

:V-T If you acquire something, you buy or obtain it for yourself, or someone gives it to you.

获得

尊敬；敬意；尊重

  1. The acquirer must be prepared to provide top management to the acquired business within a

fairly short period, a year at most.

收购人必须准备在相当短的时间内(最多一年)向被收购企业提供最高管理层。

fairly ：

( before adjectives and adverbs

用于形容词和副词前 ) to some extent but not very 一定地；相当地

The successful acquisition must rapidly create visible opportunities for advancement for both the

people in the acquiring business and people in the acquired business.

成功的收购必须迅速为收购方的人员和被收购方的人员创造明显的发展机会。

ACTION POINT:

Evaluate three acquisition prospects against these six rules. Which ones would you recommend

that your organization pursue?

Evaluate：

估计；评价；评估

prospects：

可能性 前景

recommend：

劝告；建议

pursue：

追求；致力于；执行；贯彻

to form an opinion of the amount, value or quality of sth after thinking about it carefully

N-VAR If there is some prospect of something happening, there is a possibility that it will happen.

to advise a particular course of action; to advise sb to do sth

[ VN ] to do sth or try to achieve sth over a period of time

;

The Frontiers of Management

The Successful Acquisition (Corpedia Online Program).

人很难赚到符合你认知的钱

除非你靠运气

11 DECEMBER

Six Rules of Successful Acquisitions

Acquisitions should be successful, but few are, in fact.

Acquisitions should be successful, but few are, in fact. The reason for this

nonperformance is always the same: disregard of the well-known

and well-tested rules for successful acquisitions.

The six rules of successful acquisitions are:

The successful acquisition must be based on business strategy,

not financial strategy.

The successful acquisition must be based on what the acquirer

contributes to the acquisition.

The two entities must share a common core of unity, such as

markets and marketing, or technology, or core competencies.

The acquirer must respect the business, products, and customers of

the acquired company, as well as its values.

The acquirer must be prepared to provide top management to the

acquired business within a fairly short period, a year at most.

The successful acquisition must rapidly create visible

opportunities for advancement for both the people in the acquiring

business and people in the acquired business.

ACTION POINT:

Evaluate three acquisition prospects against these six rules.

Which ones would you recommend that your organization pursue?

The Frontiers of Management

The Successful Acquisition (Corpedia Online Program).

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

阿宾的故事

阿宾是我一个朋友，也是一个人到中年的人。

就像每一个人到中年一样，阿宾手头也有很多事情在做，遗憾的是都不大赚钱。

阿宾有梦想，有情怀。他现在手头的很多事，都是和情怀有关。阿宾已经为情怀买了很多年单了。

慢慢地，阿宾发现自己买不起了，所以，阿宾想赚钱。

阿宾觉得，如果能用情怀来赚钱的话，就更好了。

阿宾有很多人脉关系，也有不错的资源，有完整的履历，除了年龄略大外，一切都想中年男人一样优

雅，没有理由赚不到钱呀，所以，阿宾自己也觉得奇怪。

“为什么老是在种地，就是不打粮食呢？”

这是阿宾最近一直思考的问题。

阿宾在圈子里也有一些名气，经常有人来找他做一些事情。前几天有个杂志找他来做一些活动。这个

杂志挺有名的， 阿宾很喜欢，也觉得有面子。

这个杂志社提的要求，阿宾觉得自己可以很轻松完成，而且杂志社会给他一个身份，也有一些钱。这

些都是阿宾想要的。

阿宾就想答应。

一方面，阿宾觉得杂志社这个要求和自己的“目标”是一致的，虽然阿宾也不知道自己的目标是什么。

另一方面，阿宾又可以有这个杂志社的身份了，还可以轻松完成杂志社的任务，何乐而不为呢？

然后，阿宾给我电话，问我的意见。我听了后，给了阿宾两个建议。

  1. 加入这个杂志社，以“运营总监”的身份全力做一些超出这些人预期10倍的事情。或者，

  2. 不要碰这个事情，你不缺这样的身份。这个和你的“目标”完全不一致。

而阿宾自己的方案：用五分之一的精力完成杂志社的诉求，同时换的身份和一些金钱。这个方案我是

完全否决的。

因为，在这个方案里，阿宾其实是在满足第三方（杂志社）的诉求，而自己获得是只是经济回报和一

个看起来靓丽却完全没有用处的身份。而他自己真实的诉求：做成某件事。则是完全没有影子。

其实，人到了中年，或者说到了一定的阶段，就不再建议去做一些琐碎的事情了，更不建议像狗皮膏

药一样给自己身上贴一堆标签。最多也就是像百兽之王那样，在脑门上标记一个”王“字而已。

对于一个中年男人，没有什么职位、标签可以给你真正的帮助，只有你真实的实力了经历才可以让你

获得真实的影响力和自信心。

而自信心，确实中年男人的一个需求。

挂了电话后，我就忘记了这件事，今天读到德鲁克的观点：不要因为”便宜“而收购一家公司，一定要

考虑被收购公司对自己的战略价值。

是呀，一个优秀的杂志社的”运营总监“，并不会给你什么真正的帮助，除非你可以借助这个职位做一

些真正有影响力的事情，而要做这个，你花五分之一的精力是完全不够的。

要做，就all in，让这个人生的一小步， 变成你的人生战略的关键一步。

如此而已。

如果你说阿宾，你会如何做？

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

12 DECEMBER

Business Not Financial Strategy

Strategy：

[ C ] ~ (for doing sth) | ~ (to do sth) a plan that is intended to achieve a particular purpose

策略；计策；行动计划

“There ain’t no bargains,” and “You get at most what you pay for.”

bargain：

减价品；便宜货

a thing bought for less than the usual price

Successful acquisitions are based upon business plans, not financial analyses.

analyses:

N-VAR Analysis is the process of considering something carefully or using statistical methods in order to understand it or

explain it.

分析

Acquisition targets must fit the business strategies of the acquiring company; otherwise, the

acquisition is likely to fail.

Acquisition：

商

[ C U ] ( business

) a company, piece of land, etc. bought by sb, especially another company; the act of buying it

购置物；收购的公司；购置的产业；购置；收购

The worst acquisition record of the last decades of the twentieth century was that of Peter Grace,

the longtime CEO of W. R. Grace.

He was a brilliant man. He set out in the 1950s to build a world-class multinational through

financially-based acquisitions.

brilliant：

很成功的

set out： 出发；开始；陈述；陈列

very successful

institute, proceed, speak, leave, start off

He assembled the ablest group of financial analysts and had them scout all over the world for

industries and companies with a low price/earnings ratio.

assembled：

V-T/V-I When people assemble or when someone assembles them, they come together in a group, usually for a

particular purpose such as a meeting.

ablest：

集合

He bought these companies at what he thought were bargain prices.

bargain：

减价品；便宜货

a thing bought for less than the usual price

The financial analysis of each Grace purchase was impeccable.

impeccable：

无错误的；无瑕疵的；完美的

without mistakes or faults

But there was absolutely no business strategy.

By contrast, one of the most successful examples of company growth based on acquisitions was

the one that underlined the stellar performance of General Electric during the tenure of Jack

Welch as CEO from 1981 to 2001.

underlined：

stellar：

tenure：

（尤指重要

the period of time when sb holds an important job, especially a political one; the act of holding an important job

政治职务的）任期，任职

The largest single cause of the company’s growth in sales and earnings—and the resulting rise in

the company’s market value—was the acquisition-based expansion of GE Capital.

Of course, not all of them panned out.

panned out：成功；结果（是）；证明

In fact, there was one major failure, the acquisition of a brokerage firm.

brokerage：n. 佣金；回扣；中间人业务

But otherwise the GE Capital acquisitions seem to have worked out magnificently.

magnificently：adv. 壮丽地，宏伟地；壮观地

Underlying practically all of them was a sound business strategy.

ACTION POINT: Think through an acquisition made by your organization. What was the basis of

the acquisition: strategic or financial? How has it worked out?

acquisition：

[ U ] the act of getting sth, especially knowledge, a skill, etc.

The Successful Acquisition (Corpedia Online Program)

（知识、技能等的）获得，得到

12 DECEMBER

Business Not Financial Strategy

“There ain’t no bargains,” and “You get at most what you pay for.”

Successful acquisitions are based upon business plans, not financial

analyses. Acquisition targets must fit the business strategies of the

acquiring company; otherwise, the acquisition is likely to fail. The worst

acquisition record of the last decades of the twentieth century was that of

Peter Grace, the longtime CEO of W. R. Grace. He was a brilliant man.

He set out in the 1950s to build a world-class multinational through

financially-based acquisitions. He assembled the ablest group of financial

analysts and had them scout all over the world for industries and compa-

nies with a low price/earnings ratio. He bought these companies at what

he thought were bargain prices. The financial analysis of each Grace pur-

chase was impeccable. But there was absolutely no business strategy.

By contrast, one of the most successful examples of company growth

based on acquisitions was the one that underlined the stellar performance

of General Electric during the tenure of Jack Welch as CEO from 1981 to

  1. The largest single cause of the company’s growth in sales and

earnings—and the resulting rise in the company’s market value—was the

acquisition-based expansion of GE Capital. Of course, not all of them

panned out. In fact, there was one major failure, the acquisition of a bro-

kerage firm. But otherwise the GE Capital acquisitions seem to have

worked out magnificently. Underlying practically all of them was a sound

business strategy.

ACTION POINT:

Think through an acquisition made by your organiza-tion.

What was the basis of the acquisition: strategic or financial? How has it

worked out?

The Successful Acquisition (Corpedia Online Program)

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

买，买，买，你凭什么买人家？！！！

在这个商业的时代，也无外乎有钱人的买买买，以及穷人的卖卖卖。

那么，你凭什么买呢？

你去商场买一双鞋，因为你需要。你去饭店买一桌饭，因为你需要。你买一个电脑，因为你需要。对

于这些没有生命的东西，只要你需要，你有钱，你就可以买。买了就用，坏了就修，不想修就换。有

钱就可以任性。

如果你喜欢一条狗呢？而且是非常非常喜欢？而且狗也不贵，那么你会买么？

可能会，也可能不会。因为，这时你就要考虑你有没有能力养狗了。

作为一个爱狗多年的人士，我一直没有养过狗 。因为我知道，在养狗前我需要考虑清楚五件事：

  1. 不会抛弃它

  2. 学习宠物知识

  3. 让它开心地度过一生

  4. 给狗狗一个家

  5. 承诺包容狗狗

因为各种原因，我一直没法给狗狗一个家，所以，我也就一直没有养狗。虽然狗狗很便宜，甚至有一

些朋友要送我狗狗，我也忍心拒绝了。

所以，当你买狗时，就不是简单地买卖了。在你“买”狗钱，你需要考虑的是你能为狗狗做什么，你是

否已经准备好了？

那么，如果你要买一个公司呢？

那就更复杂了，因为买一个公司，涉及到很多人，还涉及到很多事。那么，你是不是有钱就可以买

呢？

在IT行业，有很多有趣的并购。比如，Juniper收购过一家叫做”Paribit”的公司。Juniper是一件网络设

备公司，Paribit也是一家网络设备公司。Paribit 只有一个产品，就是广域网加速，而Juniper也有同样

的产品：Juniper WX（DX）。

Parabit的产品在市场居于领先位置，确实一家很小很小的公司。后来，Juniper收购了他们，然后把他

们关掉了。Juniper WX就成了市场上最好的产品了。

在这个收购中，Juniper有钱，Paribit就消失了。这就是这次收购的价值。

这是一种毁灭性收购，大部分收购不会是这个样子的。毕竟，大部分收购还是要考虑商业价值的。收

购方和被收购方都希望得到利益。

那么，最佳的收购是什么样子的呢？

我想起了十多年前中国企业网对新网的收购。

新网是一家顶级域名提供商，他们通过和根域名服务器的对接在国内提供域名的注册、解析服务，而

中国企业网是一家以互联网产品销售为主的产品，他们本来是新网的代理商，代理销售新网的域名。

当然，中国企业网也是当时另一家顶级域名服务商：万网的代理。

中国企业网的销售能力很强，在不到2年的时间里就拥有了5万家企业用户。

这时的中国企业网脚踩两条船：万网和新网（其实还有CNNIC），在两家之间找价格。

而新网和万网也因着中国企业网的销售能力而处于相对被动地位。

作为企业，中国企业网，新网，万网（这是万网比新网要大不少）都要最佳的利润。

这时，中国企业网对新网提出了收购申请。

当然，收购价格不高：2000万。当然，新网一共也没几个人，所以，2000万的价格虽然偏低，还是可

以接受的。

中国企业网（现在改名后中企动力）真正有收购新网底气的其实是他们遍布在全国50多个城市（2003

年数据）的销售网络。

也就是说，中企动力的收购，会给新网的销售带来强劲的动力，也会大大增加新网产品的竞争力以及

更新的迭代能力。

看在2000万的份上，更是看着这个庞大的销售体系的份上，新网卖给了中企动力。（现在归属中企动

力的母公司：中国数码）

德鲁克认为，这样的收购，才是有益的收购：收购方在收购前已经想好了能为被收购方做些什么，而

不是直接关掉被收购方。

买一双鞋，买一条狗，买一家公司，看起来都是卖卖行为，你的思考逻辑则完全不同。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

13 DECEMBER

What the Acquirer Contributes

Acquirer： 收买者； 法 受让人；需方； 电子 捕捉器

Contributes：[经] 捐献（contribute的第三人称单数）

[ ]

[

]

transferee, alienee

The successful acquisition is based on what the acquiring company contributes to the acquisition.

An acquisition will succeed only if the acquiring company thinks through what it can contribute to

the business it is buying, not what the acquired company will contribute to the acquirer, no matter

how attractive the expected “synergy” may look.

synergy：

术语

[ U C ] ( technical

) the extra energy, power, success, etc. that is achieved by two or more people or companies

协同作用，协同增效作用（人或公司共同协作所产生的效果优于各自单独行动的效果）

attractive：( of a person 人 ) pleasant to look at, especially in a sexual way 性感的；妩媚的；英俊的；诱人的

working together, instead of on their own

What the acquiring company contributes may vary.

vary：

一组类似的事物

[ V ] ~ (in sth) ( of a group of similar things

等）相异，不同，有别

) to be different from each other in size, shape, etc.

（大小、形状

It may be management, technology, or strength in distribution.

This contribution has to be something besides money.

Money by itself is never enough.

The acquisition of Citibank by Travelers was successful because the acquiring company, Travelers,

thought through and planned what it could contribute to Citibank that would make a major

difference.

Travelers：n. 旅行家（户外用品公司名）

Citibank had established itself successfully in practically every country of the world and had, at the

same time, built a transnational management.

transnational：( business 商 ) existing in or involving many different countries 跨国的；多国的

But in its products and services Citibank was still primarily a traditional bank, and its distributive

and management capacity way exceeded the products and services commercial banking can

produce and deliver.

traditional：

being part of the beliefs, customs or way of life of a particular group of people, that have not changed for a long time

传统的；习俗的；惯例的

And Travelers had a good many of these products and services.

What it saw itself as being able to contribute was greatly to increase the volume of business the

superb Citibank worldwide distribution system and management could sell, and at little or no extra

cost.

ACTION POINT:

Before making an acquisition, focus on contribution, not synergy.

acquisition：

商

[ C U ] ( business

) a company, piece of land, etc. bought by sb, especially another company; the act of buying it

购置物；收购的公司；购置的产业；购置；收购

synergy：[ U C ] ( technical 术语 ) the extra energy, power, success, etc. that is achieved by two or more people or companies

working together, instead of on their own 协同作用，协同增效作用（人或公司共同协作所产生的效果优于各自单独行动的效果）

The Frontiers of Management

The Successful Acquisition (Corpedia Online Program)

13 DECEMBER

What the Acquirer Contributes

The successful acquisition is based on what the acquiring

company contributes to the acquisition.

An acquisition will succeed only if the acquiring company thinks through

what it can contribute to the business it is buying, not what the acquired

company will contribute to the acquirer, no matter how at-

tractive the expected “synergy” may look. What the acquiring company

contributes may vary. It may be management, technology, or strength in

distribution. This contribution has to be something besides money. Money

by itself is never enough.

The acquisition of Citibank by Travelers was successful because the

ac-quiring company, Travelers, thought through and planned what it could

contribute to Citibank that would make a major difference. Citibank had

established itself successfully in practically every country of the world

and had, at the same time, built a transnational management. But in its

prod-ucts and services Citibank was still primarily a traditional bank, and

its dis-tributive and management capacity way exceeded the products and

services commercial banking can produce and deliver. And Travelers had

a good many of these products and services. What it saw itself as being

able to contribute was greatly to increase the volume of business the

superb Citibank worldwide distribution system and management could

sell, and at little or no extra cost.

ACTION POINT:

Before making an acquisition, focus on contribution, not

synergy.

The Frontiers of Management

The Successful Acquisition (Corpedia Online Program)

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

金庸笔下门派的合并和分裂

话说天下大势，分久必合，合久必分。在金庸的江湖中，分久必合是小势，合久必分则是大势。有很

多门派，搞得好好地，说分就分了。

最著名的当然是《笑傲江湖》里的华山派了。好好的一个华山派，就因为练功的优先级：先练习气功

还是先练习剑术，硬生生分成了两派：气宗和剑宗。好好的一个剑气冲天，也变成了以气御剑。

谁对谁错呢？其实，哪有对错，只是一个根据各个弟子的领悟能力做的优先级安排而已。

还有《雪山飞狐》里的天龙门，不大的一个门派，分成了南北两宗。北宗位于辽东，南宗位于天南。

相隔几千公里，如果不是为了那一把刀子。两派几乎要见不上面了。

随着时间的推移，两派的武功、理念也都有了天翻地覆的区别。

还有北宋的无量剑派，分成了北、东、西三个宗。北宗从云南迁到山西，四十年后都没联系了，老死

不相往来，形同陌路。剩下两个宗离心离德，整天内斗。几乎成了黑恶势力的聚集，都不成个派了。

再比如因为教主失踪而分裂出来的天鹰教，分裂出来后，把自己的总舵设置到了东南一代，天鹰教的

崛起是伴随着明教的式微的。

从明教分裂出的天鹰教，仍然坚持明教的教宗，隐约成为明教的新中心。而且一直也是吧做自己当成

明教的新生力量。

后来明教崛起，天鹰教也就再次回归明教了。

分裂后的门派，大多消失了，如西域少林；有的连横的要死的老门派都消失了，如无量派，逍遥派

等。

那么，合并呢？金庸笔下的合并不多。比较著名的就是五岳派的合并了。

五岳派指的是泰山、华山、嵩山、恒山、衡山五个剑派，五岳分布在山东、陕西、湖南、山西、河南

五个省，之间相距动辄上千里。从华山到泰山，大约有八百公里；从华山到衡山，要一千多公里。

在那个时代，即使轻功卓越，走一遍五岳派也是很难的一件事。所以，五岳派合并失败了。努力想促

成五岳派合并的左冷禅、岳不群，都死了。

那么，五岳派真的不能合并么？在这个分裂为主的江湖，五岳派的合并，只是死路一条么？

其实不然。

五岳派都是以剑术为主，所以称为五岳剑派。他们有共同的技术：剑术。就凭这一点，他们就有了合

并的基础。

你想呀，大家都是用剑的，嵩山剑法大开大合，泰山剑法招数古朴，衡山剑法变化繁复，华山剑法轻

灵机巧，恒山剑法却极少破绽。

在长达百年间，分布在五岳的五个剑术门派，分布发展出了完全不一样的剑术，他们之间对剑的理解

也都达到了炉火纯青的地步，他们肯定需要知道其他剑术高手对剑的理解。

这也就形成了他们合并成一个门派的主要动因。

只要有一个才能人，出一个有创意的点子，这五个剑派就可以成为联盟（这个已经形成）。而且，在

《笑傲江湖》中，五岳派的弟子也认可：五岳弟子，情同兄弟。

这时，如果再有一个有创意的领袖人物，则很容易把五岳派合并为一，这样，大家就可以专心研究剑

术，成为天下第一剑术门派，而且遍布全国。这时，他们就可以说：“天下剑术，无不出于五岳派”。

可惜，所托非人，五岳派合并失败了。遗憾。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

14 DECEMBER

Common Core of Unity

Unity:

团结一致；

There has to be a “common culture” or at least a “cultural affinity.”

affinity:

喜好；喜爱

[ U sing. ] the state of being in agreement and working together; the state of being joined together to form one unit

联合；统一

[ sing. ] ~ (for/with sb/sth) | ~ (between A and B) a strong feeling that you understand sb/sth and like them or it

Successful diversification by acquisition, like all successful diversification, requires a common

core of unity.

diversification:n. 多样化；变化

The two businesses must have in common either markets or technology, though occasionally a

comparable production process has also provided sufficient unity of experience and expertise, as

well as a common language, to bring companies together.

Without such a core of unity, diversification, especially by acquisition, never works; financial ties

alone are insufficient.

One example is a big French company that has been built by acquiring producers of all kinds of

luxury goods: champagne and high-fashion designers, very expensive watches and perfumes and

handmade shoes.

It looks like the worst kind of conglomerate.

conglomerate

商

:[ C ] ( business

) a large company formed by joining together different firms

联合大公司；企业集团

The products have seemingly nothing in common.

But all of them are being bought by customers for the same reason, which, of course, is not utility

or price.

Instead, people buy them because they are “status.”

status:n. 地位；状态；情形；重要身份

What all the acquisitions of this successful acquirer have in common is their customers’ values.

Champagne is being sold quite differently from high fashion.

Champagne:n. 香槟酒；香槟酒色

But it is being bought for much the same reason.

ACTION POINT: In any acquisition, make sure there is a common culture or a cultural affinity

between the two entities.

The Frontiers of Management

The Successful Acquisition (Corpedia Online Program)

14 DECEMBER

Common Core of Unity

There has to be a “common culture” or at least a “cultural affinity.”

Successful diversification by acquisition, like all successful diversifica-

tion, requires a common core of unity. The two businesses must have in

common either markets or technology, though occasionally a comparable

production process has also provided sufficient unity of experience and ex-

pertise, as well as a common language, to bring companies together. With-out

such a core of unity, diversification, especially by acquisition, never

works; financial ties alone are insufficient.

One example is a big French company that has been built by acquiring

producers of all kinds of luxury goods: champagne and high-fashion de-

signers, very expensive watches and perfumes and handmade shoes. It

looks like the worst kind of conglomerate. The products have seemingly

nothing in common. But all of them are being bought by customers for

the same reason, which, of course, is not utility or price. Instead, people

buy them because they are “status.” What all the acquisitions of this

successful acquirer have in common is their customers’ values.

Champagne is being sold quite differently from high fashion. But it is

being bought for much the same reason.

ACTION POINT:

In any acquisition, make sure there is a common culture or

a cultural affinity between the two entities.

The Frontiers of Management

The Successful Acquisition (Corpedia Online Program)

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

金庸笔下最成功的一次并购

金庸笔下的并派，大多不成功，因为所有的并派都意味着独裁，威权，霸道，而主角大多是反抗这些的，就像令狐冲反对五岳派并派。

那么，有没有完美的并购呢？完美的并购应该是什么样子的呢？

其实，在金庸笔下有一场非常完美的，堪称教科书级的并购，而且是主角主导的。这就是《鹿鼎记》中韦小宝所带领的青木堂对王屋派的并购。

青木堂本来是江苏一带的天地会分舵。在各种机缘下，也是为了发展，他们来到了北京一带活动。并且找了韦小宝做他们的堂主。

韦小宝是一个身份比较复杂的人。他不但是天地会青木堂的堂主，还是康熙皇帝身边的红人，还是御前侍卫，还是神龙教的白龙使等等等等。

这一天，康熙皇帝想犒劳小宝，就派了他一个美差：让他去扬州盖祠堂，同时免除扬州三年的赋税。

这是个大大的美差，不但可以得利，还可以得名。

王屋派在河南境内，原本是吴三桂的部下军队。吴三桂投降清军后，他们就留在王屋派落草为寇，慢慢的，也形成了一个门派。在某次活动中，康熙皇帝知道了在山西和河南交界处有这么一直“军事力量”。就放在了心里。

这次小宝去扬州盖祠堂，正好路过王屋山，康熙就给了小宝一个密旨，让他带几千兵马，顺便把王屋山给剿了。

小宝看到这个密旨，很是迷茫。

一方面，这是康熙皇帝的密旨，必须照办。另一方面，王屋派是反清义士，和天地会是一路的，小宝于情于理都下不去手。

而且，如果他真的执行皇帝的密旨，剿灭了王屋派，师父陈近南，还有天下汉人，都会认为小宝是个大大的坏人。

小宝虽然不是什么好人，可是做汉奸还是不干的。

所以小宝很纠结。

怎么办呢？

走一步看一步吧，反正皇帝的命令必须执行，而王屋派的好汉必须不杀。

到了王屋山后，小宝命令军队团团围住王屋山，小宝带了5000名士兵。围住一个小小的王屋山绰绰有余。

围住后，小宝正想如何放人。突然看到一条大汉从山上冲下来，手里拎着什么东西，后面还跟着几个人，小宝命令士兵抓住，发现这个是是吴三桂的侍卫，叫做巴朗星。巴朗星被抓住后，随即说自己奉吴三桂的命令，杀了王屋派的掌门人司徒伯雷。他后面那些人当然也就是他的带来的手下了。

看到巴朗星，还有司徒伯雷的脑袋，小宝陷入了轻轻的思考。

想着王屋派那个清秀的姑娘曾柔，小宝更加坚定了注意：并购王屋派。

小宝先是给了见面礼：司徒伯雷的人头和被捆绑起来的巴朗星及其随从。

司徒伯雷的儿子司徒鹤（理论上，这时他应该是掌门了）看到这份见面礼，也就只好接见小宝和小宝的随从了。

为了方便行动，小宝只带了天地会青木堂的人上山去谈并购。

到了山上后，徐天川先是对王屋派一顿猛夸，把王屋派捧的如天之高，司徒鹤也就有点飘飘然了。

接着，小宝带着大家在司徒伯雷的棺材前大哭一顿，哭的那叫一个惨，看的司徒鹤都想过去安慰了。

不过，司徒鹤想，这些清兵究竟想干嘛呢？就凭这个巴朗星的脑袋，还有哭这几下，就想让我们归顺朝廷？没这么简单吧。

果然，小宝哭完后，徐天川就表明了自己的身份：天地会青木堂的。

然后徐天川和司徒鹤就开始了互捧模式。徐天川说王屋派如何如何有一起，司徒鹤说天地会如何如何领袖江湖。

说着说着，徐天川说，要不，你们加入我们天地会得了？

司徒鹤一愣，才反应过来：你们不是清兵么？怎么成了天地会的？你们不是来剿灭我们的门？怎么反而杀了我们的仇敌，来祭拜我的老父亲？

徐天川这时隐晦地说小宝是“身在曹营心在汉”，等待时机反清复明。司徒鹤看着小宝。想起上次在小宝军营被小宝释放，这时才恍然大悟。

徐天川进一步说：“皇帝要剿灭王屋派，你们归入天地会后，和我们一起离开王屋山，到北京去，这样小宝也好交差，大家也有个出路。”

司徒鹤想了想，也没有别的方法，而且，他觉得徐天川他们对自己还是很敬重的，而且，王屋派和天地会，本来也是同一个目标。

于是，司徒鹤就答应了。

这时徐天川才说小宝其实是青木堂的堂主。

大家大开香堂，接纳了王屋派加入青木堂，然后大家穿上清军的衣服，成了清军了。

并购完成。而且，司徒鹤很开心：“既然韦香主做的清军的官，我们为什么做不得清军的兵？”

每次读到这里，我总是认为，这个并购是理所当然的：既然王屋派和天地会都是反清复明的，那么干嘛不并购呢？

后来想想，其实不然。沐王府和天地会就很难并购，各大派也大多不愿意被并购。

我觉得，青木堂之所以可以顺利完成对王屋派的并购，有几个点是很关键的。

首先是大兵压境，在这种情况下，是否同意并购就是生死的选择。当然，舍生取义的人也大有所在。

其次就是天地会的身份，天地会在反清义士中有很好的名声，被天地会并购兵不丢人。

最后一点，就是天地会对王屋派的认可，以及对司徒伯雷的尊重。如果没有这个尊重和认可，即使是天地会去并购，最后的结果都可能是鱼死网破。

所以，在并购中，收购方对被收购方的认可和尊重，是非常重要的。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

15 DECEMBER

Respect for the Business and Its Values

The acquisition must be a “temperamental fit.”

acquisition：

temperamental：

[ U ] the act of getting sth, especially knowledge, a skill, etc.

（知识、技能等的）获得，得到

( usually disapproving ) having a tendency to become angry, excited or upset easily, and to behave in an

unreasonable way

喜怒无常的；容易激动的；反复无常的

No acquisition works unless the people in the acquiring company have respect for the product,

the markets, and the customers of the company they acquire.

acquisition：

[ U ] the act of getting sth, especially knowledge, a skill, etc.

（知识、技能等的）获得，得到

Though many large pharmaceutical companies have acquired cosmetic firms, none has made a

great success of it.

Pharmacologists and biochemists are “serious” people concerned with health and disease.

Lipsticks and lipstick users are frivolous to them.

By the same token, few of the big television networks and other entertainment companies have

made a go of the book publishers they bought.

Books are not “media,” and neither book buyers nor authors—a book publisher’s two customers—

bear any resemblance to what the Nielsen rating means by “audience.”

bear：

在否定句和疑问句中与 ╱ 连用

( used with can/could in negative sentences and questions

deal with sth unpleasant

resemblance：

承受；忍受

can could

[ C U ] ~ (to sb/sth) | ~ (between A and B) the fact of being or looking similar to sb/sth

) to be able to accept and

相似；相像

Sooner or later, usually sooner, a business requires a decision.

People who do not respect or feel comfortable with the business, its products, and its users

invariably make the wrong decision.

invariably： 始终如一地；一贯地

always

ACTION POINT:

Take an acquisition with which you are familiar.

Was there a temperamental fit between the two companies?

temperamental：

( usually disapproving ) having a tendency to become angry, excited or upset easily, and to behave in an

unreasonable way

喜怒无常的；容易激动的；反复无常的

How did the companies respect, or fail to respect, each other’s business?

The Frontiers of Management

The Successful Acquisition (Corpedia Online Program)

15 DECEMBER

Respect for the Business and Its Values

The acquisition must be a “temperamental fit.”

No acquisition works unless the people in the acquiring company have

respect for the product, the markets, and the customers of the com-pany they

acquire. Though many large pharmaceutical companies have acquired

cosmetic firms, none has made a great success of it. Pharmacolo-gists and

biochemists are “serious” people concerned with health and dis-ease.

Lipsticks and lipstick users are frivolous to them. By the same token, few of

the big television networks and other entertainment companies have made

Ago of the book publishers they bought. Books are not “media,” and neither

book buyers nor authors—a book publisher’s two customers—bear any

resemblance to what the Nielsen rating means by “audience.” Sooner or later,

usually sooner, a business requires a decision. People who do not respect or

feel comfortable with the business, its products, and its users in-

variably make the wrong decision.

ACTION POINT:

Take an acquisition with which you are familiar. Was there

a temperamental fit between the two companies? How did the com-panies

respect, or fail to respect, each other’s business?

The Frontiers of Management

The Successful Acquisition (Corpedia Online Program)

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

天山童姥的手段

对于江湖中很多人来说，天山童姥是一个恶魔般的存在。不管哪一派的帮主或者岛主或者洞主，直接

抓过来做努力，先是种上生死符，安排一系列重苦的活，干的好了，就一顿鞭子，干的不好，生死符

直接要了你的命，也不用多废话。

对于童姥来说，控制帮主、岛主、洞主，是一件很高效的事情。只要控制了他们，他们的一个帮派所

有的人都为自己服务。自己只要使劲虐待帮主就够了。其他人自然也就听话了。

万一虐待死，就再在里面找一个呗，不听话就直接打死。反正人多的是，说话还费劲呢。

童姥为什么这么做呢？为什不像丐帮那样通过兄弟情谊把大家绑在一起？或者想少林那样，通过宗教

和故事书（典籍）把大家绑在一起，甚至像大理段家拳掌门人段老师，通过世俗的皇帝规则占据了一

块地盘。

童姥为什么要用这么野蛮的方法呢？这简直回到了原始社会嘛。为什么呢？

其实，这也是童姥的不得已而为之。咱们就他就说说天山派的这个神奇架构。

姑且称天山童姥以及她架构的这三十六洞、七十二岛主为天山派。首先，童姥的武功是非常高的，在

天龙八部里是超一流的，对于童姥来说，既然拥有了超一流的武功，那么用武力统治别人就是成本最

低的事情。

其实，童姥有一个敌人，就是李秋水。童姥要花很大的精力来对付李秋水，所以就没有精力去经营天

山的势力，可是，童姥又是一个需要权势的人，对于她来说，用武力快速获得权势就是一个实际的需

求了。

从旁观者的角度看，童姥并没有多好的管理能力，她的管理也无外乎恩威并施，以威为主，用武力做

背书。

所以，我们假设，童姥没有能力构架一个完整的经济和权力系统。那么怎么办呢？就是某个人有钱，

他想开公司，可是，有没有管理和创业能力，怎么办呢？

买买买、合合合呀。并购一切可以并购的帮派就是童姥的策略。

所以，童姥就开始了一个帮派，一个帮派地收购。

当童姥收购了第一个帮派后，发现帮主并不大鸟自己。而且自己也不能天天守着这个帮派。自己虽然

占了地盘，可是，架不住帮主自己出去做别的，反正，既然是能做到帮主的人，大多还是有一些本事

的。

而且，自己一走，这帮人就各种偷懒，不听自己的。

怎么办呢？每个人都会从自己的优势想事情：给他种个生死符吧。

于是，缺乏管理才能的童姥，就开始了魔鬼般的统治历程。

慢慢地，童姥发现，这些做帮主、教主、堂主的人，大多还是有一些本事的，而这些有本事的人，大

多是不会老老实实听自己的。肯定会想着逃跑后再去其他地方做帮主、教主、堂主什么的。

这就更加坚定了懒惰的童姥的想法：用生死符控制帮主，进而通过帮主控制帮众，通过帮众达到自己

的经济和权势的诉求。

果然，在生死符、蟒蛇鞭、透骨钉等的帮助下，童姥很快建立了包括一个三十六洞主、七十二岛主的

庞大的利益和权力网络，开始了作威作福的生活。

在天山派的架构中，第二层都是一些“老大”，也就是“创业者”，这些人不管能力高低，都有一个共同的

特点：不甘居人之下。

对于这些人，如果不用生死符，他们是不会甘心做一个下属的部门经理的。如果没有生死符，这些人

肯定早早地就散了，天山派也就不存在了。

熟悉《天龙八部》的人可能会说，后来虚竹解了所有人的生死符，这些人依然围在他身边呀，还跟着

他去救萧峰，这说明这些人也是可以形成一个大帮派的。

那么咱们就要看看，100年后的射雕、神雕时代，丐帮依然是天下第一大帮，少林依然是领袖武林，大

理的段家依然是皇族，虚竹的逍遥派呢？只有一个黄药师，依稀是某个岛主的后代。

依稀而已。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

16 DECEMBER

Provide New Top Management

The business these people sell is their “child.”

Within a year or so, the acquiring company must be able to provide top management for the

company it acquires.

The buyer has to be prepared to lose the top incumbents in companies that are bought.

incumbents：

在职者

N-COUNT An incumbent is someone who holds an official post at a particular time.

Top people are used to being bosses; they don’t want to be “division managers.”

If they were owners or part-owners, the merger has made them so wealthy they don’t have to stay

if they don’t enjoy it.

merger：

（机构或企

[ C ] ~ (between/of A and B) | ~ (with sth) the act of joining two or more organizations or businesses into one

业的）合并，归并

And if they are professional managers, without an ownership stake, they usually find another job

easily enough.

stake：

[ C ] a wooden or metal post that is pointed at one end and pushed into the ground in order to support sth, mark a particular

桩；标桩；篱笆桩

ownership stake：股权

place, etc.

Then to recruit new top management is a gamble that rarely comes off.

recruit：

吸收（新成员）；征募（新兵）

gamble：

（牌戏、赛马等中）赌博，打赌

comes off：

举行，成功；表现；脱离

to find new people to join a company, an organization, the armed forces, etc.

(sth) (on sth) to risk money on a card game, horse race, etc.

come off

This applies particularly to a CEO who originally built the company that he or she sold.

Very often this CEO has actually initiated the acquisition.

initiated：

使开始 发起

V-T If you initiate something, you start it or cause it to happen.

;

He or she typically expects the acquirer to make the changes that he or she has been reluctant to

make—for instance, get rid of an old employee who is a close friend and has served the company

faithfully as it grew but has been long outgrown by the job.

reluctant：

(to do sth) hesitating before doing sth because you do not want to do it or because you are not sure that it is the right

不情愿的；勉强的

outgrown：adj. 过大的

thing to do

But still, the business these people sell is their “child.”

And the moment it is owned by someone else, they become protective and see their job as

defending the “child” against one of those unfeeling “foreigners” who now own it.

protective：

保护的；防护的

[ only before noun ] providing or intended to provide protection

ACTION POINT:

Investigate a recent acquisition by your company or another company.

Investigate：

to carefully examine the facts of a situation, an event, a crime, etc. to find out the truth about it or how it happened

调查，侦查（某事）

What happened to the top management of the acquired company?

The Frontiers of Management

The Successful Acquisition (Corpedia Online Program)

16 DECEMBER

Provide New Top Management

The business these people sell is their “child.”

Within a year or so, the acquiring company must be able to provide top

management for the company it acquires. The buyer has to be pre-pared to

lose the top incumbents in companies that are bought. Top people

are used to being bosses; they don’t want to be “division managers.” If

they were owners or part-owners, the merger has made them so wealthy

they don’t have to stay if they don’t enjoy it. And if they are professional

man-agers, without an ownership stake, they usually find another job

easily enough. Then to recruit new top management is a gamble that

rarely comes off.

This applies particularly to a CEO who originally built the company

that he or she sold. Very often this CEO has actually initiated the acquisi-

tion. He or she typically expects the acquirer to make the changes that he

or she has been reluctant to make—for instance, get rid of an old

employee who is a close friend and has served the company faithfully as

it grew but has been long outgrown by the job. But still, the business

these people sell is their “child.” And the moment it is owned by someone

else, they become protective and see their job as defending the “child”

against one of those unfeeling “foreigners” who now own it.

ACTION POINT:

Investigate a recent acquisition by your company or an-

other company. What happened to the top management of the acquired

company?

The Frontiers of Management

The Successful Acquisition (Corpedia Online Program)

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

创业：养猪？还是养孩子？

前几年，大众创业，万众创新，身边涌现出很多创业者。有的成功了，大部分都失败了。

而那些最成功的，则是被BAT这样的公司收购了。拿个几千万，瞬间到达人生的顶点。

而那些没成功的呢？一两年时间，凭着实力亏掉了过去多年凭运气赚的钱。一朝打到了解放前。

有一次参加一个大佬组织的交流会，参加的人除了我，都是有些身份的人，我注意到了其中一个人的

TITLE是前京东VP。

我对京东还算比较了解，知道VP在京东是很高的职位，就和这个人聊天。他说，他以前做了一个电商

平台的联合创始人，后来公司被京东收购了。他们就整体加入了京东。

京东收购的价格还可以，所以，他也赚了一些钱。而且，刚并入京东时，京东给了他一个集团VP的

TITLE，这个TITLE让他开心了挺久。

不过，没过多久，他还是离开了京东。

我问他：“京东待遇不错呀，而且你是VP，名利都有了，干嘛还要离开？”

这位兄弟说：“没办法，被架空了，没事干，只好离开。”

我听了后，才知道：原来如此。

其实，这是BAT，以及各个大厂的习惯。为了快速发展，他们会收购一些行业内的优秀公司，收购后，

会任命被收购公司里的一部分高管为集团的VP（这就是为什么这些公司VP很多），然后，公司正常运

转一段时间。这些VP也差不多就架空了。

再过一段时间，这些有钱没事，由不甘寂寞的VP就纷纷离职了。

现在这个朋友又做了一个电商，这次是会员电商，我体验了一下，感觉普通，就没下单。

其实，对于大多数创业者来说，这位兄弟算是最佳的结局了：有钱（收购款几千万到上亿），有名

（有京东这样公司VP的履历），而且还有闲，多好呀。

这样想的人，大概率是把创业当成养猪。

自己花几块钱注册一个公司，花半天时间写个PPT，然后就开始想着投资人上门扔钱了。公司做的差不

多，更加值钱了，转手一卖，自己也就套现走人了，多像养一头猪，养肥了就拉去卖钱？

不过，还有一些人创业是当成养孩子，自己辛辛苦苦、兢兢业业地按自己的想法管理这个公司，等着

公司慢慢长大，然后一分钱一分钱地通过自己组建的公司来赚钱。

接下来，就是生活了， 通过公司赚钱，通过公司生活，如此而已。

这两种都没错，只是第二种公司还有另一个结局：月有阴晴圆缺，当公司经营不下去时，当发不出工

资时，总会找到BAT这样的公司来投靠，一旦卖出公司了。这个公司的创始人，还有高管，肯定会非常

心痛。

当然，这种时候，他们仍然是会得到大笔的钱，同时也会得到这些大厂的VP的职位。因为这是这些大

厂收购公司的标准动作。

然后，用不了多久，这些人就会离开大厂。继续开始新的生活，或者创业，或者去实现自己的梦想：

环游世界？

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

17 DECEMBER

Promote Across Lines

Promote：

Across Lines:

Politically, the people in the acquired company become “us” determined to defend their business

against “them.”

Politically:adv. 政治上

Even if all the rules have been faithfully observed, many acquisitions end up failing or at least

take forever before they live up to their expectations.

faithfully:

忠实地；忠诚地

in a loyal way; in a way that you can rely on

acquisition：

商 ) a company, piece of land, etc. bought by sb, especially another company; the act of buying it

购置物；收购的公司；购置的产业；购置；收购

[ C U ] ( business

Legally the acquired business is now part of the acquiring company.

But politically, the people in the acquired company become “us” determined to defend their

business against “them,” the people in the acquiring company.

defend：

防御；保护；保卫

(sb/yourself/sth) (from/against sb/sth) to protect sb/sth from attack

[ VN ]

And the people in the acquiring company similarly think and act in terms of “us” against “them.”

Sometimes it takes a whole generation before these invisible but impenetrable barriers come

down.

impenetrable：

不可进入的；穿不过的；无法透视的

barriers：

that cannot be entered, passed through or seen through

N-COUNT A barrier is something such as a rule, law, or policy that makes it difficult or impossible for something to

happen or be achieved.

障碍

come down： 下来，降落；流传下来；倒塌；落泊，失势

collapse, get down

It is therefore imperative that, within the first few months after the acquisition, a number of people

on both sides are promoted to a better job across the lines.

imperative：

[ not usually before noun ] ~ (that…) | ~ (to do sth) ( formal ) very important and needing immediate attention or

action SYN vital

重要紧急的；迫切的；急需处理的

This way both sides see the acquisition as a personal opportunity.

The goal is to convince managers in both companies that the merger offers them personal

opportunities.

convince：

使确信；使相信；使信服

sb/yourself (of sth) to make sb/yourself believe that sth is true

This principle apples not only to executives at or near the top, but also to the younger executives

and professionals, the people on whose dedication and efforts any business primarily depends.

If they see themselves blocked as a result of an acquisition, they will “vote with their feet,” and as a

rule they can find new jobs even more easily than displaced top executives.

displaced：

使背井离

乡

V-T If a person or group of people is displaced, they are forced to move away from the area where they live.

ACTION POINT:

Make sure you promote people in the wake of an acquisition.

in the wake of：紧紧跟随；随着…而来；作为…的结果；仿效

The Frontiers of Management

The Successful Acquisition (Corpedia Online Program)

17 DECEMBER

Promote Across Lines

Politically, the people in the acquired company become “us”

determined to defend their business against “them.”

Even if all the rules have been faithfully observed, many acquisitions end

up failing or at least take forever before they live up to their expec-tations.

Legally the acquired business is now part of the acquiring com-pany. But

politically, the people in the acquired company become “us” determined to

defend their business against “them,” the people in the ac-quiring company.

And the people in the acquiring company similarly think and act in terms of

“us” against “them.” Sometimes it takes a whole gener-ation before these

invisible but impenetrable barriers come down. It is therefore imperative that,

within the first few months after the acquisition, a number of people on both

sides are promoted to a better job across the

lines. This way both sides see the acquisition as a personal opportunity. The

goal is to convince managers in both companies that the merger of-

fers them personal opportunities. This principle apples not only to execu-

tives at or near the top, but also to the younger executives and

professionals, the people on whose dedication and efforts any business

primarily de-pends. If they see themselves blocked as a result of an

acquisition, they will “vote with their feet,” and as a rule they can find

new jobs even more easily than displaced top executives.

ACTION POINT:

Make sure you promote people in the wake of an acquisi-

tion.

The Frontiers of Management

The Successful Acquisition (Corpedia Online Program)

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

家族和家庭的关系

最近见了一些人，这些人是做“家族办公室”的， 家族办公室被称为财富管理行业皇冠上的明珠，是很

多业内人士的“诗和远方”。他们谈论的话题是产权梳理、身份规划、离岸架构、家族基金、新生代培

养等等等等。

我看了看菜单，感觉没有自己的菜，感觉有点颓废，就怯怯的问了一句：“请问，有家庭办公室么？”

这位才华横溢的美貌妇人白了我一眼，说：“没有，我们是做家族的，不做家庭，丢不起那个人。”

然后我就更怯怯了。赶紧收起了自己的小想法。然后找来百度百科，看看自己离家族还有多远。

在百度百科， 我查到了家族的定义：

家族，是指具有血缘关系的人组成一个社会群体，通常有几代人。语出《管子·小匡》：“公修公族，家

修家族。使相连以事，相及以禄。”

中国历史上有名的家族有春秋时期的晋国六卿，即赵氏、韩氏、魏氏、智氏、范氏、中行氏。

隋唐时期的五姓七望，即陇西李氏、赵郡李氏、博陵崔氏、清河崔氏、范阳卢氏、荥阳郑氏、太原王

氏等。

那么，家庭呢？百度百科告诉我说：家庭是指婚姻关系、血缘关系或收养关系基础上产生的，亲属之

间所构成的社会生活单位。

从社会设置来说，家庭是最基本的社会设置之一，是人类最基本最重要的一种制度和群体形式。

从功能来说，家庭是儿童社会化，供养老人，是满足经济合作的人类亲密关系的基本单位。

从关系来说，家庭是由具有婚姻、血缘和收养关系的人们长期居住的共同群体。

我姓韩，已婚，有爸爸，还有媳妇，还有两个孩子，这大概就是我的家庭。至于家族？应该有韩氏家

族，我们家族据说还建国了， 叫做韩国，可是，我去找他们的话，还得要护照，太麻烦。

韩国应该是个大家族了，他们的掌家人在做家族规划时，会考虑我么？或许会，或许不会，那个应该

靠不住。我还是需要做我自己的家庭规划，有我的爸爸，有我媳妇，还有儿子们。

有人告诉我，其实家族也没有那么大，也就是管理资产过1亿美元就好了。一亿美元，看起来也不算

多。知乎上应该有大把的人可以达到这个收入。

我还是达不到的，然后，我找了一下招商银行（贝恩公司）对中国富人的统计。发现超过1亿人民币的

人，在国内大概有17万人。这只是一亿美金的好几分之一。

嗯，据说回龙观小区有100万人。

看来，我是赶不上了。

而我只是一个普通家庭，一家几口，上有老，下有小，年收入30-100万之间。看起来生活的还人模人

样，一场风险就会被摧毁。

所以，我也需要家庭规划，甚至比大的家族更需要家庭规划。那么谁来给我做家庭规划呢？

我也买了不少保险，我也买了一些基金，也有股票，也有房产，也有期权，却都是零零散散，自己没

能力，也没精力去思考这个规划的问题，我要是静下来思考规划的问题的话，又会影响我的收入，毕

竟，我的精力是有限的。

可是，并没有人在做帮我做家庭财富规划，或者说家庭风险规划。那么，也就是没有人在帮我建设一

个我的“家庭办公室”。

换一个角度，家族是什么呢？《红楼梦》里的贾家肯定是个家族了吧。贾家由宁国府和荣国府组成。

那么，荣国府是家族么？应该也是。毕竟荣国府单独开府也近百年了。

那么贾赦家呢？是家族么？贾赦自己也封了侯爷，也有不少子子孙孙，也有巨额财富，应该也算家

族。

贾政当然也算了。

甚至说，贾琏算么？贾琏和王熙凤一家，也有很多亲戚和利益相关体，在一定程度上，他们也组成了

一个不小的家族。

那么贾宝玉算么？应该不算，毕竟，他只是孤家寡人一个。

他要是结婚后，生一堆孩子呢?几百年后，就会有一个贾宝玉家族。

所以，我理解，家族其实是家庭的聚合物。每个人的家庭，就是以自己为中心的一些血缘关系，也就

是：我，我的另一半，生我的以及我生的。这和简单的关系组成了一个最简单的家庭细胞。

中国是个农业社会，农业社会讲究的是人和人之间通过血缘而协作的关系。所以，我的兄弟姐妹，他

们也有他们的家庭细胞。我也会和他们协作、合作，当协作的事情多了，协作的关系非常紧密了，自

然也就组成了家族。

不过，家庭内和家族内的关系是完全不同的。家庭内，只有亲情，没有道理。你不能在家庭内讲逻

辑，讲商业。

家族则不同，家族虽然也讲亲情，更多也是需要商业逻辑的。因为商业是最成熟的合作关系。

家庭和家庭之间紧密的商业关系，加上血缘关系，让家族有了做大的可能性。不过，并不比非血缘关

系好多少。

所以，我理解，家庭和家庭通过商业、法律以及政治逻辑才可以组成家族，或者说，这样组成的家族

才是稳定的，这些商业、法律以及政治的描述文档或许可以解释为是“家族宪法”一类的东西。

不过，家族形成是很难的，中国几千年，形成家族的也就那么几十个，大部分家庭还是成不了家族，

即使很有钱，即使超过一亿美金，也成不了家族。

那么，现在，我问你，如果你很聪明，要进入财富管理这个行业，你是愿意做一个家族办公室？还是

愿意做一个家庭办公室？

  1. 产权梳理

2.身份规划

3 离岸架构

4 美国架构

5.家族基金

  1. 投资组合管理

7家族治理

8家族办公室

9 家族慈善

10新生代培养

大纲

百字摘要

联盟代替独资公司，成为首选的商业模式

这个模式，可以依托法律和政治（已经成熟的架构），得到急速的发挥。

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

18 DECEMBER

Alliances for Progress

The practice of management will have to base itself on the new assumption that its scope is not

legal but the entire economic chain.

Business growth and business expansion in different parts of the world will increasingly not be

based on mergers and acquisitions or even on starting new, wholly owned businesses there.

They will increasingly have to be based on alliances, partnerships, joint ventures, and all kinds of

relations with organizations located in other political jurisdictions.

partnerships：

伙伴关系；合伙人身份

joint venture：

商

[ U ] ~ (with sb) the state of being a partner in business

( business

) a business project or activity that is begun by two or more companies, etc., which remain separate

合营企业；合资企业

jurisdiction：[ U C ] ~ (over sb/sth) | ~ (of sb/sth) (to do sth) the authority that an official organization has to make legal decisions

about sb/sth 司法权；审判权；管辖权

organizations

They will increasingly have to be based on structures that are economic units and not legal—and

therefore not political—units.

There are many reasons growth henceforth will be based on partnerships of all sorts rather than

on outright ownership and command-and-control.

henceforth：

美‑

( also hence·for·ward /ˌhensˈfɔːwəd/

此后；从此以后

outright：complete and total 完全的；彻底的；绝对的

/ ˈfɔːrwərd/ ) ( formal ) starting from a particular time and at all times in the

future

One of the more compelling will be the need to operate in both a global world economy and a

splintered world polity.

compelling：

引人入胜的；扣人心弦的

splintered：

that makes you pay attention to it because it is so interesting and exciting

N-COUNT A splinter is a very thin, sharp piece of wood, glass, or other hard substance, which has broken off from a

larger piece.

薄而尖的碎片

A partnership is by no means a perfect solution to this problem.

But at least the conflict between economic reality and legal reality is greatly lessened if the

economic unit is not also a legal unit, but is a partnership, an alliance, a joint venture, that is a

relationship in which political and legal appearance can be separated from economic reality.

lessened：

减少 降低 减

轻

V-T/V-I If something lessens or you lessen it, it becomes smaller in size, amount, degree, or importance.

legal unit：法定单位

;

;

ACTION POINT:

A very successful U.S. company constructed a number of plants in South America.

A less prominent U.S. company decided to form alliances with existing companies in South

America.

The first company failed miserably, whereas the second succeeded.

What insights are provided by this reading as to why the second was successful and the first a

failure?

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

18 DECEMBER

Alliances for Progress

The practice of management will have to base itself on the new assumption

that its scope is not legal but the entire economic chain.

Business growth and business expansion in different parts of the world

will increasingly not be based on mergers and acquisitions or even on starting

new, wholly owned businesses there. They will increasingly have to be based

on alliances, partnerships, joint ventures, and all kinds of relations with

organizations located in other political jurisdictions. They will in-creasingly

have to be based on structures that are economic units and not

legal—and therefore not political—units.

There are many reasons growth henceforth will be based on partner-

ships of all sorts rather than on outright ownership and command-and-

control. One of the more compelling will be the need to operate in both

Aglobal world economy and a splintered world polity. A partnership is by

no means a perfect solution to this problem. But at least the conflict

between economic reality and legal reality is greatly lessened if the

economic unit is not also a legal unit, but is a partnership, an alliance,

Ajoint venture, that is a relationship in which political and legal appearance

can be separated from economic reality.

ACTION POINT:

A very successful U.S. company constructed a number of

plants in South America. A less prominent U.S. company decided to form

alliances with existing companies in South America. The first company

failed miserably, whereas the second succeeded. What insights are pro-

vided by this reading as to why the second was successful and the first

Afailure?

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

从一件小事看黄蓉的智慧

黄蓉给大家的印象是聪慧，机智，机会没有她解决不了的问题。

十几岁的她，远远超过钻研了一辈子术数的瑛姑；随便摆个阵，就可以困住武功远远告诉她的金轮法

王；一边看一边就学会了洪七公的《逍遥游》；面对武功远高于自己的欧阳克，在那样一个孤岛上，

还带着一个受了重伤的洪七公，居然压住了欧阳克。

不过，这些聪明或多或少有一些金庸的喜爱在里头，甚至有些聪明表现的有点过，近似妖了。

今天我要说的是一个很小的细节，从这个细节可以看出，即使没有主角光环，黄蓉也是聪慧异常的。

而且是那种久经历练的大智慧。

我要说的是黄蓉和李莫愁打斗一场后，发现李莫愁其实对自己的孩子还是挺好的，就对李莫愁有了好

感。

同时，黄蓉需要去找杨过，一方面救助杨过，一方面找回被杨过带走的小郭襄。而杨过大概是去了活

死人墓。

找到杨过后，黄蓉还需要去绝情谷去救武三通的师叔天竺神僧和朱子柳。所以黄蓉需要武力。

这时，黄蓉身边有李莫愁；武三通父子三人；耶律齐、耶律燕兄妹二人；还有郭芙。其中李莫愁、武

三通和耶律齐的武功都不错。

李莫愁和武三通有深仇大恨；耶律齐有点喜欢郭芙，而耶律燕有点喜欢武敦儒。

所以，为了完成找回郭襄，救助杨过，救回天竺神僧以及朱子柳。黄蓉需要联合手边仅有的这些武

力。何况李莫愁是唯一知道如何进入活死人墓的人。

这是一个简单地联盟，这个联盟由四方组成：黄蓉母女、武三通父子、耶律齐兄妹、李莫愁。

在组成联盟前，各自有各自的目的。

黄蓉母子要找过郭襄；武三通父子要救天竺神僧和朱子柳，耶律齐兄妹想留下了接触自己喜欢的人，

而李莫愁想进入活死人墓，取到玉女心经。

为了各自的目的，大家首先要进入活死人墓，找到杨过。

这时，黄蓉做的第一件事是确定一个领导人：

黄蓉道：“嗯，咱们人虽不多，也得有个发号施令之人。武兄，大夥儿一齐听你号令，谁都不可有

违。”武三通连连摇手，说道：“有你这个神机妙算、亚赛诸葛的女军师在此，谁还敢发号施令？自然

是穆桂英挂帅。”黄蓉笑道：“当真？”武三通道：“那还有假？”黄蓉笑道：“小辈们也还罢了，就怕你不

听我号令。”武三通大声道：“你说什么，我便干什么。赴汤蹈火，在所不辞。”黄蓉道：“在这许多小辈

之前，你可不能说过了话不算？”武三通胀红了脸，道：“便无人在旁，我也岂能言而无信？”

当然，黄蓉确定的这个领导人是自己。她知道，在这些人里，自己是最佳的人选。

接着黄蓉就逼着武三通答应不和李莫愁寻仇，当然，只是在联盟阶段。

接着，黄蓉就宣布了这个联盟的步奏：先去活死人墓找杨过，找回郭襄，然后带着杨过一起去绝情谷

找公孙止和裘千尺要绝情丹，同时救天竺神僧和朱子柳。

黄蓉也知道，这个小联盟里，自己、武三通、李莫愁、耶律齐是四方的代表人，所以，在后续的历程

中，黄蓉小心地处理这四人之间的关系。

当李莫愁想反悔时，黄蓉就用武三通压她。让她不得不跟着联盟一起走下去。

最后，这个联盟到了绝情谷，基本上完成了设定的任务。

从这个小小的遭遇事件可以看出，黄蓉不亏是一个有智慧的人，也不愧做了这么多年的丐帮管理，而

她在临时组织的这个联盟里，基本上做到了德鲁克建议的步奏：

  1. 在联盟前，考虑每个组织的目的，以及联盟的目的；

  2. 考虑联盟成立后如何运作；

  3. 精心选择联盟的负责人；

  4. 每个组织都应该公布自己的组织架构；

  5. 应该由每个组织的主要负责人负责和联盟的沟通。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

19 DECEMBER

Rules for Successful Alliances

Alliances tend to get into serious trouble when they succeed.

succeed：

[ V ] ~ (in sth) | ~ (as sth) to be successful in your job, earning money, power, respect, etc.

成功；有成就；有作为

While their failure rate in early years is no higher than that of new ventures, alliances tend to get

into serious trouble—sometimes fatal— when they succeed.

ventures：

冒险

(

从事活动)

V-I If you venture into an activity, you do something that involves the risk of failure because it is new and different.

Often when an alliance does well, it becomes apparent that the goals and objectives of the

partners are not compatible.

apparent：

显而易见；明

白易懂；显然

[ not usually before noun ] ~ (from sth) (that…) | ~ (to sb) (that…) easy to see or understand SYN obvious

The problems can be anticipated and largely prevented by following five rules.

anticipated：

ADJ If an event, especially a cultural event, is eagerly anticipated, people expect that it will be very good, exciting,

or interesting.

受期盼的

Before the alliance is completed, all parties must think through their objectives and the objectives

of the “child.” （ 1 ）

Equally important is advance agreement on how the joint enterprise should be run. （ 2 ）

Equally：

平等地；同样地

to the same degree; in the same or in a similar way

Next, there has to be careful thinking about who will manage the alliance. （ 3 ）

Each partner needs to make provisions in its own structure for the relationship to the joint

enterprise and the other partners. （ 4 ）

provisions：

N-UNCOUNT The provision of something is the act of giving it or making it available to people who need or want it.

提供

The best way, especially in a large organization, is to entrust all such “dangerous liaisons” to one

senior executive.

entrust：

委托；交托；托付

liaisons：

[ VN ] ~ A (to B) | ~ B with A to make sb responsible for doing sth or taking care of sb

N-UNCOUNT If someone acts as liaison with a particular group, or between two or more groups, their job is to encourage

联络员

dangerous liaisons：中港韩三地红星章子怡、张柏芝和张东健携手主演的《危险关系》（Dangerous Liaisons）是最新版本，

也是首部中国版

co-operation and the exchange of information.

Finally, there has to be prior agreement on how to resolve disagreements. （ 5 ）

prior：

优先的；占先的；较重要的

already existing and therefore more important

The best way is to agree, in advance of any dispute, on an arbitrator whom all sides know and

respect and whose verdict will be accepted as final by all of them.

dispute：

美

/dɪˈspjuːt/ /ˈdɪspjuːt/

[ C U ] ~ (between A and B) | ~ (over/about sth) an argument or a disagreement between two

people, groups or countries; discussion about a subject where there is disagreement

arbitrator：

verdict：

a person who is chosen to settle a disagreement

断

仲裁人；公断人

争论；辩论；争端；纠纷

a decision that is made by a jury in court, stating if sb is considered guilty of a crime or not

（陪审团的）裁定，裁决，裁

ACTION POINT: Alliances have been portrayed as “dangerous liaisons.”

What is so dangerous about entering into an alliance?

portrayed ：

V-T When an actor or actress portrays someone, he or she plays that person in a play or movie.

扮演

liaisons：

N-UNCOUNT Liaison is cooperation and the exchange of information between different organizations or between different

sections of an organization.

联络

Managing for the Future

19 DECEMBER

Rules for Successful Alliances

Alliances tend to get into serious trouble when they succeed.

While their failure rate in early years is no higher than that of new ven-

tures, alliances tend to get into serious trouble—sometimes fatal— when they

succeed. Often when an alliance does well, it becomes apparent

that the goals and objectives of the partners are not compatible.

The problems can be anticipated and largely prevented by following

five rules.

Before the alliance is completed, all parties must think through

their objectives and the objectives of the “child.”

Equally important is advance agreement on how the joint

enterprise should be run.

Next, there has to be careful thinking about who will manage the

alliance.

Each partner needs to make provisions in its own structure for the

relationship to the joint enterprise and the other partners. The best

way, especially in a large organization, is to entrust all such

“dangerous liaisons” to one senior executive.

Finally, there has to be prior agreement on how to resolve

disagreements. The best way is to agree, in advance of any dispute,

on an arbitrator whom all sides know and respect and whose

verdict will be accepted as final by all of them.

ACTION POINT:

Alliances have been portrayed as “dangerous liaisons.”

What is so dangerous about entering into an alliance?

Managing for the Future

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

非暴力立FLAG

又到了一年一度立FLAG的时候了，大家梳理了一下年初里的FLAG，检讨了一下，有的完成了，有的

没完成。不过，不管有没有完成，大家有要开始重新立FLAG了，并且每个人都觉得自己这次的FLAG

是一定可以完成的，这样就可以有效完成2019年决定要完成的2018年计划完成的那些2017年制定的本

来应该在2016年完成的事情了。

今天，我在群里问几个朋友，你们2020年的FLAG是什么呢？有一个群友说：“我要找到爱情”。然后，

她得到了所有人的祝福；又有一个人说：“我要减到100斤内”，她也得到了大家的赞许。

然后，我又在另一个群里问大家明年的FLAG。有人说要学好英语，有人说要找到一份好工作，有人说

要出一本书，有人说要改掉拖延的习惯，有人说他要早起。

冬至马上就要到了，冬至是万物复苏的时刻，一切仿佛都可以重新开始。那么，你要立FLAG么？

你去年的FLAG完成了么？

应该如何立FLAG呢？

我自己也立了一个FLAG，就是要用读一年《易经》，读的目的呢？是用《易经》把自己这么多年的知

识串起来。

那么，具体如何做呢？我会从冬至那天开始，每天读64卦中的某一卦的某一爻，然后用一天的时间去

思考它。

如此而已。

这样的计划，我很喜欢。因为每一爻的爻辞都很短。少的几个字，多的十几个字，大概率没有上百个

字的。所以，每天的阅读量很少，也就不存在我看不完的问题。

那么，看不懂的问题呢？其实，这个问题更好解决，看不懂就硬看呗。再看看其他人写的内容，牵强

附会地去理解就好了。毕竟，《易经》的那几万字，也只是《易》本身的一个象而已。

如果，某天我不想看怎么办？那就不看了呗。

如果我看到一半，不想看了，怎么办？那就不看了呗。

因为，我的目的是用《易经》来串起我的知识，如果这个过程难受，说明错了，那就可以终止，也可

以休息。

其实，定所有的FLAG都是这样的，你不应该定一个硬核的FLAG：我要每天五点起床；我要每天跑步

10公里。

这样的FLAG太硬核，太暴力，因为它很难完成。

你可能5：10分起床，甚至6点起床，这些都没有问题，如果你非要强迫自己5点起床，那么，你的身

体、精神就会面临巨大的压力，反而让自己更加不健康。如果你不考虑任何因素，每天都要跑10公

里，那么你也会给自己巨大的精神压力，让自己失去信心，从而完成不了这个FLAG。

所以，我们在定FLAG时，需要柔和一些，温柔一些，要容易实现一些，描述要给自己留一些空间。

比如，”明年我要找到爱情“，可以改成”我会接受突如其来的爱情“；”我要减到100斤以内“可以改成”我

要经常性运动，让自己保持良好的心态和身体“。

毕竟，人生苦短，没必要那么为难自己。既然立FLAG，那就立一个好实现的，到了年底时可以收获一

些成功感。

那么，我的FLAG呢？

就是明年每天读一爻《易经》，每一卦写一篇解读的小文。

期待明年这会，我可以给出我的FLAG的完成情况。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

20 DECEMBER

The Temptation to Do Good

Temptation：

Do Good：做好事

[ C U ] the desire to do or have sth that you know is bad or wrong

引诱；诱惑

Public-service institutions are out to maximize rather than to optimize.

out to：试图

The most important obstacle to innovation is that public-service institutions exist, after all, to “do

good.”

obstacle：

障碍；阻碍；绊脚石

innovation：

（新事物、思想或方法的）创造；创新；改革

exist to：存在于，致力于

(to sth/to doing sth) a situation, an event, etc. that makes it difficult for you to do or achieve sth

[ U ] the introduction of new things, ideas or ways of doing sth

This means that they tend to see their mission as a moral absolute rather than as economic and

subject to a cost/benefit calculus.

moral：

道德的

calculus：

[ only before noun ] concerned with principles of right and wrong behaviour

object

微积分

[ U ] the type of mathematics that deals with rates of change, for example in the slope of a curve or the speed of a falling

Economics always seeks a different allocation of the same resources to obtain a higher yield.

allocation：n. 分配，配置；安置

yield：

产量；产出；利润

[ C U ] the total amount of crops, profits, etc. that are produced

In the public-service institution, there is no such thing as a higher yield. If one is “doing good,” then

there is no “better.” Indeed, failure to attain objectives in the quest for a “good” only means that

efforts need to be redoubled.

quest：

探索，寻找，追求（幸福

等）

(for sth) ( formal ) ( literary ) a long search for sth, especially for some quality such as happiness

redoubled：

[ VN ] to increase sth or make it stronger

加倍；增加；加强

“Our mission will not be completed,” asserts the head of the Crusade Against Hunger, “as long as

there is one child on the earth going to bed hungry.”

asserts：

坚定地陈述

Crusade：

V-T If someone asserts a fact or belief, they state it firmly.

(for/against sth) | ~ (to do sth) a long and determined effort to achieve sth that you believe to be right or to stop sth that

you believe to be wrong

（长期坚定不移的）斗争，运动

If he were to say, “Our mission will be completed if the largest possible number of children that can

be reached through existing distribution channels get enough to eat not to be stunted,” he would

be booted out of office.

stunted：

发育不足的；生长不良的；未能充分发展的

stunt：

阻碍生长；妨碍发展；遏制

boot out ：

that has not been able to grow or develop as much as it should

[ VN ] to prevent sb/sth from growing or developing as much as they/it should

fire

But if the goal is maximization, it can never be attained.

Indeed, the closer one comes toward attaining one’s objective, the more efforts are called for.

For, once optimization has been reached, additional costs go up exponentially while additional

results fall off exponentially.

optimization:n. 最佳化，最优化

exponentially:adv. 以指数方式

fall off: 减少；跌落；下降；离开；衰退

leave, fail, split, flag

The closer a public-service institution comes to attaining its objectives, therefore, the more

frustrated it will be and the harder it will work on what it is already doing.

frustrated:

懊丧；懊恼；沮丧

(at/with sth) feeling annoyed and impatient because you cannot do or achieve what you want

ACTION POINT:

Prison Fellowship seeks to reduce the rate at which released prisoners are incarcerated again

because of new crimes.

incarcerated:

监禁

V-T If people are incarcerated, they are kept in a prison or other place.

Why would it be unwise for Prison Fellowship to try to eliminate so-called “recidivism?”

eliminate:

排除；清除；消除

recidivism 再犯，累犯

[ VN ] ~ sth/sb (from sth) to remove or get rid of sth/sb

:n.

recommitment, jailbird

Innovation and Entrepreneurship

20 DECEMBER

The Temptation to Do Good

Public-service institutions are out to maximize rather than to optimize.

The most important obstacle to innovation is that public-service institu-

tions exist, after all, to “do good.” This means that they tend to see their

mission as a moral absolute rather than as economic and subject to a cost/

benefit calculus. Economics always seeks a different allocation of the same

resources to obtain a higher yield. In the public-service institution, there is no

such thing as a higher yield. If one is “doing good,” then there is no “better.”

Indeed, failure to attain objectives in the quest for a “good”

only means that efforts need to be redoubled.

“Our mission will not be completed,” asserts the head of the Crusade

Against Hunger, “as long as there is one child on the earth going to bed

hungry.” If he were to say, “Our mission will be completed if the largest

pos-sible number of children that can be reached through existing

distribution channels get enough to eat not to be stunted,” he would be

booted out of of-fice. But if the goal is maximization, it can never be

attained. Indeed, the closer one comes toward attaining one’s objective,

the more efforts are called for. For, once optimization has been reached,

additional costs go up exponentially while additional results fall off

exponentially. The closer a public-service institution comes to attaining

its objectives, therefore, the more frustrated it will be and the harder it

will work on what it is already doing.

ACTION POINT:

Prison Fellowship seeks to reduce the rate at which re-

leased prisoners are incarcerated again because of new crimes. Why

would it be unwise for Prison Fellowship to try to eliminate so-called

“recidi-vism?”

Innovation and Entrepreneurship

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

告密者伤害了谁？

小时候，大概是初二的时候。有一次上课，是班主任的课，老师不在，大家刚开始还老老实实的。

不知道是什么起因，突然有个纸飞机在教室飞了起来，纸飞机落地后，边上的同学捡起来又给飞了起

来。

没多久，教室空中的飞机有了第二个，第三个。纸飞机也就从这里飞到那里，从这个人的手里，飞到

那个人的手里。

当然，也飞到了我手里，我捡起来后，也飞了出去。

大约十几分钟的样子，教室里沸腾了起来，大家在抢飞机飞。偶尔也会飞到教室的门口，然后有同学

会捡回来。

这时，班主任老师突然推门进来了。她非常生气。

我们学校的教室是平房。玻璃也不隔音，教室里的声音传到了校长办公室，也传到了整个院子里。班

主任觉得很没面子：我才离开几分钟，你们怎么就搞出这个大个动静？

班主任老师推门进来后，生气地走到将台上，非常愤怒地问：“都谁扔飞机了？站起来！”

当然，没有人站起来，除了被抓了现行的那两三个同学。

班主任老师还是异常愤怒，不过，同学们都低着头，一句不说。

老师说：”不说是吧，是不是都是好同学？那好，你们写出来，每人都写！“

大家还是不动，老师在教室里愤怒地走了两圈，看到没有同学动手。再次走到讲台上说：”快写，不写

不能放学！不用署名！写完的就可以坐下了！“

这时，有同学开始写了，写完后，犹豫了一会，就有人交上去了。

有了第一个交上去的同学后。陆陆续续有不少同学也写了，写完的都坐下了。

看着大家都写了，我也开始写了：”老师，飞机飞到我桌子上时，我飞出去过两次。韩宝龙“

是的，我署名了。而且写得是自己飞了两次。

然后我也交上去了。回到座位上后坐下了。

等大家都交上后。老师开始看纸条。一边看，一边念。

”XXX！“，然后瞪那个同学一眼。

”XXX！“， 然后又瞪了那个同学一眼。

有几个名字出现的频率比较到。老师每次叫到这几个名字，都会使劲蹬他们一眼。

没多会，老师看到了我的纸条。然后愣了一下。

略作犹豫。老师还是念了出来：”老师，飞机飞到我桌子上时，我飞出去过两次。韩宝龙“

念完后，老师好像不生气了，也不看纸条了。把纸条搓成一堆，然后说：”放学“。

我们一生，总是会遇到一些告密者，或者是自己，或者是别人；自己也多少会参与到一些告密的事情

中。或者是告密者，或者是被告密者，或者只是普通的第三者。

甚至，有的人会把告密当成手段，谋取利益的手段，这个人或许就是你，或许是你的同事。如果是你

的话，你或许会觉得你的告密行为伤害了你的朋友。

那么，你的告密行为伤害的真的只是你的朋友么？

其实，告密对你朋友的伤害很少，甚至是有利的，因为你的告密行为会让他认清一个朋友。在以后的

路上少一些坑。

那么你的告密行为伤害的是谁呢？

其实是你所在的组织。

当一个组织出现告密行为，并且这种行为被鼓励时，这个组织内部就不再有信任。同事之间不再信

任，他们不再可以无保留地交流信息；上级和下级之间不再信任，上级不再给下级充分的信息；下级

也不再给上级完整的汇报。大家都会有一些保留，信息不再畅通，这个组织也就拥塞了。

一个信息拥塞的组织，将不再有效率。

如果是在战场上，你也不再敢全身心地去打击敌人，因为你还要防备来自你后面的子弹。

这样的团队，也不再有效率。

而你，也不再敢把后背交给任何人。

这时的你，会认为，你的告密行为，伤害了谁？

如果你是这个组织的负责人，那么，当你的组织里出现告密者时，你会如何处理？

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

一小时运动

英文原文

21 DECEMBER

The Whistle-blower

Whistle-blower：

(尤用于报章 ) a person who informs people in authority or the public that the

company they work for is doing sth wrong or illegal （公司等处）检举揭发舞弊内情的人

Whistle：the sound that you make by forcing your breath out when your lips are closed 口哨

blower： [ C ] a device that produces a current of air 吹风机；送风机

( used especially in newspapers

Whistle-blowing is ethically ambiguous.

ethically：adv. 伦理上

ambiguous：

that can be understood in more than one way; having different meanings

模棱两可的；含混不清的

Today’s ethics of organization debate pays great attention to the duty to be a “whistle-blower” and

to the protection of the whistle-blower against retaliation or suppression by his boss or by his

organization.

debate：

a formal discussion of an issue at a public meeting or in a parliament. In a debate two or more speakers express opposing

views and then there is often a vote on the issue.

retaliation：

suppression：

（在公共集会上或议会里就某问题进行的、常以表决结束的）辩论

[ U ] ~ (against sb/sth) (for sth) action that a person takes against sb who has harmed them in some way

[ U ] the act of suppressing sth

This sounds high-minded.

high-minded：

( of people or ideas

镇压；压制；抑制

报复

人或思想 ) having strong moral principles 高尚的；高洁的

Surely, the subordinate has a right, if not indeed a duty, to bring to public attention and remedial

action his superior’s misdeeds, let alone violation of the law on the part of a superior or of his

employing organization.

remedial：

旨在解

aimed at solving a problem, especially when this involves correcting or improving sth that has been done wrong

决问题的；补救的；纠正的

misdeed：N-COUNT A misdeed is a bad or evil act. 不端行为; 恶行

violation：n. 违反；妨碍，侵害；违背；强奸

let alone：更不必说；听任；不打扰

on the part of：就…而言；由…所作出的；在…一边；由…所表现出的

But in the context of the ethics of interdependence, whistle-blowing is ethically quite

ambiguous.

interdependence：

other.

互相依赖

N-UNCOUNT Interdependence is the condition of a group of people or things that all depend on each

ethically：adv. 伦理上

To be sure, there are misdeeds of the superior or of the employing organization that so grossly

violate propriety and laws that the subordinate (or the friend, or the child, or even the wife) cannot

remain silent.

grossly：

形容令人不快的事物

极度地；极其；非常

propriety：

得体的举止；有分寸的行为

( disapproving ) ( used to describe unpleasant qualities

) extremely

[ U ] moral and social behaviour that is considered to be correct and acceptable

This is, after all, what the word “felony” implies; one becomes a partner to a felony and criminally

liable by not reporting, and thus compounding it.

felony：

律

[ C U ] ( law

) ( NAmE ) ( old-fashioned ) the act of committing a serious crime such as murder or rape ; a crime of this

重罪；重刑罪

implies：to suggest that sth is true or that you feel or think sth, without saying so directly 含有…的意思；暗示；暗指

liable：~ (for sth) legally responsible for paying the cost of sth （法律上）负有偿付责任

compounding：V-T To compound a problem, difficulty, or mistake means to make it worse by adding to it. 加剧

type

But otherwise? It is not primarily that to encourage whistle-blowing corrodes that bond of trust

that ties the superior to the subordinate.

corrode：

腐蚀；侵蚀

bond of ：

to destroy sth slowly, especially by chemical action; to be destroyed in this way

[ C ] ~ (between A and B) something that forms a connection between people or groups, such as a feeling of friendship

or shared ideas and experiences

superior：

纽带；联系；关系；契合

(to sb) higher in rank, importance or position

（在级别、重要性或职位上）更高的

Encouraging the whistle-blower must make the subordinate lose trust in the superior’s willingness

and ability to protect people.

willingness： 乐意；心甘情愿；自动自发

willing to, What Makes a Man

ACTION POINT:

The Sarbanes-Oxley law encourages whistle-blowing from insiders in the case of corporate

corruption.

corruption：

腐败；贪污；贿赂；受贿

[ U ] dishonest or illegal behaviour, especially of people in authority

How will this legislation affect the bond between superior and subordinates?

legislation：

法规；法律

a law or a set of laws passed by a parliament

The Ecological Vision

21 DECEMBER

The Whistle-blower

Whistle-blowing is ethically ambiguous.

Today’s ethics of organization debate pays great attention to the duty
