to be a “whistle-blower” and to the protection of the whistle-blower

against retaliation or suppression by his boss or by his organization. This

sounds high-minded. Surely, the subordinate has a right, if not indeed

Aduty, to bring to public attention and remedial action his superior’s mis-

deeds, let alone violation of the law on the part of a superior or of his em-

ploying organization. But in the context of the ethics of interdependence,

whistle-blowing is ethically quite ambiguous.

To be sure, there are misdeeds of the superior or of the employing

orga-nization that so grossly violate propriety and laws that the

subordinate (or the friend, or the child, or even the wife) cannot remain

silent. This is, after all, what the word “felony” implies; one becomes

Apartner to a felony and criminally liable by not reporting, and thus

compounding it. But other-wise? It is not primarily that to encourage

whistle-blowing corrodes that bond of trust that ties the superior to the

subordinate. Encouraging the whistle-blower must make the subordinate

lose trust in the superior’s will-ingness and ability to protect people.

ACTION POINT:

The Sarbanes-Oxley law encourages whistle-blowing from

insiders in the case of corporate corruption. How will this legislation

affect the bond between superior and subordinates?

The Ecological Vision

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

做坏人奸！做好人要更奸！！！

做好人的资格

我为什么讨厌江南七怪

我是非常讨厌江南七怪的。不但讨厌柯镇恶，也讨厌朱聪，也讨厌南希仁，全金发也不喜欢，甚至连

着韩小莹也一起讨厌起来了。

经常，我自己对自己的这个讨厌都感到莫名其妙。江南七怪是一些挺好的人呀，为什么我这么讨厌他

们呢？

首先，江南七怪都是很重情义的。在江湖上，这绝对是优良品质。江南七怪之间是很重情义的，即使

张阿生死了，他们在教授郭靖武功时，还是教授了张阿生的武功，张阿生也算是郭靖的师父。

当柯镇恶以为黄药师杀死了自己的其他兄弟时，他想的就是杀死郭靖、黄蓉等报仇。不惜一切代价。

这些都是含金量非常高的情义。

而且，江南七怪非常重侠义，这个在江湖上也是优良品质。当江南七怪知道侠义后代郭靖被人绑架

后，当即万里追敌。

当听说全真教要去收拾黄药师时，也不辞辛苦赶到桃花岛报信。

最后，江南七怪是非常诚信的一个人，而且是愚信，一言九鼎。即使明知赴死，也绝不愿意食言。

这样的人，我为什么那么讨厌呢？是我的三观有问题么？难道我居然是个坏人？

今天读了德鲁克之后，我才知道，原来另有原因。

江南七怪非常侠义，他们受人之托去阻止丘处机。他们一直觉得丘处机在为金兵工作，是金狗，可是

他们倒是问一下呀。

七个大活人，啥也见面就噼里啪啦一顿打，但凡有一个有脑子的，开个口，也不至于闹那么大的误

会。

再说，你就算帮焦木，也要问清楚呀，不问清楚，白白放走了抓着郭静妈妈林萍的段天德。

再说了，你和丘处机大，打得过也算，打不过，不说，没理也不说，还那么横。仗着侠义，就着没脑

子硬生生用自己的好心做成了坏事。

再说柯镇恶的那些兄弟死在桃花岛的事情。也算杨康计策狠毒，放了瞎眼的柯镇恶去江湖上四处传说

黄药师的狠毒。

柯镇恶的眼睛是瞎的，他的心也是瞎的么？一些小小的计谋，就给自己的像儿子一样的弟子郭靖带来

了灭顶之灾。

他还觉得自己很委屈，不能为“兄弟们”报仇，不能全情义。

对，这不是他第一次想杀郭靖，在郭靖十几岁的时候就有一次。那时，郭靖正在跟着丹阳子马钰学习

轻功和金雁功。

柯镇恶感觉到郭靖武功进展突然飞速了，就怀疑他有了别的师父。他们觉得不放心，就跟踪郭靖一

趟，发现了梅超风的一些头骨。

柯镇恶用他的猪脑子马上判断出了郭靖是在跟着梅超风学武，很快就要害死他们兄弟几个了。

柯镇恶做了一个决定：

柯镇恶将铁杖在地下重重一顿，低沉了声音道：“咱们现下回去，只作不知，待靖儿回来，先把他废

了。“

其实，这个决定韩小莹是不同意的，韩小莹认为，郭靖不是这样的人，毕竟，郭靖是他们带大的。

不过，她自己一个人也做不了主，最后还是统一”废掉“郭靖了。由柯镇恶来下手。

柯镇恶是如何做的呢？

（郭靖）突然左右双手的手腕同时一紧，已给人抓住，跟着膝後剧疼，给人踢倒在地，呼的一声，铁

杖当头砸落。郭靖侧身倒地，见持杖打来的正是大师父柯镇恶，只吓得魂飞天外，再也想不到抵挡挣

扎，只闭目待死，却听得当的一声，兵刃相交，一人扑在自己身上。

他睁眼看时，只见七师父韩小莹护住了自己，叫道：“大哥，且慢！”她手中长剑却已给柯镇恶铁杖砸

飞。柯镇恶出声长叹，铁杖重重一顿，说道：“七妹总是心软。”

还好七妹心软，不然郭靖就死在了柯镇恶手里，全剧终。

这一段，柯镇恶杀郭靖的逻辑也是通的，也是本的兄弟情谊，因为他们要为张阿生报仇。

唯一欠缺的，是这几人没脑子。

是的，江南七怪重情义，有侠义，守诺言，他们也一心做好事，问题是，他们根本没有做好事的能

力，每一件好事都做成了坏事，最后付出了惨痛的代价，如果不是郭靖、黄蓉的主角光环，这几个重

情重义的侠义之士，早就被人打死了。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

22 DECEMBER

Limits of Social Responsibility

“It is not enough for business to do well; it must also do good.”

But in order to “do good,” a business must first “do well.”

Whenever a business has disregarded the limitation of economic performance and has assumed

social responsibilities that it could not support economically, it has soon gotten into trouble.

disregarded：

对 置之不理

V-T If you disregard something, you ignore it or do not take account of it.

…

Union Carbide was not socially responsible when it put its plant into Vienna, West Virginia, to

alleviate unemployment there.

plant：

发电厂；工厂

alleviate：

减轻；缓和；缓解

[ C ] a factory or place where power is produced or an industrial process takes place

[ VN ] to make sth less severe

It was, in fact, irresponsible.

irresponsible：

( disapproving ) ( of a person

responsibility

不负责任的；无责任感的

人 ) not thinking enough about the effects of what they do; not showing a feeling of

The plant was marginal to begin with.

marginal ：

小的；微不足道的；不重要的

small and not important

The process was obsolescent.

obsolescent： 荒废的；即将过时的；逐渐被废弃的

process：

dilapidated, ruined

a method of doing or making sth, especially one that is used in industry

做事方法；工艺流程；工序

At best the plant could barely keep its head above water.

And this, inevitably, meant a plant unable to take on social responsibility, even for its own impacts.

inevitably：

不可避免地；必然地

impacts：

as is certain to happen

on them.

影响

N-COUNT The impact that something has on a situation, process, or person is a sudden and powerful effect that it has

Because the plant was uneconomical to begin with, Union Carbide resisted so long all demands to

clean it up.

uneconomical：

( also un·eco·nom·ic ) ~ (to do sth) using too much time or money, or too many materials, and therefore not

likely to make a profit

clean it up：清理

浪费的；不节俭的；不经济的

This particular demand could not have been foreseen in the late 1940s, when concern with jobs far

outweighed any concern for the environment.

outweighed：vt. 比…重（在重量上）；比…重要；比…有价

But demands of some kind can always be expected.

To do something out of social responsibility that is economically irrational and untenable is

therefore never responsible.

out of:由于；缺乏；自…离开；用…（材料）

irrational：

不合逻辑的；没有道理的

untenable：

理论、地位等

难以捍卫的；

not based on, or not using, clear logical thought

( formal ) ( of a theory, position, etc.

站不住脚的；不堪一击的

It is sentimental.

sentimental：

) that cannot be defended against attack or criticism

connected with your emotions, rather than reason

情感的（而非理性的）

The result is always greater damage.

ACTION POINT:

Explain why this is true: In order for a business to “do good,” it must first “do well,” and indeed very

well.

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

【原书原文】

Union Carbide and Vienna, West Virginia

West Virginia, never one of the more prosperous areas of the United States, went into rapid

economic decline in the late twenties as the coal industry, long the state’s mainstay, began to

shrink. The decline of the coal industry was hastened by rising concern with mine accidents and

miners diseases. For many of the coal mines of West Virginia were small and marginal and could

not afford modern safety precautions or adequate health protection.

By the late 1940s the leading industrial company in the state became alarmed over the steady

economic shrinkage of the region. Union Carbide, one of America’s major chemi- cal companies,

had its headquarters in New York. But the original plants of the company had been based on West

Virginia coal, and the company was still the largest employer in the state, other than a few large

coal mines. Accordingly, the company’s top management asked a group of young engineers and

economists in its employ to prepare a plan for the creation of employment opportunities in West

Virginia, and especially for the location of the company’s new plant facilities in areas of major

unemployment in the state. For the worst afflicted area, however, the westernmost corner of the

state on the border of Ohio, the planners could not come up with an attractive project. Yet this area

needed jobs the most. In and around the little town of Vienna, West Virginia, there was total

unemploy- ment, and no prospects for new industries. The

only plant that could possibly be put in the Vienna area was a ferroalloy plant using a process that

had already become obsolete and had heavy cost disadvantages compared to more modern

processes such as Union Car- bide’s competitors were already using.

Even for the old process, Vienna was basically an uneconomical location. The process required

very large amounts of coal of fair quality. But the only coal available within the area was coal of

such high sulfur content that it could not be used without expensive treatment and scrubbing. Even

then—that is, after heavy capital investment—the process was inherently noisy and dirty, releasing

large amounts of fly ash and of noxious gases.

In addition, the only transportation facilities, both rail and road, were not in West Virignia but across

the river, on the Ohio side. Putting the plant there, however, meant that the prevailing westerly

winds would blow the soot from the smokestacks and the sul- fur released by the power plants

directly into the town of Vienna, on the other bank of the river.

Yet the Vienna plant would provide 1,500 jobs in Vienna itself and another 500 to 1,000 jobs in a

new coal field not too far distant. In addition, the new coal field would be capable of being stripmined, so the new mining jobs would be free from the accident and health hazards that had

become increasingly serious in the old and worked-out coal mines of the area. Union Carbide top

management came to the conclusion that social responsi- bility demanded building the new plant,

despite its marginal economics.

The plant was built with the most up-to-date antipollution equipment known at the time. Whereas

even big-city power stations were then content to trap half the fly ash es- caping their

smokestacks, the Vienna plant installed scrubbers to catch 75 percent— though there was little

anyone could do about the sulfur dioxide fumes emitted by the high-sulfur coal.

When the plant was opened in 1951, Union Carbide was the hero. Politicians, public figures,

educators, all praised the company for its social responsibility. But ten years later the former savior

was fast becoming the public enemy. As the nation became pollutionconscious, the citizens of Vienna began to complain more and more bitterly about the ash, the

soot, and the fumes that floated across the river into their town and homes. About 1961 a new

mayor was elected on the platform “fight pollution,” which meant “fight Un- ion Carbide.” Ten years

later the plant had become a “national scandal.” Even Business Week—hardly a publication hostile

to business—chastised Union Carbide (in February, 1971) in an article entitled “A Corporate Polluter

Learns the Hard Way.”

There is little doubt that Union Carbide’s management did not behave very intelli- gently. They

should have realized in the early sixties that they were in trouble, rather than delay and

procrastinate, make and then break promises—until the citizens, the state gov- ernment, the press,

the environmentalists, and the federal government all were aiming their biggest guns at the

company. It was not very smart to protest for years that there was nothing wrong with the plant and

then, when governmental authorities began to get nasty, announce that the plant would have to be

closed as it could not be brought up to environ- mental standards.

Yet this is not the basic lesson of this cautionary tale. Once the decision had been made to employ

an obsolescent process and to build an economically marginal plant in

order to alleviate unemployment in a bitterly depressed area, the rest followed more or less

automatically. This decision meant that the plant did not generate the revenues needed to be

rebuilt. There is very little doubt that on economic reasoning alone the plant would never have been

built. Public opinion forced Union Carbide to invest substantial sums in that plant to remedy the

worst pollution problems—though it is questionable whether the technology exists to do more than

a patch-up job. Publicity also forced Union Carbide to keep the plant open. But, once the spotlight

shifts elsewhere, most of the jobs in the Vienna, West Virginia, plant are likely to disappear again, if

indeed the plant re- mains open at all.

22 DECEMBER

Limits of Social Responsibility

“It is not enough for business to do well; it must also do good.”

But in order to “do good,” a business must first “do well.”

Whenever a business has disregarded the limitation of economic per-formance

and has assumed social responsibilities that it could not

support economically, it has soon gotten into trouble.

Union Carbide was not socially responsible when it put its plant into Vi-

enna, West Virginia, to alleviate unemployment there. It was, in fact, irre-

sponsible. The plant was marginal to begin with. The process was

obsolescent. At best the plant could barely keep its head above water. And

this, inevitably, meant a plant unable to take on social responsibility, even for

its own impacts. Because the plant was uneconomical to begin with, Union

Carbide resisted so long all demands to clean it up. This particular demand

could not have been foreseen in the late 1940s, when concern with jobs far

outweighed any concern for the environment. But demands of some kind can

always be expected. To do something out of social responsi-bility that is

economically irrational and untenable is therefore never re-sponsible. It is

sentimental. The result is always greater damage.

ACTION POINT:

Explain why this is true: In order for a business to “do

good,” it must first “do well,” and indeed very well.

Management: Tasks, Responsibilities, Practices

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

两个在死亡面前求生存的人

今天我要推荐两本书，说两个人。

一个是超级富豪，贵族，一生无忧无虑。而且才华横溢，几乎占尽了人间所有的福报。

这位才华横溢的年轻人到了中年后，遇到了人生最大的一个问题：生命的意义。在这个恐怖的问题

前，这位才华横溢的中年人仿佛纠结，不断和死神交手，在强大的逻辑推理和各种花样百出下，险

胜。

所以，这个中年人安全地活到了老年，生活依然富豪，依然受人尊重。只是，死神并没有完全失败，

这位才华横溢的老人，在某一件独立离家出走，死在了一个火车站。

据说是冻、饿而死。

这个人叫做托尔斯泰，这位伟大的人把他和死神斗争的过程写了一本书，这本书很薄，却充满了哲学

的智慧和思辨的理性。在这本书的结尾，托尔斯泰胜利了，不过，只是微弱的优势。

几十年后的意外死亡也说明了那次胜利的勉强。

这本书叫做《忏悔录》，强烈推荐大家读一下。

我要说的另一个人就很普通了，他是只是一个普通家庭的孩子，长大后学习成绩不错，成为一个医

生。后来因为战争，他被关进集中营，纳粹的集中营，编号119104。

在集中营，每天都有人被关进毒气室，每天都有人被焚烧。没有理由，一切都是随机。

在集中营里，人活着没有任何尊严，没有任何意义，这位医生记录了一件小事。一个集中营的年轻人

的鞋子破的不能穿了，突然就大哭了起来。因为他知道鞋子破了，他就不能正常走路了，不能正常走

路，就会被当成病人焚烧。

当这位医生听到了这个年轻人的哭声，他就知道这个年轻人放弃了。因为，那个凄烈的哭声显示了那

个年轻人对生命的无奈和放弃，果然，第二天，他就死了。生病而死。

在那样一个随时会死，身边的人随时都在死的纳粹集中营里，这个医生活了下来，他不但活了下来，

还总结了他活下来的方法：寻找生命的意义。

后来，他走出了集中营，并且把他在集中营中研究的理论写了一本书《活出生命的意义》。并且发明

了意义疗法，替人们找到绝处再生的意义，也留下了人性史上最富光彩的见证。

这个人叫做维克多·弗兰克尔，他的书：《活出生命的意义》销量超过千万册。获选“美国最有影响力的

十大图书”之一。

他创立了”意义疗法“及”存在主义分析“，被称之为继费洛伊德的心理分析、阿德勒的个体心理学之后的

维也纳第三心理治疗学派。

一个是天之骄子，在无比富足的生活中被“生命的意义逼迫，险些自杀，最后还是走上了末路。一位是

人间地狱中的幸存者，当所有人都对他们放弃，包括他们中的大多数自己时。他选择了”寻找生命的意

义“，让自己活了先来。并且在之后的25年，让更多陷入绝境的人活了下来。

这位弗兰克尔67岁仍开始学习驾驶飞机，并在几个月后领到驾照。一直到80岁还登上了阿尔卑斯山。

显示了作为人最尊严而独特的一面。

今天我推荐这两本书，如果你正好在面临”生命的意义“，我建议你一起读一下这两本书。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

23 DECEMBER

Spiritual Values

Spiritual：

connected with the human spirit, rather than the body or physical things

精神的；心灵的

Only compassion can save—the wordless knowledge of my own responsibility for whatever is

being done to the least of God’s children.

compassion:

同情；怜悯

wordless：

默默无言的；沉默的

least：

最小的；最少的；程度最轻的

[ U ] ~ (for sb) a strong feeling of sympathy for people who are suffering and a desire to help them

[ usually before noun ] without saying any words; silent

( usually the least ) smallest in size, amount, degree, etc.

This is knowledge of the spirit.

Society needs a return to spiritual values—not to offset the material but to make it fully

productive.

spiritual：

精神的；心灵的

offset：

抵消；弥

connected with the human spirit, rather than the body or physical things

补；补偿

[ VN ] ~ sth (against sth) to use one cost, payment or situation in order to cancel or reduce the effect of another

material：

材料；原料

productive：doing or achieving a lot 有效益的；富有成效的

[ C U ] a substance that things can be made from

However remote its realization for the great mass of mankind, there is today the promise of material

abundance or at least of material sufficiency.

abundance:

大量；丰盛；充裕

in large quantities

Mankind needs the return to spiritual values, for it needs compassion.

compassion:

[ U ] ~ (for sb) a strong feeling of sympathy for people who are suffering and a desire to help them

同情；怜悯

It needs the deep experience that the Thou and the I are one, which all higher religions share.

experience:

[ U ] the knowledge and skill that you have gained through doing sth for a period of time; the process of gaining this

（由实践得来的）经验；实践

religions

:N-UNCOUNT Religion is belief in a god or gods and the activities that are connected with this belief, such as praying or

worshipping in a building such as a church or temple.

宗教

In an age of terror, of persecution, and of mass murder, such as ours, the hard shell of moral

callousness may be necessary to survival.

persecution: 迫害；烦扰

terror

惊恐；恐惧；惊骇

shell

（蛋、坚果、某些种子和某些动物的）壳

callousness n. 麻木不仁

feeze

:: [ U sing. ] a feeling of extreme fear

:[ C U ] the hard outer part of eggs, nuts, some seeds and some animals

:

Without it we might yield to paralyzing despair.

yield:

paralyzing： 使麻痹；使瘫痪

despair：

绝望

[ VN ] to produce or provide sth, for example a profit, result or crop

出产（作物）；产生（收益、效益等）；提供

[ U ] the feeling of having lost all hope

But moral numbness is also a terrible disease of mind and soul, and a terrible danger.

danger：

危险；风险

numbness：n. 麻木；麻痹

[ U ] ~ (of sth) the possibility of sth happening that will injure, harm or kill sb, or damage or destroy sth

It abets, even if it does not condone, cruelty and persecution.

abet：

教唆；唆使；煽动；怂恿

condone：

[ VN ] to help or encourage sb to do sth wrong

恕；纵容

[ also + V -ing , also + VN -ing ] to accept behaviour that is morally wrong or to treat it as if it were not serious

cruelty：

暴

[ U ] ~ (to sb/sth) behaviour that causes pain or suffering to others, especially deliberately

宽恕；饶

（尤指蓄意的）残酷，残忍，残

persecution： 迫害；烦扰

We have learned that the ethical humanitarianism of the nineteenth century cannot prevent man

from becoming beast.

ethical：

（有关）道德的；伦理的

humanitarianism：n. 人道主义；博爱主义

beast：

（尤指大型或凶猛、独

connected with beliefs and principles about what is right and wrong

( old-fashioned ) ( formal ) an animal, especially one that is large or dangerous, or one that is unusual

特的）动物，兽

The individual needs the return to spiritual values, for he can survive in the present human situation

only by reaffirming that man is not just a biological and physiological being but also a spiritual

being, that is, creature, and existing for the purposes of his Creator and subject to Him.

reaffirming：

physiological：adj. 生理学的，生理的

V-T If you reaffirm something, you state it again clearly and firmly.

重申

Only thus can the individual know that the threat of instant physical annihilation of the species

does not invalidate his own existence, its meaning, and its responsibility.

threat：

[ C U ] ~ (to do sth) a statement in which you tell sb that you will punish or harm them, especially if they do not do what you

want

威胁；恐吓

annihilation ：n. 毁灭；溃败；（物理）湮灭，湮没

invalidate：

if you invalidate a document, contract, election, etc., you make it no longer legally or officially valid or acceptable

效；使作废

instant：[ usually before noun ] happening immediately 立即的；立刻的

使无

ACTION POINT:

In the presence of the threat of instant annihilation, how can we maintain meaning and

responsibility without spiritual values?

threat：

[ C U ] ~ (to do sth) a statement in which you tell sb that you will punish or harm them, especially if they do not do what you

want

威胁；恐吓

Landmarks of Tomorrow

23 DECEMBER

Spiritual Values

Only compassion can save—the wordless knowledge of my own responsibility

for whatever is being done to the least of God’s children. This is knowledge of

the spirit.

Society needs a return to spiritual values—not to offset the material but to

make it fully productive. However remote its realization for the great mass of

mankind, there is today the promise of material abundance or at least of

material sufficiency. Mankind needs the return to spiritual values, for it needs

compassion. It needs the deep experience that the Thou and the I are one,

which all higher religions share. In an age of terror, of persecu-tion, and of

mass murder, such as ours, the hard shell of moral callousness may be

necessary to survival. Without it we might yield to paralyzing de-spair. But

moral numbness is also a terrible disease of mind and soul, and a terrible

danger. It abets, even if it does not condone, cruelty and persecu-tion. We

have learned that the ethical humanitarianism of the nineteenth

century cannot prevent man from becoming beast.

The individual needs the return to spiritual values, for he can survive

in the present human situation only by reaffirming that man is not just

Abio-logical and physiological being but also a spiritual being, that is,

creature, and existing for the purposes of his Creator and subject to Him.

Only thus can the individual know that the threat of instant physical

annihilation of the species does not invalidate his own existence, its

meaning, and its re-sponsibility.

ACTION POINT:

In the presence of the threat of instant annihilation, how

can we maintain meaning and responsibility without spiritual values?

Landmarks of Tomorrow

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

东方不败小传

东方不败本来是个穷苦人家的普通孩子。

虽然穷，为人还算仗义，小小年纪已经很有一些侠义精神。

在十一岁那年，东方不败认识了一个叫做童百熊的年轻人。这个年轻人很喜欢东方不败，觉得这个小

孩很有骨气，长大后一定有出息。

童百熊这时在一个叫做日月神教的组织里有一些地位了，经济条件也可以，也就经常帮衬着东方不

败。偶尔也教东方一些武功。

东方不败的父母死后，童百熊帮着料理完后事，就带着东方加入了神教。这时，东方的武功已经超过

了童百熊，童百熊也就不再教他什么了。

当时的教主是一个叫做任我行的人，任我行看到东方不败后，也很喜欢他，没多久，东方不败就成了

风雷堂下的一个副香主，归童百熊管。

年轻的东方不败是一个武学天才，而且也非常有野心，这对与一个20多岁的年轻人也是很正常的。

东方不败四处找人学习武功，也非常努力地练习武功。只要神教有什么命令，不管多危险，他也会不

顾危险冲到第一线。特别是任我行交代的人物。

穷苦出生的东方不败知道一个道理：要想出人头地，一定要非常吃苦。

果然，屡立功劳的东方不败再次吸引了任我行的注意力，这时的东方不败已经是除了任我行外的神教

第一高手。而且机智过人。

这时的东方不败想，我应该也有资格当教主。

这一天，任我行把东方不败叫到身边，拿出一包纸递给他。

东方不败打开后，发现是一本书，上面写着：葵花宝典。东方不败有点茫然地看着任我行。

任我行哈哈大笑，说：“这是我们神教的镇教之宝，也是我教最高深的武功，交给你。”

”接下来的几个月，我要去研究咱们神教的另一个武功了。我不在的时候，你多费心。“

几个月后，任我行回来了，发现神教管理的很好，除了有一个堂主意外死亡，其他的任务都完成的特

别好。

任我行自己修炼的武功叫做”吸星大法“，这个武功可以吸入敌人的内功，经过融合后，变为己用。快

速提高自己的武功修为。

任我行本身的武功已经非常高了。这么多年，又吸了不少高手的内功。这些内功在体内捣乱起来了。

所以，任我行需要经常闭关修炼。

几次后，东方不败觉得自己已经有把握了，就在某次任我行闭关修炼时，袭击任我行，把任我行软禁

了起来。

这时，东方不败宣布任我行外出死亡，自己就任教主。

当然，有人不同意，比如朱雀堂的罗长老就不同意。童百熊见状，一刀砍死了罗长老，整个神教震

动。

东方不败也就正式成了教主。

刚当上教主的东方不败，意气风发，觉得自己是这个世界上最牛逼的人。看着满教的各路高手，东方

不败认为，自己用几年的时间就可以统一武林，文成武德，中兴圣教，让神教成为武林中新的高点。

这时的东方不败终于有时间打开《葵花宝典》了，他觉得，自己自然是教主了，不会镇教之宝说不过

去。

看了葵花宝典后，东方不败陷入了沉思。

以他的智慧，他知道这上面记录的武功确实非常神妙。而且自己的武功已经非常高了，要不要学呢？

特别是看到那一句：“欲练神功，挥刀自宫。”

这一夜，东方不败想了很久，很久。

在凌晨，看着灯火辉煌的神教总坛，东方不败挥刀自宫了。

因为，对于东方不败来说，权力已经不能满足他的欲望了，他想追求更高的，更神秘的内容，而他认

为，葵花宝典会是一条路。

果然，自宫后的东方不败和天地之间的关系更加接近了。

几个月后，学习完葵花宝典的东方不败已经对权力没有了任何欲望，只想探究人体的极限，以及生命

的感受。

他把神教的大权交个一个叫做杨莲亭的人。这个人不会武功，而且对自己极其忠诚。

自己躲在后山的一个密室里反复练习。

慢慢地，东方不败理解了天人化生、万物滋长的要道。这时的他，以及不再关系除了自己感受意外的

任何事情了。

后来，任我行来了，还带了一个年轻人，东方不败看着他们，深叹了一口气，觉得自己那些年谋划任

我行的教主之位，真是一场闹剧。

一切就这样吧，我的人生已经如此完美。

好了，我要走了。

这样一位惊天动地、威震当世的武林怪杰，竟然躲在闺房之中刺绣！

最低层次的绝望在无知的人，一心只知世俗物事；这类人没有自我意识，不认识自我的永恒性，更不

知道自己陷于绝望。

另一些人意识到自己为渴望得到某些世俗物事而绝望，但仍没有自我永恒性的意识。

另一些人开始意识到自我、永恒性，也意识到自己为世俗物事而绝望的软弱，为此他们也就不愿接受

这个自己，结果陷入另一种绝望。

再进一步，一些人决定接受软弱，听天由命，承认自己的永恒性。进而，他们要愿意接受当前的这个

自己。他们可能选择靠著“信心的一跃”重获希望，脱离绝望；可是他们也可能选择视绝望为最终真理，

将自己置于永恒的绝望中。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

24 DECEMBER

Human Existence in Tension

Tension：

[ U C usually pl. ] ~ (between A and B) a situation in which people do not trust each other, or feel unfriendly towards each

紧张局势（或关系、状况）

Existence：[ U ] the state or fact of being real or living or of being present 存在；实有

other, and which may cause them to attack each other

For Kierkegaard, human existence is possible only in tension— in tension between man’s

simultaneous life as an individual in the spirit and as a citizen in society.

Kierkegaard：

认为圣经的语法、词汇、以及历史研究是必要的但都是为阅读圣经作准备。

simultaneous：

同时发生（或进行）的；同步的

Kierkegaard

happening or done at the same time as sth else

Disintegration of the rational character of society and the rational relationship between individual

and society is the most revolutionary trait of our times.

Disintegration： 瓦解，崩溃；分解

disintegrate：

衰微；瓦解；崩溃

rational：

行为、思想等

合理的；理性的；明智的

revolutionary：

革命的

trait：

（人的个性的）特征，特性，特点

analysis, decomposition, crash

to become much less strong or united and be gradually destroyed

( of behaviour, ideas, etc.

) based on reason rather than emotions

[ usually before noun ] connected with political revolution

a particular quality in your personality

Society must make it possible for man to die without despair if it wants him to be able to live

exclusively in society.

exclusively： 唯一地；专有地；排外地

despair：

绝望

solely

[ U ] the feeling of having lost all hope

And it can do so in only one way: by making individual life meaningless.

If you are nothing but a leaf on the tree of the race, a cell in the body of society, then your death is

not really death; you had better call it a process of collective regeneration.

leaf：

叶；叶片；叶子

collective：

集体的；共有的；共同的

race

[ C ] a flat green part of a plant, growing from a stem or branch or from the root

done or shared by all members of a group of people; involving a whole group or society

:[ C U ] one of the main groups that humans can be divided into according to their physical differences, for example the colour of

their skin

人种；种族

regeneration

:Regeneration is renewal through the internal processes of a body or system.

But then of course your life is not a real life either; it is just a functional process within the life of the

whole, devoid of any meaning except in terms of the whole.

devoid：

完全没有；缺乏

of sth completely lacking in sth

Thus an optimism that proclaims human existence in society leads straight to despair.

optimism：

[ U ] ~ (about/for sth) a feeling that good things will happen and that sth will be successful; the tendency to have this

feeling

乐观；乐观主义

proclaim

:[ also + VN to inf , also + V wh- ] to publicly and officially tell people about sth important

宣布；宣告；声明

And this despair can lead only to totalitarianism.

totalitarianism：n. 极权主义,

Totalitarianism or totalitarian state is a concept used by some political scientists in which the state

holds total authority over the society and seeks to control all aspects of public and private life wherever possible.The concept of

totalitarianism was first developed in the 1920s by the Weimar German jurist, and later Nazi academic, Carl Schmitt and Italian fascists.

Schmitt used the term, Totalstaat in his influential work on the legal basis of an all-powerful state, The Concept of the Political (1927).

The concept became prominent in Western anti-communist political discourse during the Cold War era, in order to highlight perceived

similarities between Nazi Germany and other Fascist states on the one hand, and Soviet Communist Party states on the other.Other

movements and governments have also been described as totalitarian. The leader of the historic Spanish reactionary conservative

movement called the Spanish Confederation of the Autonomous Right declared his intention to ”give Spain a true unity, a new spirit, a

totalitarian polity…” and went on to say ”Democracy is not an end but a means to the conquest of the new state. When the time comes,

either parliament submits or we will eliminate it.”

Human existence is possible as existence not in despair, as existence not in tragedy; it is possible

as existence in Faith.

despair：

绝望

tragedy：

悲惨的事；不幸；灾难；惨案

[ U ] the feeling of having lost all hope

a very sad event or situation, especially one that involves death

Faith is the belief that in God the impossible is possible, that in Him time and eternity are one, that

both life and death are meaningful.

Faith：

信任；相信；信心

eternity：[ U ] ( formal ) time without end, especially life continuing without end after death 永恒；

永生；不朽

[ U ] ~ (in sb/sth) trust in sb’s ability or knowledge; trust that sb/sth will do what has been promised

ACTION POINT:

Reflect on the following: “Human existence is possible only in tension—in tension between man’s

simultaneous life as an individual in the spirit and as a citizen in society.”

simultaneous：

同时发生（或进行）的；同步的

happening or done at the same time as sth else

The Ecological Vision

The End of Economic Man

24 DECEMBER

Human Existence in Tension

For Kierkegaard, human existence is possible only in tension— in tension

between man’s simultaneous life as an individual in the spirit and as

Acitizen in society.

Disintegration of the rational character of society and the rational rela-tionship

between individual and society is the most revolutionary trait

of our times.

Society must make it possible for man to die without despair if it

wants him to be able to live exclusively in society. And it can do so in

only one way: by making individual life meaningless. If you are nothing

but a leaf on the tree of the race, a cell in the body of society, then your

death is not re-ally death; you had better call it a process of collective

regeneration. But then of course your life is not a real life either; it is just

a functional process within the life of the whole, devoid of any meaning

except in terms of the whole. Thus an optimism that proclaims human

existence in society leads straight to despair. And this despair can lead

only to totalitarianism. Human existence is possible as existence not in

despair, as existence not in tragedy; it is possible as existence in Faith.

Faith is the belief that in God the impossible is possible, that in Him time

and eternity are one, that both life and death are meaningful.

ACTION POINT:

Reflect on the following: “Human existence is possible

only in tension—in tension between man’s simultaneous life as an

individ-ual in the spirit and as a citizen in society.”

The Ecological Vision

The End of Economic Man

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

我、我的祖国还有我的神

是的，我是一个nobody，虽然我总以为自己是somebody。

有一天我跑步，一脚踩到了一个坑里，脚扭了，非常疼。这时，我离家还有900米左右，大早上的，我

也不能抱着这棵树等人来救。所以，我忍着疼往家走。

我先是试着单腿跳了几下，觉得比较别扭，而且，受伤的左脚我需要小心才能不碰到它。

这时，我下了一个决定，就是慢慢地用左脚触地，慢慢地感受左脚传来的疼痛，然后一步一步慢慢地

往前挪。

当我的左脚第一次触地时，那种疼痛，撕心裂肺。又像踩到了海绵上，我不敢用力，又有点迫不及待

想用力，因为麻木的左脚不能给我真实的反馈。

终于，我的左脚踩实了。我开始准备太右脚。当我右脚要抬起时，我真个身体的重量都会压倒左脚

上，我的左脚的痛感在不断加剧。

我略微抬了一下右脚，就往前挪了一点。

然后我急速抬起左脚，往前挪了一点，然后慢慢放下，接着慢慢抬起右脚，非常快速挪了一点点，然

后放下。

每一次挪动，都需要花费30秒，甚至更久。

走了十几步后，已经差不多10分钟过去了，我突然感觉左脚也没那么疼了。这时，我开始享受左脚踩

下去时的那个疼痛，然后我走的越来越快了。

二十多步后，我感觉我应该可以跳着走，只是左脚落地时要轻一些，小心一些。

然后，我开始jogging.

每次左脚着地时，我都会大叫一声：爽。

由跑了十几步后，我落地越来越轻松，疼痛越来越少，甚至有一些快感了。

然后，我就正常跑了起来，只是大脑在告诉我，我的左脚要留心。

等我跑到家，我的左脚已经没感觉了。我脱下鞋，然后用手使劲捏脚踝，还是有疼痛感，不过已经不

影响了。

这一天，我完全正常走路。两天后，脚就完全好了。

后来，我又扭过两次脚，我都是用这个方法处理的：先是忍着痛往前挪，然后是“颠颠地”慢跑，然后

就是正常跑。每次都在10-15分钟解决这个问题。

后来随着肌肉能力的加强，也就很少再扭脚了。

后来我去看一个朋友打篮球，朋友在抢球时脚也扭伤了。他随即下场休息。我过去鼓励他围着老球场

慢慢走，他忍着痛走了半圈后，开始慢跑。10分钟后 ，他回到赛场继续参加。直到活动结束。

这是我作为一个生物人的一个有趣的经验。我们都拥有我们自己的身体，我们对我们自己的身体拥有

最佳体验，我们也通过对我们身体的体验来感受这个世界。在这个角度来说，我们的身体是属于我们

自己的。

李笑来说过一句让我醍醐灌顶的话：“你要知道，你的大脑也是属于你的”。

这句话出自李笑来的《和时间做朋友》，当我看到这句话时，我显示愣了一下，然后就会然一笑了。

是呀，既然我的大脑是我自己的，那我应该就有能力命令他让我开心，而不是听从他的安排去开心或

者不开心。

当我不开心的时候，我就告诉答案：去想个办法让我开心。当我伤心时，我就和大脑说：去想个办法

让我不伤心。

当我遇到难以解决的问题是，我就和大脑说：去像个办法让我不那么难过。

我上次提到的弗兰克尔发明的“意义疗法”，其本质也无外乎：你的大脑是属于自己的。

所以，你可以命令你的大脑找出任何意见事的意义， 并且通过意义来给你的选择做出支撑。

这就是人最伟大的地方，你可以控制的你身体，而不是完全听医生的；你也可控制你的大脑，而不是

被情绪控制。

你可以发现任何一件事的意义。而不是去被不喜欢的事情拖入深渊。

当然，我也是属于我的祖国的，我每天都需要工作，需要做一些事情，如果我不做事，如果每一个热

偶都不做事，那么这个国家会在瞬间奔溃。

这就是人的社会性：既然人组成了这个社会，既然我要在这个社会生活下去，我就需要遵守这个社会

的规则。

既然我活着这个国家，我也要遵守这个国家的规则。

这是我对我的社会，我的国家的需要。

而作为一个社会、一个国家，他们也是需要我的。所谓的国家，也就是无数普通的和不普通的人组成

起来的。我们工作组成了这个国家。

当然，既然是一个国家，肯定有一些极端的事情，比如，需要有人去打仗，需要有人去救火，需要有

人去冒着生命危险来维护国家和社会的安全。

这是国家对个人的要求。在这个时刻，在国家眼里，个人就是一个工具：维持国家运转的工具。

你我皆工具。

其实，还有一个视角，就是神的视角。

西方有个基督，TA是神，他还生了一个儿子叫做耶稣，耶稣爱人民，他爱每一个人。

所以，在西方，每一个人在遵守社会规则的同时，他们也在乞求神的爱怜。他们认为，他们做不到

的，不满的，做错的地方，都会得到神的原谅，他们做的一切的一切，背后都有神的旨意。这是他们

生命最大的意义。

一旦接受了神作为自己的主宰，自己所做的一切无意义的事情，都变得有了意义：这是神的旨意。

我个人拥有我的身体、大脑；国家拥有我，而神拥有一切，这是一个有趣的结构。

如果我失去了我的身体、大脑，那么，我不在拥有自我，所以，我需要做一些来证明自己，比如我说

话，我写东西；如果我失去了国家，那么我将没有归属，所以，我需要做一些事情为我的祖国服务，

比如我工作；如果我失去了神的庇佑，那么，我做的一切都将没有任何意义，所以，我会把我不能理

解的事情，都交个神，然后告诉我自己：这是神的旨意。

当然，我不是基督徒，所以，我需要找到我的神。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

25 DECEMBER

The Unfashionable Kierkegaard

Unfashionable：

not popular or fashionable at a particular time

不时兴的；不时髦的；过时的

Faith enables man to die; but it also enables him to live.

My work has indeed been totally in society.

But I knew at once, in those farback days of 1928, that my life would not and could not be totally in

society, that it would have to have an existential dimension that transcends society.

farback：久远

existential：

关于人类存在的；与人类存在有关的

dimension：

维（构成空间的因素）；尺寸

transcend：

超出，超越（通常的界限）

( formal ) connected with human existence

a measurement in space, for example the height, width or length of sth

[ VN ] ( formal ) to be or go beyond the usual limits of sth

Still my work has been totally in society—except for this essay on Kierkegaard.

essay：

（作为课程作业，学生写的）文章，短文

(on sth) a short piece of writing by a student as part of a course of study

Though Kierkegaard’s faith cannot overcome the awful loneliness, the isolation and dissonance

of human existence, it can make it bearable by making it meaningful.

awful：

很坏的；极讨厌的

isolation：

孤独；孤立状态

dissonance：

不和谐；不协调；不一致

bearable：

可忍受的；能应付的

( informal ) very bad or unpleasant

the state of being alone or lonely

[ U ] ( formal ) lack of agreement

a person or thing that is bearable can be accepted or dealt with

The philosophy of the totalitarian creeds enables man to die.

philosophy：

人生哲学；生活的信条（或态度）

totalitarian：

国家或政府体制

[ C ] a set of beliefs or an attitude to life that guides sb’s behaviour

( disapproving ) ( of a country or system of government

极权主义的

creed：a set of principles or religious beliefs 信念；原则；纲领；宗教信仰

) in which there is only one political party

that has complete power and control over the people

It is dangerous to underestimate the strength of such a philosophy; for, in a time of sorrow and

suffering, of catastrophe and horror, it is a great thing to be able to die.

underestimate：

低估；对 估计不足

catastrophe：

灾难；灾祸；横祸

to think or guess that the amount, cost or size of sth is smaller than it really is

a sudden event that causes many people to suffer

Yet it is not enough.

Kierkegaard’s faith, too, enables man to die; but it also enables him to live.

…

Faith is the belief that in God the impossible is possible, that in Him time and eternity are one, that

both life and death are meaningful.

eternity：

永恒；永生；不朽

[ U ] ( formal ) time without end, especially life continuing without end after death

Faith is the knowledge that man is creature—not autonomous, not the master, not the end, not the

center— and yet responsible and free.

autonomous：

国家、地区、组织

自治

的；有自治权的

( of a country, a region or an organization

responsible：

) able to govern itself or control its own affairs

(for sb/sth) | ~ (for doing sth) having the job or duty of doing sth or taking care of sb/sth, so that you may be

blamed if sth goes wrong

有责任；负责；承担义务

It is the acceptance of man’s essential loneliness, to be overcome by the certainty that God is

always with man, even “unto the hour of our death.”

essential：

(to/for sth) | ~ (to do sth) | ~ (that…) completely necessary; extremely important in a particular situation or for a

particular activity SYN vital

完全必要的；必不可少的；极其重要的

ACTION POINT:

Salvation by society has always failed in the end.

Salvation：

基督教

得救；救恩；救世

Find a purpose that sustains you both in society and as a human being.

sustain：

维持（生命、生存）

purpose：

重要意义；有价值的意义

( in Christianity

) the state of being saved from the power of evil

to provide enough of what sb/sth needs in order to live or exist

[ C U ] meaning that is important and valuable to you

The Ecological Vision

25 DECEMBER

The Unfashionable Kierkegaard

Faith enables man to die; but it also enables him to live.

My work has indeed been totally in society. But I knew at once, in those

far-back days of 1928, that my life would not and could not be totally in

society, that it would have to have an existential dimension that tran-

scends society. Still my work has been totally in society—except for this

essay on Kierkegaard.

Though Kierkegaard’s faith cannot overcome the awful loneliness, the

isolation and dissonance of human existence, it can make it bearable by

making it meaningful. The philosophy of the totalitarian creeds enables

man to die. It is dangerous to underestimate the strength of such

Aphiloso-phy; for, in a time of sorrow and suffering, of catastrophe and

horror, it is a great thing to be able to die. Yet it is not enough.

Kierkegaard’s faith, too, enables man to die; but it also enables him to

live. Faith is the belief that in God the impossible is possible, that in Him

time and eternity are one, that both life and death are meaningful. Faith is

the knowledge that man is creature—not autonomous, not the master, not

the end, not the center— and yet responsible and free. It is the acceptance

of man’s essential loneli-ness, to be overcome by the certainty that God is

always with man, even “unto the hour of our death.”

ACTION POINT:

Salvation by society has always failed in the end. Find

Apurpose that sustains you both in society and as a human being.

The Ecological Vision

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

如何获得权力？

韦小宝说过，小丈夫一日不可无钱，大丈夫一日不可无权。我是小丈夫，所以比较爱财，身边也有一

些大丈夫，他们比较爱权。

其实财和权，相互呼应、勾结，有钱自然就有一些权；而有权也就很容易有钱。小宝作为一个不大不

小的官，短短的几年里贪污了几百万两白银，很好滴证明了有权就可以有钱。

那么，怎么可以快速获得权力呢？获得权力有很多方式，比如卖身相府就是一个很好的途径。不是说

宰相门前七品官嘛，接近权力是最好的获得权力的方式。

不过，这些指的都是成熟的权力体系。那么在一个人群中，普普通通的人群中，如何获得权力呢？靠

知识？靠认知？靠钱财？

或许都可以，那么，靠知识、认知或者钱财获得权力的本质是什么呢？某一天我突然找到了答案：恐

惧。

按照马斯洛的需求层次理论，人最底层的两个需求是生理需求和安全需求。人一旦满足了基本的生理

需求后，就面临着安全的需求。而人是一个安全性很差的动物。在现实社会中，人会为了安全的需求

让渡很多权利。

比如，飞机的安检，人们期待非常安全的飞机，所以可以接受任何级别的飞机安检。没有人认为飞机

安检有辱人格。

地铁安检也一样，每一个地铁口都放一个口号：配合安检，安全你我他。大家觉得被人拿着棍棍在身

上摸来摸去是很正常的：他们是为我们的安全考虑呀。

有资料显示美国政府是获得了日本偷袭珍珠港的情报的，不过，他们并没有采取动作，因为他需要让

自己的国民陷入恐惧中，这样他们才可以迅速通过相关的军事法案。

果然，偷袭珍珠港后，美国政府获得了巨大的权力，美国所有的涉军事行动的法案都迅速通过，二战

局势从而改变。

其实，这是政治人物用的方式：贩卖一些恐惧，然后告诉你，他是来解除你的恐惧的。而你唯一要付

出的就是你的一部分自由：让他搜身，甚至让他随意处置你的生命。

随着你出让的权力越多，他获得的权力也就越大。

随着他的权力越来越大，他也就有能力做任何事情。甚至得到其他民众的支持。

你可以试想，如果你不配合安检，恐怕首先发怒的不是安检人员，而是其他被安检的人员：你他妈的

怎么那么多事？人家可是为你好呀。

所以，刘慈欣说：当人类真正流落太空时，极权只需五分钟。因为在太空中，所有人都亟需安全感。

大纲

百字摘要

自由 VS 平等和安全

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

26 DECEMBER

Return of the Demons

Demon：

恶魔；魔鬼，

an evil spirit

( informal ) a person who does sth very well or with a lot of energy

人，something that causes a person to worry and makes them unhappy （使人担忧和不快的）邪恶事物

技艺出众的人；精力充沛的

Return of：？？？

If freedom is incompatible with security, the masses will decide for security.

incompatible：

(with sth) two actions, ideas, etc. that are incompatible are not acceptable or possible together because of

basic differences

masses：

（与某事物）不一致，不相配

N-PLURAL the body of common people

群众

The masses, then, have become prepared to abandon freedom if this promises to reestablish the

rationality of the world.

promises：

承诺

reestablish： 恢复，重建；复兴

rationality：

有限理性

V-T/V-I If you promise that you will do something, you say to someone that you will definitely do it.

restore, repair

bounded rationality

If freedom is incompatible with equality, they will give up freedom.

equality：

平等；均等；相等

[ U ] the fact of being equal in rights, status, advantages, etc.

If it is incompatible with security, they will decide for security.

decide for：作对…有利的决定；赞成做某事

To be free or not has become a secondary question, since the freedom available does not help to

banish the demons.

banish：

放逐；流放；把

[ usually passive ] ~ sb (from…) (to…) to order sb to leave a place, especially a country, as a punishment

（某人）驱逐出境

Since the “free” society is the one that is threatened by the demons, it seems more than plausible

to blame freedom and to expect delivery from despair through the abandonment of freedom.

threatened：adj. 受到威胁的

plausible：

借口或解释

有道理的；可信的

blame：

把 归咎于；责怪；指责

despair：

绝望

delivery：

传送；递送；交付

( of an excuse or explanation

) reasonable and likely to be true

[ VN ] ~ sb/sth (for sth) | ~ sth on sb/sth to think or say that sb/sth is responsible for sth bad

…

[ U ] the feeling of having lost all hope

[ U C ] the act of taking goods, letters, etc. to the people they have been sent to

ACTION POINT:

The passage refers to the embrace by Europe of Nazism to escape the demons of war and

depression.

passage：

章节；段落；乐段

[ C ] a short section from a book, piece of music, etc.

embrace：

[ VN ] ( formal ) to accept an idea, a proposal, a set of beliefs, etc., especially when it is done with enthusiasm

受，乐意采纳（思想、建议等）；信奉（宗教、信仰等）

Nazism：n. 纳粹主义

depression：

不景气

[ C U ] a period when there is little economic activity and many people are poor or without jobs

欣然接

萧条期；经济衰退；

Why will society be more likely to embrace complete regimentation and totalitarianism in the

absence of strong institutions?

embrace：

欣然接

[ VN ] ( formal ) to accept an idea, a proposal, a set of beliefs, etc., especially when it is done with enthusiasm

受，乐意采纳（思想、建议等）；信奉（宗教、信仰等）

regimentation：N-UNCOUNT Regimentation is very strict control over the way a group of people behave or the way something

is done. 严格管理; 严格控制

totalitarianism：n. 极权主义

institutions：N-COUNT/N-IN-NAMES An institution is a large important organization such as a university, church, or bank. 机构

The End of Economic Man

26 DECEMBER

Return of the Demons

If freedom is incompatible with security, the masses will decide for security.

The masses, then, have become prepared to abandon freedom if this

promises to reestablish the rationality of the world. If freedom is in-

compatible with equality, they will give up freedom. If it is incompatible

with security, they will decide for security. To be free or not has become

Asecondary question, since the freedom available does not help to banish

the demons. Since the “free” society is the one that is threatened by the

demons, it seems more than plausible to blame freedom and to expect de-

livery from despair through the abandonment of freedom.

ACTION POINT:

The passage refers to the embrace by Europe of Nazism to

escape the demons of war and depression. Why will society be more

likely to embrace complete regimentation and totalitarianism in the ab-

sence of strong institutions?

The End of Economic Man

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

高性能计算

IPT

无纸化办公 为赵锐要（）

前言

后端的高性能图站

前端的IPT处理

无纸化办公

安全要单独写一个篇章

最后给一部的的方案上改

赵锐也写。

我们需要怎样的江湖

你我皆凡人，我们需要怎么的江湖呢？

假如你在一个小饭店做服务员，你生性滑稽，经常喜欢说一些段子。

某一天，店里来了一个大汉，后面有来了一个小姑娘。大汉点什么，小姑娘就点什么，你逗趣地说了

句话，然后就被小姑娘把舌头割了一节。终生口齿不清了。

不过，你还是幸运的，因为你的另一个同事，正在战战兢兢地端菜， 结果被后面进来的一个年轻人打

了一巴掌，整个人都变成了黑的，死透了。

我想，你应该不想在这样的江湖。

所以，你出身不错，家庭条件也不错，家里很有钱，也会武功，你跟着父亲也学了一些武功，家里事

业也遍布全国。你倍成为少爷。

某天，你带着几个家丁出去玩，在一个酒馆里看到一个外地人调戏老乡，你去打抱不平。结果不小心

杀了了一个人。

你非常害怕，就跑回家。没几天，家门口来了很多人，然后，你看着自己身边的人一个一个地死掉

了，而你，只能逃跑，逃跑。

我想，你应该也不想要这样的生活。

你努力学武功，四处拜名师，居然还拜了一个号称龙王的人为师，你师父的武功确实厉害，你学成了

文武艺，投靠了当时最有权势的金国。

结果，没几年，你就在太湖上被人一刀砍了。

我想，你的努力学习，肯定也不想要这样的江湖。

然后，你天赋异禀，轻功绝世无双，而且，你加入了一个非常厉害的教派，教里的兄弟都非常和谐，

和称你为“青翼蝠王”，你四处杀人，为所欲为，因着你的武功高，别人不敢惹你。

你身体有些残疾，每次练功都要喝人血，所以，你经常要用牙齿咬死人。

每天晚上，在梦中，当那些被你咬死的人临死前恐怖的面容出现在你梦里时，你会惊醒。

在这半梦半醒之间，你会说，这不是我要的江湖 。

所以，江湖开始变化，那些武术大侠的影响力越来越低。世俗的法律和政府的权力越来越大，普通人

的生存权力也越来越大。

当东方不败怀着绝世神功，在闺房绣花时，他肯定想，这才是我要的生活。多希望这种生活和我的武

功无关。

令狐冲是笑道最后的人，不过，这时的他已经是独孤九剑+吸星大法+易经筋+无数人的内功。这时的令

狐冲会不会在想：多希望我的笑傲和我的武功无关，而是做了一个普通的华山大师哥。

是呀，在江湖上，不管你多努力，不过你武功多高，你都没有安全，你每天都在防备被杀死。这不是

你想要的生活，这也不是你想要的江湖。

如果武功的学习，只会带来恐怖。那么这个江湖不要武功也罢。

在金庸的最后一本书里，在《鹿鼎记》里，最后胜出的是不大会武功的韦小宝。而小宝身边那些武功

高手，都被他玩的团团转。

我想，金庸在告诉大家：这才是他要的江湖，在这个江湖中，你有一个安全的归宿。

在《鹿鼎记》之前的江湖中，主角的安全感都来自无与伦比的武功，而《鹿鼎记》做了修正。

这才是我们想要的江湖。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

27 DECEMBER

Integrating the Economic and Social

It is this absence of a functioning industrial society, able to integrate our industrial reality, that

underlies the crises of our times.

crises:

危机

underlie

构成 的基础；作为 的原因

N-VAR A crisis is a situation in which something or someone is affected by one or more very serious problems.

:[ VN ] [ no passive ] ( formal ) to be the basis or cause of sth

…

…

Man in his social and political existence must have a functioning society just as he must have

air to breathe in his biological existence.

However, the fact that man has to have a society does not necessarily mean that he has it.

Nobody calls the mass of unorganized, panicky, stampeding humanity in a shipwreck a

“society.”

panicky：

焦虑不安的；惊慌的

stampeding：

兽群或人群

（使）狂奔，涌向

humanity：

（统称）人；人类

shipwreck：

船舶失事；海难

( informal ) anxious about sth; feeling or showing panic

( of large animals or people

) to run in a stampede ; to make animals do this

[ U ] people in general

[ U C ] the loss or destruction of a ship at sea because of a storm or because it hits rocks, etc.

There is no society, though there are human beings in a group.

Actually, the panic is directly due to the break-down of a society; and the only way to overcome it is

by restoring a society with social values, social discipline, social power, and social

relationships.

Social life cannot function without a society; but it is conceivable that it does not function at all.

conceivable：

可想象的；可信的

that you can imagine or believe

The evidence of the last twenty-five years of Western civilization hardly entitles us to say that our

social life functioned so well as to make out a prima-facie case for the existence of a functioning

society.

entitle：

prima-facie：

V-T If you are entitled to something, you have the right to have it or do it.

[ only before noun ] ( law

later

基于初步印象的；初步认定的

使有权

律 ) ( from Latin ) based on what at first seems to be true, although it may be proved false

ACTION POINT:

The passage above was written during World War II.

It recognized that after centuries of industrial advance there had not been a similar advance in

other institutions of society.

Should the economic dimension of society ever take supremacy over the human, social, and

political dimensions?

supremacy：

至高无上；最大

[ U ] ~ (over sb/sth) a position in which you have more power, authority or status than anyone else

权力；最高权威；最高地位

The Future of Industrial Man

27 DECEMBER

Integrating the Economic and Social

It is this absence of a functioning industrial society, able to integrate

our industrial reality, that underlies the crises of our times.

Man in his social and political existence must have a functioning soci-ety just

as he must have air to breathe in his biological existence.

However, the fact that man has to have a society does not necessarily mean

that he has it. Nobody calls the mass of unorganized, panicky, stampeding

humanity in a shipwreck a “society.” There is no society, though there are

human beings in a group. Actually, the panic is directly due to the break-

down of a society; and the only way to overcome it is by restoring a society

with social values, social discipline, social power, and social relationships.

Social life cannot function without a society; but it is conceivable that

it does not function at all. The evidence of the last twenty-five years of

West-ern civilization hardly entitles us to say that our social life

functioned so well as to make out a prima-facie case for the existence of

Afunctioning society.

ACTION POINT:

The passage above was written during World War II. It

recognized that after centuries of industrial advance there had not been

Asimilar advance in other institutions of society. Should the economic di-

mension of society ever take supremacy over the human, social, and

politi-cal dimensions?

The Future of Industrial Man

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

家族和家族企业

最近和朋友聊家族和家庭的区别，我觉得越来越有意思。

我的理解是，家庭是社会组成的最小单元：我、陪伴我的、生我的和我生的；而家族呢？则是通过血

缘、商业以及政治等规则联合起来的家庭。

今天我又看到了一个名词：家族企业。那么，什么是家族企业呢？

我的理解，家族企业就是家族在形成做成中所从事的商业活动。

那么，企业和家族企业又有什么区别呢？其实，所有的企业本来都是家族企业，随着工业化和现代社

会社交网络的发达，才出现了非家族企业。

所以，可以认为，家族企业其实是目前企业的组要组织形式。

当然，在大家的理解中，现在的企业多数都是职业经理人在做管理工作。其实，你没注意的是，大多

数企业，其实还是家族企业。

记得有一次我去南三环一个不大不小的饭店吃饭，我和服务员聊了一会，才发现店里的厨师、老板、

收银员、服务员等等等等，都是一家人：姐夫、哥哥、姑姑、侄子，等等。很少有外人。

这个才是中国很多企业的真实情况，其实也是世界上很多企业的真实情况。

因为，对于很多人来说，商业、企业，只是让自己生活的工具，（讨）生活而已，找那么多外人干

嘛？外人的好坏和我有什么关系？

樊登是樊登读书会的发起人，樊登读书会的发心是让三亿国人养成阅读习惯。樊登讲书的一个主要分

类就是管理学。

可是，在樊登的管理中，自己的外甥什么的，也是在公司作威作福。

其实，在中国人的视角中，我的企业自然是为我服务的，外人有什么好？外人好或者不好，又和我有

什么关系？

而且，家族企业和非家族企业的一个明显区别是对传承的诉求。对于飞家族企业，没有人关心它的传

承。它什么时候死掉，什么时候奔溃掉，其实没有什么人关心的。

而对于家族企业，则会有人去关心他的传承，是儿子？还是孙子把“祖宗基业”毁掉了？

有数据显示，在现代，家族企业传承到二代的有30per，传承到三代的有10per，传承的四代的只有4per。

（参考《家族企业》杂志，2004年数据）

这个数字看起来不高，其实，也非常不低，因为，非家族企业，根本没有人在意他的传承。可以想

象，他会更低。

我今天路过了红星二锅头的一个博物馆。红星二锅头的创始人是三位赵家人：赵存仁、赵存义、赵存

礼。

然后，400多年后的红星，和赵家人还有什么关系么？或许，文化上是传承的，商业上则未必。

至于百年门框、六百年烤鸭、东来顺、六必居等等等等，更多是技艺和文化的传承，商业传承？未

必！

而技艺和文化的传承，其实和血缘、商业，都没什么关系。

而商业，则有商业自己的规律。而那些真正传承两代、三代、四代，甚至更多代的企业，需要更加复

杂的商业、社会、政治、以及法律筹划。

那就是另一个故事了。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

28 DECEMBER

The Family-Managed Business

The majority of businesses everywhere are family controlled and family managed.

majority：

大部分；大多数

sing.+sing./pl.v. ] ~ (of sb/sth) the largest part of a group of people or things

The majority of businesses everywhere—including the United States and all other developed

countries—are family controlled and family managed.

majority：

And family management is by no means confined to small and medium-sized firms—families run

some of the world’s largest companies.

by no means：决不

confined：

空间或地区

狭窄而围起来的

[ usually before noun ] ( of a space or an area

) small and surrounded by walls or sides

DuPont, controlled and managed by family members for 170 years (since its founding in 1802 until

professional management took over in the mid-1970s), grew into the world’s largest chemical

company.

And two centuries after a still obscure coin dealer began to send out his sons to establish banks

in Europe’s capitals, financial firms bearing the Rothschild name and run by Rothschilds are still

among the world’s premier private bankers.

obscure：

send out：

not well known

无名的；鲜为人知的

PHRASAL VERB If you send out things such as letters or bills, you send them to a large number of people at the same

time.

分发; 散发

Yet management books and management courses deal almost entirely with the publicly owned and

professionally managed company—they rarely as much as mention the family-managed business.

Of course, there is no difference whatever between professionally managed and family-managed

businesses in respect to all functional work: research or marketing or accounting.

But with respect to management, the family business requires its own and very different rules.

These rules have to be stringently observed. Otherwise, the family-managed business will not

survive, let alone prosper.

stringently：adv. 严格地，严厉地

observed：adj. 观察的；观测的

prosper：

繁荣；兴旺；成功；发达

[ V ] to develop in a successful way; to be successful, especially in making money

ACTION POINT:

Less than 30 percent of family-owned companies survive into the second generation, while only 10

percent make it to the third generation, and just 4 percent to the fourth generation (Family

Magazine, Web site, June 2004).

Speculate as to why family businesses have such difficulty transitioning from generation to

generation.

Speculate：

推测；猜测；推断

transitioning：

(about/on sth) to form an opinion about sth without knowing all the details or facts

[ U C ] ~ (from sth) (to sth) | ~ (between A and B) the process or a period of changing from one state or condition

to another

过渡；转变；变革；变迁

as to：至于，关于；就……而论

Managing in a Time of Great Change

28 DECEMBER

The Family-Managed Business

The majority of businesses everywhere are family controlled

and family managed.

The majority of businesses everywhere—including the United States and

all other developed countries—are family controlled and family managed.

And family management is by no means confined to small and medium-sized

firms—families run some of the world’s largest companies. DuPont,

controlled and managed by family members for 170 years (since its founding

in 1802 until professional management took over in the mid-1970s), grew

into the world’s largest chemical company. And two centuries after a still

obscure coin dealer began to send out his sons to establish banks in Europe’s

capitals, financial firms bearing the Rothschild name and run

by Rothschilds are still among the world’s premier private bankers.

Yet management books and management courses deal almost entirely

with the publicly owned and professionally managed company—they

rarely as much as mention the family-managed business. Of course, there

is no difference whatever between professionally managed and family-

managed businesses in respect to all functional work: research or market-

ing or accounting. But with respect to management, the family business

requires its own and very different rules. These rules have to be

stringently observed. Otherwise, the family-managed business will not

survive, let alone prosper.

ACTION POINT:

Less than 30 percent of family-owned companies survive

into the second generation, while only 10 percent make it to the third gen-

eration, and just 4 percent to the fourth generation (Family Magazine,

Web site, June 2004). Speculate as to why family businesses have such

difficulty transitioning from generation to generation.

Managing in a Time of Great Change

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

家族企业中的家族和企业

当我们说家族企业时，我们的关注点是企业，而不是家族。这个和我们古人的看法恰恰相反。

因为我们国家还是一个新的国家，目前最有钱的那些人，那些家族，还都是一代，他们的财富来源大

多是创业所得，也就是说，他们的创始的企业是他们主要的财富来源。

比如，今年的胡润百富版这几位。

对他们来说，他们的家族就是企业，没有了企业，他们所谓的家族也就不存在了。

那么，阿里是家族企业么？当然不是，腾讯是家族企业么？当然不是，当当是家族企业么？当然是。

换一个视角，马云通过阿里的发展，形成了自己的家族，而阿里却不是家族企业；马化腾通过腾讯，

形成了自己的家族，而腾讯却不是家族企业；比尔盖茨通过微软形成了自己的家族，而微软却不是家

族企业。

这些家族有企业么？或者说，对于马云、马化腾、比尔盖茨来说，他们的家族有家族企业么？

好像没有。

不过，马云家族确实是需要考虑传承的，他的传承，除了他超出想象力的财富外，还有一些复杂的架

构，一些一些持续增值的股票（显然包括阿里的股票）。

这就是马云、马化腾、比尔盖茨这些现代人聪明的地方，他们成功地解决了家族企业传承中很重要的

一个问题，而他们的解决方法无一例外是把公司变成公众公司。

他们甚至没有家庭成员加入公司去工作，没有记录显示比尔盖茨的女儿在微软工作，也没有记录显示

马化腾的孩子们在腾讯工作，也没有记录显示马云的孩子们在阿里工作。

当然，这些并不是忌讳。即使他们加入微软、阿里、腾讯，也是因为自己的能力和努力加入的。

在现在的微软、阿里、腾讯高层，已经没有了这三个人的痕迹，至少表面是没有的。整个公司已经变

成了公众公司。这个公司的成功，成了很多人，非常多的人的目标和愿景。

在这些公司的每一个岗位，都有非常专业的人各就其位。

而为了让这个公司可以正常地、高效地运转，它也需要非常专业人员。

其实，对于马云、马化腾、比尔盖茨这些人来说，他们已经完成了家族企业的传承。而这个传承，不

再对他们的后人有过多的要求和期待。

更准确地说，他们把家族企业的传承，成功地转换成了财富传承，而且是一个持续的财富的传承。

至于如何做（持续）财富的传承？那是另一个问题。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

29 DECEMBER

Rules for the Family-Managed Business

The controlling word in “family-managed business” is not “family.” It has to be “business.”

controlling word：一个很有意思的字。

The first rule is that family members do not work in the business unless they are at least as able as

any nonfamily employee, and work at least as hard.

The second rule is equally simple: No matter how many family members are in the company’s

management, and how effective they are, one top job is always filled by an outsider who is not a

member of the family.

Typically, this is either the financial executive or the head of research—the two positions in

which technical qualifications are most important.

technical qualification：技术资格

Rule three is that family-managed businesses, except perhaps for the very smallest ones,

increasingly need to staff key positions with nonfamily professionals.

increasingly：

越来越多地；不断增加地

more and more all the time

The knowledge and expertise needed, whether in manufacturing or in marketing, in finance, in

research, in human resource management, have become far too great to be satisfied by any but the

most competent family member.

expertise:

专门知识；专门技能；专长

competent

足以胜任的；有能力的；称职的

[ U ] ~ (in sth/in doing sth) expert knowledge or skill in a particular subject, activity or job

:having enough skill or knowledge to do sth well or to the necessary standard

Even the family-managed business that faithfully observes the preceding three rules tends to

get into trouble—and often breaks up—over management succession.

faithfully:

准确地；如实地；仔细地

observes

遵从

preceding 在前的；前述的

breaks up 打碎，破碎；结束；解散；衰落

accurately; carefully

:V-T If you observe something such as a law or custom, you obey it or follow it.

:n.

:n.

prior, prius

conclude, knapp

Then what the business needs and what the family wants tend to collide.

collide：

(with sb) (over sth) ( formal ) ( of people, their opinions, etc.

人、意见等 ) to disagree strongly 严重不一致；冲突；抵触

There is only one solution: Entrust the succession decision to an outsider who is neither part of

the family nor part of the business.

Entrust：

委托；交托；托付

succession：

[ VN ] ~ A (to B) | ~ B with A to make sb responsible for doing sth or taking care of sb

[ U ] the act of taking over an official position or title; the right to take over an official position or title, especially to

become the king or queen of a country

outsider：

继承；继任；（尤指王位的）继承权

a person who is not part of a particular organization or profession

（组织、行业）外部的人；外来者

ACTION POINT:

Get to know the top management of a family-owned business.

top management：

N the most senior staff of an organization or business, including the heads of various divisions or

departments led by the chief executive

高层管理人员(包括由行政长官领导的各部门领导)

Ask members how they plan to handle the problem of management succession “into the next

generation.”

succession：

[ U ] the act of taking over an official position or title; the right to take over an official position or title, especially to

become the king or queen of a country

继承；继任；（尤指王位的）继承权

Determine whether the plans are being driven by business issues or family issues, or by a

combination of the two.

issues：

议题

combination：

结合体；联合体；混合体

N-COUNT An issue is an important subject that people are arguing about or discussing.

[ C ] two or more things joined or mixed together to form a single unit

Managing in a Time of Great Change

29 DECEMBER

Rules for the Family-Managed Business

The controlling word in “family-managed business” is not “family.”

It has to be “business.”

The first rule is that family members do not work in the business unless

they are at least as able as any nonfamily employee, and work at least as hard.

The second rule is equally simple: No matter how many family mem-bers are

in the company’s management, and how effective they are, one top job is

always filled by an outsider who is not a member of the family. Typi-cally,

this is either the financial executive or the head of research—the two

positions in which technical qualifications are most important. Rule three is

that family-managed businesses, except perhaps for the very smallest ones,

increasingly need to staff key positions with nonfamily professionals. The

knowledge and expertise needed, whether in manufacturing or in marketing,

in finance, in research, in human resource management, have become far too

great to be satisfied by any but the most competent family

member.

Even the family-managed business that faithfully observes the preceding

three rules tends to get into trouble—and often breaks up—over manage-

ment succession. Then what the business needs and what the family wants

tend to collide. There is only one solution: Entrust the succession decision to

an outsider who is neither part of the family nor part of the business.

ACTION POINT:

Get to know the top management of a family-owned busi-

ness. Ask members how they plan to handle the problem of management

succession “into the next generation.” Determine whether the plans are

being driven by business issues or family issues, or by a combination of

the two.

Managing in a Time of Great Change

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

创新不是从零到一，而是改变一点点

创新总是被鼓励的，那么什么是创新呢？

前几天和一个漂亮的女生聊天，这个女生不会骑自行车。

有一次从地铁出来，要到目的地，差不多1公里左右，我说咱们骑个车吧。

这个漂亮的姑娘红着脸怯怯滴说：”我不会。“

我说干嘛不学呀，现在很少有人不会自行车了。然后，这个姑娘感慨地说了一句话：“我一直以为自行

车很快就会被淘汰了，现在才知道，不会骑自行车马上就要被淘汰了。”

是呀，谁能想到，在工业化几百年后的今天，自行车突然成了城市生活的基本技能。

自行车的起源大概是在18世纪末。

1790年，法国人西夫拉克发明了最原始的自行车。它只有两个轮子而没有传动装置，人骑在上面，需

用两脚蹬地驱车向前滚动。

1801年，俄国人阿尔塔马诺夫设计出用踏板踩动的自行车。

1817年，德国人德莱斯开始制作木轮车，样子跟西夫拉克的差不多。不过，在前轮上加了一个控制方

向的车把子，可以改变前进的方向.但是骑车依然要用两只脚，一下一下地蹬踩地面，才能推动车子向

前滚动，他自称为：小马崽。因此德国男爵卡尔•德莱斯成为一般公认的自行车发明人！

1839年，苏格兰人麦克米伦制造出木制车轮，装实心橡胶轮胎、前轮小、后轮大、坐垫较低、装有脚

踏板和曲柄连杆装置，骑者可以双脚离开地面的自行车。同年，麦克米伦又将木制自行车改为铁制自

行车。

1840年，英格兰的铁匠麦克米伦，在德莱斯发明的“小马崽”的基础上，进行了改进。他在前轮的车轴

上装上曲柄，再用连杆把曲柄和前面的脚蹬连接起来，并且前后轮都用铁制。这样一来，人的双脚真

正离开了地面，由双脚的交替踩动变为轮子的滚动。1842年，麦克米伦骑上这种车，一天跑了近20千

米。

1861年，法国的米肖父子。在前轮上安装了能转动的脚蹬板，车子的鞍座架在前轮上面。他们把这辆

车冠以“自行车”的雅名，并于1867年在巴黎博览会上展出，让观众大开眼界，曾一度掀起自行车热。

但是因高度的关系上下车及下坡时十分危险容易跌倒以及存在危险性又把鞍座改为固定在车架上。

1867年，英国人麦迪逊设计出第一辆装有钢丝辐条的自行车。

1874年，真正具有现代化形式的自行车诞生。英国人劳森在自行车上别出心裁地装上链条和链轮，用

后轮的转动来推动车子前进。但仍然不够协调与稳定。

1886年，英国的机械工程师斯塔利，从机械学、运动学的角度设计出了新的自行车样式，装上前叉和

车闸，使用滚子轴承，前后轮大小同，以保持平衡，并用钢管制成了菱形车架，还首次使用了橡胶车

轮。显著地提高了自行车的骑行性能。斯塔利不仅改进了自行车的结构，还改制了许多生产自行车部

件用的机床。

同年，英国人詹姆斯把自行车前后轮改为大小相同，并增加了链条，使其车型与现代自行车基本相

同。

1887年，德国曼内斯公司将无缝钢管首先用于自行车生产。

1888年，爱尔兰的兽医邓洛普，从医治牛胃气膨胀中得到启示，将自家花园用来浇水的橡胶管粘成圆

形并打足气装在自行车上，这是充气轮胎的开端。

从此，基本奠定了现代自行车的雏形。充气轮胎是自行车发展史上的一个划时代的创举不但从根本上

改变了自行车的骑行性能，也解决了自行车多年来最令人难受的震动问题，同时更把自行车的速度又

推进了许多。而且完善了自行车的使用功能。

从1791年到1888年，自行车的发明和改进，经历了近100年中这些发明者的不懈奋斗。从此，基本奠

定了现代自行车的雏形。时至今日，自行车已成为全世界人们使用最多，最简单，最实用的交通工

具。也许人们应该永远记住这些自行车的发明者们，他们的名字，丝毫不亚于汽车的发明者卡尔.本

茨。

在中国，1980年的自行车大军，是很多大城市的名片。随着小汽车进入每一个家庭，自行车离我们越

来越远，仿佛只能在赛场上看到了。

很多人觉得，自行车会完全消失。知道摩拜、OFO等的崛起。正应了那个美丽的姑娘说的话：“我以为

自行车要被淘汰了，原来不会自行车要被淘汰了。”

其实，从1790年到现在的200多年里，自行车自行车不停地在演化，每一点演化都在解决一个很小的

问题。而到了今天，成为了如此成熟和完美的产品。

哪一步不是创新呢？

其实，所谓的创新，就是这样：改变一点点，让它更有效。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

30 DECEMBER

Innovations for Maximum Opportunities

Innovations：

Opportunities：

[ U ] the introduction of new things, ideas or ways of doing sth

（新事物、思想或方法的）创造；创新；改革

[ C U ] ~ (to do sth) | ~ (for sth/for doing sth) | ~ (of doing sth) a time when a particular situation makes it possible

to do or achieve sth

机会；时机

What is lacking to make effective what is already possible?

The characteristic of the innovator is the ability to envisage as a system what to others are

unrelated, separate elements. (见微知著）

envisage:

想象；设

想；展望

[ also + V that ] ( especially BrE ) ( NAmE usually also en·vis·ion ) to imagine what will happen in the future

unrelated

not connected; not related to sth else

无关联的；不相关的

It is the successful attempt to find and to provide the smallest missing part that will convert already

existing elements.

在已知的系统中发现一个很小的缺陷是一件很牛逼的事情。

To find areas where innovation would create maximum opportunities, one asks:

为了让创新创造出最大的机会，一个人应该问三个问题：

“What is lacking to make effective what is already possible?

为了让已经存在的变得高效，我应该做什么？

What one small step would transform our economic results?

transform：

使改变形态

economic：

工序、业务或活动

to change the form of sth

的；合算的

( of a process, a business or an activity

) producing enough profit to continue

我们做哪些小的改变，就会改变我们的经济结果？

What small change would alter the capacity of the whole of our resources?”

哪些小的改变会改变我们整个资源的能力？

有利可图的；可赚钱

To describe the need is not to satisfy it.

描述我们的需求，并不是为了满足它。

satisfy：

[ VN ] ( not used in the progressive tenses

满意；使满足

不用于进行时 ) to make sb pleased by doing or giving them what they want 使

But describing the need gives a specification for the desirable results.

但是，描述会让我清楚我自己想要什么。

desirable：

(that)… | ~ (for sb) (to do sth) ( formal ) that you would like to have or do; worth having or doing

想望的；可取的；值

得拥有的；值得做的

specification：[ C U ] a detailed description of how sth is, or should be, designed or made 规格；规范；明细单；说明书

Whether they are likely to be obtained can be decided.

以及，我们要不要得到他们。

Innovation is applicable to finding business potential and to making the future.

applicable：

适用；合适

[ not usually before noun ] ~ (to sb/sth) that can be said to be true in the case of sb/sth

ACTION POINT: Ask yourself the three questions above.

Managing for Results

【原书原文】

FROM YESTERDAY TO TODAY

Maximizing opportunities looks for those seven-league steps toward realizing the ideal business

and obtaining rapidly the greatest benefits possible.

By projecting the ideal business design on the analysis of the existing business all the products,

markets, distribution channels, cost centers, activities, and efforts of the business can be sorted

out into three categories:

• One high-priority group where the real push has to be made, because there is a great opportunity

to achieve extraordinary results.

• One high-priority group where the opportunity lies in not-doing; that is, in rapid and

purposeful abandonment.

• One large and heterogeneous group of also-rans—products, mar- kets, knowledge work, and so

on—in which neither efforts to excel nor abandonment promise significant results.

To call abandonment an “opportunity” may come as a sur- prise. Yet planned, purposeful

abandonment of the old and of the

unrewarding is a prerequisite to successful pursuit of the new and highly promising. Above all,

abandonment is the key to innova- tion—both because it frees the necessary resources and

because it stimulates the search for the new that will replace the old

Push areas and abandonment complement each other and therefore deserve equal priority.

The push priorities are easily identified. What should be pushed are those areas where the results,

if successful, produce their costs many times over. These are invariably the products or markets

that fit most closely the ideal-business design.

The General Motors’ experience is characteristic. Buick and Cadillac, the two makes that were

profitable in 1921 and had market leadership, were also the only two of the company’s eight makes

which fitted the ideal-business design.

Typical result areas which deserve priority are, for instance:

• Tomorrow’s breadwinners and sleepers

• The development efforts needed to replace tomorrow’s breadwin- ner the day after tomorrow

• Important new knowledge and new distributive channels

• Cutting back high support costs, high policing costs and waste in the cost structure

The areas of high potential are rarely over-supplied with

resources. Hence what matters is not whether the budget for such an area is too high but whether

it is high enough for results.

The candidates for abandonment are also usually fairly obvious.

There is first the investment in managerial ego. Unjustified specialties are also on the list. Then

there are unnecessary support activities, and waste that can be eliminated without major effort.

Yesterday’s breadwinner should almost always be abandoned on a fairly fast schedule. It still may

produce net revenue. But it soon becomes a bar to the introduction and success of tomorrow’s

breadwin- ner. One should, therefore, abandon yesterday’s breadwinner before one really wants to,

let alone before one has to.

Altogether, whenever the cost of incremental acquisition is more than one-half of the likely return,

there is a candidate for abandonment. It is not good enough that an activity does not

appear to cost any money. It should produce results to be kept on.

And the hidden costs of any activity are always much greater than anybody assumes or than any

accounting system shows.

To keep a man on the payroll always costs at least three times his wage or salary. He needs space

to work in, heat, light, and a locker in the washroom. He needs materials to work with, supplies, a

telephone, and so on. He needs a supervisor. In a hundred hidden ways he creates costs.

Every proposal for abandonment is opposed. The arguments that can be advanced to justify

retention of the resultless, unpromising, and unrewarding are rarely more than excuses. Most

common is the plea:

• We must grow; we cannot afford to shrink.

But growth, after all, is the result of success, of offering what the market wants, buys, and pays for,

of using economic resources effectively, and of making the profits needed for expan- sion and for

the risks of the future. General Motors either aban- doned or completely made over six of the eight

makes in the line—and the result was tremendous growth.

The argument is also sophistry. It confuses fat with muscle, and busy-ness with economic

accomplishment. Activities which do not produce results waste substance. They are a burden—the

way overweight is a burden on the strength of a human being.

A management in an expanding economy needs to be growthconscious. But growth means exploiting the opportunities

that the economy offers. It does not mean doing the wrong things to get volume. The volume will

come soon enough if a business concentrates on doing the right things.

There are in each business products, services, activities, and efforts which are neither clear

candidates for concentrated major work nor candidates for abandonment: the large number of

also- rans which form the third category to be considered.

Among them will be today’s breadwinners and frequently the productive specialties. Here also will

be cost centers which, while representing a sizable cost burden, can be reduced only by efforts out

of proportion to the probable results. And here will be found the

repair jobs of all kinds and descriptions, the products, services, markets,

and so on, which might become worth while if only some major change or modification were made.

The main rule for also-rans is that they must not absorb resources at the expense of the high

opportunity areas. Only if resources are left over after the high opportunity areas have received all

the support they need, should the also-rans be con- sidered. And high-grade resources already

committed to also- rans should be kept there only if they cannot make a bigger con- tribution in a

high opportunity task.

In practice, additional resources can rarely be spared for also-rans. And only the productive

specialty among them normally deserves all the resources it employs. The others will almost always

be found to absorb resources that would be more productive elsewhere.

Also-rans therefore have to make do with what they have— or with less. They are put on “milking

status”: as long as they yield results, they will be kept—and milked. They will, however, not be “fed.”

And as soon as these “milk cows” go into rapid decline, they should be slaughtered.

THE FORWARD PROJECTION

Upgrading the existing business leads to doing things better.

But what are the different things that ought to be done?

Here there are two distinct categories of opportunities:

• Replacements of present products, activities, and efforts which are almost right, by products,

activities, and efforts that are completely right

• Innovations, the highest-opportunity group, though a small one

Replacements deserve high priority only if a very small change can convert an almost right product

into one that fits the ideal business design.

What distinguishes a replacement from a development is that it repre- sents a different idea of

what the market is and what it wants, or a different exploitation of the company’s knowledge. A

new pack- aging material is a development—no matter how difficult technologically it might be to

design and to produce it. A new packaging con- cept, shipping on pallets or in container bodies

which fit on railway flat- cars as well as on highway trucks, is a new idea and a replacement. In the

General Motors redesign by Alfred P. Sloan, Jr., the replacements were the three cars that were

revamped in everything but name: the old low- priced Chevrolet, the Oakland (later the Pontiac),

and the Oldsmobile. These cars had customer acceptance and a dealer organization. They had

the basic design. What they did not have was a clear idea of their function and place in the market,

the right pricing policy, and management. For a downtown department store in the United States

the suburban shopping centers were essentially replacements; they were ways to make the essential strengths of the department store—its reputation and its merchandis- ing knowledge—available

where the customers shopped.

A replacement should never present great technical difficulty. It should arise out of the recognition:

“Now we suddenly understand what is wrong with this product, this market, this activity.

Now we suddenly understand what we have done wrong, or failed to do.” What changes is much

less the product itself-if it is not almost right one should not waste time and effort on it—than the

way the business itself sees, presents, and uses the product.

Innovation is the design and development of something new, as yet unknown and not in existence,

which will establish a new eco- nomic configuration out of the old, known, existing elements. It will

give these elements an entirely new economic dimension. It is the missing link between having a

number of disconnected elements, each marginally effective, and an integrated system of great

power.

It is this “systems” aspect of innovation that is invoked when we say that men like Siemens or

Edison created a new industry. All the elements were there, except

one. Adding this one new element created an entirely new economic capacity.

There are many other examples:

Sears Roebuck built its business on the innovation of a “money- back-and-no-questions-asked”

guarantee to the farm customers. All

the ingredients of a successful mail-order business existed. What was lack- ing was the simple

element of confidence in the customer.

IBM similarly created the computer industry by innovating the concept of pro- graming as a distinct

function which bridged the gap between the technically highly complex machine and the

technically untrained potential customers,

and which yet could be learned by high school graduates in a short time.

Sloan’s innovation was the idea of an automobile company supplying the entire market in a planned

and organized fashion where formerly General Motors—and all the others—had seen themselves as

producers of individual makes each trying to appeal to all the potential customers.

American Motors innovated the idea of the “compact,” that is the smallest car

that would still give adequate room and performance to people used to big cars.

Innovation is not invention or discovery. It may require either—and often does. But its focus is not

knowledge but per- formance—and in a business this means economic performance. Its essence is

conceptual rather than technical or scientific. The characteristic of the innovator is the ability to

envisage as a sys- tem what to others are unrelated, separate elements. Innovation is not the

better the bigger it is. On the contrary, it is the better the smaller it can be. It is, to say it again, the

successful attempt to find and to provide the smallest missing part that will convert already

existing elements—knowledge, products, customer demand, markets—into a new and much more

productive whole. To find the areas where innovation would create maximum opportunities, one

asks: What is lacking to make effective what is already possible? What one small step would

transform our eco- nomic results? What small change would alter the capacity of thewhole of our

resources?

To describe the need is not to satisfy it. But describing the need gives a specification for the

desirable results. Whether they are likely to be obtained can then be decided. Innovation is applicable to finding business potential and to making the future.

But its first application is as a strategy for making today fully

effective, and for bringing the existing business closer to the ideal business.

30 DECEMBER

Innovations for Maximum Opportunities

What is lacking to make effective what is already possible?

The characteristic of the innovator is the ability to envisage as a system

what to others are unrelated, separate elements. It is the successful at-tempt to

find and to provide the smallest missing part that will convert al-ready

existing elements. To find areas where innovation would create maximum

opportunities, one asks: “What is lacking to make effective what is already

possible? What one small step would transform our economic re-sults? What

small change would alter the capacity of the whole of our re-

sources?”

To describe the need is not to satisfy it. But describing the need gives

Aspecification for the desirable results. Whether they are likely to be ob-

tained can be decided. Innovation is applicable to finding business poten-

tial and to making the future.

ACTION POINT:

Ask yourself the three questions above.

Managing for Results

透过金庸读懂德鲁克

一个员工的自我修养

如果做一个好员工呢？其实很简单，遵守六个原则就好了。

原则一：知道自己的工作是什么以及工作应该是什么。

每天下班前，想一下这一天你都做了什么，而这一天你本来应该做什么。你的工作是技术，那么你用

你掌握的技术为公司解决问题了么？而是用去修打印机泡公司的行政小妹妹了？

原则二：知道自己为公司做了什么以及应该做什么。

想一下，你所做的事情，为公司带来了什么价值，以及你应该为公司带来什么价值？加入你是销售，

你为公司带来订单了么？你做了什么来为公司带来订单么？

原则三：知道你公司赖以生存的基础是什么。

万幸，在寒冷的2019年，你公司还活着，还在给你发工资，那么你知道你公司赖以生存的基础是什么

呢？是你老板的钱包？还是你们的产品？还是创新的模式？

原则四：了解你公司需要哪些信息

你公司为了活下去，需要哪些信息？如何获得这些信息？这些信息，哪些是你可以获得呢？你应该如

何获得？

原则五：明确作为一个好员工，你应该获得哪些信息

作为一个员工，技术也好，销售也好，市场也好，为了做一个好员工，你应该获得哪些信息？如何获

得？

原则六：给多少钱，干多少事。

这是一个经济时代，我们处在一个经济社会，老板给多少钱，就干多少事，如果你觉得自己能力超

群，可以稍微多干一些，但不要太多。因为，你老板不会为你的努力买单的，特别是大公司。

大纲

百字摘要

金庸案例

时间消耗

阅读理解：

大纲：

撰写：

录音

一小时运动

英文原文

31 DECEMBER

From Data to Information Literacy

Literacy:

读写能力

[ U ] the ability to read and write

The executive and the knowledge worker have only one tool—information.

Information is what holds an organization together and information is what makes individual

knowledge workers effective.

Enterprises and individuals will have to learn what information they need and how to get it.

They will have to learn how to organize information as their key resource.

In moving from data literacy to information literacy, you need to answer two principal questions:

“What information does my enterprise need?” and “What information do I need?” To answer these

questions you have to rethink:

What your job is, and what it should be

What your contribution is, or should be

What the fundamentals are of your organization

You will need three different types of information, each with its own concepts.

The three primary types of information are: external information, internal information, and

cross-organizational information.

Your success and the success of your organization depend upon getting these answers right.

ACTION POINT:

Answer these questions: “What is my job? What should be my contribution?” and “What are the

fundamentals of the organization?”

Then answer: “What information does my organization need?” and “What information do I need?”

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

From Data to Information Literacy (Corpedia Online Program)

31 DECEMBER

From Data to Information Literacy

The executive and the knowledge worker have only one tool—information.

Information is what holds an organization together and information is what

makes individual knowledge workers effective. Enterprises and in-dividuals

will have to learn what information they need and how to get it. They will

have to learn how to organize information as their key resource. In moving

from data literacy to information literacy, you need to answer two principal

questions: “What information does my enterprise need?” and “What

information do I need?” To answer these questions you have to

rethink:

•What your job is, and what it should be

•What your contribution is, or should be

•What the fundamentals are of your organization

You will need three different types of information, each with its own

concepts. The three primary types of information are: external informa-

tion, internal information, and cross-organizational information. Your suc-

cess and the success of your organization depend upon getting these

answers right.

ACTION POINT:

Answer these questions: “What is my job? What should be

my contribution?” and “What are the fundamentals of the organiza-tion?”

Then answer: “What information does my organization need?” and “What

information do I need?”

Management Challenges for the 21st Century

From Data to Information Literacy (Corpedia Online Program)
